review.title: Affordable Union Square Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText:
I found this hotel through Expedia hoping to find a more affordable hotel in Union Square, and overall was quite pleased with our experience.  The staff were welcoming and congratulated us on our honeymoon (I made mention of this in the check-in comments) which was nice.  The room was a standard size for the era of the hotel, being built in 1914, but spacious enough for our liking.  The bed was fantastic, and they offered pillow service as well - a nice touch to see.  When we returned to our room that night, they set out some champagne and rubber duckies of a bride and groom... this is definitely a signature of the hotel, I loved the extra touches.  Overall the hotel was in good shape, I noticed some carpets being replaced during the day so there is some work still being completed.  The elevators are also fairly small and somewhat slow, but for a 100 year old hotel that's how things were built - they worked and that's all that matters.  

I was very pleased overall with our experience, we got a great story to share in a hotel right on Union Square far cheaper than the big hotels beside us.  I would recommend it to anyone willing to step outside the box (just a touch).
review.positiveRemarks: Remodeled rooms, comfortable bed, fantastic location, relatively affordable compared to other hotels in the area, nice character
review.negativeRemarks: Minor issues with billing but not major.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square shopping, trolley car stop directly outside the hotel, perfect central area to explore San Francisco from

review.title: Great location!!
review.reviewText: Great staff, very accommodating and helpful. Great location, easy access to whatever was needed.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing really.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to BART, cable cars, stores, restaurants.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Great location. The hotel is nice and clean and the staff is friendly and helpful.  We'll stay here again.
Cozy, clean and welcoming, friendly staff, great location.  We enjoyed our stay and will go back.

review.title: Nice hotel in a great location near Union Square
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for 2 nights in August 2016. We have zero complaints about this hotel! We would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend the hotel to family and friends. It was a great experience.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, really large comfortable beds, walk in wardrobe, nice bathroom and toiletries. Great location for union square with tram stop outside on powell street. Loved it and would definitely return!

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Only downside was it could be noisy outside but that quietned down as the evening went on.

review.title: A great place to say
review.reviewText: I came across the Chancellor hotel via Expedia.  It was a reasonably priced hotel that turned out to be a great place to say.  the cable car was out front, I was walking distance to where I needed to go.  The staff was nice, friendly and helpful.  The restaurant breakfast had the best sourdough pancakes!
review.locationRemarks: Cable car to Fisherman's Wharf!

review.title: NICE
review.reviewText: NICE, CLOSE TO EVERYTHING DOWNTOWN.  BUT THE HOTEL FURNITURE IN THE LOBBY WAS VERY DIRTY THEY NEED TO UPDATE THIS.  THE RESTAURANT WAS FANTASTIC.
review.negativeRemarks:
THE FURNITURE IN THE LOBBY NEEDS TO BE REPLACED IT WAS VERY DIRTY.
ROOM WAS NICE.
review.locationRemarks: EVERYTHING WAS CLOSE WE COULD WALK TO SOME THINGS NOT TO OTHERS...IT WAS VERY BUSY AND CROWDED...

review.title: Great little boutique hotel, excellent location.
review.reviewText: Loved it, great staff, nice resto, outstanding location and fabulous price...!!!

review.title: Brilliant position, greatest bed and room comfort.
review.reviewText: Loved the position as we were so close to the beautiful square, fabulous high end shops, cable car, buses and easy walking to china town . Hotel has old world charm and new world comforts and we loved our stay. Super quiet as we chose the back of the hotel but lost the view! Just loved our time there.
review.negativeRemarks: Drinks at the bar seemed less potent than normal!
review.locationRemarks: As mentioned above.... Perfect

review.title: Very close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Family-friendly hotel near Union Square, close to city sights, plenty of public transportation options. Rooms are small but you're in one of the most beautiful cities in the world--go explore!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Staff really super helpful. Room traditional style. Great to have free 24 hr hot drink access. Option to have 7 dollars credit in lieu of room being cleaned, and you can combine this with the 241 7dollar cocktail hour. Ideal hotel for us at good price. would stay again.
Great location. No air. Little out dated / old fashioned.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The staff was eager to please us. The decor was awesome!

review.title: Nice hotel; fantastic location at Union Square
review.reviewText: Room was small but well appointed with super comfy bed. Surprisingly quiet at night in spite of being right at Union Square, which is great for shopping, eating and catching hop on hop off buses. Courteous staff and overall nice and clean.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: When we fist walked in to the lobby, it was nice to see coffee and cookies. We were a little disappointed that we didn't get a room with a view being our first time in SF. Our room was clean and nice but too small. We could barely walk around with our suitcases opened up but they did have a nice open closet to put one of them in to. We really liked the breakfast and the nice wait staff. The location was great. My husband also liked the concierge service and wished we would have went there right from the beginning. Desk clerk Bryce was very nice and told us about the credit for no room service. Overall great value.
review.negativeRemarks: Checking in, seeing that we were on vacation and first time in SF, they could have given us a room with a view if available.
review.locationRemarks: You're right in Union Square where you can easily get anywhere. Tons of shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Simply the best
review.reviewText: Very good location;  nice staff and very good facilities

review.title: Exceptional hotel! Great value for the dollar.
review.reviewText:
Cannot not speak more highly of this hotel. Great location, super clean. Some reviews have said that the rooms are small, but we found it comfortable and roomy. Not sure why you would need a larger room unless you had an excess amount of luggage of one of those oversize strollers. There is a walk-I closet that holds plenty of luggage. 

The location is great and you can walk to numerous places and many great restaurants. Trolley runs in front and numerous tour/hop on hop off buses run from Union Square. Would highly recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: No.

review.title: Excellent hotel, fabulous service!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for 5 nights when in San Francisco for our anniversary.  I can't say enough nice things about the staff.  They were friendly, helpful and welcoming each time we came "home" to the Chancellor after a day of seeing the city.  The rooms are smaller than a standard hotel room, but the hotel has such wonderful, old charm that you don't even notice.  The closet is quite large so we kept our luggage and other larger items there.  The lobby is beautiful as are the rooms.  Plus, there are free cookies in the lobby!
review.locationRemarks:
About 100 ft from Union Square and shopping/restaurants
Can catch tour buses from the square
3 blocks to Chinatown

review.title: An environmentally conscious hotel
review.reviewText:
Chancellor Hotel is well-located in the heart of activities.  It has been recently renovated and the room does not look and feel old despite its age.  

What I am appreciative of the hotel is the strong move to being green.  There is a recycle bag in the room, you can request for no cleaning of room and get rewarded because you have helped to save water and conserve the environment.

Though no kettle nor coffee making machine was provided in the room, the hotel provides 24 hours coffee and tea at the lobby for the guests to access.  In addition, cookies and fruits are also provided.  Appreciate these small thoughtfulness and to me this is another way of being environmentally-conscious.  

Had a good stay here!

review.title: Brilliant location and friendly staff
review.reviewText: Brilliant location, knowledgeable and friendly staff. Would stay at this hotel again for all of these reasons but if going soon, check if the renovations are still going on as the drilling is loud and did disturb our sleep on a couple of occasions.
Great hotel in a perfect location. Staff were very pleasant.  Room was very clean, quiet and comfortable. I will recommend this hotel to all my friends.

review.title: Great when it's not hot out
review.reviewText: Proximity to Union Square is great, if this matters to you.  Room was fine, i.e. nothing wrong.  Didn't feel small or cramped.  Free coffee in mornings in lobby. Just be aware there is no AC - at least not in 11th floor room I was in.  There was a ceiling fan. Since it was cool out, the room wasn't too hot, though I did have the window open all night.  My room wasn't street facing and high enough to escape most street noise.

review.title: Very convenient area. Hotel is classy.
review.reviewText: Check in was flawless. Room small but adequate size and clean, well maintained. All else was perfect, helpful staff gave me hints and direction.

review.title: Charming hotel in the heart of Union Square!
review.reviewText: I honestly can't think of one negative thing to say about our stay at this hotel! It was the absolute perfect location, minutes from restaurants, shopping, cable cars, and BART! The staff was friendly and helpful, our room was clean and spacious for being right in Union Square, the beds were super comfy, the bathroom was spacious, and we even had a walk-in closet! I will stay here again every time we visit!
review.negativeRemarks: Would like the restaurant to serve dinner, but honestly there are so many places nearby for every meal, it was fine!
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants, shopping, cable car runs right in front of the hotel, world famous Sears restaurant literally next door, BART and Muni train nearby.

review.title: Nice union Square affordable price for San Francis
review.reviewText: Nice updated hotel with great character and hospitality. Hotel staff want to make your stay is wonderful,  so be sure to let them know your needs. It's close to restaurants, shopping, activities & transportation options: cable cars, cabs, Muni or BART - Cool boutique hotel.
Steps from union square. Good experince. Thier coffee is good and it's free.

review.title: Hotel in the middle of a nice area
review.reviewText:
My husband and I stayed at this hotel during our anniversary trip. Our flight arrived at 10 a.m. And they were able to provide us a room right away so we didn't have to wait until the 3 pm check in time. Overall our stay was fine apart from a couple of minor snafus. The most irritating one being that we ordered pizza to stay in one evening and went down to the bar to get drinks to take up. The bartender took our order, gave me my bud light but didn't get my husband his cocktail for 10 minutes. Instead she thought it was more important to take a few dirty cups to the kitchen. We clearly were just wanting to get drinks and go back up but she was rude and told us to sit down and served several others ahead of us. The situation could have been handled much more professional and productive on her end. Not a huge deal but annoying none the less. 
This hotel is located a half block from major shopping like saks fifth avenue, coach, and more high end stores. I loved hearing the man playing the trumpet through the open window at night.

review.title: Vintage SF
review.reviewText: Charming hotel in the center of it all. While the standard queen room was small, it was confortable and cozy. Just steps away from the best luxury shopping...and some bargain shopping if you know where to look.

review.title: Verly Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean ! Staff esp the front desk was very helpful !! Nice little bar area with very friendly bartenders in which to unwind after a long day of sightseeing !! Perfect location to get around !!!   Loved our stay here !!  We spend a total of 6 nights at this location .

review.title: Right at Union Square
review.reviewText: Hotel is RIGHT on S.F.'s cable car line (one of them anyways).  Short walks to higher end shopping.  Many restaurants nearby.  Our room was SMALL...a queen bed and all the necessary furniture.  So this would not have worked for more than 2 people.  Staff is VERY friendly.  Tiny bar...restaurant attached.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking is $45/night (OUCH!).  You can self park nearby, still $32/night.
review.locationRemarks:
numerous restaurants, shopping...take cable car to The Wharf!!!
Go to cable car museum...quite interesting (and free)

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was great and nice central location. I would just recommend a coffee maker in the room if possible.

review.title:
Great location.
Centrally located.
review.reviewText:
This hotel has some character - not your typical 'chain hotel' experience.
Not the fanciest but very nice and comfortable.
Desk and concierge staff extremely pleasant and helpful; overall a more 'personalized' experience than staying at a bigger chain hotel - and reasonably priced.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff; location, coffee, tea, cookies, fruit available in lobby at all times.
review.negativeRemarks: Some noise from clanging of trolley car bells and  from Union Square. Not sure if that's in all rooms. Soundproofing windows?
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, Fisherman's wharf, public transportation.

review.title: Excellent location!
review.reviewText: Our hotel was on several bus routes and cable car in front of the hotel. We had a 3 block walk to the BART to get to and from the airport. We could walk to all major US department stores and there were many restaurants close by.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, friendly and helpful staff. There was flavoured ice water, cookies and apples in the lobby. Nicely upgraded older hotel!
review.locationRemarks: Shopping and great public transit routes.

review.title: Nice hotel in the heart of the city
review.reviewText: Nice Victorian style room. Ceiling fan was not working which made the nights a little hot. Staff was amazing, very helpful and respectful. Location is great, nice and close to lots of shops and diners.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: This was our third time to stay at the hotel. The staff is always helpful, the rooms are clean and pleasant, and the location is great!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything - and the restaurant breakfast is very good.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is expensive - especially if you valet.
review.locationRemarks: Location is perfect. Trolley stops across the street.

review.reviewText:
Lovely building, full of charm. Extremely comfortable bed and pillows. Bathroom fine, good deep bath. A bit of city background noise, but you are in the middle of the city.
Overall a great introduction to America (from Australia)

review.title: Excellant location!
review.reviewText: Perfect convenient to Union Square & shopping. Small room but was to be expected. Pleasant helpful staff. Could not fault anything. Will definitely book again.

review.title: Good hotel in the city center
review.reviewText: Good hotel in the city center.  Various shopping and dining options within walking distance.
Excellent location. Very helpful concierge, and incredibly nice staff at Luques. Mao always brightened our mornings at breakfast !

review.title: pretty hotel, great staff, great location
review.reviewText: old world charm in this boutique hotel - well informed and courteous concierge
review.positiveRemarks: coffee and water available all day in the lobby, an easy cab ride to tourist attractions
review.locationRemarks: great location - cabs everywhere, cable car stop on the corner, many restaurants, shopping

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location right in union square. The hotel is nice despite being over 100 years old. Rooms were small but fine for a one night stay for two. I'd stay there again.

review.title: Good bang for your buck!
review.reviewText: I really liked this hotel. It was super close to union square which was awesome and it was a very nice place. Clean room, plenty of amentities and perfectly comfortable. It was a little bit small but it was not something we got hung up on.

review.title: Good location for the price
review.reviewText: Everything was as it should be and the location was convenient.

review.title: Great Location, in the heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: Stayed 2 nights, hotel staffs were very friendly.  Enjoyed 2 single beds room, but room had terrible view of adjacent business' rooftop.  No A/C but ceiling fan made up for it.  Great location, cable car stop & Union Square shops are just steps away, Chinatown & Powell BART station are short walking distance.

review.title: Surprisingly great
review.reviewText: Excellent boutique combination of keeping original architecture and style, while upgrading and mountains of in-room amenities.
review.positiveRemarks: Upgraded bathroom kept original or original-like fixtures, even bottle opener. Rubber ducky I'm told is hit among regular guests. Bartender great.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, all good.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car outside, union square steps away.

review.title: Older Hotel with Charm
review.reviewText: Overall, my experience was great.  There was no waiting for check in and it was a simple process, due to prepayment through Expedia.  Although the room and bathroom were very small, they were clean, which is extremely important to me.  The staff was friendly and efficient.
review.negativeRemarks: Since my only complaint is the size of the room, there is nothing that can be done to improve.
review.locationRemarks: Music and events in Union Square; numerous shops and restaurants within walking distance.  Fisherman's Wharf just a short Uber ride away!

review.title: Nice place in union square
review.reviewText: Very kind staff, give me early check in with very clean room, provide any information i need in sf

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel right at the heart of downtown with the cable car line running past your door and a good restaurant for a nice breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Fine as it is
review.locationRemarks: Union square for shopping ,good restaurants for all budgets,historic cable cars,

review.reviewText: Very great staff and nice location in the downtown SF.

review.title: Nice hotel with great location
review.reviewText: Be awear its a very old hotel. Can smell the oldness in the room. parking is not covered, great location for cable car and shopping.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I'd stayed here many years ago and was pleasantly surprised to find it's still just as good as I remember it.
review.positiveRemarks: The little lobby bar was a plus. We had a view of Union Square from our room. Parking was convenient.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel could not be more perfectly located! It's in the hub of San Francisco.

review.title: Decent hotel, right off Union Square
review.reviewText: This place will do the trick if you're looking for a clean, decent hotel in the middle of downtown. It's not cheap, but cheaper than the other places nearby. My room was clean and small, it really looked like someone's house. The old charm is intact, with a few of the less charming aspects of an old building like a hole in the wall next to the tub. But overall this place worked for a one night business stay, it was safe and clean and priced better than most other options.

review.title: Comfortable historic hotel in a central location
review.reviewText: Great renovated historic hotel just off union square and on one of the main tram lines from Union Square to Fisherman's wharf. Hotel has an old and retro feel to it yet has been renovated to appear clean, comfortable and smart. Staff are excellent and friendly whilst the hotel has gone the extra yard to offer guests free usage of a decent gym facility across the road. There is no breakfast included in the standard rate but the free coffee and cookies at reception easily make up for this whilst you head into the city to hunt for a breakfast location.
review.positiveRemarks: Spacious rooms, free coffee/cookies, consideration of guests needs that they may not have space/facilities to provide e.g. gym.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning in the rooms

review.title: Great location, great staff
review.reviewText: easy to find, just a couple of blocks up Powell St from the Embacadero BART station, very easy check in, friendly helpful staff. Lovely hotel, not spacious, felt quite home like, complimentary coffee, cookies, fruit and flavoured water in reception. Our room was smallish but well furnished with a comfy bed, a pillow menu, Windows that open (yay) nice bathroom, great shower and toiletries, room has a refrigerator, a safe and an iron. There is a nice little bar (happy hour 5-7) and a great restraunt also. Really handy location with Union Square across the road (Maceys) and cable cars right outside, a couple of blocks walk down hill to Market Street (BART station) I would defiantly stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, friendly helpful staff, comfortable hotel
review.locationRemarks: Bars, restaurants, shops and transport at your door

review.title: Great hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Arrived at 10pm and the member of staff on duty checked us in very quickly and gave us a great room on the 13th floor (when booking, I requested a good view). Staff were friendly and helpful, and the room/bed was really comfortable. The room and bathroom were also pretty spacious despite reviews I read before about things being a little on the small side. TV also had a guide unlike many of the other hotels I've stayed in, so I didn't have to channel flick late at night to find something to watch. The toiletries were really nice too, and the cleaning staff were very good and friendly. Breakfast in the hotel was great - lots of choice and the sourdough pancakes were some of the best I've eaten. They also had free cookies, coffee and popcorn in the hotel lobby - nice touch!
review.negativeRemarks: The wax polish (I think that's what it was) they used on the floor late one evening smelt pretty bad
review.locationRemarks: Union square - food, shopping, great transport links, and about a 20 min taxi ride to San Fran Int Airport.

review.title: Nice hotel but not comfortable
review.reviewText: There was no air conditioning.  The windows were left slightly open so that air would flow into the room.  The bathroom was too small. The room was also small.  The pluses were the hotel staff,  they were very accommodating.  The hotel was located in a perfect location.

review.title: Perfect location overlooking union square
review.reviewText: Traditional style hotel one of the first built overlooking the square, perfect location, free tea / coffee & snacks in the lobby, good size rooms, would stay again.

review.title: A 3 night stay.
review.reviewText:
This is a very centrally located hotel.  We walked to the Wharf, Chinatown, etc.  Rooms are small, but very clean.  Hotel staff was very helpful.  Speedy check-in.
We would recommend this hotel to friends - price is right and location is great.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to shopping, Fisherman's Wharf, and Chinatown.  All are a 15-20 minute walk - max.

review.title: Great location; comfortable beds!
review.reviewText:
My husband and I stayed here while we were in town celebrating our 5 year anniversary. The location was great  for those using only public transportation. Close to lots of restaurants, shopping, and entertainment. 
The rooms are small but comfortable. I couldn't believe how quiet it was at night. We didn't have a fantastic view on the backside of the hotel, but the fan from the building below actually helped drown out street noise. 
Would definitely stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Great location! Super comfy beds. Oh, and yummy free cookies and coffee.
review.negativeRemarks: Slow elevators, but I don't think that would be a deal breaker.
review.locationRemarks: So many great restaurants within a few minutes walks. Awesome shopping. Really close to busses, cable cars, and BART. Fun little TAP house next door.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel is well our room don't have any view likes we saw on the Internet review.
Classic hotel right on Union Square.  Charm plus location.

review.title: nice hotel, close to shopping and dinning.
review.reviewText:
Went to San Fran for the first time and this hotel definitely was a great choice. Close to shopping, restaurants, trolley, etc.
Plenty of amenities in the room like umbrellas, rollaway beds, iron, safes, refrigerators, etc.
Nice stay it was warm the days I was there and the AC is not optimum which led to hots nights.

review.title: Great location!  Great customer service
review.reviewText: All staff were very helpful and welcoming, from the front desk, the concierge to the maid service.  Very comfortable room.  Old style bathrooms, but clean and very adequate.  Great location with easy access to shopping, cable cars, Bart and Metro station easy access, China town, plenty of nearby eating and shopping. Easy starting point for any SF touring.  Nice touches with iced flavored water, coffee, tea, and apples available in the lobby each day.  Would definitely come back again.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable, clean, and very helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Clearer communication about reusing towels in bathroom, are they replaced each day? where do you leave them if you want fresh towels during your stay?
review.locationRemarks: Great!  Everything is easily accessible.

review.title: Nice hotel stay
review.reviewText: Staff are super friendly. Walking distance to shopping, food and transport. Area is very nice,  quiet.  Rooms are nice, walls are a little thin.
We arrived late at night, so the staff provided late check-out without being asked.
review.positiveRemarks: The service is good, and the hotel is centrally located.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel shows signs of age.
review.locationRemarks: The location is very central.

review.title: Excellent location - couldn't have been better.
review.reviewText: Great location with clean rooms and good staff service. The rooms are a little small with no a/c. Latter only important in Summer. overall great hotel for the price and more than adequate for our 3 night stay. As they say it is all about location location location and I don't believe this could have been better!
review.negativeRemarks: A/C for the summer.
review.locationRemarks: Outside front is stop for Tram and Maceys is less than 100 metres! walk to pier 39 takes 20. All excursions leave and drop off from outside hotel.

review.title: Centralized
review.reviewText: The hotel is centralized to many places to shop and dine. Only negative part about this area are the amount of homeless people roaming the streets. The hotel itself was well kept for a fairly old building.

review.title: Union Square Gem
review.reviewText: My husband and I were stopping in San Fran on our way back from our honeymoon in Hawaii, and were so pleased to have booked this place.  The staff member that checked us in was so friendly, definitely a great way to start our stay.  The rooms are on the smallish size, but very cute and clean.  Beds, pillows, linens were good quality.  The Power-Mason cable car stops right out front so this was the perfect way to travel home from dinner at Scoma's on our last night.  The hotel offers happy hour and also other food that we never had a chance to try.  For the price this hotel was more than sufficient and would absolutely recommend to others for a comfy stay in a great location!  If you have a car to valet park it is really, really pricey here.  We walked or took an Uber everywhere and that worked out perfectly.
review.negativeRemarks: carpet replaced
review.locationRemarks: Half a block from Union Square, many restaurants, luxury retailers and interesting people all close.  Powell-Mason cable car stop right out front.

review.reviewText:
my room was nice enough.
The bedding was fresh and clean, the bed comfortable with plenty of pillows.
My window opened above Powel street so I was serenaded by the Union Square buskers who play all day and much of the night along with the cable car sounds below.
review.positiveRemarks:
Location.
Close to transportation to all points in the Bay Area.
review.negativeRemarks: They could add a simple continental breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: All points of transportation to every possible activity.

review.title: Wonderful service
review.reviewText: There were 3 of us staying for a night we did not realize the rooms were meant for 2 but the staff provided a cot upon request. Location was perfect, the cookies in the lobby were a nice treat. I would stay here again

review.title: Good option. Great location!!!!
review.reviewText: It was a cute hotel. Very clean and the staff was friendly. Breakfast was good.  It was a little odd that there was no central a/c but the fan and cracking open the window kept us cool at night. Room was very small with very comfortable bed, even though it was also small. Most important part for me was that it was clean and cute. Also, you can't beat the location!!!!! Right in the heart of downtown steps away from awesome reataurants and great shopping. I would stay there again.

review.title: Traditional hotel in the heart of San Fran
review.reviewText:
I've stayed at the Chancellor on multiple occasions over the past 15 years. We originally selected it for its central location in San Francisco - opposite Union Square and right the Cable Car line. The Chancellor is a smaller, older hotel in the Art Deco style. Since we stayed last time the rooms have been upgraded which was nice and now include WiFi and USB ports for charging. The hotel isn't big and the rooms aren't as generous as some you will find but are very comfortable and reasonably priced for such a central location. The staff were all very helpful. 

If you're looking for a reasonable hotel at a reasonable price in a central location you can't go wrong in my opinion.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable rooms, good service and a great, central location.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathrooms could do with an upgrade.
review.locationRemarks: Union Sq - shopping. Powell and Hyde St Cable Car (literally right outside the front door) and restaurants. Also very close to the BART Powell St stop

review.title: Hidden Treasure
review.reviewText: Did not know what to expect...but I was more than pleasantly surprised.  Typically used to staying in know hotels (Hilton, Marriott, Holiday Inn etc.), but have never stayed at a boutique hotel.  The Chancellor is centrally located in the heart of Union Square within easy walking distance to Chinatown, Italy-North Beach, Ferry Building and Fisherman's Wharf.  Hotel is charming and the staff wonderful.  Fresh morning coffee & cookies a nice touch!  The one thing I did notice...if you are traveling as a family (not on business or an adult vacay), boutique hotels are probably not a good fit.
review.positiveRemarks: Centrally located to attractions and great restaurants.

review.title: Great little boutique hotel close to action
review.reviewText: We had a great stay. Hotel staff were wonderful, very welcoming and friendly. The hotel was clean. Rooms were small, but that's what you get in a boutique hotel. Would definitely stay here again. And the apples were delicious.

review.title: Pretty nice hotel, could have been better
review.reviewText: Ladies at the front desk weren't too smiley or friendly like I expected.  I told them it was my boyfriend's birthday and anniversary weekend, nothing happened because of it, like other reviews boasted about. Bed was comfy, room was small and sweet. We slept good.  Restaurant was pretty OK. The parking was really expensive which sucked. Overall, pretty good experience, but definitely had some downfalls. Payed for a cheaper hotel the next night, and it was a lot better. Eh, probably would go somewhere else next time.
Great little hotel - would definitely stay here again! Really comfy bed and pillows
Highly recommended all around, staff, food, location can't be beat

review.title: Clean boutique
review.reviewText: Love the extras like the choice of pillows, the fruit and cookies at the front desk. Ample room in the bedroom with a very comfortable bed. I like the fact there was a small restaurant just down the stairs.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Pretty much what you should expect from a urban hotel in this price range.

review.title: Fantastic location and friendly staff
review.reviewText:
This hotel is located just off from Union Square, which is a very central location for sight-seeing or business. 

I stayed here for the Oracle conference, and all of the conference hotels were only a 5 minute walk away.

All the staff I interacted with were very friendly and helpful, and the room (although slightly dated) was comfortable and quiet. The only minor quibble was the lack of an aircon unit, which could be a problem in the height of summer :-)

review.title: Union Square Gem
review.reviewText: I've stayed here half a dozen times over the years. Staff has always been welcoming and professional. Nice quiet reasonably priced hotel in the heart of Union Square. Boutique hotel in the best possible way. I'll be back.
review.positiveRemarks: On cable car line. Close to great shopping,Theater District, Chinatown, Financial District.
review.negativeRemarks: This hotel hits the sweet spot of delivering a great experience without charging an arm and a leg. I love it as is.

review.title: Stayed at the Chancellor at least a dozen times
review.reviewText: Whether it's a work-related conference or just a vacation, we always stay at the Chancellor when we are in town. It's not a fancy hotel, but it's remarkably affordable while still being close to everything that you would ever want to do/see.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to some of the most desirable parts of SF.
review.negativeRemarks: In-room coffee/kettle would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: EVERYTHING is nearby. And if it's not nearby, then the Chancellor is near to F train, Cable Car, Muni, Lyft, walking... It's the perfect spot!

review.title: Nice Hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: This is our second time staying at the Chancellor both times were around the Holidays.  We like the location, the breakfast downstairs is good too.  The rooms are small, but we are really only in the room to get ready to go out to the City and to sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: Our room had a sound that kept on all night long (almost like dripping water, but it was by the window).
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, all the restaurants, bars, shopping stores, it's a great location.  We BART into the City from the East Bay and walk up Powell to hotel.

review.title: Comfortable hotel at a great location
review.reviewText: We found the hotel to be very comfortable and at a great location right at Union Square.  The staff were very friendly and gave excellent advice on places to eat.  The concierge desk provided very comprehensive information about a variety of tours and places to visit.  The room whilst compact was very well set up with a separate walk in wardrobe and an adequately equiped bathroom.
review.positiveRemarks: The location firstly and the service provided.
review.negativeRemarks: We believe this hotel adequately provides the necessary comforts.
review.locationRemarks: The location is on Union Square with the cable car right outside.

review.title: Close to union square and shopping
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and helpful . Easy access to trolly and tour buses a little bit noisy at night but overall was a pleasant trip
Stayed for 3 nights on vacation. Very central location, comfortable bed and helpful staff.

review.title: Great Price, Great Location
review.reviewText:
What makes this hotel nice is that it is a great price and a great location.

Rooms are small but cozy. It is an old hotel, but that is what gives it its charm, and you can't beat that you can jump off your cable car right infant of the hotel.

review.title: Great, quaint hotel
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I went to San Francisco on a short weekend trip. We wanted a central area since we were going to be on public transportation, and we were pleasantly surprised! We arrived early, before check in time, and the Chancellor hotel had our room ready so it was great to just be able to drop off our bags and go. There was coffee and tea and cookies in the lobby and fresh water and apples as well. The room was the perfect size for the both of us. Yes, its an older hotel, but its charming and all the amenities we needed were great. I appreciated that they also had a pamphlet of different pillows that they offered for extra comfort. Edith at the concierge is a gem!! We had a great conversation with her and she helped us map out an excellent route to the Golden Gate Bridge using public transportation. The hotel is close to shopping and great restaurants and a few steps from Union Square. All in all, we had a great time and great stay. Thank you Chancellor Hotel!
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square, trolley, all public transportation, great restaurants.

review.title: quaint hotel near union square
review.reviewText: Great location.  Very comfortable beds.  Very friendly staff.  Great hotel for the price!
review.negativeRemarks: lamps didn't work when we got there
review.locationRemarks: Eat at Sears Fine Food next door for breakfast.  It is pricey but very good!

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel staff very pleasant and very polite, nice location next to union square and cable cars xx

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: First time to San Francisco and stayed here because of the location, as we decided not to rent a car. True, the rooms were small, but they were clean and the staff was accommodating. We would definitely come back here again and recommend this to friends and family. GREAT VALUE.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the location, price, cleanliness -- and charm.
review.negativeRemarks: Have two sets of towels (perhaps available in the closet) would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: We thought the location was great having all modes of transportation conveniently located nearby.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Right in union square! Cant beat the location, staff are very friendly and helpful, room was clean and comfortable, great stay!

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText:
We made a reservation at the last minute and we were able to get a great deal.  The room was small but manageable.  The location makes up for it.  The bed and pillows were very comfortable.  The two areas that need attention are the hallway and the bathroom.  The carpet in the hallway was very dingy and the bathroom is in desperate need of a remodel.

It's nice to see the little touches the hotel provides - free coffee, cookies and fruit.  We will stay again if the price is right.

review.title: I felt like ELOISE!
review.reviewText: What a treat to stay at the Chancellor. Not having been to SF in over a decade I chose this hotel based on its ratings and I'm glad I did. Lovely stay from the moment I arrived. And I had a place where I could valet my car, the bed and pillows were great. Charmingly decorated with everything I could need - fridge, TV, closet, deep tub (even a rubber duck!), iron/board, heater, extra blanket, fluffy towels and even an umbrella! You can order breakfast in bed and there is a cute restaurant downstairs. And it's right in the middle of Union Square.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of Union Square - I chose it because it was a mile away from a theater I was going to to see a friend star in the leading role. Perfect.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Value for the money was incredible. I will stay here next time. Right along the cable car line. Clean. Good bed. Historic. Fun 100 year old hotel with character.

review.title: Nice downtown hotel
review.reviewText: Extremely pleased with my stay at this quality historic hotel in downtown SF.  Furnishings had style and were in good condition.  Very comfortable bed.  Excellent value in a great location next to Union Square!
Nice hotel close to resturants, shops and trolley access.  Will definitely stay again.

review.title: Outstanding hotel and service
review.reviewText: Will definitely be staying here for my future visits.
The Chancellor is a great hotel in central location. The staff was very friendly and accommodating.

review.title: Convenient.
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel because we wanted to be close to everything and not having to worry about driving around. This hotel delivered!! We chose valet for parking and the staff was very helpful with evrything that we need. There were restaurants all over the place and we ended up eating 2 dinner 2 lunches and 2 breakfasts. The staff was more than happy to help us have a very comfortable stay.
review.positiveRemarks: location and the rate and staff
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Macy's mall, chinatown and many restaurants.

review.title: Okay bed, but HORRIBLE bathroom amenities.
review.reviewText: The bed was nice / clean and comfortable, but the bathroom and shower was absolutely terrible. Parts of the mirror were chipped off, mold in the corners, the toilet looked like a toilet at a bar, and the base of the shower was sticky and slippery at the same time.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was big and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom was in extremely poor condition.

review.title: Conveniently located in the center of SF
review.reviewText:
The hotel should be renovated and modernized.
The room is too small for 2 people and the lobby uncomfortable.
No drawing room, no hospitable facilities.
Staff dedicated and ready to help.
review.positiveRemarks: Basically, its easy location close to Union Square
review.negativeRemarks:
See above


See above.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping and going to the ocean shore.

review.title: staff
review.reviewText: entire staff had genuine  hospitality.  warm greetings and engagement.
review.positiveRemarks: location, staff, old fashion service feel.
review.negativeRemarks: a/c.
review.locationRemarks: good location.

review.title: Very Nice Historic Hotel...
review.reviewText: great service, very nice. get a room on the back side to avoid the street noise.
review.locationRemarks: very central to shopping and restaurants

review.title: Great location for getting about
review.reviewText:
Stayed here for 4 nights in October 2015. Lovely hotel in a great location, it has easy access to several varieties of public transport. 

The hotel is very nice and friendly, I didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on this side but the room was more than adequate for me as a solo traveller. 

Only thing to note is the walls are very thin and the toilets have a loud flush, however after a few days you get used to it.

I would definitely stay there again and wouldn't hesitate suggesting it to others.

review.title: Great hotel with awesome staff
review.reviewText: Came here at the end of our honeymoon tp Maui.   The Chancellor hooked us up and even gave us a bottle of Champagne. Fresh fruit infused water in Lobby was q great touch. Cute hotel right in the middle of Union Square.  Thanks Chancellor we will be back!

review.title: Lovely characterful hotel in a great location!
review.reviewText: Overall I had a very pleasant stay here. The hotel room was well equipped and very nicely furnished. The hotel is situated right off Union Square. My room had a massive closet which was great for storing the suitcases and also had a decent sized (easy to operate) safe. I was at the back of the hotel, which was quieter.
review.positiveRemarks: It was old fashioned and characterful.
review.negativeRemarks: The only downside to the hotel was that the decor was dated, but this didn't detract from a great friendly service and overall my room was very tidy.
review.locationRemarks: Location couldn't be any better. The cable car system runs right outside the hotel and Union Square, Macy's, Bloomingdales etc. is on the doorstep.

review.title: Nice hotel @ Union Square.  Good location.
review.reviewText: Last minute reservation.   Excellent price for SF.

review.title: My favorite place to stay!
review.reviewText: This has been my hotel for my last three visits to S.F. It is in the perfect location, the staff always kind, room always clean and affordable price! Can't beat it!
Amazing location, staff very helpful, very good breakfast.

review.title: Nice hotel central San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is a nice old world hotel located in the middle of the shopping and restaurant district in San Francisco. The rooms are a little on the small side however this just added to the charm. Our first option was to stay at Fisherman's Wharf but so glad that we opted for a hotel at Union Square as there are better restaurants and the overall feel is much better.
review.negativeRemarks: Access to taxi's
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants & shopping

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Awesome location. Nice ambiance. Old style, but very well kept! The WiFi needs help!
review.positiveRemarks: Old fashion, but very well kept! Being able to have a nice breakfast in the hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: WiFi system needs help!
review.locationRemarks: Just stayed a night, visiting relatives.

review.title: Nice hotel in very center of San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed there for 3 days from 25 to 28 of September. In general it was pleasant stay in the very center of the city. Means easy access to almost all SF attractions. Cable car (stop- just in front of hotel)- to Fisherman Wharf/Lombard St/Coit tower, street car- to Twin Peaks. A lot of restaurants around, shopping centers (actually all famous brands). But as always you will pay for center location- a bit noisy in rooms facing Union square (but we slept well)  and expensive parking. Stuff was excellent and very helpful, complimentary coffee and snacks (in lobby area) was nice. To resume- I would stay again in that hotel and recommend it to my friends
review.negativeRemarks:
Better sound protection in rooms facing Union square,
better water pressure in shower,
more TV channels selection,
less expensive parking
review.locationRemarks:
The very center of city- close to everything
Cable car to Fisherman Wharf, Lombard St, Coit tower
Street car to Twin Peaks

review.title: Lots of charm in a great neighborhood
review.reviewText: Very nice boutique hotel in a great part of the city! Close to lots of restaurants and tourist attractions.  Rooms are small but clean and the hotel has a lot of character throughout.  I forgot my glasses in the room; they called to let me know and even mailed them back to me!  Great customer service.

review.title: Nice old downtown hotel.
review.reviewText: Room is very small. Bed looked clean,  but the restroom always smelled like pee even when we even hadn't use it yet. Staff members excellent! Loved the history of the hotel!

review.title: Excellent location to union square.
review.reviewText:
Placed us on the 3 rd floor..... Perfect.  Open the window heard the clang clang of the trolley.  Loved it.  When we wanted more quiet, just closed the window.  No noise.  Very, very clean.
The bed was wonderful.  Great bar.  Didn't eat at the restaurant.  Perfect location.  I would recommend this hotel to everyone.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, bar, clean, the bed.  We liked everything.  No complaints.
review.locationRemarks: We did the hop on hop off.  The trolley runs right in front of the hotel.  The stop is about 50 feet down the street.

review.title: Great location and very clean
review.reviewText: Next to Union Square and cable car line.  The entire hotel staff were very professional and accommodating.  The room was very clean and even though a older hotel it was well maintained and in very good repair.  This was our first time visiting the Chancellor; on our next visit we will stay again, highly recommend!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, competitively priced, and very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Faster elevators
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square, Cable Car line just out the door, tour companies pick up at the front entrance, easy walking to ChinaTown. Major shopping stores by

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText:
I will start by saying if San Francisco is having a heart wave the Hotel does Not have air condition! The first night we got there it was so hot in our room it was miserable. The staff brought a small fan n the window was open about 8 ". It didn't help! The Hotel is very old and didn't have air condition. 
The weather got cooler for the rest of the trip so we stayed. 
The location is perfect. The staff was very helpful. The hotel restaurant had a good breakfast but it was not free. 
Other than a heat wave and no a/c everything else was great.

review.title: Good, centrally located hotel
review.reviewText: Very enjoyable stay at the hotel. Reception staff were friendly and helpful when we arrived. The room was comfortable and the ceiling fan was very quiet. We were at the back of the hotel and despite the hotel's location on a busy street we were not disturbed at all. Really close for picking up the cable car and for shopping in Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: Good facilities in reception, cool flavoured water, coffee and cookies. High standard of cleanliness and all the staff were  very friendly and helpful
review.negativeRemarks: Very hot when we visited, so the room was a bit uncomfortable at night.
review.locationRemarks: Close to pickup for the cable car. Easy access to Fisherman's Wharf and Alcatraz. Also within walking distance of shopping in Union Square.

review.title: Nice old hotel great location
review.reviewText: Overall great experience from check in thru check out. I liked that the windows opened but my room on the 5th floor was a little noisy with the window open. no AC, ceiling fan worked well

We were on the 2nd floor and it got a bit noisy at night, but nothing some earplugs couldn't take care of! The staff was great, room was very clean and comfortable. We would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Very pleasant stay.
review.reviewText: Spent 3 nights and it was most enjoyable.  Room was a little small, but it is on Union Square in an old building, so that was completely understandable.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the small, quaint hotel feel.
review.locationRemarks: If you like to shop and eat, this is the place for you; stops and restaurants everywhere.  Huge versions of mall stores, i.e. Victory Secrets, Macys.

review.title: Walls are very thin
review.reviewText: Walls are so think, you can hear everything.  But the restaurant served great breakfast and lunch.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: The weather was exceptionally hot, which made the room's ceiling fan inadequate.
review.positiveRemarks: Lovely old-world charm, as befitting a building dating from a more gracious era.
review.negativeRemarks: Any form of air conditioning

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to comment on your stay with us. I sincerely apologize that you found things unacceptable during your stay and I would like to try and see if there was anything I could do to make things better. Regarding the fixture you saw on the wall, that is actually the heating system for the hotel not an A/C unit, many of the boutique hotels in San Francisco do not have air-conditioning. I will definitely talk to housekeeping department in regards to how the fan was brought up and the cleanliness of the room and bathroom. I know from personal experience, nothing is worse than something not meeting expectations. I know that the parking can seem a bit pricey but we actually are on the lower side when it comes to the prices for parking around Union Square. Once again I am terribly sorry your stay was a disappointment. Please let me know what I can do to turn your experience around.

review.title: Was NOT Impressed! Don't stay here!
review.reviewText: We booked the hotel through Expedia for a last min one night stay in the city. I normally do my research and browse Tripadvisor before booking to see actual hotel travelers photos and reviews. Since we were rushed I went off the 4.3/5 rating that was listed on the site. When we arrived we were told each hotel room had great views. Our view was a brick wall. The room was small and hot! Almost like being in a prison cell. They have an A/C wall fixture in the room and when we called the front desk to ask how it worked they said the hotel had NO A/C and they would bring an extra fan if we liked. They brought the fan to us with the cord hanging, it was just very unprofessional. The carpet was coming up in the room and the corners had dirt, candy wrappers etc all in that area that was exposed. The bathroom smelled gross. Almost like a men's restroom/ urinal. It smelled of urine and didn't seem clean at all. We didn't even want to use the bathroom. The bed was hard and still. At least the pillows were comfortable. PARKING is about 40 bucks  if you parked it yourself which is a block away. You would have to walk all the way back with your bags. We opted for valet which was about 53 bucks and because we had a truck they charged us an additional $11 on top of that. This was PER DAY charge. That's CRAZY! I would personally NEVER stay at this hotel again!
review.negativeRemarks: The parking rates, Cleanliness of the bathroom and the smell of the bathroom, getting A/C for the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of Union Square. Everything to do right outside the hotel doors.

review.title: Very comfortable and good location
review.reviewText: Needed a last minute hotel room in SF went online looking for central location. Reviews and price were good so we booked. The room was very clean! The bed and pillows so comfortable, it is one of the best nights sleep I have had in s hotel. Front desk staff friendly no hidden fees. I would stay there again!

review.title: Very Comfortable hotel. Great location.
review.reviewText: Top location on Union Square. Close to good shopping and restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice idea to have complimentary cookies, fruit and water in lobby. Tea/ coffee in evenings

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: An older hotel with a terrific staff! It has been around a while, but the staff obviously cares about your stay.

review.title: No AC
review.reviewText: the hotel is nice and the staff is very nice. The rooms don't have AC so it is very hot during the summer.

review.title: Great hotel in a excellent location.
review.reviewText: Arrived hot and sweaty at 10 am after a being up since 2 am, just looking to leave our bags there till check in time. "Surprise your room is ready! This great service continued during our 4 night stay. The rooms are not that small, very clean, great bed and towels. Fridge get's really cold too. Yes the front is noisy but that comes with the great location. Had delicious egg's Benny their one morning also. This hotel is a rare combination of character, comfort and class.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Right by tram stop and union square. Staff are so friendly and helpful.  
Tea coffee and goodies served complimentary down in receotion all day 
Would definitely go back

review.title: Hotel with character
review.reviewText: I was there for a very brief time - after a late dinner and left early in the morning for a flight.  Happy to be in a hotel with some charm and not a cookie cutter like so many others.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: very good
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was helpful and friendly. I did not see any bugs anywhere in the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Lots of character, built in 1914. It is very well maintained.
review.negativeRemarks: I liked it just as it is.
review.locationRemarks: It's a short down hill walk to union square and Bart. The cable car is right out front.

review.reviewText:
My sister and I stayed here for 4 days during our trip to San Francisco, and we really enjoyed the Chancellor. Our room was comfortable and very clean. The room didn't have air, so it would get a little hot as we were getting ready for the day (using our hair dryers and straighteners), but at any other time during the day, the ceiling fan and cool breeze from the window was just enough. I do suggest though, if you dont want to hear all of the noise and sounds of the city, dont get a room facing powell st. My sister and i didnt mind it, but for some, it might be too noisy.
The staff was very friendly and offered us complimentary water, cookies, and apples upon our arrival (which we definitely took advantage of after coming in from a long day of walking around the city). 
The Chancellor is also in a perfect location, right in Union Square by Macy's and Saks! We took the BART train from the airport right to powell st and the hotel was only a short walking distance away. The cable car also runs right in front of the hotel, and any of the double decker tour buses can be caught there as well.

This was a great hotel, and I would recommend it to everyone!

review.title: The Hotel to Stay At!
review.reviewText: After trying out a few hotels and exploring San Francisco for our first time, we stumbled upon this hotel, and we were sold.  Will stay here every time from now on.  Clean, well priced, great staff, great room, great location!  Made us want to stay in San Francisco longer.
review.negativeRemarks: Just know it will take about 30 minutes to get your car from valet, so plan accordingly.
review.locationRemarks: Great food next door, around the corner, and near by!  Good location to all things.

review.title: convenient location
review.reviewText: The hotel is not too fancy, but it's located in the heart of the downtown. You can walk and take BART or buses everywhere. The room is reasonably comfortable, and windows shut out the noise outside quite efficiently. There are a lot of formal restaurants and fast food services nearby. From the airport, you can take BART to Powell Station and then walk to the hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: It was a good stay. I knew the rooms were going to be small, so I was prepared.  We didn't always get soap or bath salts when they were needed. The staff was very helpful with planning our outings.  I'd stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: A microwave would have been nice or coffee maker. I didn't always want to get dressed to go get a coffee.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great. Lots to do in the union square area.

review.title: Great Hotel - Great Location
review.reviewText: easy check in, pleasant staff, great location, clean guest room, walk in closet. VERY much enjoyed my stay :)
review.negativeRemarks: only con is the bathroom doors should open outwards instead of inwards due to the toilet.

review.title: Great hotel located in the middle of everything.
review.reviewText: Loved our stay at the chancellor. Clean rooms and very attentive staff!

review.title: Great location, great price, value for money.
review.reviewText: Was at hotel for business. Arrived early and room was ready. There was cold water and snacks in the lobby. Room was great. Something cool and different is they had a pillow menu, where you could pick the type of pillow you wanted.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location.  In an area where hotels are either pricey or smaller than a closet, this one delivers a good sized room at great price.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms have fans, would of preferred AC, but that is a personal choice.

review.title: Nice hotel, in the middle of everything.
review.reviewText: Pros: Cute, comforting, clean, nice decor, beds were very comfortable, in the middle of downtown. Cons: The rooms were small for me, and kinda stuff air conditioning wasent working as well, the wifi was not connectable.But i would stay again.

review.title: Great location and staff
review.reviewText: great location and staff who went out of their way to assist. Especially appreciated the late checkout. Would recommend to anyone visiting San Fran. Rooms serviced and cleaned in prompt manner
review.negativeRemarks: Had no problems
review.locationRemarks: close to restaurants, cable cars all bus tour pick up areas and shopping precinct. Easy to get around

review.title: Centric  Hotel
review.reviewText: Love San Francisco!  Trolley stops  right outside hotel awsome! Rooms are small and no ac/heater but provided a portable heater. Comfortable  stay.

review.title: Classic comfort
review.reviewText: A comfortable hotel that pays attention to the small details.
review.locationRemarks: A central location in the middle of excellent shopping.

review.title: Sweet
review.reviewText: Very pleasant experience. Super clean, nice older hotel with a lot of charm. Complementary water, coffee and cookies in the lobby. Rooms are well decorated, clean. Location is in the heart of everything.  Would stay again!
Great hotel, very clean and good staff in a superb location. Can't fault it!

review.title: Warm and wonderful
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is a lovely hotel, personable staff, great location, well tended lobby and rooms. Topping it off: coffee and tea available throughout the day along with cookies if one wishes to indulge. Altogether a delightful experience.

review.title: Old Charm
review.reviewText: This hotel is old but charming and kept up well. The amenities were great, the staff was friendly, and you can't beat the location!  The bed was HUGE and comfortable. I would definitely chose to stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The charm of the old building but still feeling like it was kept up well.
review.negativeRemarks: The tub had some paint chips missing but that didn't affect my rating at all.
review.locationRemarks: Its basically ON union square - near tons of shopping. I got my nails done around the corner. There's a street car right in front.

review.title: Chancellor Hotel in SF
review.reviewText: We very much enjoyed our stay in the hotel.  It was our first time in SF and the location and service were excellent.  Room was attended to daily and staff at front desk, concierge, bell captain and restaurant were all very helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower could have used a mild tweak.
review.locationRemarks: Access to everything SF is straightforward, restaurants, entertainment, shops, public transit, fisherman's wharf, all is within minutes.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, good location in centre of town.  Friendly staff and good coffee at reception

review.title: Nice hotel, very convenient location!
review.reviewText:
easy check in and out.  Home made cookies and apples, coffee, tea 24 hrs./ day
Nice lounge area and bar area with sports on, but not loud. location is best part.  small, but walk In closet holds a lot.  2 luggage racks are very helpful.  Nice size tub/ shower.
review.positiveRemarks: Solid, elegant flair. Nice restaurant for breakfast, lunch, bar evenings.
review.locationRemarks: On Powell so can catch the street car Accross the street.  walk one block to Union square, small park,like.  2 nice in/ outdoor restaurants.

review.reviewText: Wonderful friendly & great location! I loved the old charm & great coffee!

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is located in Union Square so you are literally in the heart of the city!  The 100+ year old hotel has a perfect blend of old world charm mixed with modern comforts (which includes a menu with over 12 different types of pillows to choose from)!!! Next time I am in San Francisco, I will undoubtedly stay there again!

review.title: Nice accommodations - good walkable location
review.reviewText: Nice weekend. Location accessible to all forms of transportation from feet to buses to cable cars. Very good restaurants in area. Woman concierge not helpful in suggesting restaurants, wasn't familiar with ones nearby! Would return again.

review.title: don't stay here if you want a restful sleep
review.reviewText:
no air conditioning - the room was really hot
we had to open the windows - the street noise and people keep us up all night.

review.title: Great location, nice staff, comfy
review.reviewText: Best place for us... on the cable car line, within sight of Union Square.  Was so glad to stay there.  Complimentary coffee and cookies.  Great atmosphere.  Would definitely like to stay there again!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff helped us to extend our stay there... very helpful and nice staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Located near the theater, art gallery areas close to Union Square... and shopping down at Market St

review.title: Vacation
review.reviewText: We choose the hotel due to several reviews.  We enjoy older hotels that have history and character.  The Chancellor has both in a wonderful way.  We arrived late but the staff greeted us like old friends.  We used the dining facility for breakfast every morning.  OUTSTANDING.  We were less than 1/2 block from all the stores at Union Square.  We also walked to China Town which only took a few minutes even for us, senior citizens.  The beds and bedding were very comfortable.  If you are looking for ultra modern, this is not for you.  BUT if you want comfort and classic good service, you will not be disappointed.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to everything.  The cold water in the lobby, a very refreshing touch
review.negativeRemarks: Leave the hotel as is.
review.locationRemarks: There are numerous excellent restaurants for dinner within  a short two block area.  Union Square is less than 1/2 block from the entrance.

review.reviewText: The staff is wonderful and able to recommend excellent places to dine in the area.  The breakfast menu provided enough options to make almost any one happy.  We were always greeted when ever we came in.  Although an older hotel the rooms are very comfortable.  The bath room is a little small, but this is what you expect in a 100 year old hotel.  Pillows and bed were just right for sleeping.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything.  Especially the flavored ice water in the lobby.  Very refreshing.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Very close to all shopping at Union Square.  Chinatown is an easy walk.  Excellent restaurants in the area.

review.title: Lovely hotel for short stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Although the room size was understandably small (what do you expect with a historic downtown SF building?), the hotel makes up the lack of space with very accommodating reception and housekeeping staff. The complimentary wireless internet, luggage storage, and treats (water, tea/coffee, cookies) in the lobby were also a bonus.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very helpful. I needed a last-minute need for a scanner and they were able to provide it for me.
review.negativeRemarks: An addition of complimentary breakfast, maybe?
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of downtown SF: lots of shopping, Union Square for people-watching and passing time, nearby Chinatown, well-loved cable car rides!

review.title: Best Place to Stay in the City!!
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed this hotel.  The staff was amazing!! Easy check in and out! They provided a complimentary bottle of champagne for my birthday!! I love old hotels and the feel of the past with all of today's amenities!! I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Friendly helpful staff, complimentary coffee, fruit and cookies in reception. Great location for cable cars, bus tours, and BART transportation, shopping (Macys etc) opposite hotel, and there is a Wallgreens convenience store close by if needed.

review.title: Excellent location by Union Square
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were great, the hotel was just the right size, not too big.  The location was excellent, right by the trolley car stop and great shopping.  The rooms were small, but well maintained and functional.
review.positiveRemarks: The concierge was extremely helpful and knowledgable on the area and the attractions.

review.title: Great place to stay along Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice clean rooms. A little tight but we weren't staying in the room that much touring the city. Overall pleasant stay. Not too exposed to outside noise considering the central location. Would book here again.

We had fun during our stay at the Chancellor Hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and the hotel was old but clean. The rooms were comfortable and having a pillow menu was an added bonus. The hotel was a little pricey compared to the other hotels in the same area.

review.title: Hotel is in a great area...next to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Great old Classic Hotel in SF next to Union Square. We had a view of a brick building across our window...but it was okay, because it was in such a great area: restaurants and shopping. I love this hotel...very Parisian .
review.positiveRemarks: The ice water in lobby, with lemon. The luggage guy was great!
review.negativeRemarks: Better wine. Nicer bartender. He acted as though it was a "pain" to get me a better chardonnay.  Their chardonnay was really bad.  Sorry.
review.locationRemarks: Great food near by and pharmacies

review.reviewText: great location, good room facilities and very reasonable price for Union square in San fransisco

review.title: Nice location. Room is nice.
review.reviewText: first room wasnot goodlocation and too nisy sndcoudn't sleep, so we asked to change room. Second floor to top floor we moved. Then everything was good.

review.title: very good
review.reviewText: very good place to stay in SF, perfect location for tourists. Not recommended for family with kids - small room in busy downtown. They don't have  complimentary breakfest which  is good ( usually junk in the hotels ), but they serve delicious coffee and tea with very tasty cookies 24h!! You can buy very tasty breakfest in hotel's restaurant  in good price.

review.title: Nice hotel in the middle of everything
review.reviewText: The hotel is really nice, although the room was small it was well appointed and very clean.  It is in the middle of Union square and was easily accessible via the trolley or walking.  We had a car and opted for the valet parking which added an additional $45 dollars a night to our bill but it was worth the cost, so if you have a car while visiting add the price to the estimate of your cost.  They had coffee available all day and night, even decaf which was very tasty as well as snacks.  The front desk and all the staff were very nice.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the coffee and the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was a bit small for us.
review.locationRemarks: In the middle of Union Square it is close to a cable car pick up, Chinatown, the Financial district and not too far a walk to the Embarcado.

review.title: Good value hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Two night stay while meeting friends in San Francisco. Good location for sightseeing and cable cars.
review.negativeRemarks: Air con
review.locationRemarks: Very central

review.title: Great hotel,  felt safe, great locatiodn
review.reviewText: Safe,  great clean and neat. no a.c. but it is not required,  opening windows onto union square was great. Has great character. Highly recommend.

review.title: Great location... Great Staff!!
review.reviewText: Perfect location in Union Square. Entire staff very nice. Rooms are very clean with a good amount of space. Only downside was noise from street. We were on 4th floor facing Powell street. Not a huge deal and was a good experience being in the city! Highly recommended...

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel in superb location, convenient for most SF touristy spots. Welcoming and helpful staff. No complaints, only fulsome praise.
review.negativeRemarks: Cannot think how it might be improved
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location in centre of San Francisco

review.title: Nice hotel, nice staff
review.reviewText: Stayed for 2 nights in May. Other than the lack of air conditioning, we found the hotel very comfortable and the staff went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable. We were able to check in early upon our arrival which was great and housekeeping made sure our stay was enjoyable as well. Hotel staff seem happy which always makes for a great experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is easily accessible by trolley car or walking.

review.title: Great Deal for San Francisco
review.reviewText: I went to San Drancisco with my sister to explore the city. we stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. the building is old historical hotel exactly on Union Square which makes it the best location to go everywhere in the city. the cable cars stop right infront of the hotel, as well as many busses and trolleys . great location for shopping and fine dining . the only minus is that the rooms are not very large but it is normal for downtown hotel in San Fran, and the rate for this hotel is much cheaper that any other around. go for it if you want nice, clean and affordable place in the best location of the city. and there are always complimentary cookies and coffee

review.title: Nice place to stay close to Union Square
review.reviewText: This was our second stay at the Chancellor.  The rooms are smallish but the hotel is in a great location and is reasonably priced.  The staff is excellent and the facilities are clean and very well maintained.  The dining room is great for breakfast and lunch, it would be nice if they were open for dinner too.  Highly recommended!!!

review.title: Friendly staff and excellent location
review.reviewText: One of the best independent hotels in Union Square area. Location is excellent and the staff was very helpful.

review.title: godd hotel in all way
review.reviewText: there 24 hrs coffee, tea, milk, cooki just awesome. everything else is perfect

review.title: Stayed on two seperate occasions within 2 weeks
review.reviewText:
Rooms relatively small
NO Air conditioning... a big NO NO in this day and age
review.negativeRemarks:
Air conditioning
all on breakfast menu NOT available

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Excellent location, room comfortable, bathroom a bit tired.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We had a great time at the Chancellor. It has a prime location on Union Square, close to transportation, restaurants and stores.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the very friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Although the hotel has the character of an old building, it could certainly use some revamping. Walls are not soundproof either.

review.title: My go to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION.. PERFECT!!! Surrounded by the shopping of Union Square, restaurants, bars, clubs, cable car, bart, what else do you need? I really enjoyed my stay! I've stayed in San Francisco at nicely priced hotels and you get what you pay for. But I paid about the same price for this room and I was impressed! On the hotel staff I rated a 3 because on our way out we payed for a shuttle to pick us up at 1:55. We were there at 1:55 and the shuttle had already left. The employees there were like you can catch the bart or a taxi. I'm like we already paid cant you call the shuttle back? We are right on time. By coincidence and luck the shuttle driver came back for us. No thanks to the hotel staff. Other than that my room experience was amazing!!!
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was comfy, the location, and I walked out on the fire escape to take pics :)
review.negativeRemarks: I was very pleased!
review.locationRemarks: There is nothing you cannot do in Union Square!

review.title: Great Hotel better than the Hilton on Union Square
review.reviewText: Great room the ambiance it is just amazing. Better than the Hilton on Union Square few blocks ahead where I stayed for 4 nts.
review.positiveRemarks: The ambiance the cleanness. Everything was great and also the perks,.
review.locationRemarks: Great location in the heart of everything,.

review.reviewText: Room was clean and comfortable and hotel was very conveniently located.

review.title: Very Nice and Clean
review.reviewText: The staff was very nice from check in to check out.  Rory in the bar was excellent.  The room was nice and clean.  Well maintained.  Newly updated.  Room was on the backside of building so it was quite even with my window open.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff very friendly, room nice and clean.  Comfortable bed!!
review.negativeRemarks: Slow elevator :)
review.locationRemarks: Great location in Union Square.

review.title: Great hotel and great location
review.reviewText: We loved the hotel and the location. We had a fire escape out side of our window so we were able to climb out and listen to jazz music playing from the corner. The staff were excellence to and helped with late night food recommendations.,

review.title: Amazing hotel
review.reviewText: The location can't be beat, the ro was cute and super clean and fresh. Only issue is it was a bit warm but you can get a breeze from the window. We will definitely stay there again!!

review.title: In a perfect position to explore San Fransisco.
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time . San Fransisco s a beautiful city

review.title: Historic hotel with charm
review.reviewText: Great location to shops, sights, restaurants, public transportation. Staff very friendly and willing to please. Great hot breakfast served in hotel restaurant with charming waitress.

review.title: Prime location-Union Square
review.reviewText: Friendly staff. Super clean room. Comfy bed. Nice vintage feel with modern touches. Complimentary coffee, tea, cookies. Excellent location-in the heart of union square.

review.title: Excellent one-night stay for work - great location
review.reviewText: I was staying just for one night for work. The location is perfect for a central and safe place - right next to Union Square, where all the great shopping places (other than Westfield, which is about a 10-15 min walk away) is based. Great food places too - the Bellini cafe was lovely (great Cuban latte and crepes). The hotel itself was easy to find, the staff were helpful and the building had quite a art deco feel for me.
