Lovely room, very comfy bed, TV was great, bathroom was well equipped and clean. Definitely would have stayed longer if I could have.
review.negativeRemarks: Adjustable height of shower head would have been a bonus
review.locationRemarks: Shopping at Macy's right on the opposite side of the hotel, where the Cheesecake factory is also based on their lovely sky terrace.

review.reviewText: Cute and comfortable, easy to get around in the heart of downtown. Great Bloody Mary's
Wonderful stay. Rooms are small but not uncomfortable. Fantastic central location within walking distance of so many restaurants and shops. Very reasonable cost-wise.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Perfect lication and friendly staff. Rooms are small and some rooms have a wall in front of the windows.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Value for money hotel, room slightly small for two, instead of a cupboard, room had a small cupboard room which was very clever, very convenient hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need renovation
review.locationRemarks: It's in Union Square which is center of SF in my view, so everthing and anything is close by.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Very Good Location, close to public transportation and cable car, friendly staff, clean rooms
review.locationRemarks: cable but run in front of the hotel, so you can easily go to Fishermen Wharfs, Bowel station for public transportation and airport

review.title: Good downtown hotel
review.reviewText: Good value for money, rooms have a small fridge and windows that open. I would stay at this hotel again
review.positiveRemarks: available complimentary fresh fruit, all day tea/coffee. Friendly and helpful staff
review.negativeRemarks: no further comment
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking to Powell St BART and MUNI, Market St Westfield and all major department stores

review.title: Comfortable and clean, good location
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect to come back to after our long days walking around the city. It was close enough to everything that we were able to come back and rest at various points during the day, too. It was in an area that seemed mostly about shopping, which we weren't into, but it was a 20 minute or less walk to almost everywhere we wanted to go - north beach,  the pier/Alcatraz ferry, Japan town, etc. It was a quick walk to the BART, too, so it was easy to get to the mission district in 15 minutes. Our room was small but not too small, it was very clean, and it was super quiet which was pretty amazing since it was in the heart of a busy area. There were free cookies in the lobby and water infused with cucumbers or fruit which was awesome. I'd stay here again for sure!

review.title: Small Parisian Type Hotel In SanFrancisco
review.reviewText: Small hotel with charm. Helpful pleasant staff and all you need is there for a comfortable stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, pleasant helpful service and a feeling of safety. Everything you need is there for a small hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Small bathrooms but wouldn't be possible to be made bigger.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for shopping, dining and walking distance to many points of interest as well as close acess to public transportation.

review.title: The Small Hotel that Has it All
review.reviewText: My Grandson (9 years old) and I just returned from San Francisco where we stayed at the Chancellor Hotel .  When we walked into the room my grandson said,"I love this hotel".  Our room  was immaculate, and the decor was up to date.  The services we received were way above the norm. Food service in the restaurant was excellent. The concierge was "spot on" in response to requests, Housekeeping  cheerfully found our gift that was left in the room and agreed to mail it to us, and the staff set up seats outside so guests could comfortably watch the Chinese New Year Parade.  I usually stay a the large hotel right down the block, but I will return to the Chancellor Hotel in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: The overall feeling that we were very well taken care of.
review.negativeRemarks: Today, I cannot think of a thing.
review.locationRemarks: Everything we needed was within walking distance, access to public transportation, cabs everywhere, and just a few steps to Union

review.title: Outstanding in almost every way.
review.reviewText: Fantastic location, friendly staff, nothing was too much hassle. It's a little dated but this actually added to the character of the place. Highly recommended.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: This was our third stay at this hotel. Great location at Union Square making everthing easily accessible. Love the fresh apples, delicious cookies, and the strawberry water in the lobby! Great value for your travel dollar.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel is located right next to Union Square, convenient to restaurants and shops.

review.title: Great location, comfortable and affordable.
review.reviewText: Great hotel.  The bed was comfortable, great location and very competitive price.  I'll stay here again.

review.title: Nice traditional hotel ideally located
review.reviewText: This is not a modern chain hotel, it is traditional and a little European. The rooms are small but comfortable, for San Francisco it is a good size. The hotel is very clean and the staff is wonderful. For the first time i felt comfortable enough to not lock away my stuff when leaving a hotel room. There is coffee, water, tea, fruits, cookies and muffins available in the Lobby 24/7 which i thought was a great idea. especially if it is breakfast to go or a late night snack. The location is perfect. It is on the lower end of Powell Street very close to Macy's and all the shopping on Union Square and about 1/2 hr walk to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39 where you can get really great and all types of sea food. Also there are a lot of cafes on the street as you walk out of the hotel. if you choose not have breakfast at the hotel. It is literally next to DSW and Walgreens.  Would definitely stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: i am fine with it
review.locationRemarks: see experience

review.title: Very nice hotel and centrally located.
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with many things:  How easy it was to walk to from the Powell Street BART station; how centrally located it was in the heart of Union Square with the shopping dining and entertainment; the cleanliness; the European type charm; the friendliness of staff and the amenities.  The price through Expedia was great!  Eating at Sears right next store for breakfast was fabulous.  I will return often!
review.positiveRemarks: It's location, price and European charm!
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located for shopping, theater, dining and night life.  Breakfast at Sears, Lunch at Mocca on Maiden Lane, drinks at the Sir Frances Drake.

review.title: Very convenient location
review.reviewText:
A very convenient location just above Union Square. Although I had a room overlooking the main road there was no problem with noise. Staff very friendly. Free hot drinks available in the reception area 24 hours. Free cookies and muffins in the morning. Free WiFi with reasonably fast speeds. 
Some parts of the hotel feel a little tired (e.g. carpets on stair cases, bathroom) and would benefit with updating. However I would certainly stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Some bits need refreshing
review.locationRemarks: Opposite cable car stop.

review.title: Girls week
review.reviewText: My 16 year old daughter  and I stayed here for a 3 night girls trip... Was everything we needed and more.  Perfect location as we did not have a car.  We Walked most places but did use the bus and the occasional cab.  I have never reviewed a hotel before but decided to since we have such a good experience here.  The only warning I would have is not to stay here during the summer as the hotel does not have AC. We stayed in February and it was in the 70'S-the room was a little stuffy when we would return  in the  evening-we opened the window for a little while and it was perfect.  Loved the city noise from the street when the window was open, really could tell you were in a big city. Rooms are small and have a European feel to them. Perfect place to stay, would not change a thing!

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect. Perfect location, good price, great food. I haven't been to the SF for a very long time.  I cannot wait to go back! I would stay here again for sure! The room was perfect, Very comfy bed, clean room,  nice decore. Located in the heart of Union Square.

review.title: Worth the price....
review.reviewText: Good service and nice, clean room. Staff were very friendly. They had coffee/tea/cookies/apples at the front desk and in the morning.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, visit to Chinatown, cable car trip

review.reviewText:
Perfect location. Good price.
Helpful staff . Facilities are old but comfortable. Will stay again..

review.title: Update needed urgently
review.reviewText: Noisy and smelly room. Everything needs update. Not coming back

We had a great stay at The Chancellor the Staff were very helpful and friendly. We enjoyed the complementary fruit and cookies. It was close to plenty of shops, and a short trip to the main attractions on a cable car. The concierge went out of his way to help us beyond our expectations. We would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: The hotel is in Union Square so it's very convenient.  We took the train from the airport into the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: It's a bit old but it's pretty clean.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, lots of shopping, close to the pier, etc

review.title: Couple vacation
review.reviewText: Arrived at airport (SFO) and took BART to Powell Station.  Then walked 4 or 5 blocks to hotel.  Brought a Bart airport ticket and Cable / Muni pass at information Desk located just outside of the Airport Bart Station.  Hotel is located just across the street from Cable Car stop.  Hotel near high end shopping area.  Walking distance to China Town and Ferry Building.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and how the people at the front desk treated you.
review.negativeRemarks: No
review.locationRemarks: Everything was near the hotel (shopping (high end), cable car, etc.

review.title: Best Value Hotel in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Where do I start??  Homemade DELICIOUS cookies ALL DAY, fresh apples, a variety of teas & coffee PLUS flavourings available all day in foyer.  Fresh icy water, infused with strawberries or cucumber. In room facilities were excellent - jar of lollies! Super comfy bed, bath salts and a RUBBER DUCKY to take home as momento!  Can't rave about the place enough.  My 2nd trip to SanFran & this place completely changed my experience from last time.  We were right at Union Square & could see the skating rink, trolley car stop right outside front door.  Fantastic Italian restaurant over the road....if you are looking for an awesome hotel in San Fran, then look no further.  This was by far the best hotel we stayed at during our month long travels through the USA.
review.negativeRemarks: NOTHING!  The place is perfection!
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Alcatraz, Fisherman's Wharf, Golden Gate Bridge, Land End, Lombard Street......EVERYTHING in San Francisco.

review.title: Nice small hotel in a good location
review.reviewText:
Had a pleasant experience in this centrally located nice hotel. Would consider staying here again in the future.

GOOD:
- excellent location
- friendly staff
- tea/coffee making facilities, cookies and popcorn available free in lobby

NOT SO GOOD:
- need better sound proofing as noise from street heard in room
- tea/coffee not available in room only in lobby
- small rooms
- would be nice to have body wash instead of soap in the toiletries
review.locationRemarks: right next to union square, a lot of places to dine in nearby including a Walgreens (supermarket). Trams/Trains/buses walking distance.

review.title: A lovely old lady
review.reviewText:
The Hotel is a lovely old lady with a lot of character located in the central city. The rooms are a little small but well appointed.
Staff are friendly and very helpful and friendly.
We will stay there when visiting SFO
Great location, small hotel, small bar and lobby area.  Staff friendly and helpful.   Bathroom was small but clean.
review.negativeRemarks: It's an older hotel that has been updated.  The lobby and bar were okay but very small.  The step up to the bathrooms was a bit odd and not safe.
review.locationRemarks: Right next to Union Square, easy access to public transportation.

review.reviewText: Great staff and location. Small rooms, but clean and comfy!

review.title: Nice and very close to Union Square
review.reviewText: This is an older hotel, so expect smaller elevators, rooms and bathroom. Within walking distance of Bart, Powell St station, Union Square, Chinatown gates and cable car stop. Only in town for two days and this hotel was perfect.

review.title: GREAT Location - Affordable Price
review.reviewText: My husband and I planned this weekend getaway to re-charge and to explore San Francisco.  We booked The Chancellor solely based on the Expedia reviews and we were not disappointed.  The location puts you within walking distance of all that Union Square has to offer and is just a short 5-minute walk from Chinatown.  It is conveniently located near the Powell Street Bart station and the Cable Car literally stops in front of the hotel.  The staff was excellent and even helped us check in to our room super early (10:00 am).  The rooms are clean and well-appointed and there's plenty of hot water for a relaxing bath.  We highly recommend this hotel especially for those on a budget.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff, room, Happy Hour at the hotel bar.
review.negativeRemarks: The walls are thin so you may hear your neighbors' conversations.
review.locationRemarks: Great Union Square location for those that like to shop.  Chinatown is a 5-minute walk from the hotel.  The Bart Station and cable cars are close by.

review.title: Locally owned hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is quite quaint.  It is definitely old school and the rooms are a bit small.  However they are very comfortable and very clean. The staff can't be beat.   The location is spectacular.

review.title: Vintage Union Square hotel.
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is a 100 year old hotel on Union Square, across the street from Saks Fifth Avenue. It is centrally located, and most of San Francisco is within walking distance. Countless restaurants and shopping opportunities are within a five minute walk. The hotel has an on site bar and restaurant. The front desk staff were fantastic: very cheerful and eager to please. The concierge was very helpful assisting us with a shuttle to and from the airport, as well as directions to restaurants and other sites. Being that the building is old, the lobby and rooms have a great deal of charm and character. This is not a boxy cookie cutters style hotel. The only drawbacks are that the rooms are small, which is not surprising given the age of the hotel, and that a great deal of street noise will reach your room, even as high as the seventh floor. The beds were quite comfortable, although the noise made sleeping difficult.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Love this little hotel, have been staying here for years!

review.title: Our stay at the Chancellor per your recommendation
review.reviewText: Our stay was great in that it was right around the corner from our Luncheon.  We didn't know it would cost EXTRA for the parking; that should have been part of the advertisement; for the same price we could have stayed at another location where the parking was FREE.  The room was nice but the street noise was continuous all night; emergency vehicles and there must have been a night club close by with a not so good singer.  What was good; they allowed us to STORE our luggage, through our luncheon, and until we could retrieve our vehicle from the parking garage, to return and load our luggage.  The location offered plenty of eateries nearby for a variety of foods.  I forgot to check the receipt they gave me when I checked out after retrieving our luggage; it only listed the parking, not the room.  Therefore I won't know if they charged me for anything more than the room, until I receive my bank statement.
review.positiveRemarks: Stated above, storage of luggage because of distant PARKING.
review.negativeRemarks:
Better windows to keep out the exterior noise.  I don't believe the amenities listed included Parking was EXTRA.
I forgot to look at the receipt
review.locationRemarks: Stated above, plenty of eateries nearby -

review.title: Fix the room temperature!
review.reviewText:
This is a lovely old hotel with a great location right by Union Square.  Rooms small but nicely decorated and quite clean; staff gracious and competent.  There was only one negative aspect but unfortunately it was a big one:  The room was unbearably warm for sleeping (we visited in January, so we assume there was central heating in effect), and there are no in-room temperature controls.  

There was an overhead fan with two speeds, which we tried to use, but unfortunately the speeds were (1) very fast and (2) even faster, so it was like trying to sleep in a wind tunnel -- very unpleasant.  The other option was to open the window, which thankfully did open six inches or so.  We took that option, but the street was quite noisy below, even though we were on the eighth floor, and although we jammed our earplugs in as far as we could, we essentially passed a sleepless night.  

We visit San Francisco often, and would love to return to this hotel, but until they figure out a way to deal with the overheated rooms, I don't think we would do so.

review.title: Central location
review.reviewText: Location was central and within walking distance of many attractions. The staff was attentive and helpful.

review.title: Convenient, Great Deal
review.reviewText: I stayed here because there was a great deal with Expedia and it was close to my job interview site. There was not a line when I checked in, my room was clean, comfy and had all the basics. When i checked out early the next morning the staff were very helpful. The building is older, but they've done a good job making it comfortable in such a great location. Super close walk to the BART. I would stay here again if I needed to be in downtown SF.
Great experience there. Staff and accommodations were excellent. Would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Great Location ... Great Price ... Great Weekend!
review.reviewText: What a great weekend in an hotel that is a lot older than me, and I'm a proud senior citizen. I felt safe and comfortable. I took the train into the city from my hometown.  It was great not to have to deal with the stress of driving or overnight parking.  Everything I had planned was in walking distance from the hotel; shopping, dining and theater. The hotel service I received was excellent; I had an end room which was small (king bed, clean and comfortable), the right size for a short visit. The front desk service was welcoming; and the concierge rep was new, and extremely knowledgeable.    I hope the Chancellor continues to work to be the best, because its in the best location.

review.title: Great character, old school San Fran best location
review.reviewText:
Great happy hour,easy in and out,
Retro building with modern upgrades bathrooms could use an overhall but why ruin the nostalgia
We were in town for just one night & needed to be close to Union Square. Hotel was close to everything and comfortable.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with this hotel.  The staff extremely friendly and accommodating.  Great location, nice small extra touches in the room.  Beautiful lobby & concierge desk to help with entertainment plans or directions.  Restaurant was nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great.  Sm xtra's...Candy jar, cotton balls & Q-tips in the bathroom, big closet, very soft bedding, cookies in the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Very near the corner of Union Square. 3 min walk to Market Square. Several restaurants and popular stores within a block or two.

review.title: Satisfied customer
review.reviewText: I worked for 12 years at a 5 diamond Relais & Chateaux, I was very impressed by the property, service and hospitality at the price point. I spent the next night at a different hotel a block away that was more expensive ( friend had a hotel booked and just arrived), it was not up to par.

review.title: Old. Needs upgrade.
review.reviewText: Old hotel. Small rooms. Small bathroom. No A/C. Elevatortakea forever.

review.title: Had a wonderful time I got such a great time!
review.reviewText: Me and my kiddo had a wonderful time got the best rate from Expedia I plan on using Expedia again this Saturday and I'm hoping to stay at this hotel again! :)

review.title: Very clean & neat hotel. Great location
review.reviewText:
No issues at all. Great stay.
Location is perfect for anything you want to do downtown San Fran, but the cable car is straight outside for a trip to Fishermans Wharf.
Excelent location if you want to walk around downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel was the perfect hotel to stay at, because of its location; in Union Square, close to the Bart Station and Chinatown. I'll definitely stay at the Chancellor when I visit San Francisco again.

Good location if you like to be in the heart of the city. Some may prefer new construction, but I'm an old house person, so I dug that the place had history...over 100 years. Room was comfortable and updated, but a bit small.
Great experience. Service was excellent. Staff were friendly and approachable. I would definitely return and recommend to anyone.

review.title: Great location. Boutique style hotel
review.reviewText: Loved the location. Right outside is the cable car stop on the line that takes you right up to fishermans wharf. Close to union square with many shops and restaurants nearby. We went in winter and there was an ice rink in Union square. The room was unusually hot with only heating but was in need of aircon instead. The room got rather stuffy. Staff were friendly and helpful. Parking one block away was about $29 a night which added up!

review.title: Great location and staff!!
review.reviewText:
This hotel is right in the heart of downtown just across the street from the trolley going to Fisherman's Wharf, shopping galore and Chinatown  in walking distance. You will find cafes and restaurants from French, Italian, Irish and sushi to some delightful home cooking types all withing a few blocks. Plus right next door is a sports bar, across the street Italian and Lori's Diner half a block away. 
The lobby has free coffee and refreshing water for your convenience 24 hours a day. The bar in the lobby has happy hour Mon. - Fri. We didn't eat in the on sight restaurant but did order room service for breakfast that was excellent and delivered at the exact time we requested. 
The only down side is the street noise at night. BUT you are in the middle of a city.It would not keep us from staying there again but it is the one thing that was not perfect. We aren't light sleepers so it was fine once we were asleep. 
Super comfortable beds with pillows that you can request if you need something more than a standard pillow.
We spent four days traveling all over the city with our $26 passport that allowed us to ride the various forms of transportation from one end to the other.
review.positiveRemarks: SUPER GREAT LOCATION! Clean comfortable rooms! Wonderful staff from the desk, the bartender, room service to the maids. Apples, coffee & water 24 hrs.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe triple pane windows to keep street noise out. Trolley cables super loud until 1:30 am and then start up again at 4:30 am!
review.locationRemarks: Boutique shopping plus Macys, shoe stores and a mall right there. TONS of coffee, bars and food! Trolley rides, bike rentals plus China Town!

review.title: Great staff, hotel & location
review.reviewText: My husband and i stayed here Christmas and the following weekend. We had a GREAT stay at the Chancellor. The staff is wonderful! It is a boutique hotel that is immaculate and beautiful. The location is Union Square so central to everything! It was a CRAZY BUSY weekend and I was pleasantly surprised how quiet our room was! Give it a shot! Great hotel! Shout out to Wilson!!!

review.title: good location for visiting SF
review.reviewText:
Fantastic location for visiting SF near Union Square.  It can get a little crowded in the streets but not too bad.  Parking is a block and half away and costly but that's what happens in the city.  

Hotel itself is small, but very cute and clean.  Small bar and restaurant.  And they their pillow menu which is free! The room is very cozy for two in queen size bed and little older looking but we could not complain for staying during new years. They have free cookies and i believe coffee. 

The walls can be on the thinner side so you can hear your neighbors.
review.locationRemarks: near union square

review.title: Nice historical place right in the city center
review.reviewText: The location seemed great so we picked this hotel. Were not disappointed, it's in walking distance from bart station (easy to reach airport), and all downtown sights. It's a 100 years old building so it's not as modern and comfortable as super modern hotels, but on the other hand we got very authentic experience of living in the place that seen history. Rooms and furniture are old but very clean. Staff are great, very nice and work 24 hrs.

review.title: Perfect union square hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. Very Clean. Great location. Friendly staff.

review.title: Cozy hotel with perfect location in Union square
review.reviewText: All the staff, including bell man, cleaning lady, and front desk, was very friendly from check in to check out. Great location in Union square. It was very convenient to have Walgreens, bank, and starbucks all next door, not to mention all the shops and restaurants. Room was small but cozy and comfy.

review.title: Nice hotel at a great location
review.reviewText: I have stayed here many times, and though once in a while wish the room (and bathroom) were bigger, come to the conclusion that the overall clean and comfortable room combined with excellent location is worth the price. Looking forward to my next stay here.
My room faced away from Powell Street. It was very quiet--no noise from other rooms or from the street.
review.positiveRemarks: It was very quiet--no noise from other rooms or from the street.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee makers in the room, but 24 hour coffee and cookies in the lobby was fine.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
Didn't realise till checking out that coffee, tea & biscuits are complimentary in the lobby, pays to read the information provided in the room.

Be aware of booking shuttle to airport, check the ticket and ensure the amount to be paid is understood by all. Was assured the amount circled was the deposit leaving a small residue to pay the driver, it turns out it was the other way around and ended up paying much more at the airport. Not happy!
review.positiveRemarks: Centrally located to all shops, transport & restaurants.

review.reviewText: great location and good value    great location and good value      great location and good value

review.title: Little Piece of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great experience staying at this hotel. Staff were helpful and the restaurant and bar in the lobby is great with lovely staff. City blacked out one morning we were staying. There was no generator; however, staff made a god effort to ensure occupants stayed safe.
review.positiveRemarks: Very charming. It's warm and cozy with a true San Francisco vibe.
review.locationRemarks: Great location!! Only a block from Union Square and a short walk to many other attractions as well as the public transportation services.

review.title: Great central location; Friendly Staff
review.reviewText:
This is an older hotel, so the rooms have a European feel to them (e.g., there isn't an abundance of space!).  But the bed was comfortable and the room was very clean. The location near Union Square is also very convenient for getting around, particularly with the cable car stop outside the front door.

The staff were fantastic.  I was visiting during the Dec 11"storm of the decade" when the power was lost for 3 hours. I was still able to get a cold breakfast (staff had flashlights) and we were kept up to date with news of the repair efforts.  It was well done.

review.title: Excellent hotel, perfect location
review.reviewText: We will definitely stay here again! Great staff, perfect location, adequately priced. Loved the umbrella in the closet. Really simple touch that goes long way!

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: We have stayed at the Chancellor many times because it is convenient for shopping, fine dining and theatres. The valet parking is helpful  and the rooms are clean. Breakfast is good, too. We will return.
review.negativeRemarks: It is really noisy if you stay on the Powell St. side of the hotel. I don't know how to improve that---just try not to get a room on the Powell side.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in November and had a wonderful time.  Yes it is a little dated..yes there are no tea making facilities in the room....yes there is no air conditioning, but I could not fault our stay.  The location of the hotel was fantastic (right on union square), the staff were pleasant and helpful and the hotel provides coffee, tea and cookies  at reception for everyone. Would recommend this hotel to all my friends.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor and facilities a bit dated but did not impact on our stay.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square right on doorstep.

review.title: Great find
review.reviewText: Highly recommend this beautiful hotel with great location
Best hotel in the city.  The location is perfect, the staff and accommodations are even better.  I can't wait to come back and stay at this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: location is perfect and the staff & accommodations are even better
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking is kind of a mess.  took forever to get my car back

review.title: GREAT Union Square location.
review.reviewText: Hotel located right at Union Square.  You can catch cable car half a block from the hotel.  Macys is a block from the hotel.  Fabulous shopping all walking distance.  I had a great view of the Union Square Christmas tree from my room.   Met some really interesting people at the bar, both repeat regular visitors and locals.  They all love this place.  Even if I didn't stay here I would go back to the bar and hope to run into them again.  The bartender was nice and had great ideas for places to go.  This hotel will be my first choice of places to stay when visiting San Francisco now.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  Loved the cucumber water in the lobby and late night cookies.  Room was small, as was the older bathroom.  I took the little rubber ducky.  It was so cute and I assume everybody takes them.  But the room was very clean and the bed was super comfortable.  Felt like an authentic visit to San Francisco whereas those big hotel chain rooms look the same all over the country.   would like to buy one of those white comforters that was on my bed.  Just what I'm looking for.  They even have umbrellas in the closet and at the front desk you can use while you're there.
review.positiveRemarks: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION.  I like that my room didn't look like a big hotel chain room.  The lobby is small, but it's charming and cozy.  Staff.
review.negativeRemarks: I like it just the way it is.  It wouldn't be the same if changes were made.
review.locationRemarks: At Union Square.  World class shopping right there.  Cable car half a block away.  Easy to go to wharf.  Close to Market Street. BART 4 blocks away.

review.title: Nice small hotel in the heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: A very nice little hotel in a very central Union Square location. The room was very small but nicely appointed and very comfortable for my brief stay. A tiny bar in the lobby but so many great bars and restaurants just steps away. Very helpful staff. Only complaint is that it took almost 45 minutes for the valet to bring my car around--and that's more the fault of San Francisco itself than the staff, who were apologetic. I'd definitely stay there again and recommend it--great value in an expensive city.
review.positiveRemarks: Great rate and value, and comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking speed.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for tourists--world class shopping, dining, entertainment all within easy walk.

review.title: Nice hotel for the money
review.reviewText: Great location.  Very clean.  Only limits are slow wifi and no cable.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square. Clean.
review.reviewText:
Centrally located. A European feel to this wonderful gem across from Union Square.
Small rooms but clean and adequate with comfy bed. Small bathroom a bit tight for my
tall, built husband. Fine for me, I'm small. We always stay here when we visit the city.
Now they have added a very nice, delicious restaurant...a bonus, to a place we love.
review.positiveRemarks:
Front desk, consierge service, delicious coffee, fresh water, cookies and apples in lobby
24/7.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of rooms....impossible. They are small.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located. You can walk or take trolley. Four blocks from Bart station.

review.title: Good old-style hotel in Union square
review.reviewText: Furnishings are great but bear in mind that it is deliberately being maintained in original condition. So the bathroom has the old tiles and the walls are plaster and few facilities etc.. It's all in good condition and if you want that kind of charm then it's great for you, but if you want the chain hotel look and facilities then it isn't.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText:
convenient location - walking distance to union square, china town (10-15mins), next to Walgreen hypermarket (excellent, if you wanted to buy mineral water and groceries with very cheap price).
friendly front desk staff
complimentary of coffee, cookies & apples.  I like the cookies, very delicious
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: convenient location - walking distance to union square, china town (10-15mins), next to Walgreen hypermarket (excellent, if you wanted to buy mineral

review.title: Awesome stay in Union Square
review.reviewText: We loved our hotel. Location was great, staff was friendly and close to transportation.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to BART and cable cars. Loved the old charm of the building. The rooms are nicely decorated and lots of pillow options!
review.negativeRemarks: The room was a bit warm. Unable to open window due to noise on Powell Street and the ceiling fan was a great idea, but could have used a higher speed.
review.locationRemarks: Close to BART and cable cars. Awesome shopping in Union Square and Westfield Mall.  Tons of restaurants and coffee shops nearby.

review.reviewText: Love staying at The Chancellor! Great staff and so conveniently located to everything fun and delicious in The City!

review.title: Nice hotel close to union sq
review.reviewText: greattttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttttt

review.title: Fun hotel
review.reviewText: Perfect location to shopping, Unipn Square, public transit, great restaurants. Large bedroom, great mattress and pillows. Clean, well-maintained property. Helpful, friendly staff. All amenities. Reminds me of the late, great and lamented Wyndham in New York City.

review.title: Nice hotel on Union Square
review.reviewText: Overall, it was a pleasant experience. The hotel itself has a rustic charm - given it was celebrating it 100 year anniversary this year. My room was cozy, which was to be expected. The noise could become a little much at night - I was on the second floor facing Powell street. They provide earplugs, which were quite hard and uncomfortable so I would recommend bringing your own, but at least they were provided. The staff was always pleasant, especially the restaurant staff - the one man made me smile every morning. I would most definitely come here again if I was in the city.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in an excellent location next to Union Square. Rooms were clean and staff were pleasant.  The small room size is the biggest drawback and could do with being renovated. Bathroom was tiny and also needs to be updated.  However, the central location of this hotel still makes it a good choice for a visit to downtown San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms and bathroom could be updated.
review.locationRemarks: Ride the streetcar, go to the wharf, go shopping.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: Only would like to know parking fees were higher for SUVs before booking

review.title: Comfortable, friendly, very San Francisco
review.reviewText: Chancellor Hotel is located one-half block from Union Square, by the cable car.  Room is small but complete and well-maintained.  Staff is friendly and helpful.  I travelled alone and felt safe and welcomed.  Restaurant is open for breakfast and lunch only, but the bar has good food at dinner time, if you wish to dine "at home.  Many restaurants close by.  I will be back.

review.title: Old tired hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice front desk staff greeted us, and then we waited patiently for the 2 old elevators. When we got into our room, it was small and tired. There was no ventilation system other than opening a window. The ear plugs on the night table should have been a clue about how noisy Union Square is right now with tons of construction. We'd recommend avoiding it. Everything about the room was old, tired, dark, and unappealing. We left after one night rather than stay the three nights we had planned - it was that unappealing. The staff was very nice, and offered to move us to a room on the back side of the hotel that they thought would be quieter, but also told us that the 'view' out of the window would be a brick wall. So we left.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice staff. Good coffee in lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: The whole hotel just needs a complete renovation and updating. There's not much that can be done about it. It's dark, dated, small, etc.
review.locationRemarks: Union Sq is very convenient if you like to shop at department stores and smaller shops. But the noise is a problem

review.title: great location great for shopping ,sightseeing
review.reviewText: clean and tidy room,elevators very slow only one working all the time.Great bar staff and reception area staff are excellent.

review.title: very convenient location
review.reviewText: Great little hotel well located. Right next door to Sears Fine Foods. Try their breakfast! A San Francisco institution.

review.title: Great location, small but nice room.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed hotel and would recommend for a couple. Small for family.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: Union square and cable car in front of hotel. Walking distance to BART, cable car, shopping and Chinatown. Who could ask for more.

review.title: Close to so much
review.reviewText: This was our first visit to San Francisco. My husband and I enjoyed the history of this hotel and will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Value for Money
review.reviewText: Good hotel for central area. Hotel a bit tired but very good value for money. Staff very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Redecoration and modernisation of bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Very central, near to cable car and plenty of restaurants and bars.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Very pleased from check in to check out. Would definitely stay there again

review.title: Convenient stay downtown
review.reviewText: The chancellor was a nice place to stay downtown.  You can't beat the free wifi and proximity to the BART to get to/from anywhere you need to go in the city.
review.positiveRemarks: While the room is not huge it is plenty big and there is a very large closet.  If you were travelling with kids they could easily sleep in there
review.locationRemarks: Location is convenient to shopping and the BART (subway) system. Easy to get to from the airport.

review.title: Classic hotel steps from union square
review.reviewText: Chancellor hotel is great if you know what to expect - this is definitely an older hotel so the rooms are smaller and the bathroom is quite tiny. That said, the staff was incredibly nice, the bed was amazingly comfortable, and we really enjoyed our stay!
review.locationRemarks: Right near union square and shops

review.title: Old style hotel in the heart of SF.
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent five nights at the Chancellor Hotel. It's a classic old style hotel in the heart of San Francisco. Our room was clean and comfortable. The room was a bit cramped, but this is typical of older downtown hotels. My only complaint would be the noise. Although the streets quiet down after 10 PM, my sleep would be disturbed by the sound of an occasional police siren or an early morning garbage truck. The hotel is located in front of a cable car line, so I would wake up to the sound of a cable car rolling by (I actually found the sound to be pleasing).  Despite the noise, I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent location! Close to shops, restaurants and public transportation. Good value for San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: There's not much the hotel can do about the noise, so bring some earplugs if you're a light sleeper.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is close to Union Square with tons of shops and restaurants. Public transportation is very accessible.

review.title: San Francisco Week
review.reviewText: We had a terrific time in SF - the city is beautiful and so are the people.
review.positiveRemarks: We enjoyed the convenience of being located so close to everything we wanted to see.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was a little on the small side, especially the bathroom. It would be helpful if there was just a little more space.
review.locationRemarks: As stated above, the location was the biggest plus

review.reviewText:
They assigned us a "quieter" room, but on the 2nd day, they started some repair work in the room underneath of ours and the drilling noise was terrible, like we were in the middle of a road construction. I called the front desk, and they changed the room to another in next 10 minutes, which I appreciated. 
The staff was very friendly. The 2nd room was very clean. (The first one had some smell in the walk in closet.) The location was great.

review.title: Frustrating stay
review.reviewText:
To sum it up: 

location is great
rooms are small and super stuffy
staff is not great
parking is a joke - we ended up waiting 50 MINUTES for out car to arrive from valet. This is in addition to the $40/night charge.
bar is awful

Stay somewhere else.

review.title: Comfortable Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice small rooms. Great selection of pillows and a very comfortable bed. In the heart of Union Square and close to the financial district. Front desk wasn't the friendliest but cleaning staff were amazing.

review.title: Noisy hotel in a busy area
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel for one night since I needed to an appointment early the next morning nearby. The room was small but clean with a comfortable bed and a nice desk for working. Unfortunately even with the windows closed the noise from the street was very loud all night.
review.negativeRemarks: Replace the windows with double pane glass to block out street noise.

review.title: A Neighborhood Gem!
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay at the Chancellor Hotel.  It was located right in the heart of union square and close to many wonderful things to do and see.  The staff were simply wonderful, from those checking you in and working the front desk to the very friendly staff working in the restaurant.  The rooms are rather small but as you do not really spend a lot of time in your room it's hardly noticeable.  The hotel has lots of charm and character - something you will not find in chain hotels.  The Chancellor Hotel is truly unique, I would highly recommend it.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were simply wonderful and the best asset of the hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: Some of the rooms could do with some sprucing up.
review.locationRemarks: Located right in the heart of union square!

review.title: Nice hotel and comfortable
review.reviewText: On a business trip and was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the accommodations and the location.  Flew into Oakland, took Bart to the Powell Street station and a short walk to the hotel.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Location was great--right downtown. Plenty of restaurants and shopping, public transit. Room was comfortable and clean, although the hotel could do with a little reno job.

review.title: Nice hotel with old style charcter
review.reviewText:
Great customer service, clean hotel, a little noisy because of the location on Union Square,
definitely not disappointed.  Got this hotel at a good price.
review.positiveRemarks: It was right on Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: If there was air conditioning

review.title: Convenient to Union Square
review.reviewText: Close to Union Square,shops and cable car. Also very handy to some nice restaurants. Excellent staff especially Mao at breakfast.  On the negative side hotel room bit small.
review.negativeRemarks: Bigger rooms airconditioning

review.title: Close to union square. No Air Conditioning
review.reviewText: Room was older, but very clean. No air conditioning so I wouldn't stay there during a hot spell.
review.negativeRemarks: Airconditioning?

review.title: Nice and in the middle of everything
review.reviewText: Very solid hotel in the heart of SF. Courteous staff, good breakfast, the room was small, but the bathtub was enormous. I'd stay there again, no question. 4 minute walk to Bart and Muni. It's a little loud, but the windows are actually very effective in blocking noise.
review.positiveRemarks: cool, old hotel; central location; nice staff
review.negativeRemarks: restaurant and room service close at 9:30, that's a little early
review.locationRemarks: It's right in union square, super central, but also a very busy touristy area. if you're looking for tranquil, this ain't it.

review.reviewText: Very good for all day serve coffee and muffin and cookie.

review.title: Near Union Square
review.reviewText: Great central location.  Rooms are very small, but clean and with all necessary amenities.  Loved the on site restaurant, healthy food options, 24/7 coffee and hot water in the lobby.  Only read complaint was no air conditioning and it is a very noisy area with and without the window open.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, great location, wi-fi.  Loved the farrow for breakfast and other healthy options.
review.negativeRemarks: Very noisy area of town.  Air conditioning.
review.locationRemarks: If you are a good walker, everything is accessible.  Excellent restaurants nearby, street car just outside.

review.reviewText: Nice Hotel. Awesome place to stay closer to downtown,SF

review.title: Nice hotel in union square
review.reviewText: Hotel and room were nice. Right in union square. Cable car stop right out the front to go to Fishermans Wharf. Only downside was room was hot with no air conditioning in any of the rooms. Just a ceiling fan. Lucky weather wasn't too warm

review.title: Great location, near lots of shopping.
review.reviewText: Needed a hotel near my conference. This hotel had a good price and good ratings. It's an older building, but I liked the old charm it had. The bed and bedding were one of the most comfortable I've had in a long time. I felt at home. I loved the apples, popcorn, cookies, and water the hotel offered. I would return again.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square, lots of shopping. Walking distance to a handful of must see neighborhoods.

review.title: Nice hotel in great location.
review.reviewText: Prim location, close to everything including public transit. Rooms were neat and clean, staff was friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Very noisy as both nights we had our window open due to mild temperature. Would be nice if rooms were air conditioned.
review.locationRemarks: Loved Union Square. Close to great restaurants, cable cars and public transit.

review.title: In the heart of downtown!
review.reviewText: We stayed for 8 nights and enjoyed every night. The staff was wonderful and had great recommendations for dining.  Vanessa was great and always so welcoming each afternoon.  Mike was great in booking our tours.  The rest of the staff was great.  Moa was a terrific encourager each morning we dined in the restaurant.   It is the small things that make an impact and they truly excel in them!
review.positiveRemarks: The boutique feel.  The personal service.
review.negativeRemarks: No suggestions
review.locationRemarks: Right up from Union Square, on the trolly, Muni and rail lines close. Embarcadero is in walking distance. Numerous good resturant and shopping.

review.title: Great Union Square location
review.reviewText: Hotel was pleasant but old. The rooms do not have air conditioners which we knew, however they were warmer than expected. Ceiling fan kept air moving and windows opened at night were fine. The staff are pleasant. The tour desk manager is very helpful.  Buy a multi day pass for use on the cable cars and buses. It is quite a savings.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Right on the cable car line. However cars were very crowded and difficult to get space on.  We used the bus as a good alternative.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade and facelift are definitely needed.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart if SF district. Many nice upscale and unusual shops and galleries. Walking distance to many good restaurants and wine bars.

review.title: Location, location
review.reviewText: First visit to San Francisco and couldn't have been in a better location everything in easy reach and cable cars passing hotel entrance!
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly and helpful staff and location
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of Union Square, shopping, restaurants and transportation

review.title: Fantastic location. Very welcoming staff.
review.reviewText:
Had a great stay. Walking distance to major stores. Easy to get taxi or tram.
The reception staff bar staff and bell staff make this an excellent hotel.
Is san fran which has old buildings and hotel so expect that. Found bathroom small as in some european hotels.

review.title: Hotel close to shopping.
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time in San fransisco. This hotel was clean, comfortable bed but needs a facelift   Old hotel which needs upgrading.

review.title: Great location.  Good value.
review.reviewText: Great location, across the street from Union Square.  Staff very friendly, helpful, and professional.   Older hotel with cozy somewhat dated rooms and small bathrooms but clean, quiet despite bustling location, comfortable bed, and good water pressure in the shower.  No air conditioning but rooms have ceiling fans and windows open so was not a problem during my stay and given San Francisco's weather patterns unlikely to be a problem most times of the year.  Restaurant on site serves breakfast and lunch with limited room service which I did not try but right next store is a good full service restaurant.  All in all good value and a low key, peaceful, friendly alternative to the impersonal mad house atmosphere of the fancy high rise convention hotel where the meeting I was attending was held.  Will definitely return.

review.title: Nice hotel but don't get lower level room!
review.reviewText:
Hotel was in great location for Union Square, and all attractions on one of Trolley lines. Room was small but clean, only problem was being on lower floor 4th at rear, outside were the industrial air conditioning units which could be heard all night, if you're a light sleeper make sure you ask for higher floor level. Hotel even put sponge type ear plugs in room so obviously knew of this problem.
Nice touch in hotel was free coffee/tea etc and cookies in Lobby area, great after long day walking about. Also on site restaurant good for breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from Air Conditioning/ Generators outside. ?Double glazing.
review.locationRemarks: Really close to Union Square, shopping and restaurants, on Trolley line and easy access to Wharf Area and other attractions.

review.title: Quaint hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: First time in San Fran, traveling with my 6yo daughter and wasn't sure what to expect. Pleased with the decision to stay at Chancellor. Our room was very clean, and although it was small, it was the perfect size for the two of us. Front desk staff were very helpful. Asked for a room on the 14th floor with a view of Union Square, and didn't hear a peep from outside when the windows were closed.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, helpful staff, comfy bed, good location, quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: AC units.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square. Kitschy diner around the corner. Great place to leave out from in order to see different areas of the city.

review.title: Great location next to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Room and facilities were good but unless the window was open it was difficult to keep the room cool. When the window was open outside noise was significant. Otherwise in every other respect we were really pleased with our choice.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, free wi fi, access to ice, and complimentary tea and coffee albeit in the foyer
review.negativeRemarks: Temperature control in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Central to everything; shopping, tour buses, famous cable trams, with China Town, Little Italy, and Fisherman's Market within walking distance.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: No complaints. Good time. Nice hotel.  Clean hotel.  Location can not be beat

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Good experience.  Coffee & tea always available.  Delicious cookies.  Small room but everything there.  Would stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Right by Union Square.  Lots of shopping and access to the cable car.

review.title: Central and comfortable
review.reviewText:
The hotel suited our needs perfectly and seemed better than the rated 3star. Staff were friendly and obliging. Great to have a little bar downstairs and the breakfast menu was superb. We dined in all three mornings and on one of them we needed an early start for a Napa Valley Tour we arrived at 7:05 and had finished within 20min. Great seeing we needed to be at the ferry by just after 8. 
The rooms were beautifully furnished and the bed was fabulous which was just what we needed after sleeping on hard beds and pillows in Europe for a month. Tram outside was very handy.

review.title: Great location for first timers
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in Union Square, which is a hub of activity and great for tourists. If you've never been to San Fran, the tour buses are nearby, as well as the cable cars, so it's easy to find your way. The hotel also provided maps of the city, the staff were very courteous and sometimes they have even have cookies at the reception. It's got a lot of old world charm (it's 100 years old this year), but that also means narrow stairs and tiny elevators. The housekeeping staff should be tipped and they are appreciated. The hotel restaurant was also worth checking out.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was ideal and it had a lot of charm on the inside.
review.negativeRemarks: I'm not certain that it would be fully accessible for all people.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, cable cars, tours, Macys, lots of high end shopping, easy access to Market street, bars, restaurants, patios and Walgreens.

review.title: 100 years old, perfect for today
review.reviewText: We stayed three nights at the Chancellor, which is kitty-corner to Union Square (nicely positioned to go anywhere in downtown San Francisco, and just four blocks from the BART station, which we used to get into town from the airport). The staff at the Chancellor were friendly and polite and helpful, and the building itself is great. The room was smaller than a more modern hotel, but not small. No air conditioning, which was an issue the first night, but given San Francisco weather, not a problem the other nights.
review.positiveRemarks: Classic charm. Lovely architecture and a gorgeous lounge (complete with fresh lemon- or strawberry-infused water and fresh cookies).
review.locationRemarks: Close to Chinatown, Union Square (tour buses leave from there), bike rentals, good restaurants and shopping and the trolly!

review.title: Nice hotel. Great Location.
review.reviewText:
Nice staff. Walking distance to almost everything including AT&T Park. 

Bed was comfortable, shower was average, room was clean but small. 

Would stay again.

review.title: Central SF location, old compact hotel
review.reviewText: Very good service from the staff.   The Chancellor is a 1914 era hotel, very compact rooms and hallways.  No air-con, overhead fan only.  Water pressure in shower is very weak. Rooms are compact.  Be aware that if located on the front side of the hotel it will be very noisy from traffic and trams.  If you are looking for location, this can't be beat.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location, discount on the breakfast for first day helped us get oriented.   Very good service from staff who helped relocate us to diff room
review.negativeRemarks: It is what it is, I think it's shortcomings will be take it or leave it with such an historic building.
review.locationRemarks: Right on Union Square, direct access to fine shopping, cable car and tour buses.  Right in the centre of the action.

review.title: Good hotel, fantastic location
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel is a historic building with lots of character. The rooms are small, however, because of its location, we really didn't spend much time in our room except to sleep.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff are very friendly and helpful. It's location on Union Square. Close to all means of transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: I understand that the beds cannot be increased in size due to the small rooms, however, an increase in the quality of mattresses would be nice
review.locationRemarks: located on Union Square, shopping district, close to the subway, trolly car ride, walk to the piers, close to museums and art galleries

review.title: A brief stop in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Chancellor Hotel on Union Square is a great place to stay. It is small, comfortable, central and affordable. If you are looking for a flash hotel then this isn't you. It is an older style building with classic San Francisco interior - classy and timeless. The rooms are small but sufficient. There is no air conditioning but you don't really need it. For us it was perfect for our short stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Could be a little difficult for those that cant handle the background noises of a city. We were on the 12th floor so were fine.
review.negativeRemarks: The girl serving behind the bar was quite rude. She acted like she just didn't want to be there and it wasn't just us - she was rude to others.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, shopping, downtown San Fran - lovely.

review.title: 4 star quality at 3 star price
review.reviewText: This is a great little hotel right next to Union Square. Rooms are small (it is San Francisco after all) but very comfortable. Tiny bathroom but able to fit a great deep bathtub. And they even provide bath salts for you. The staff was very friendly. What more could you want.

review.title: Great location great staff
review.reviewText: Loved the location. The staff was awesome. The hotel is old and being updated nicely but the rooms are small and the bathroom is tiny. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Excellent, central location...
review.reviewText: The perfect place to stay for a central location with easy access to all San Fransisco has to offr, good, clean rooms and good quality bedding, towels.  Only down side was lack of air conditioning in the room however windows open and fans available.

review.title: Nice hotel, central & close to Union  Square.
review.reviewText: Pleasant hotel & staff. Central to Union Square, cable cars, taxi, shopping and restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning & in room fridge.
review.locationRemarks: Central to Union Square, shopping, transport, cable cars.

review.reviewText: Chancellor Hotel has a great location in Union Square.  Easy access to the BART to get to the airport.  Walking distance to most of the major attractions.  Bed was comfortable and the staff was really friendly.  Would highly recommend to a friend.  Can't beat the location and service at this price point.

review.title: Central location for nightlife
review.reviewText: Stayed here to go out downtown with some friends from who had never been to the US/California before. Didn't want a hotel that was dumpy and needed something centrally located with easy access to local bars and clubs, without breaking the bank. This hotel had a substantially lower price point than any others nearby and was also close to night life  (Rube Skye, Infusion Lounge, The Irish Bank, etc.) so we went with it. Not a disappointing decision, but would NOT recommend staying for long periods of time as the rooms are small, bathrooms are very outdated (room furnishings are not) and there is no air conditioning.
review.negativeRemarks: Quality of in suite bathrooms is not unclean, but could definitely use an updating...
review.locationRemarks: Only stayed one night to go out on the town, but being next to Union Square there is a lot of shopping and the SF Embarcadero isn't too far off.

review.title: Hidden Gem
review.reviewText: Had an amazing experience at the Chancellor. The staff were extremely accommodating and friendly, and our room was comfortable, quiet, and clean. We requested a room at the back higher up because it's quieter and that's what we got! Centrally located and close to public transit. Will return!
Great location, great stuff, coffee and tea always available in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds are not so comfortable.  My mattress was not even
review.locationRemarks: Best locatioin I could only dream about

review.title: Great hotel, very well placed.
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel. We had a great room (8th floor, quiet side).Bed comfy, enough space (not a lot, but enough), shower and bath, even a cubby room for suitcases and stuff. Great to have free wifi. Very well placed for transport and on Union Square. I would definitely stay here again. Thanks to all staff.

review.title: Comfy beds, great staff, well stocked amenities.
review.reviewText: Staff here is amazing and helpful.  I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Excellent location for central San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Chancellor Hotel is situation only a short walk from Union Square, which made it ideal for us as we had booked hop on/off bus tours which departs from there.
Staff were very friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble.
Hotel was clean and room was very pleasant - our room had a small room for luggage/clothing which was very handy.  Only niggle we had was the fan for bathroom would turn on randomly during night and this was a bit noisy.
review.locationRemarks: very central, excellent location

review.title: Central hotel by Union Square and the cable car.
review.reviewText:
The hotel was recommended by a friend who'd stayed there.  The rooms are small by US standards though the facilities are very good, including an old fashioned umbrella hanging in the closet!  There is no (apparent) air conditioning but the extremely quiet ceiling fan kept the room pleasantly cool and we didn't need to open the window at night (we visited in July).  Ear plugs are provided but we didn't need them.  The bed was very comfortable and there was a choice of pillows too.

We only used the concierge once, to book the airport shuttle bus, but he was very helpful.

The Chancellor has a small bar  and also a breakfast/lunch room which closes around 2pm.  There are plenty of eating choices close by so finding somewhere for dinner was not a problem, though we ate mainly at Pier 1 on the Embarcadero or at Fishermans Wharf.

The hotel may not have all the bells and whistles of big, modern hotels but its very central position meant we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Hearing the cable car bell as it went up Powell Street and being so close to Union Square which we had a view of from our room.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: Use the delightful vintage streetcars on the F line on Market Street to get to Fishermans Wharf as the cable cars are overcrowded and hard to get on.

review.title: Excellent hotel in the heat of San Francisco
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at this boutique hotel. Gray value for a hotel near Union Square. Friendly staff.  Free coffee,  apples, cookies, water 24 hrs. Parking is cheap at $30 a night about a block away. Rooms are small but very comfortable.  Definitely recommend.

review.title: On the edge of Union Sqaure.
review.reviewText: Lovely boutique hotel with comfortable rooms.  Great location by Union Square with public transport at the door.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly, professional staff, with little extras - coffee, fruit, cookies.
review.locationRemarks: Central location to Union Square with great shopping - Macys, and on the Cable Car line to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Traditional hotel with wonderful friendly staff!
review.reviewText:
The staff, especially the breakfast team, made the stay wonderful. I can't stress enough how great it was to meet these guys. There seems to be a lovely feeling amongst them. 

The hotel itself is traditional with smaller rooms (at least for the standard rooms, anyway), and my room was quite noisy with generators outside, but that doesn't really bother me. I was very happy with this place, especially when I discovered the coffee machine downstairs. The location is fantastic.

review.title: Nice hotel, centrally located.
review.reviewText: From start to finish pleasant and relaxing.  Lots of fun.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were pleasant and helpful.  Room although small was very comfortable.  Close to union square, cable car, restaurants.

review.title: So handy to all the places I needed to get to.
review.reviewText: Location excellent, bed comfy, lovely quality coffee free of charge in foyer, very helpful tour desk staff, great value 'happy hour ' , great coupons and maps, overall excellent !

review.title: Great location and excellent service.
review.reviewText: I can't say enough great things about The Chancellor Hotel. It's location is great and central to so many things in the city. The room was spotless and the hotel staff was excellent. They knew I had an early morning flight coming in and had my room ready when I checked in at 10:30 am. To add to it, you can check out as late as 2:00 pm without paying extra, just let the front desk know. I had a wonderful experience.

review.title: Good location, but no air cond.
review.reviewText: Stayed 2 nights June 2014.  Right in Union SQ.  Friendly staff.  Rooms small but clean and well kept.  Only issue was there isn't air conditioning in the hotel.   Usually not a problem in SF, but during my stay SF was warmer than normal
review.negativeRemarks: doubt its practical, but air condidtioning
review.locationRemarks: Right in Union SQ.  Nuff said.

review.title: Old school hotel in great location.
review.reviewText: We stayed at the chancellor for five nights of a USA trip. While this hotel resides in an older building, it was one of the best. The amenities were great, staff obliging and location central. Great hotel.

review.title: A hotel with character
review.reviewText: This is definitely not a traditional sort of hotel. It is an old establishment with an old style, and yet modern amenities. The only missing element is air conditioning, which is not typically needed, but if the breeze isn't flowing into your room, you may get a little warm (despite the ceiling fan). The room we stayed in was a basic Queen room, and was definitely on the small side for $200/night, but the location at Union Square is pretty fantastic for those visiting and wanting to see some great highlights of the city within walking distance. Definitely a great location for food, shopping, trolley rides, etc. The staff is very friendly and attentive, the room service is good, and the Sears restaurant next door is timeless and delicious as well.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, location, LCD TV and mini fridge.
review.negativeRemarks: A/C and air flow, room size, room rates.
review.locationRemarks: Right at Union Square. Lots of shopping, restaurants, trolley rides, etc. all in walking distance.

review.title: Just steps of Union Square
review.reviewText: Excellent location, wonderful experience will stay here on my next visit to SF.
review.locationRemarks: Steps from Cable Car stop and Union Square

review.title: hotel in the middle of union square
review.reviewText:
no air conditioning had to leave windows open to stay cool, noisy with windows open but they did provide ear plugs
nice restaurant nice, clean rooms but small, parking very expensive
review.positiveRemarks: clean hotel and rooms, staff helpful and friendly, restaurant good food
review.negativeRemarks: a/c so you could leave windows closed
review.locationRemarks: middle of union square, lots of restaurants and shopping, cable cars, etc. close by

review.title: In the heart of Union Square.
review.reviewText: Hotel was right off Union Square and close to lots of things to do. Small quiet hotel, friendly staff and less than a block from the parking garage.

review.title: Great location poor facilities
review.reviewText:
We should have guessed there could be a problem when they provide ear plugs on the bed table!
Room faced a ventilation hood that ran 24hours. We couldn't open the window to get fresh air. No air conditioning meant we had to run the ceiling fan all night to add to the noise. Rooms very small but clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms very small, no air conditioning.

review.title: Solid 3 Star
review.reviewText:
Pros: Great location, the trolley car runs right up and down this street. Walking distance to Union Square and China Town. Very friendly and helpful staff. Great concierge in the lobby helps you route your trip anywhere using the trolleys or bus. Fridge in the room.

Cons: NO AIR CONDITIONING! Hotel is charming but you can tell it is very old. No fan in the bathroom. There is a lot of noise coming from some sort of generator right outside the window, we had to sleep with the TV on to drown it out.

review.title: Convenient location at Union Square
review.reviewText:
Location is very central very near to Union Square and convenient for shopping. Cable car to Fisherman's Wharf can be caught just outside the hotel.

The service at the hotel bar was terrible. Breakfast was very poor for the price compared to nearby diners and cafes. Checkout was also very slow.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is very central very near to Union Square and convenient for shopping. Cable car to Fisherman's Wharf can be caught just outside the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The service at the hotel bar was terrible. Breakfast was very poor for the price compared to nearby diners and cafes. Checkout was also very slow.

review.title: Chancellor Union Square
review.reviewText: My wife and I enjoyed our stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. We especially enjoyed the food and service at Luques as we joined them for breakfast each morning. The pancakes were excellent!

The Chancellor is located right in the middle of everything in Union Square. Great location and easy walking to shopping, restaurants and Chinatown. Easy cab rides to Fisherman's Wharf and other locations.
The hotel is older and pretty small, but that is what you should expect for the location and city. The staff was very accommodating and helpful when it came to where to park and how to get around.
review.negativeRemarks: No air conditioning in the rooms, so it was a bit warm, but not too bad.

review.title: Excellent location at a great price!
review.reviewText: If you are not fussy about having a modern updated room, this hotel is clean and comfortable. Our room faces Powell and we got some ear plugs on the nightstand. We did not need them once we closed the windows. We could hear the buskers playing sax, guitar or violin and it was actually pretty awesome!

review.title: Very central hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
Check in was smooth and the receptionist was very pleasant. Our room on the second floor overlooked Powell St. but we were not disturbed at all by noise. The hotel makes it clear that the bedrooms are not large, but ours had a little "dressing room" which contained a good size safe, big enough for a laptop, ipad and more than one camera. There were also two luggage racks in this little room for our suitcases. The bathroom was small but very clean, although a little tired. The hotel is situated close to Union Square, and is conveniently only five minutes walk from the cable car turn round at Powell/Market Streets, and the BART Station, so it was easy to get to Fishermans Wharf etc.
The hotel staff we encountered were all very pleasant and helpful, from the receptionist to the waitress at breakfast, who remembered us each day, and the gentleman on the tour desk who organised our shuttle to the airport on our final day.
I should also mention that flavoured iced water, coffee, tea and cookies were available all day in the lobby and were very welcome.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, clean rooms, very comfortable bed and helpful staff

review.title: Great location, friendly staff
review.reviewText: We only stayed two nights but could not have been happier with all aspects of the Hotel. The room was comfortable and for two people plenty of room. The staff were friendly and efficient. The location was superb. And breakfast was delicious.
review.locationRemarks: You can walk to almost everything if you don't mind going up and down - which we didn't - even if you are an older couple like us

review.title: Good location, air conditioning issues
review.reviewText: we stayed at the Chancellor hotel in May - weather was warm (for kiwis) however no air conditioning in our room and rooms were tiny - no space to move
review.positiveRemarks: location was great, close to everything
review.negativeRemarks: air conditioning in the rooms
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of the city, cable car at the door - walking distance to everything

review.title: Great location, genuine staff
review.reviewText: Fantastic location right next to Union Square. Staff were all very helpful. The hotel even has someone who specialises in helping with all of your travel questions. It was refreshing to stay at a hotel where the staff were seemingly not completely driven by tips. All staff (reception, bar, tour desk) were genuinely helpful. There is no air conditioning but during summer months the large fan should do the trick. The room was not overly large, but certainly clean and comfortable. There are free cookies (always stocked) and apples at reception, as well as free tea and coffee. Very, very happy we chose the Chancellor!

review.title: Center of town
review.reviewText: The hotel was located right across from the Sir Francis Drake Hotel, directly in the center of town. It was accessible for every tour trip we wanted. Restaurants were within near walking distance, as was Chinatown. Good shopping was nearby. The restaurant next to the lobby was good and the service great. It was a pleasant and very enjoyable experience.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was very clean and comfortable, the staff very helpful. The lobby area nice. Coffee, cookies and fruit were always there for guests.
review.negativeRemarks: The size of the rooms were a little small, but it really didn't matter for the few days we spent there.
review.locationRemarks: You're in the center of town, so you can do anything. Tours were nearby, and we explored much of San Francisco with the hop on hop off tours.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: This hotel is very convenient to shopping and many nice restaurants. Also, it is right across the street from the cable car pickup/dropoff. As it was within walking distance of AT&T Park, we had an enjoyable walk to and from the park.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Very nice, excellent location
review.reviewText: People is very nice, complimentary coffee, tea, cookies, makes it cozy. Excellent location. Nice bedrooms.

review.title: Century old hotel sitting in a wonderful location
review.reviewText: Location-wise, it's perfect! Just at the corner of Union Square. As it's already a century old (open in 1914), one can expect and understand the facilities it can provide. Condition of hotel is pretty good from that sense. Staffs are very helpful and friendly. Complementary coffee is provided to enlight your day!
review.negativeRemarks: Sound proof, especially for lower levels
review.locationRemarks: Union Square; cable cars just run on Powell Street in front of the hotel.

review.title: Wonderful location and great hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was a great start to our trip, the rooms were fairly small but it was an old hotel so that's expected, the price was great and the location was fabulous, we were able to walk to our hop on/hop off tour bus and pretty could get anywhere without the use of a car.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable, great view of union square, good sound proofing and clean, free wifi, coffee, tea and cucumber water which we were always drinking from!
review.negativeRemarks: I'd say make the rooms bigger but that's impossible! Not much I would say they'd need to improve
review.locationRemarks: Tonnes! It's in union square so near the tour buses and within walking distance of tonnes of shops and restaurants. Really wonderful location!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great hotel for a short stay in SF, hotel with great history, family owned with great views of union sqare

review.title: Great location and lovely staff
review.reviewText: Stayed just two nights in SF but would definitely return to this hotel and city again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, easy to drive to and parking not too expensive
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Nice hotel at union square
