review.reviewText: We booked this hotel based on good rating on the web and it deserved all the great reviews. This is our first trip to San Francisco and it was a great experience. The hotel is closed to everything and right on the cable car route. We enjoyed both walking and the riding. The public transit system is very convenient - a 3 day pass is a good choice to tour the city! The Designer Shoe Warehouse (DSW) is next door which is an add on for the ladies!

review.title: It was just right.
review.reviewText: Convenient location for shopping downtown and easy to catch cable car and buses. Room is small but just right, comfortable, classy, clean. Quiet with the sound of jazz trumpet/sax from Union Square. Free rubber ducky!
review.positiveRemarks: Great location. Front desk very helpful in directions. Free newspapers.
review.negativeRemarks: Wish parking was cheaper but that's life in the big city.
review.locationRemarks: Shop and eat! Chinatown nearby.

review.title: Great hotel close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: This is a wonderful hotel in an excellent area. You are within walking distance to fabulous shopping and restaurants. Public transportation is very convenient. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was small but very clean and the bed was comfortable. They always have cookies, fruit and coffee in the lobby. They do not provide a free breakfast but they have a restaurant that had good omelets. If I am fortunate enough to get to San Francisco again, I wouldn't stay anywhere else!! Thanks so much!!
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe better TV channel selection. When we crashed in our room at night after running around all day it would have been nice to have more choices.

review.title: quaint but tiny
review.reviewText: Nice to be in the middle of town however if you're looking for more space in your stay the rooms might be a little tiny to accomodate.
review.positiveRemarks: it was clean and close to decent shopping
review.negativeRemarks: the rooms are very small
review.locationRemarks: one trolley ride to fisherman's warf

review.title: Chancellor Hotel
review.reviewText: We loved the hotel and the location being close to shopping! The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our only issue was no air conditioning in the room...but the weather was unusually hot when we stayed.

review.title: Great location, free wifi
review.reviewText: Great location, room was small but clean & friendly staff

review.title: Nice decor in rooms but sleep at your own risk-
review.reviewText: Long story short, we had the fan on over night and one of the blades flew off and nearly knocked us out- There is no ac- which I guess is normal for San Fran? But it was a super hot night and the windows barely open. Since I paid with expedia our room wasn't comped, so we got some other voucher.

review.title: Nice hotel next to Union Square
review.reviewText: Pleasant, clean, easy ingress/egress with valet parking, easy access to everything Union Square has to offer. A nice perk is the "pillow Menu" where they offer you different/supplemental pillows and cases to help you enjoy your bed even more!

review.title: Great location at reasonable price
review.reviewText: Centrally located by Union Square and short walk to cable car and rail link to airport. Fine old building but with all amenities. Appreciated the fact that the windows actually open for ventilation rather than relying on air con. Helpful staff. Didn't try the hotel bar or restaurant.

review.title: San Fran experience
review.reviewText: Great location, cool City, would return to SF & Chancellor
review.positiveRemarks: Free coffee machine in lobby, room had fridge & safe. There was also ice machine on each floor.
review.negativeRemarks: Poor view & noisy fan.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, easy to hop on a tram & to walk around city.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: All points of interest are very accessible from this location. The old cable car runs right in front of the hotel, we walked to China Town, the beautiful City Hall, symphony and ballet halls. Shopping and so many restaurants we couldn't count.

review.title: Location, Location, Location!
review.reviewText: The hotel has a perfect location at Union Square- the staff are super friendly. The room itself is a little on the small side and the hotel is a little dated but it was totally fine for our stay as we didn't spend much time in the room. If you are visiting San Fran, make sure to consider this hotel as it is perfectly located and there is even a cable car stop right outside!

review.title: perfectly fine, but not at this price
review.reviewText: the hotel was in a great location, the staff was nice, and there were some lovely touches, like free coffee and cookies, but the room was quite small and very basic.
review.positiveRemarks: the location the free coffee and cookies nice staff
review.negativeRemarks: small rustic bathroom small room

review.title: Nice hotel along Union Square.
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is a nice hotel along Union Square, in an excellent location to see many of SF's sights. The staff is friendly and helpful and offer great tips on buses to take, restaurants, etc. The rooms are always clean and the hotel restaurant is good, especially for breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, friendly staff, little amenities such as free tea and home-made cookies, and many other little touches make this an enjoyable place to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms along the street can be noisy with street noise--the cable cars go past all day and almost all night--but use earplugs or shut the windows.
review.locationRemarks: The location is right next to Union Square, the cable cars, several nice restaurants. You can also walk up Powell street and get to Nob Hill easily.

review.title: European Feel
review.reviewText: We loved the convenience of being right in Union Square and the European feel of the hotel. The staff was very helpful and friendly. What we didn't love quite as much was that we didn't have air conditioning and with cable cars running in front of the hotel til 12:30 AM it was a little noisy to keep your window open. Overall, really enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Good place to stay if don't want to spend alot
review.reviewText: The good news. It's convenient to trolley, market st, streetcars. Not expensive. Excellent tasting free coffee available 24 hours in lobby. Room had great beds and very comfortable pillows and comfortables. Bad news - no free shuttle from airport, room had a musty smell and advised to leave bathroom window open when showering.
review.negativeRemarks: Musty smell of room and very noisy (generator) right outside bedroom window
review.locationRemarks: Great location downtown. Easy public transportation. Scala rest. across the street had great dinner. Luigi and Sears rest had good breakfast

review.title: Chancellor Hotel review
review.reviewText: We've stayed at the Chancellor for many years and loved it's Small Boutique Hotel feel and great price with a fantastic location but as the price has continued to go up and there is only so many reasons to stay in a small room. They do the very best they can with the space and it is a very classy hotel with great people working there but I doubt if we will stay again just because the price verses space doesn't equal out anymore.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and how clean the hotel and rooms are plus and great staff.
review.negativeRemarks: TV system and too heavy of bedspread. Get some light weight down comforters that keep you warm and toasty without weighing you down.
review.locationRemarks: Love, love, love the location.

review.title: Great location, wonderful staff
review.reviewText: One of the hotel's great assets is its location really close to Union Square with cable cars running past the front door. The other is the staff, who are friendly and helpful. We had an issue with noise coming from the room next door which was dealt with quickly and effectively - a tv turned up really loud while the guest was in the bathroom! Our room was rather dark and though we had no street noise there were occasional grumbles from the plumbing - but the plus points of the hotel more than made up for that. Breakfast was good value and the service there was great as well.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location - and the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: It's an old building so there's not much that they can do - but it's full of character and perfectly comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco is on your doorstep ...

review.title: Fantastic hotel in the heart of Union Square!!
review.reviewText:
Just returned from a 4 night stay at The Chancellor Hotel in San Francisco!!! we decided to stay at The Chancellor Hotel in the absolute heart of Union Square!! The location could not have been better if you like to shop.The stores down Powell St.were fantastic and there were many restaurants to choose from. We felt very safe and we were happy to be so close to everything . ChinaTown is also very close with lots of cute souvenirs to be had.
The bus is close and the trolley cars run right down Powell St in front of the hotel which was very convenient and they were a blast and every tourist should try it at least once!!
I have to send an extra special thank you to Annie who worked at the front desk at The Chancellor who was such a help to us and always recognised us when we arrived back from a trip out . Her customer service was appreciated as well as the other front desk staff who were helpful with directions and information as well as the excellent service and staff at Luques restaurant in the hotel!! There was 24hr coffee available with fresh cookies and fruit which was a nice touch.
The room was cozy with 2 twin beds. the room was a bit small but we were there just to sleep and then be off for the day! Would stay at this great little hotel again!
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the customer service was excellent and the restaurant called Luques that was inside was wonderful for a yummy breakfast that super handy
review.locationRemarks: right on the trolley line on Powell St in the heart of Union Square

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square in SF.
review.reviewText: Checked in very late and night manager was very helpful in locating a place to get food. Very friendly staff. Love the old SF charm and quirkiness of the building with up to date ammenities.
review.locationRemarks: Near cable car and steet cars. Walking distance to everything. Great shopping and restaurants within a few blocks. Near Moscone Center.

review.title: Great hotel in an even better location
review.reviewText: An older hotel this place has lots of character with the rooms offering a very comfortable bed with a pillow menu to chose one to suit you perfectly. We stayed on the top floor with a wonderful view of union square and beyond. It was a little noisy with the bell from the cable car but what do you expect from a downtown hotel! With the top floor room we had a very large walk in closet which was perfect to put away our luggage. I loved the hotels charm and the staff were very helpful. As a bonus there are complementary cookies, tea, coffee, fruit and even popcorn in the lobby to help you stave off the hunger before you head for breakfast or dinner. From the hotel everything is within a good distance for example fishermans wharf is about a 45min walk and a cable car stop is right across the road. I highly recommend this hotel and it isn't too expensive!
Nice warm feeling older hotel. Great staff. Staff made you feel welcome to be here.
Great place in a prime location! Highly recommend
Perfect location. Friendly, helpful staff. Loved having adjoining rooms - we didn't even request that! We will be back!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Staff were friendly and very helpful. Room was clean and quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: The friendly service and the location
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Bus tours and shopping very near. Also some great restaurants.

review.title: Nice central hotel , reasonable proces
review.reviewText: We booked and paid for three rooms from expedia , but when we get there we find out they only had 2 rooms availiable. So expedia failed...

review.title: Great location, great price
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here for two nights on vacation in April. The location was amazing! The room is not huge, but we spent very little time in there and had no problems with it. Hotel was very clean and the staff was friendly and helpful! We loved that they provided an umbrella in the room for guest use during the stay! Would definitely stay here again and/or recommend to friends and family!

review.title: Quaint hotel and a pleasing stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a prime location for those wishing to visit downtown San Francisco. It was a quaint hotel with a pleasant atmosphere.
review.positiveRemarks: The server in the dining room from Cambodia I believe, was very pleasant and was quite enjoyable to listen to. He went out of his way for us.
review.locationRemarks: There were tons of things to do in the area, a short walk to China town, a multitude of stores to shop in although they were high end.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel , excellent location for visiting everything in San Francisco without needing a car. Room was spotlessly clean. Coffee and cookies were great and available all the time.
review.positiveRemarks: This hotel was in a good location
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location for seeing everything , you could walk to all the sights in San Francisco . The tram was jus outside the front door.

review.title: All in all, a nice night.
review.reviewText: Great option for an affordable, comfortable, stay on Union Square. The lower level rooms can be noisy.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice staff. Nice bed. Nice location. Nice price.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower floors are LOUD.

review.title: Nice central location
review.reviewText: Enjoyed san francisco and the great attractions many parts are how they were many years ago

review.title: Perfect spot!
review.reviewText: Very welcoming with nice touches. Tour desk was so helpful and patient with us. Must eat at Sears, next door!

review.title: The hotel staff were very helpful and nice.
review.reviewText: When I checked in they noticed I had a cane so they offered a chair for the shower which was very useful.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This was our first time in SF. Location is very central, lots of shopping, restaurants, bars, park, and transportation. Hotel was nice Euro Style. Rooms not big, but at least had room for bed, extra chairs and desk/dresser. Views are to be desired, ugly Fire Escape room 702, facing building across the street. You are on a Trolley street, across from the park, so we enjoyed the bells of the trolley ,and the music of a trumpet player in the park. The bar in the hotel was not very pleasing, almost like a coffee nook.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, ice water in lobby, and the cookies
review.negativeRemarks: Make the bar area more inviting.
review.locationRemarks: See above

review.title: OK hotel on Union Square
review.reviewText: I think the location is this hotel best feature, the rest is ok. I chose this place because it was a good deal and I wanted to spend most of my money on activities and bars/restaurants.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Had good service from the Hotel and particularly the travel desk was very helpful and friendly.

The only let down was the size of the room was very small. It was difficult to find room for the suitcases (2 lrg & 2 carry on) without tripping over things.
review.positiveRemarks: Location made seeing the city via trams, and cable cars very easy.
review.negativeRemarks: room size or configuration. Alternatively getting rid of some furniture to make it easier to move around the room
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf, China Town, Little Italy, shopping, all nearby or accessible through the public transport

review.title: Nice hotel, great location!
review.reviewText: Hotel was very quaint and comfortable. The location was good and I would definetly go back.

review.title: Bed too soft
review.reviewText: Staff excellent, very helpful. Very clean, great tourist location.....
review.negativeRemarks: Bed was a hole too difficult to get out of.....
review.locationRemarks: Was in a seminar......not a tourist

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: While the hotel is beautiful, the rooms face the street and as a result, it is very noisy and difficult to sleep. Rooms do not include cable, air or coffee makers. Staff was not helpful nor particularly kind. Items such as hair dryer and bathroom fan did not work properly.

review.title: Hotel Chancellor
review.reviewText: This is an old, possibly historic hotel. It was very clean and well kept for it's age. It is a smaller hotel close to lots of shopping and restaurants. It's not fancy or luxurious, but it is safe, clean and comfortable. My room didn't have any sort of view, but the bed was comfortable, I had a huge closet, shower water pressure was good and it was quite at night. WiFi was also a little better than average.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Loved the location of the Chancellor....very close to all the fab shopping in Union Square. It was right on the cable car line so Fisherman's Wharf was only a few minutes away. Chinatown was within easy walking distance. The hotel has a very European feel.....the rooms are a bit small, but I've been in smaller rooms in Manhattan!
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the location and the charm.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of shopping .....Chinatown is a 10 minute walk......very easy to catch the cable car.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText: Great time in San Fran and at the chancellor! Rooms are small, but nice, and the staff is sooo helpful.

review.title: Not so comfortable this time...
review.reviewText: We have always loved staying at the Chancellor Hotel because of it's great location near Union Square, downtown shopping, and Nob Hill. However, this time the room wasn't so comfortable. We were put in a small room on the second floor overlooking the ducting for the ventilation system. There were no controls in the room for the heating and cooling system so to get any fresh air, we had to leave the window open and anyone climbing on the ventilation system could have easily entered our room. High pitched noises throughout the night also made it difficult to sleep...

review.title: Perfect Location, Comfort
review.reviewText: Do not choose this hotel for a glitzy and pampered stay. It is a perfect location mixed with a delightful traditional feel that really satisfied our stay in San Francisco

review.title: Just OK.
review.reviewText: The hotel was OK. Expected it to be a little better but it was just a little above average. The cookies were nice, the coffee was nice, service was OK, room was small (as expected). Nothing stood out however.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is within walking distance of many things a traveler would want to visit. The room (and the bathroom) is small - especially if you have two big suitcases like we did. Our room was clean and the bed was comfortable. On one occasion, one of the two elevators was out of order but worked again when I tried later.
The wifi on our floor (7th) was very spotty and when I called the reception they didn't seem too willing to help out, claiming my device was the problem. Then, when I went down to the lobby, reception worked fine... Besides this, the hotel staff was pretty friendly and check-in/-out went smoothly.
review.positiveRemarks: Walking distance from Union Sq, very good breakfast at hotel restaurant, cleanliness, choice of pillows, complimentary apples & cookies in lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi (give me a break, this is SAN FRANCISCO!!), parking is a bit pricey

review.title: Good location and that's about it
review.reviewText: Not a good room, bathroom. Hotel is old and rooms need major remodeling. Didn't enjoy being there at all.

review.title: Great value hotel in prime location
review.reviewText: The room was very pleasant, clean, well decorated, professionally done and included all amenities. Breakfast at Luques Restaurant was a fantastic bonus. Great dining, with good value for such a quality breakfast. The location was perfect in Union Square. My only negative was that my room was a bit noisy being on a lower floor, although this had no impact on my stay and is to be expected in such a busy location. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Perhaps choose a higher floor to limit the noise from Union Square.

review.title: Great location, OK stay
review.reviewText: If this hotel were located a little further away from Union Square, I might have regretted paying the price I did for the room I got. As it was, though, the hotel was within walking distance of almost everywhere I wanted to go in San Francisco, so I'm definitely glad I stayed here. The room was small (having luggage for two people required jumping over it once or twice) and the bathroom was miniscule, but everything was clean and the bed was very comfortable. Check-in and check-out were easy. My only other two complaints were that our room was a bit noisy (it was located on the front of the hotel near the cable car line) and that it didn't have air conditioning, which was fine every night except for one particularly warm one. All in all, though, I'd definitely consider staying here again.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance from Union Square shopping, Chinatown, North Beach, Fisherman's Wharf, the Ferry Building, the Exploratorium, Ghiradelli Square.

review.title: First time in SF! Great hotel in perfect location!
review.reviewText: We stayed last week in room 706 which is located in the back of the hotel so it's nice and quiet. We always travel with a sound machine (Marpac Dohm) but really didn't need to use it (slept with the windows open too). Turned it on out of habit. If you stay in a room in the front of the hotel, you might consider getting one because Powell Street is lively and fun at night but maybe a little too lively for some people. Our room was perfect! Very clean and comfortable. New Serta beds with fluffy white comforters and excellent pillows. Place to plug in all your gadgets. Beautiful lobby and friendly staff. Excellent location. We will definitely return!

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: I liked the location of this hotel but it was very noisy, both from street noise and from neighbours. When we informed the front desk about some girls partying in the next room at 1 a.m., they suggested we change rooms- on our fifth night! Otherwise, the hotel was charming and the rooms comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The free coffee and cookies in the hotel lobby was a nice touch but could have been better quality.
review.locationRemarks: near Union Square, Grace Cathedral, China town and much more...

review.title: Nice hotel right in the heart of the city
review.reviewText: The Chancellor was very nice. Simple and classic design. The room was very comfortable and simply decorated. I love the vintage feel of the hotel and design. There we no bells and whistles, just simply a nice place to stay.

review.title: Great location, good price
review.reviewText: Little bit noisy, but a great location and a great price.

review.title: Great location, friendly hotel!
review.reviewText: Uncomfortable bed!!! Freezing room! Heater was in the closet, but we (wrongly) assumed the thermostat on the wall controlled the temp. Didn't spend much time in the room because if the WONDERUL location though.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText:
The best feature of the hotel is it's location--without a doubt in one of the best spots in the heart of SF.
The staff courteous and helpful; the 24 hrs coffee and cookies complimentary service very useful, especially when you are up at odd hours because of jet lag.
Room clean with good mattress and pillows; good wireless service in the room.
On the downside, our room was a bit too small with a lot of space wasted for a huge walk in closet (abt 30% the size of the room!!) Heating problematic in a cold wintery weather and almost nonexistant wall electrical outlets.
Would recommend for a short visit.

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: Very pleasing to be able to move around San Francisco by many transport modes, including the trolley cars from sites adjacent to the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Our room was excellent and the bar and restaurant staff extremely friendly and obliging to 2 Australians on their first visit.to your wonderful city.
review.negativeRemarks: Happy the way it is, however.

review.title: Nice Place to Stay and a Great Value
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Safety and cleanliness are the two criteria I look for first when choosing a hotel and this hotel was both! Great location and a short cable car ride from Fishermans Wharf. Amenities included free wifi, free refrigerator in room, fresh water, coffee, cookies and apples available at all times (also free). Lovely little lobby bar with knowledgeable bartenders and staff. The restaurant was good and we received exceptional service from the very sweet Wilson. When I return to San Francisco I will definitely stay again at Chancellor Hotel--a very good value. Great experience.

review.title: good location, very close to Union Square
review.reviewText: good location, very close to Union Square, nice staff. It's within 10 mins walk to the underground station. It's also very close to Chinatown, financial centre, nob hill and the Beach.

review.title: Charming and comfortable
review.reviewText: The bedding is the most comfortable thing I've experienced. Every staff member was extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel seemed small and charming, yet was perfectly clean and well maintained. My only complaint was the weekend noise level from being in a street facing room.

review.title: Perfectly located for tourism in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Charming beautifully positioned with small rooms but all facilities in good order. Not cheap by any stretch of the imagination and the breakfast facilities were not up to scratch. Helpful courteous staff particularly on the tour desk. Clean rooms but two girls and two suitcases filled a room.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast menu confusing and disproportionately expensive
review.locationRemarks: Great for shopping and well located for tourist sites. All of these can be reached by walking e.g. Chinatown or bycheap($2/ride) public transport

review.title: Linda's Amazing Adventures in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Once again, Pleasant, Relaxing, Amazing...!! I live in S. California, and have stayed many, many times at the Chancellor Hotel.... A Lovely View of Union Square from my Room, always makes me happy.. Watching the Cable Cars is always fun.... Walking everywhere, with a Fabulous Union Square location... Love it...!!
review.positiveRemarks: The Staff, Convenience of Location, and Great Breakfast in their on property restaurant..
review.locationRemarks: Farallon Restaurant..... The Best...

review.title: Top Location
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were so friendly and helpful, location is superb. So convenient having a tour desk who recommended and booked day tours which were great.
review.locationRemarks: Location is superb, right on Union Square for shopping with cable car to Fishermans Wharf at the front door plus great restaurants nearby.

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel uses the older feel as part of its charm. The staff was wonderful and helped with any problem we had. The location was great and the area nice. Right next to a Walgreens which was perfect. The shuttle organised through the hotel was perfect for us.

review.title: I've stayed there for years - my favorite hotel'
review.reviewText: I always stay here in SF. Would you let me know where to buy that mattress and cover? What make and style? I love everything about the Chancellor. And, the location is perfect! Thanks you. Carlee
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the staff, the bar, the room, the linens, the old SF feeling. I love it.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, dining, theater, walking,etc.

review.title: Exceptional Location
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is in the heart of Union Square. Traveling around the city from this location is a breeze. The cable cars, busses, and Bart lines are all nearby the hotel. The staff at the Chancellor is welcoming and helpful. The hotel also provides great little touches such as having apples, cookies, water, and coffee/tea available 24/7. Rooms are a bit small, so I would definitely only have two people per room.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the personal touches and atmosphere of this historic hotel, as well as the stellar location.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is steps away from the cable cars. It's also in a great location for shopping, dining and having drinks.

review.title: Best location to price ratio
review.reviewText: My husband's first time in sf and mine in six years. The room was small but what room isn't in sf. Very clean and well kept. Comfortable bed like others have mentioned. So close to union square, China town, muni stops and cable car. Go to sears next door for breakfast it's amazing you won't regret it. We went there both days because it was so convenient. The front desk girls are the best! Effortlessly answered all my lost tourist questions about how to get places by using a map and making a route for me. Will stay here next time. P.S.cookies in the lobby! They were sooo good I had too many!

review.title: OK old hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel lobby is a mess. Restaurant closed on Mondays.
Room was small but comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel lobby needs upgrading

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Great location, nice staff, and cookies in the lobby! The walls were very thin and room were perfect size for 2 people

photos.caption: Fabulous view of Nob Hill from the back of the hotel

review.title: Wonderful boutique hotel in perfect location
review.reviewText: I love this hotel! From the first moment I was greeted by the bellman until the last moment the concierge wished me a safe trip home, the staff made me feel like I was their favorite and most important guest. The building is charming if just a little bit cramped, and the food, drinks and service were all uniformly splendid. The room was so immaculately clean and well-appointed that it was easy to overlook its rather small size, and the views are amazing from both the front and the back of the hotel. I love the quaintness of the vintage fixtures, and the rubber ducky is a lovely whimsical touch in an otherwise quietly genteel boutique hotel. The Union Square location simply cannot be beat anywhere, and the rates are remarkably reasonable considering everything you get for your dollar. I would highly recommend the Chancellor to anyone traveling to San Francisco, and I would and will stay there again - in fact, I've already booked my next visit!

review.title: Decent Room Good Value
review.reviewText: The room was decent, especially compared to other rooms I've had in SF. It was larger than many similarly priced hotels, with a king size bed. Only complaint was housekeeping. It appeared that all they did was make the bed. Towels weren't folded and garbage was left on the desk and floor (where I had dropped something without noticing - I'm not in the habit of leaving garbage on the floor).
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping
review.locationRemarks: Union Square.

review.title: Okay But Don't Have Your Car Valet Parked
review.reviewText:
Hotel is very conveniently located and the staff is very nice. For an old hotel it is kept up pretty well. The room was very small and the traffic noise from the street was loud all night (we were on the 7th floor). Ask for a quiet room (if they have one). Breakfast was okay.

Don't have your car valet parked!!! The attendant scratched our car but we didn't notice it until we got home. The hotel gave us phone numbers for Execupark, Inc. (the company they use to park cars) but I received no response to my calls. I will never pay to have someone park my car in SF again!
review.negativeRemarks: Valet
review.locationRemarks: Convenient

review.title: Great Location/Reasonable Price
review.reviewText: The hotel was so convenient to everything. We are walkers and walked everywhere from here. We had a room on the Cable car side (Powell st). It was very noisy between 12am and 5am but we also kept the window open! Next time I would ask for a room on the other side. Would recommend it and would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and price. It is a relatively small hotel more boutique style than a the larger chain hotels.
review.negativeRemarks: It was perfect for us. We were out and about during the day and only came back to sleep in the evening.
review.locationRemarks: Very central, shops, transport, theatres, movies, galleries, museums, China town etc all close. Approx 30-40 minute walk for us to fishermans wharf

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: wonderful lobby, coffee, tea, water, cookies and fruit at all times
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Union station, perfect location.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Very comfortable and close to the city, great price
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the city, clean, comfortable.

review.title: Bargain Lixury!
review.reviewText: A boutique hotel experience with an organized and professional staff. I was surprised by the degree of elegance and service I received during my stay here, especially considering the unbelievable rate! Something about this place felt like a little bit of New York in San Francisco, in a jazz kind of way. If I were to make a suggestion, I would want to upgrade the cookies. It's wonderful to have the cookies in the lobby, but if they were higher quality, they would be one more thing to rave about.
Great location. Good service.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, shopping, shopping.

review.reviewText: Bartender was very good and agreed to make our favorite cocktail. The intimacy of the little lobby bar was very fun and an opportunity to meet others.
review.positiveRemarks: Although our room was right above Powell, when we closed the patio window it was surprisingly quiet. We had no problems sleeping.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is very accessible with many bars and restaurants close by.

review.title: Nicer than expected
review.reviewText: I havef stayed at the Hyatt and Hilton on Union Square before and feel this hotel is now my first choice for location, price and confort.
review.positiveRemarks: I could tell that this hotel gives attention to details from the interior, cleanliness and decor and just a little touch of candy in my room.
review.locationRemarks: My family go every year the day after Christmas for seeing the city, shopping, dining and having fun. The location is a BIG PLUS.

review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is great as it is in the centre of Union Square. The rooms are a bit run down and in need of a good renovation. The free wifi was handy as we needed to look up maps etc. The staff were friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need a renovation

review.title: Good Experience
review.reviewText: good locationgood servicegood experienceStrongly recommend this hotel to everyone!

review.title: Very Nice Hotel on Union Square!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice! It was comfortable, extremely clean, and the staff were all helpful, pleasant, and courteous. Yes the room may be a bit smaller than we were used to, but it was big enough, and the Chancellor has a lot of character! We will absolutely stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Helpful friendly staff, clean, great location!
review.locationRemarks: Union square, Chinatown, shopping, close to transit stops, tons to do and see!

review.title: Awesome location!
review.reviewText: Really close to Union Square and to shopping! Staff was helpful and hotel was in good condition.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText:
just next to union square.
Staff is nice.

review.title: Decent place from which to explore
review.reviewText: This hotel is charming and located in a very central location. Don't stay here if you are sensitive to noise, although they have white noise machines upon request. Has great charm but lacks modern amenities. Close to shopping and downtown business. Close to Bart. As a female traveling alone I felt safe the entire time.

review.title: First trip to San Fran
review.locationRemarks: Ate at Sears next door. Great breakfast. Just walk across street to catch cable car. Loved eating at The Cheesecake Factory on top of Macy's.
Union square at your doorstep including cable car stop, walking distance to SF shopping mall plus tons of places to wine dine and dance!

review.title: older building-great experience
review.reviewText: Loved the bath-room..deep big tub!! walking distance to everything..would definitely stay again !! only ate breakfast , but was very reasonable compared to the hotels you get stuck in in union square!! older hotel , and i was surprised at the fit and finish..good experience!!

review.title: Historic hotel-convenient to Union Square
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the Chancellor. It is a historic hotel and the room reflects the history of the years of operation. It was sufficient for two people looking for a cozy stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful with all our travel needs. The location is most convenient for walking to many restaurants and shopping. Also an easy walk to Chinatown from the Chancellor. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the history of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms are relatively small but sufficient for two people. I think families might find it a little crowded unless other rooms are more spacious.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great. You can walk to a variety of restaurants. Sears Fine Foods which has been in business for ages like the Chancellor next door.

review.title: Great hotel, near everything!!!
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is right in the middle of everything , step out the door and grab a cable car to anywhere you want to go... the hotel is small, and beautiful, the staff, wonderful! We were married at city hall Nov. 15th 2013, and it was the perfect place to stay, 10 mins to city hall and off we went. I would highly recommend this hotel to all !!
review.negativeRemarks: King size beds
review.locationRemarks: Near everything...

review.title: Good hotel and very well located.
review.reviewText: This was a good choice for Union Square and put us close to all the usual tourist attractions. The hotel is pleasant enough and while the rooms are a little dated ours was comfortable enough. Staff were helpful and we would stay again.

review.title: Great Location!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is great! A great location with friendly and knoweldgable staff
review.positiveRemarks: Great restaurant and location. Friendly staff!
review.locationRemarks: Saks Fifth Avenue is directly across the street and the hotel is literally a 30 second walk from Union Square

review.reviewText: Began staying there probably 30 years ago but haven't been back for about ten. Delighted to find it is still a quiet, homelike place with a friendly staff and nothing of the feel of a typical big chain hotel. My rating is based on the ratio of quality/prince.

review.title: Stay At Chancellor Hotel SF
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a good location; ideally placed just off Union Square close to all amenities. 2 of the 3 trolley bus routes run pass this hotel so a great experience to be had. The hotel is comfortable without being luxurious with rooms in SF being smaller than the US average. Reception has a tourist desk with very helpful staff with reasonable prices.
review.negativeRemarks: Increase the temperature in the restaurant at breakfast service; it was quite cold when we ate in there and the food went cold quickly.
review.locationRemarks: Great central location for shopping, restaurants, China Town, cable cars & Union Square.

review.reviewText: I loved the location of this hotel. It was right in the heart of San Francisco - Union Square. The restaurants were fantastic and the service at the hotel was great.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the service. The staff was very knowledgeable about happenings in the city. We appreciated their suggestions.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds were not very comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: I liked the location because you could walk to the restaurants and stores. The cable cars were right

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Location was perfect. The hotel very good in everything. The free cookies and coffee in the foyer were a great touch!

review.title: Staff are very nice
review.reviewText:
It's okay. We stayed at this hotel hoping to have good feeling of being in the Union square.
The request to have the two rooms we reserved be on the upper level was not honored and instead we were placed on the second floor without the view. We were told that we can move the following day but that is just too much hassle to pack before 12 and to be moved after 3 pm.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed seems old and ready to be replaced. Not firm slightly saggy
review.locationRemarks: Close to the union square, close to several shops and restaurants.

review.title: Great location hotel.
review.reviewText: Great location, just off Union Square. The staff were helpful and very friendly. The hotel is a little dated in places, but is clean with comfy bed. We were at back of hotel so was reasonably quiet for the centre of a.city. Quite good for what we paid.

review.title: Loved the location. Very close to Union Square.
Wonderful family-owned boutique hotel.
review.reviewText:
I attended a conference at Moscone Center and found the Chancellor Hotel to be a nice walking distance from Moscone. Steps from Union Square as well. But...the best part of the hotel is the staff and facilities. Very friendly and relaxed staff. Not a corporate feel at all. The hotel is very well maintained and exceptionally clean. The architecture is definitely older with small rooms and unusual bathrooms but I loved it. How many cookie-cutter rooms have we all been in.

The quaint lobby was welcoming and the other guests were quite friendly as well. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling alone or a couple. (Wouldn't recommend for kids due to size of rooms.)

Also, easy to get to from SFO. The Powell St. station is a short walk away. Easy and stress free.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly and professional staff. Very clean and fresh. Vintage architecture. Location.
review.locationRemarks: You are steps away from Union Square and tons of shopping and dining opportunities. Easy walk to Moscone Center. Very safe location.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText:
the hotel is really nice, old building but really well kept. The room is big enough, really clean and with pretty much everything you need. The bathroom amenities are ok, the bed is really confy and the pillow-menu is pretty awesome.
I barely saw the cookies at the entrance but there was always fresh water.
The location is superb!!... 1/4block away union street, and with a walgreens right at the corner.
They have a big tv with enough free cable channels and free wifi wich is really fast.
The only down side is the staff!!!... the cleaning ladies are respectfull but the staff at tbe front desk particullarly at night are not so nice, not helpfull at all. There where 2 guys in the morning who made it up!!, no one to help you with the bags or either to hold the front door for you!!....the only mole in my beautiful 7 days stay.

review.title: Nice hotel in center city
review.reviewText: Noisy room above street level for first night, idling truck form 3 - 5 am, had to change room

review.title: A clasic hotel worth your visit
review.reviewText: This is a charming hotel build in 1914 which still retains its chracter and charm. The rooms are small by modern standards and the barthrooms are in need of renovation but this perhaps is a reflection of the long history of the hotel and so are not necessarily negatives. There is no air conditioning but there are ceiling fans and the outside windows can be opened (though streat noise can be a factor with an open window). The staff were very nice and helpful. There is a small cafe which serves breakfast and lunch which we enjoyed. There is also a small kiosk in the foyer that will help you plan day trips etc. The location is good with multiple transport options near by including the cable car which stops almost right out the front that takes you to Fisherman's Wharf. We will stay there again if we get back to San Francisco :)
review.positiveRemarks: Historic hotel, good staff, good location
review.negativeRemarks: Hard one. In some ways upgrades would increase comfort but reduce the apeal of the hotel.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText:
The Chancellor is very well located just off Union Square and central for all transport. The staff were all pleasant and the free coffee and water was very well appreciated after a hard day doing touristy things!
Breakfast is well worth a visit and good value

review.title: Small family owned hotel in fantastic locatiom
review.reviewText: A little noise at night, but worth it for the location & price

review.title: union square hotel
review.reviewText:
arrived early, room not ready, so front desk kindly stored our luggage.
rooms small but clean and quaint

review.title: Great Hotel in a good location
review.reviewText:
Recently spent 3 nights here having heard what a great hotel this was. What a great hotel, the rooms aren't huge but they are fine for what you need, you have room to move around easily.
The little touches likes the sweets, the rubber duck in the bathroom and the free tea/coffee downstairs make this a place I'd recommend to friends. If I'm back in San Francisco I'll be disappointed if I can't stay here again.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: close to shopping and cable car stops in front. picked up a muni pass at the hotel travel desk and took muni everywhere. walked to good restaurants nearby. Union Square was great for people watching. Room was well furnished , including a small refrigerator, and kept very clean by daily maid service. Went next door to Sears Restaurant for breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: staff very helpful and room was clean, not worn out. good bed
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant was OK but not special

review.title: Excellent location.
review.reviewText: This is a brilliant hotel. Superb location on Union Square which is in the centre of town. The trolley bus goes right by on the way to Fishermans Wharf, but most places are within walking distance. We asked for and got a room overlooking the square. Highly recommend it.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, quality of the rooms and the staff were great.
review.negativeRemarks: Air con would be great if it's hot.
review.locationRemarks: Brilliant location. Lori's diner, 50m up the hill is great for breakfast, La Scala across the street very good for dinner.

review.title: Excellent location to Union Square
review.reviewText: Location, location, location.... This hotel is half a block from Union Square and within walking distance to shopping, Beach Blanket Babylon and the Cable Car Line. The hotel is older, but very nice. Luque's Cafe, within the hotel, has the best Eggs Benedict ever!! We enjoyed the city noises, so left the window open; however, the hotel is very well insulated from both internal and external noises. The room size was adequate. The bathroom was on the smaller size and was a little awkward with the half step into it. The closet was large enough to put a twin bed into.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for Union Square--shopping, BART station, restaurants, Cable Car Line.

review.title: Nice hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: We spent seven nights here and were pleased with the hotel. Room was clean and roomier than expected. I thought the mattress was hard, but my husband was fine with it. Great location in Union Square, close to trolley and lots of great restaurants. We loved Old Siam a few blocks away. Helpful staff and on site tour bookings.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText:
A nice old hotel right off Union Square . Well maintained . A nice change from slick modern hotels . Front desk staff was top-notch , pleasant and always helpful . . Breakfasts in the dining room were good and not priced out of line , though you might do better off site . My room was certainly roomy enough , though you should realize that SF hotel rooms , at least in the older hotels , are on the small size . Pretty good , though not lightning fast wi-fi . My room had a desk with a usb charging station . No air conditioning , really didn't need it , the windows open and there's a ceiling fan to keep air moving . Walk to cable cars , buses , BART , F line is no more than a few blocks at most . Walking distance to Chinatown and North Beach , though it's partly uphill . There's a counter in the hotel that will sell you a MuniPass , and arrange sightseeing if you want .
Two possible downsides :
The bath tubs , are apparently original equipment from the early 1900's and are considerably deeper than modern ones . There's a big step-over to get in and out . Not so good if you're short or not so nimble.
Valet parking is off site , figure about 20-30 minutes to get your car.
All things considered , a nice place to stay , I'd come back again.

review.title: Nice hotel in central San Francisco
review.reviewText: Had a great time in San Francisco. Hotel was very clean, staff very helpful and friendly. Restaurant was a great place to eat.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were very helpful and friendly. The restaurant was very good. Rooms were quaint, small, but still more than adequate.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Lots of shopping. Trolley car to go to Fisherman's Wharf close by. BART train close by for airport trip. Chinatown close by.

review.title: Vacation
review.reviewText: It was a nice hotel, great location. Would recommend checking it out.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: Stayed 5 nights. Our room was a little small but adequate. We were on the 11th Floor and afternoon/evening sun streamed into the room. Hotel is very near Union Square so is close the transport, cable car, shopping and lots of restaurants. Staff were helpful, The hotel breakfast was not as good as the local restaurants.

review.title: Nice hotel right in Union Square
review.reviewText:
The Cancellor hotel was an enjoyable stay in the heart of Union Square.
The hotel is older but well maintained where we stayed. The rooms are smaller, but for the 2 of us , there wasn't a problem.
The staff was friendly and it was nice to have cookies, coffee and apples available to us in the lobby at all hours.
The trolley car runs right by the hotel and there is lots of shopping near by

review.title: A Great Location
review.reviewText: I needed a hotel that was close to a large conference hotel just off Union Square. The Chancellor was a short walk for me, easily accessible to the BART station at Powell, and had a lot more character than the conference hotel (just not air conditioning). While my room was small, it was well furnished and exceptionally clean and comfortable. I was glad that my room faced away from Powell so I experienced less noise from the cable car line or the street musicians on Union Square. The fresh cookies in the lobby were a nice touch and I had a pleasant breakfast at the hotel's restaurant one morning.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet hallways, speedy elevator, comfortable room, and great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning would have let me keep my window closed and experience less street noise.
review.locationRemarks: I walked up Nob Hill for great views of the city and enjoyed lunch around the corner at Wolfgang Puck's Postrio restaurant.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Clean,friendly,efficient and very well positioned.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much. Thought the rooms were small until we got to New York!!! Much better value, and much friendlier staff.
review.locationRemarks: Couldn't have asked for better for the price.

review.title: It was a great hotel.
review.reviewText: I loved how it was close to everything; walking distance to the cable cars, the Bart, the shopping centers and restaurants. The room itself was great, very comfy & very clean. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Ideal for exploring San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is yards away from Union Square, the city shopping and cable cars run right past the entrance. It was reasonably priced and there was always free coffee and cookies in reception. The room was quite small but had everything we needed for our 4 night stay. Staff were friendly and helpful. We had to call maintenance when the safe in our room wouldn't open and a very pleasant man was at our door within minutes to fix it. The Hotel has a small bar and restaurant although we didn't use either preferring to go out and explore the city.
review.positiveRemarks: The location of the Chancellor Hotel is ideal.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Had a great 3 night stay in August 2013. Hotel is in an excellent location, comfortable and clean and is great value for money. Tried the breakfast on 2 mornings, this was tasty and also good value for money. Staff were all friendly and helpful.

review.title: Best location in Union Square
review.reviewText:
We had a great time on our San Francisco vacation, and much of it was due to the Chancellor Hotel.
The location is perfect..very centrally located. It's next door to Sears Fine Food, with the best breakfast.The hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful. If there was something they didn't already think of, they would get it for you. The hotel is nearly 100 hundred years old and so charming..fresh paint, big down comforters, all kinds of sleep pillows, old sink and tub and perfectly clean.
review.positiveRemarks: The charm of the historic hotel, but yet so clean. The employees were ALL very friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: A large fan for those 90 degrees days...
review.locationRemarks: DSW is next door. Sears Fine Food on the other side has the best hash browns. Walgreens..yes..you will need something from there is a few doors down.

review.title: Nice hotel by the Union Square
review.reviewText: We arrive early and the front desk was flexible about check-in time. Everything went smoothly well, made our short stay enjoyable.
review.positiveRemarks: Very close and at the center of shopping, restaurants and major attractions of the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size a bit small for the price.
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping, restaurants and attractions.

review.title: Fantastic location; lovely thoughtful touches
review.reviewText: Very slick, friendly and a fantastic place to stay with Union Sq and plenty of restaurants nearby. The room was very comfortable, although small, but this is a city hotel, so space is at a premium. It was everything we hoped for and an excellent place to stay in SF. Some reviews said it was noisy, but we had a room to the rear and when the windows were closed it was perfectly peaceful. It was well-placed for the cable car, wine tour pick-up and buses.
review.positiveRemarks: Lovely, friendly touches like a jar of sweets, cute rubber duck looking after the toiletries and the apples and fresh cookies in the foyer.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing - perfect place to stay and very enjoyable
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, right by Union Square and all the shops. Bus easily accessible and we walked to the wharf area, but a long walk and hilly!

review.title: Good location, slightly tired decor.
review.reviewText: The hotel is right next to Union Square so perfect for shopping and very close to the tram and bus stops. The building is obviously old and the decor and room size reflected this.

review.title: Hotel with a heart in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel was the perfect place for me to stay during my first visit to San Francisco. Across the corner from Union Square, it's location couldn't have been better-close to restaurants, shopping, trolley cars, BART station, sight-seeing bus stops, China Town, Grace Cathedral. Although considered a boutique hotel, it was large enough to have its own great restaurant-Luques-and small bar area, as well as an in-house sight-seeing co-ordinator. But it was small enough to be personal-almost a family feel. Truly a hotel with a heart.
review.positiveRemarks: EVERYTHING! And the price was terrific-MUCH less expensive than other hotels in the vicinity.
review.negativeRemarks: I love it just the way it is!
review.locationRemarks: Located in the heart of downtown San Francisco-everything you wanted to see was either close by or a only tour bus away.

review.title: Small Hotel, No room to move,
review.reviewText: 3 Star overpriced, Run like a backpackers. Not much more to say other than I did not lick this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: For the price should included Breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Will not stay at that location again, Too many Beggars sticking cups in my face.

review.title: Centre of town on cable car line
review.reviewText: Fun location in centre of town. Cable car passes front of hotel
review.positiveRemarks: Brewed Coffee available in foyer 24/7 Plus yummy freshly baked biscuits.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to most things. A long walk in some cases but doable.

review.title: Good location but not worth the money
review.reviewText: The best thing about this hotel, apart from the very good location, was the complementary hot drinks service available in the reception area 24 hours a day. The room was barely acceptable for the cost and the bathroom was very small and distinctly shabby. The walk-in closet was welcome but was poorly aired and our clothes always felt damp. Reception staff were very knowledgeable but not particularly friendly.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Loved the pillow menu. Staff very helpful. Found it is worth paying for valet parking/garage when booking as when arriving at night is not convenient to walk the few blocks with suitcases down the street. Very quiet interior; busy exterior traffic. Concert going on at Union Square at night was fun.
review.locationRemarks: Is right on trolley line, but usually full trollies going past hotel as turnaround is 2 blocks away & need to get on there if want to ride.

review.title: Great Value on Union Square
review.reviewText: Had an outstanding stay. Friendly, helpful staff. Very comfortable room and bed. Great location on Union Square, close proximity to Chinatown. Highly recommend.

review.title: Charming, beautiful clean hotel.
review.reviewText: Hotel is half a block from Union Square. Free coffee, apples and cookies. Great deal on rental cars. Helpful friendly staff. Charming, comfortable room. No a/c but none needed. We stayed for 3 nights on a belated honeymoon. And absolutely loved it.

review.title: Pleasant in the hub of Union Square and shopping
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here not knowing the exact location. If you want to shop all the big department stores stay in Union Square. If you want to be on the Wharf near the water then do not chose this location . It does have the trolly right outside the front door and the electric bus drops off two blocks away. As for the staff they were pleasant also the gentleman at the tour desk was great. The room was a little small but we just needed a place to sleep very clean. If you want outside air it will be noisy but extremely quiet when windows are closed. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again. If you like Irish coffee please be sure to go to the Buena Vista!!!!
review.locationRemarks: Lots of department store shopping outside your door. Just a walk over to Chinatown & Little Italy

review.title: I love the location. The staff is wonderful.
review.reviewText: We have been guests at the Chancellor many times over the years and always enjoy our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of the rooms???
review.locationRemarks: Right on the cable car line and just off Union Square.

review.title: Old hotel close to the shops
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were very helpful however it was very noisy in my room and I was lucky to get a few hours sleep at night. Also the rooms were very hot only with an old ceiling fan which didn't do anything. The hotel is in a good location close to all the shops.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are outdated
review.locationRemarks: Location in union square lots of shops nearby

review.title: Nice hotel for the location, great price!
review.reviewText: Good hotel, much cheaper than others close by, great location, great price. Hotel Restaurant: very reasonable prices and good food~!
review.locationRemarks: Great location for shopping, buses and cable cars.

review.title: Great location to explore San Francisco
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the hotel. Great location, comfortable, good bar.

review.title: It was great! Cute room and great location.
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel, bonus it was so quiet! The location is awesome, staff nice, check in smooth. Free wireless was nice and it was easy to login, a rarity now days! And, the pillows -- they were amazing! We loved the hotel! Nice and small and cozy, European feel. Tour desk in lobby was helpful. They allowed us to check in early and that too is a rarity. Loved the Chancellor! Small bar looked cozy, didn't check it out though. We did have breakfast in the hotel and it waa yummy, plus we had a 10% off coupon given to us during check in. Another bonus, there are many, was that the cable cars stop was right in front. Very San Francisco!

review.title: Perfect for sightseeing
review.reviewText: Excellent location very clean, staff very helpful and polite, rooms "cosy" lots of free tea and coffee, choice of bars, restaurants and shopping also on the cable car route.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfy beds and close to everything
review.negativeRemarks: In hotel breakfasts avoid these
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Reasonably priced hotel in great location.
review.reviewText: This hotel is centrally located for upmarket shopping and restaurants. Free tea, coffee,iced water and apples/ cookies were a welcome addition. Enjoyed breakfast and the bar staff in the evening always made you feel welcome(particularly Rory :). Although disappointed there were no evening meals served and the bar closed promptly at 9.30.As a couple the room was adequate for our needs. There was sometimes some noise from nearby Union square and the ceiling fan sufficed as an alternative to AC. We would stay at this hotel again :)

review.title: Enjoyed my time and would happily return.
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Chancellor Hotel. The Hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. We could see Union Square across the road, and the cable cars travelling up and down the streets from our window. We didn't have to travel too far to find, see and do everything that we planned to do. It was a relaxing stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location, close to everything. Complimentary 24 hour tea, coffee and snacks provided in the lobby made our stay even better. Thank you.
review.negativeRemarks: If I had to be picky and pick something, I'd say the very small bathroom, but it is an older hotel. It suited our needs though.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel was on the main cable car line, close to all modes of transport. Short walking distance to all shops and also the Hop-On Hop-Off tour buses.

review.title: Great hotel and super central!
review.reviewText: We arrived to the hotel early, and they were able to check us into our room. We thought we would have to wait around until 3:00. The staff was really helpful, especially the man working the "touring" desk downstairs. We really appreciated the two for one wine deal, that was enjoyed after pounding the pavement all day in the city. The rooms were super clean and the bed was a slice of heaven. What a quaint, clean and friendly hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The waiter in the diner downstairs over charged us, that was annoying!

review.title: great location
review.reviewText:
Pleasant room,unfortunately on a lower floor with only a view of the exterior fire escape and adjoining building.
Given that, however, the location is fantastic,right on Union Square and the cable car line.

review.title: Nice Historic hotel
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel was absolutely lovely. Everyone from the bellman, to the front desk staff, from the maid service was so wonderful. The hotel itself has a lot of charm. Our room was beautiful, looked just like the pictures. The bathroom and closet were both very large. Like many reviews I had read, it is very loud. That is something you have to just accept with the location and the view. It is in the middle of a busy square- so yes- it will be loud. They offer a sound machine- which is great. My only complaint is the mattress. Any way I moved, I could hear the springs shifting. May be time for new mattresses.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, location, charm, free coffee...MIKE!! Best concierge ever.
review.negativeRemarks: Mattress
review.locationRemarks: Trolly, shopping, restaurants, bike rental, near the BART, near Chinatown...

review.title: San Francisco The Chancellor on Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel was close to everything. The staff were very helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't mind not staying in a 5 star hotel and just wants a nice, clean hotel near Union Square.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText:
Rooms were small but clean- had everything I needed. Kind of like staying at your fancy Aunt's house

Staff were alright but knowledgeable about the city
review.negativeRemarks: More modern decor
review.locationRemarks: Everything!

review.title: Vacation
review.reviewText: This is second time I have stayed here and thoroughly enjoyed my six night stay!
review.locationRemarks: In Union Square. Near restaurants, transit and shopping.

review.title: Stay at the Chancellor
review.reviewText: Great time staying at this hotel. The staff was excellant. Room was a bit tiny, but local and staff made up for that.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was in great shape for an older building. Hotel was clean and the rooms were fine. Had a restaurant for breakfast and lunch.
review.negativeRemarks: No view from the back of second floor window, Rooms are a bit small, but ok for the wife and I. Didn't spend much time in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Close to all the major shops and the cable car turn around. Easy to get to from the airport

review.title: Great hotel, staff could be little more attentive.
review.reviewText: Very nice experience here. Nice, clean room & hotel in great location. One thing I noticed when checking out was a couple w/their young child asleep in mother's arms & loads of suitcases not get offered any kind of help by desk as far as ringing a bellhop. Kind of disappointing to witness as they had their arms full trying to get everything in the elevator.

review.title: I would stay here again!
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, great location, the hotel is clean. I don't have anything negative to say! The hotel itself is old but the furnishings aren't old. Much like a lot of other hotels in SF it's got the fire escape stairs outside your window. I thought it was cute.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Great, right across union square.

review.title: Great Hotel.. Central to all tourist areas
review.reviewText: Hotel is centrally located. Friendly staff. Clean room.
review.locationRemarks: Great location!

review.title: Very good
review.reviewText: Pleasent and helpful staff, excellent downtown location. No coffee maker in the room, but coffee available in the lobby 24 hours. Very nice old hotel with character not found in modern franchise hotels.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to restaurants and shops. Cable car stops out front, goes to China Town and Fisherman's Wharf, Tour buses pick up a few steps from the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Prime location in Union Square area.

review.title: Good place to stay fos first time visitors
review.reviewText:
Great hotel. Staff friendly, efficient and helpful. Room spotlessly clean.
Hotel situated very near shops, cable cars and sightseeing bus stops.

review.title: Small but comfortable rooms with excellent locatio
review.reviewText: The room was small and dated, but clean! Service of the hotel staff is gd though and location is very centralized. If u r driving, there is parking although a little ex. Fisherman's wharf has more space although in SF, u don't really need a car.
review.negativeRemarks: Size

review.title: Awesome location. In the middle of Union Square.
review.reviewText: This was the perfect location for a hotel. The hotel is within walking distance of almost everything. The coffee and the cookies every morning were a nice surprise. Also, guests have complimentary access to a very nice gym around the block. The tour information employee was very helpful and nice.The hotel is clean and welcoming. The rooms are the typical size of a hotel room in San Francisco -- small. At times, other conversations in bordering rooms could be heard.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was great. The complimentary gym access, cookies, coffee, cleanliness, and WIFI were an added plus.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom amenities could be improved. They are very simple.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car, shopping, bars, restaurants, are right within the vicinity of the hotel.

review.title: Hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText:
Good location beside Union Square and short walk to the Bart for transfers to airport. (only 8:25$ one way) . Close enough to walk over the hill to fishermans wharf and the baseball ground for the giants. Shops were plentiful if thats what you are there for. Buses,cable car and taxis were all close at hand.
Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was smaller than other hotels we had stayed in but clean and comfortable. Did not have breakfast with our deal but tea, coffee, cookies and apples plus cold water were always available. Close to other places to eat, Chinatown, Nob hill etc.
Strange climate to deal with! Foggy in the mornings and night so take a jumper. Some people were wrapped up as if it was winter!! Only managed to see the famous bridge on 1 day out of 4 . Good fresh fruit at the farmers market down on the front on Saturday.
review.negativeRemarks: Smaller room
review.locationRemarks: Good position for the square and, if you are energetic , walking over the famous hills. Plus the cheesecake factory is just across the square.

review.title: Convenient and Reasonable
review.reviewText: Chancellor Hotel is very conveniently located if you're looking for a place to stay in the city. The rooms are very basic but clean. This hotel has been around for a very long time so the fixtures and layout may seem outdated, but it didn't bother me at all because I just wanted a comfortable room in the city. I purchased a room with parking which was about 1/2 a block away, the front desk will give you instructions on how to get there when you check in. The price was very reasonable, other hotels close by were almost twice the cost. I'd highly recommend the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: 1. Conveniently located 2. Staff was very friendly and helpful
review.negativeRemarks: It's an older hotel with basic amenities, you won't confuse it for a 4 or 5 star hotel but it was more than adequate for me.
review.locationRemarks: Across the street from Union Square and along the cable car line. Lots of shopping and dining close by.

review.title: Excellent choice for price and location
review.reviewText: I stayed here while visiting my son in San Francisco this July. The rooms are on the small side but well-furnished and comfortable. The high-sided tubs might present a problem for visitors who are on the elderly side. Free internet service and a helpful concierge.
review.positiveRemarks: Free internet service, a four-block walk to the Powell Street BART station, helpful staff, comfortable beds. Ask for a room away from the Powell side.
review.locationRemarks: Cable cars go up and down the street outside the door - either a plus or minus depending on your point of view. Easy walk to BART.

review.title: Very nice and located hotel and staff
review.reviewText:
Me and my wife stayed there for 3 nights and this hotel does worth what you pay. It is a good hotel, very well located and even though if you are just on Powell Street and cable car runs until midnight, if you close the window your room will get quiet enough for a good sleeping. Staff team is good as well including breakfast restaurant service. Room was clean and we did not see any issue regarding that, by the way the bed is very comfortable.
I will stay again at this hotel in the future and I recommend it to others.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff and also simple and clean room.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Union Square and just on Cable car street. Very good restaurants around the hotel as well so you can have a nice dinner

review.title: Really comfortable hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Really central location, right on Union Square - very handy for shops and most tourist attractions are within walking distance. Rooms a little smaller than expected but very clean and comfortable.

review.title: Great position and helpful staff
review.reviewText: This was my second stay. i found Very helpful staff that made you feel at home. The position of the hotel was great being close to union square shops and close to the Powell street station and a tramcar stop on the same block. I appreciated the unlimited supply of apples, cookies and coffee or tea in the foyer. Travelling alone I always felt safe and at home. I would recommend the hotel to other travellers.
review.positiveRemarks: The good position and homelike atmosphere
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Very close to union square and easy to access by the train from the airport

review.title: Nice hotel right on Union Square
review.reviewText: Just needed a room for a one night stay while in SF. The staff were very nice and helpful. Room was small, but accommodating for what we needed. I would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: I would have liked to have coffee and tea available in the room. I like getting up and making a quick cup right away. Not going to the lobby!
review.locationRemarks: Many stores to shop in. It's a very busy area at all times.

review.title: A bit noisy
review.reviewText: We found the hotel very noisy from street noise outside. You could also hear the guests talking in the room next door unfortunately we had quests next to us who had a birthday party until 2am - found it necessary to phone their room to ask them to quieten down but it didn't stop them. No air conditioning only fans could not leave windows open due to noise.
review.positiveRemarks: Tea and coffee availability, good breakfast and very friendly bar women who recommended very nice Italian restaurant to go to.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise and no air con

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Excellent location; very good breakfast in the restaurant; friendly and helpful staff; clean, comfortable and quiet room, though small by modern standards.

review.title: Great location / Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: We stay at this hotel every time we come to San Francisco, which is least 3 times per year. The location is ideal to all public transportation and shopping, the rooms are very clean and comfortable. The addition of small refrigerators has made the hotel more attractive. The staff are friendly and accommodating. Finally, The tour desk in the lobby is a great source for tickets, attractions, and other services for guests.
review.locationRemarks: Close to all transportation and China Town

review.title: Good Hotel- great location
review.reviewText:
I really liked this hotel- the staff was friendly and helpful. Someone was smoking on the floor and the hallway smelled really bad. I mentioned it to one of the staff and they had it back to normal in about 30 minutes.
It's in a great location and they have an easy shuttle ride to/from the airport.
I'll stay there again!
review.negativeRemarks: I can't think of a thing.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of restaurants and shopping within walking distance, and it's right next to the trolley line.

review.title: Great location, very comfortable stay
review.reviewText:
Really enjoyed the hotel, and it was in a great location and easily accessible to the places I needed to be.

I appreciated that there was a real hair dryer (not the mini ones some hotels provide), and that there was ample room with seating, closets, etc. The one potential disadvantage is that there is minimal counter space within the bathroom, but that is a very minor consideration. But everything was very clean, and the staff were knowledgeable and helpful.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
Stayed here for three nights. Check in was easy and painless.
Staff were welcoming and pleasant throughout. Hotel is obviously an older building like most in area but has been maintained fine and our room on 6th floor at rear was nice and quiet, although the view was non existent (a/c units on adjacent roof). Didn't come to San Fran to sit in my room looking out of the window anyway! Street side rooms would have probably had a lot of traffic noise so ours suited us fine.
The only time we ate in hotel was breakfast on the first morning which was ok and service was very good and pleasant.
Overall a pleasant experience
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location, quiet room, polite cheerful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient for shopping. Cable car stop just yards away, BART a short walk although used a cab from airport.

review.title: Good hotel, great price for sf location
review.reviewText: Decent hotel at an excellent price. Fantastic location. Room clean and comfortable. Bathroom could do with an update.

review.title: Goldilocks-just right-location-personal-friendly
review.reviewText:
Was in town for conference, on my own. Great location for Moscone (15 min walk). Cable car out front though, would be a little noisy if you are light sleeper and in room over street (Cable cars stop at around 11pm I think) my room at side no view but not noisy really. I was out most of the time so that
