does affect my view of the hotel. Bathroom small but very neat. Free Wi fi was very appreciated. Staff were great, could leave my things there after check out. Fresh fruit, biscuits and Descent coffee and twinnings tea and others all available free in the lobby throughout the stay. thoroughly recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: Mid June A little stuffy,fan in room,would have used that if it had been hot. I hate air/con anyway windows opened so this was ok
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Chancellor Hotel
review.reviewText:
excellent location,2 mins from Union Sq. and on the cable car route.
the in house restaurant meals were tasty, and good value. service was excellent.
All staff were friendly and helpful, i would definitely reccommend this hotel

review.title: very good hotel
review.reviewText:
very good staff
Excellent hospitality
good location
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent hospitality Staff are courteous and willing to help
review.locationRemarks: Excellent hotel's location in Union Square

review.title: Perfect location, small rooms
review.reviewText: Perfectly located hotel, only steps to Union Square. Rooms are small but have everything you need and are clean and well maintained. Very comfy bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: My husband & I were in town for a conference. We chose this hotel because of the location & price. It was very nice to be close to shopping, restaurants & public transportation. The temps were cool enough that we were very comfortable without a/c, nice to have free coffee in the lobby, apples at the front desk & popcorn available in the lobby in the afternoon, and free wifi access from our room
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure in shower, addition of floor length mirror
review.locationRemarks: convenient location to variety of shopping and restaurants. 2 blocks to bus stop, convenient to cable car

review.title: International traveler
review.reviewText: Special thanks to "Olga" who was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Top spot on tram line
review.reviewText: Location is great with trams right outside door and easy walking to shops, restaurants, mini supermarkets and tourist sites. Our room was on 4th floor and was totally quiet which was a treat in a big city. The bed was very comfy and the lollie jar was a nice touch. No tea and coffee facilities in room but you can get them for free all day/night in lobby - and they also provide yummy fresh baked biscuits. The room maybe compact but it is supplemented by a generous walk in closet and decent bathroom - we thought it was all good. Easy to get around via trams and trolley buses - a 3 day Muni pass at $22 was a bargain.

review.title: stayed during 25th Aniversery
review.reviewText: Spent 3 nites during our 25th Anniversery this week, considering all things, price, location, room area, Westin, Drake, Fairmont, Hilton, Mark Hopkins didn't make sense for us on this trip. We.met mostly International travelers, New Zealand, London, Brazil, Australia. We all found a good price on Expedia for this Union Square location that is the best area to stay in SF. Staff was great, Bartender Rory was a good dude, Doorman Oliver and Front desk were professional & courteous at all times. Just a wonderful experience in SF with Chancellor Hotel being part of the plan and received the level of service we expected. Our room was 3rd floor facing Powell, we enjoyed listening to the sounds of the cable car bell ringing and when not in mood for noise, just shut the window. Will be back again soon.
review.positiveRemarks: Bartender Rory, he was easy to get information from and was really down to earth as a person.
review.negativeRemarks: Had to leave to go back home
review.locationRemarks: Ideal location, we love Union Square as a base in SF

review.title: The perfect antidote to the characterlehotel chain
review.reviewText: An excellently run hotel; obliging and friendly staff, top quality service unobtrusively delivered. Fine attention to details - the little things that count they get absolutely right. Rooms are compact but perfectly adequate and although this is an older building the interior features and fittings and decor are beautifully maintained. This hotel would not be out of place as an up-market London establishment. It has character, without the downside. Perfect location, too.
review.positiveRemarks: Style and ambience, unobtrusive service delivery, room comfort, hospitality
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of air conditioning
review.locationRemarks: Perfect position

review.title: Happy in SF
review.reviewText: Good hotel loads of character staff friendly rate good excellent location room on the small side

review.title: charming
review.reviewText: It is right on the cablecar line on Powell Street. VERY noisy, but I liked the ambiance. Every evening I could hear the spontaneous music from Union Square---bag pipes on Mon and Tues, trumpeter the rest of the days. None of them were very good, but they were not awful either , so I opened my window to listen. No AC, so ya gotta open a window for air.
review.negativeRemarks: no coffeemaker or microwave in room
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Classic old SF Hotel with a helping of unique char
review.reviewText: Very nice, always love to spend time in SF. Don't miss the cable car to the Buena Vista for Irish coffee.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location, great access to cables and Union Square

review.title: Chancellor hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, quiet if you request room facing the back. Rooms are small, but good for price. Clean. Great staff.
review.locationRemarks: In Union square

review.title: Enjoyable Stay
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel, clean, comfortable, good location and helpful staff. Free cookies, Wi-fi and rubber ducks.

Only issues rooms were the room was kind of small and old. And the view from our room was a fire escape and brick wall.

But overall enjoyed our stay and would stay again
review.negativeRemarks: View and room size.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, close to food, shops and transport.

review.title: Great location for downtown
review.reviewText: Overall experience was just ok. It's a good location if you need to be downtown. Price is fair but the facilities are just old.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, price,staff were pleasant, close to shopping and fishermen a wharf is a short taxi ride away
review.negativeRemarks: It really needs to be updated. It is an old structure. You have to step up into the bathroom. Kind of quaint. I would stay there again.

review.title: Great location!!! Couldn't ask for better!
review.reviewText: Location is superb! On union square. Cable car stop to fishermans wharf outside! Also the muni is a couple of minutes walk away. This will take you anywhere in the city. Only $2! (go in via frontdoor). Hotel was great. We requested a view of union square and that's what we got! As advertised, no air con in hotel. They do have a ceiling fan, this was fine for out stay as temp never got beyond late 68f. However, in Hight of summer could be hot in room. Hire a car and go to napa valley. Cannot be missed!

review.title: Nice Hotel!
review.reviewText: Great location with friendly staff...hotel was older but nice and clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Centrally located and easy to obtain public transportation from this area. Very close to restaurants and shopping.
review.locationRemarks: Food, drinks, public transportation and shopping!

review.title: Perfect location, faded hotel.
review.reviewText: Perfect location but the hotel is a little faded. The room was comfortable but small. The bathroom was tiny with the toilet far too close to the door.

review.title: Comfortable, affordable and well located.
review.reviewText:
We recently spent two nights at the Chancellor and thoroughly enjoyed it.
The rooms are not huge, but are well appointed, comfortable and scrupulously clean.
Location is ideal, just a stone's throw from Union Square. We didn't eat at the hotel, but given the location there is no shortage of eating and drinking options right on the doorstep.
All in all a very pleasant stay and we'd certainly consider it again next time we're in San Fran.
review.positiveRemarks: comfort and cleanliness of the rooms
review.negativeRemarks: nothing that comes to mind
review.locationRemarks: in the midst of the Union Sq action...all good

review.title: San Francisco a great stay
review.reviewText: A really lovely hotel in the heart of the city.Being at Union Square and on the Cable Car track was great.The hotel was near anise Irish Pub and spring in San Francisco is crisp but nice.Union Square is lovely and it's not far to museums.We rode the Cable Car to Fishermans Wharf regularly.Having tea/coffee facilities in the foyer with cookies was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Small elevator/lift
review.locationRemarks: Right in the right spot

review.title: Old City Charm
review.reviewText: Still has that charm. Staff happy to see you. The in house magic parlor is a delight and being small and intimate makes one feel part of the city. Great for that get away or relaxing after business. Rory the bar keep, one of the rare old breed that actually listens to you stories from past trips to San francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Quite and intimate. Built in 1915 so you are in the past.
review.negativeRemarks: Really nothing-
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything important in the city.

review.title: An affordable Union Square location
review.reviewText: The room was average-sized but adequate. The desk in the room was a helpful place to get work done. The bathroom was small and fixtures were old. Elevators were small. The location on Union Square was a major plus especially at the price charged.
review.negativeRemarks: Tiny elevators
review.locationRemarks: This is in Union Square and is convenient to much of downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Basic, but good.
review.reviewText: This hotel is nice and close to a lot of shops. Its small, walls are thin in the rooms and guests can be loud. Very basic hotel, no bells or whistles. Trams are right in front of hotel. Good neighborhood, but close to bad neighborhoods. Parking is about a block up and a block over. The parking is about $30 a day.

review.title: Great find
review.reviewText: Great location, close to all transportation, shopping, eateries. Smallish room but all that two adults require. Courteous and helpful staff. We would definitely recommend this boutique hotel. And, for sure try Sears restaurant next door!

review.title: Convenient and Nice
review.reviewText: We had a great time in San Francisco. Found the hotel to be very conveniently located. This hotel has a great staff and the rooms were very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: parking was a block off-site
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Nice for a short getaway
review.reviewText:
My husband and I stayed at The Chancellor for 2 nights on our "baby moon." The hotel is very conveniently located near the heart of Union Square and a 15 minute walk from Fisherman's Wharf.

The room was much smaller than I expected, however, I live in Las Vegas and am used to larger hotel rooms. We didn't spend much time in the room so it was ok.

We would definitely stay here again if we got the same great deal.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room and bathroom

review.title: Give it a go.
review.reviewText: This is my 3rd visit and the only hotel I have ever stayed at in San Fransisco and always recommend it to others. As a solo traveller the room size is always right for me and I just love the old world style and charm expecially the bathrooms. Free wifi and bar fridge which was great. As always the staff in the shop were friendly and helpful and organised tours, shuttles and muni passes. Lots of great restaurants and shopping, coffee and cocktails and of course the cable cars. No greeting or goodbye this time from front desk which I thought was odd as I always recall how polite and friendly everyone is.
review.negativeRemarks: Given room on 5th floor which was a little disppointing my view was the mainteance roof and fire escape, was a little anxious to have my window open
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Great hotel for the price!! Walking distance to the financial district. Room was great. A little warm since there is no AC but I was not bad enough for me to not give it 5 stars. Only compliant was that my bed was a little old but the cheapest surrounding hotel was DOUBLE the price!! Great hotel! I'd book again and will when I return for work travel.
review.negativeRemarks: No AC - it was 79' in San Fran. . this is not the norm.
review.locationRemarks: A short walk to anything you need.

review.title: in the middle of san francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel has perfect location. It is in the middle of everything. It has reasonable price. The complementary stuff regarding wifi in the room ,apples,tea and cookies were great. Time spent there is unforgettable
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: It is close to union square. Close to all modes of transportation. In the middle of resturants and shopping centers

review.title: OUR SAN FRAN EXPERIENCE

THE HOTEL IS WELL SITUATED WITH EASY ACCESS TO ANY THING YOU MAY WANT OR
SEE OR VISIT

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Hotel was comfortable and clean, although due for a renovation. Superb concierge. Great location, good value for the price.

review.title: spring trip
review.reviewText: Great location: but the noise in the room from the busy street was very disturbing. I could not sleep since I am a light sleeper and the noise from the street was going all night as this happens to be in union square. The hotel has to consider improving the sound proofing of the rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: The choice of food for breakfast was very poor indeed
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Can't wait to stay here again...
review.reviewText: This was a charming hotel with a friendly, helpful staff. The bonus was that it is right there on Union Square. Nothing seemed too far away to walk to or take public transportation (i.e. a cable car or Muni bus). We plan on staying here again, next time we are in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Our room was not large, but it was cheerful and perfect for two.
review.locationRemarks: Being part of Union Square, it was a great location.

review.title: Very good experience!
review.reviewText: The location great!, the amenities in the room very good!. Friendly Staff, the paint in the room 1509 was ok but had some bubbles ... And the water pressure got lost some time in the shower.. The linen are great, pillows, the bed very comfortable , even with a small room.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, bed and pillows, got a nice deal with gymn One ...
review.negativeRemarks: Eater pressure
review.locationRemarks: Extraordinary, near everything, near even to a rental car return ... Walking distance to Bart etc..

review.title: We'd stay again
review.reviewText: Great hotel - great additions like the cookes and coffee in the lobby

review.title: Great for business travelers and others
review.reviewText:
I stayed here while visiting San Francisco and environs for business. It proved to be an excellent home away from home, for the most part. The location was great.

The room and public spaces of the hotel were clean and the amenities in the bathroom were decent quality. I also was pleased to have free wifi--I have stayed at comparable hotels that charge for this, which is such a rip off. Free wifi is essential for business travelers and really anyone.

The staff were friendly and helpful, and helped me navigate and find restaurants. However, one bad experience was that one of the doormen hailed a town car after several minutes of no empty cabs. The driver charged me $30 for a ride that should have cost $7. At least the man behind the front desk who I told later was apologetic and agreed that shouldn't have happened.

Other drawbacks: the guests next door were rather noisy and the walls were thin. Also, the mini refrigerator was very loud and I had to unplug it at night, thereby rendering it useless as a refrigerator, so not much point in having it.

I also wish there had been a coffeemaker in the room, although there was coffee in the lobby (which I didn't discover until my 4th day there) and plenty of coffee shops nearby.

The safe was too small for my laptop although at least nothing happened to it.

Overall, though, I had a good experience here and would recommend it. I also got a really good deal through Expedia so I feel like I got a lot of bang for my buck.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, nice room and public spaces, free wifi, and friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise, expensive town car ride to Chinatown, safe too small.
review.locationRemarks: The location in Union Square was very convenient, within walking distance of SFMoMA, many good restaurants, shopping and public transportation.

review.title: Good deal
review.reviewText: Very good value, great location, excellent breakfast.

review.title: perfect location and enjoyed my room and experence
review.reviewText: They did everything I asked for.I got sick one night and couldn't eat my spicy soft tofu and the girl at the front went and microwaved my strange meal with a smile.

review.title: Thank you.
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a fantastic location. The rooms are small but there is so much to do in San Franscisco we were out most of the time. We appreciated the access to tea, coffee, biscuits and fruit in the lobby (available 24hours). Luques the hotel restaurant was very enjoyable for breakfast. The staff very pleasant and helpfull.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the lobby. Being able to make a proper cup of tea with pouring milk!
review.negativeRemarks: Size of the room.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic, we walked every where. it is near cable car turn around and a great choice of restaurants.

review.title: A good place close to the union square.
review.reviewText:
the good position close to union square.
the nice package item including the parking fee.
the old building so not clean a little.
the small size room but I think it cannot help it inside of downtown.
Totally, it is worth staying at this hotel with this price.

review.title: Chancellor Hotel San Fran is a good spot overall!
review.reviewText: There's a nice vibe in the hotel. The staff are very friendly. The guy on the desk inside the door is very helpful with suggestions and booking taxis, restaurants, aiport shuttle etc. The hotel is ideally located. There's a superb breakfast place right next door also - Sears Fine Foods.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of extra facilities.
review.locationRemarks: Ideally located - central and convenient.

review.title: Loved it and San Fracisco!
review.reviewText: Hotel is a boutique Hotel located in a great area. Union Square and shops were outside the door. Quite a walk to Fishermans' Wharf, but it can be done. The rooms were clean and tidy and we both really enjoyed ourselves. The staff were helpful and friendly. I would stay in this hotel again.
review.negativeRemarks: Bar closed too early ;-)
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic. Union Square and great shops and restaurants

review.title: Great quality for its value!
review.reviewText: I highly recommend the Chancellor to anyone who is on a student budget but has high expectations for cleanliness and location. The hotel has very friendly and helpful staff, and I enjoyed all the complimentary treats. I was in town for a conference and this hotel was an excellent choice in terms of comfort and being in the heart of the city.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed! I had the best sleep.

review.title: Great stay at the Chancellor
review.reviewText: Service at front counter was pleasant and efficient - although we were in early from a cruise they managed to find us a good room which was freshly decorated and very comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean comfortable room at a great location at a reasonable price.
review.negativeRemarks: There did not appear to be a doorman to assist with luggage on arrival.
review.locationRemarks: Oposite Saks store a few metres from Union Square and short walk to all amenities in downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Good for Weekend Visit
review.reviewText: Great location on Union Square. Old hotel, but good value. Interior rooms have no views.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of views
review.locationRemarks: Short walk from BART station. Cable car stop right outside (if you can get on).

review.title: Great location for shops and bars.
review.reviewText: Had a pleasant 3 night stay. Staff were accommodating with late check in. We found the rooms a little small but as it was a brilliant location this is probably to be expected. The rooms were clean and had everything you would need. Taxi to fishermans wharf is approx $11, $15 back I assume this is due to the one way system. It can be walked (we did once) but it is very tiring due to hills. Lots of restaurnts, bars and shops near hotel.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
This hotel is located in Union Square, and is about a 25 minute ride from SFO (Taxi runs around $45). The rooms are SMALL, but if you don't plan on spending much time in your room it is a great price for the location. The rooms are clean, and have a small refrigerator in them. There is no air conditioner, but you won't need one. We were on the 11th floor and still could hear noise from the street, but was able to sleep without any trouble. The free cookies, popcorn and coffee were great. The Cable Car stops right outside. The cost to ride is $6. We took the cable car to Fisher Wharf one day. Tour buses will pick you up right outside also. There is a Cheese Cake Factory on the top floor of Macy's. There are also other restaurants within walking distance. A Walgreens is on the corner.

My only real compliant is that the remote did not work to turn the tv on and off. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Note: dress in layers!

review.title: Pleasant and in a good location
review.reviewText: Best Feature: Location and friendliness and helpfulness of all the staff. Rooms are not large. Apples and cookies in the lobby a cute idea and in keeping with the welcome. Not highbrow.
review.negativeRemarks: small room
review.locationRemarks: eaasy access to all of Union Square and the Powell St Cable Car

Easy to go up and down

Cons

review.title: Fabulous location and comfortable room
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel is a wonderful period hotel with all the modern amenities. From the art deco lobby and well dressed staff to the small but comfortable and clean room, it is also located in a perfect spot close to Union Square. I'd go back to this hotel and would recommend it to friends!
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for getting around San Francisco.

review.title: Union Square Hotel Stay
review.reviewText:
Quaint older hotel with small but adequate rooms. Clean and well maintained
Very polite and helpful staff. Great location if you want to be on Union Square.
If you enjoy the sounds of the the city to include the cable cars than get a room
on the front.
Great casual cafe and bar
Well priced for this location.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms on front can be noisy.

review.title: Comfortable stay in SF near Union Square
review.reviewText:
Comfortable room, stayed on the 11th floor. Despite being winter, it got quite warm in the room overnight. Needed the fan! Street noise very loud with windows open, reasonable with windows closed however.
Good location right next to Union Square an on the Powell-Hyde cable car line.
Utilised the complementary coffee, tea & cookies every day!
Tour desk staff were helpful.
Very easy check-in & check-out.
review.negativeRemarks: Street noise with window open

review.title: Excellent Hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel in a superb location. Next to Union Square and on the Cable Car route. This hotel has a lot of character, the staff are efficient and helpful, and relative to comparable hotels in the city it is very good value. Rooms are small but well furnished, supply of free coffee and cookies in reception is a very nice touch.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms were on the small side, as expected in a historic city centre hotel, but well furnished
review.locationRemarks: Central SF

review.title: Great location around Union Square
review.reviewText: This hotel has Very good location and it is a nice place.

review.title: Very nice stay!
review.reviewText: The staff were very friendly. The room was exactly as pictured on the website. The location is amazing, only blocks from all buses, street cars, cable cars, metro and BART to get anywhere in the city. The food in the restaurant was average, but decent; after breakfast menu is not very vegetarian friendly. All day free coffee, tea, cookies and fruit was very nice. Hotel a good feel and charm. Overall a very great stay. Would definitely without a doubt stay again and have already recommended!!

review.title: great location in Union Square
review.reviewText: This is an old, "historical" hotel which is located right across from Saks Fifth Avenue in Union Square. The location and price are definitely right. However, the room was very cold and there was no access to controls for heat. The bathroom and rooms are also very tiny. So, if you plan to be out of your room for most of the time, it is a great value.
review.negativeRemarks: freezing cold room.
review.locationRemarks: Right in Union Square across the street from the Saks Fifth Avenue

review.title: Comfort and convenience in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
This is a treasure, right in the heart of San Francisco.
We will definitely recommend it and will return on our next visit.

review.title: Great location. Easy access from SFO on Bart
review.reviewText:
Stayed at most of the hotels around Union Square, both large and small. This was a pleasant find in the world of 'standard' modern hotels.

Tip:
Easy trip from SFO on Bart. Just exit Powell, and head up the the hill a few blocks.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Overall very good considering the price and The location.
review.negativeRemarks: Room and bed size
review.locationRemarks: Very central, direct access to cable cars

review.title: Room very cold
review.reviewText: All aspects of the hotel were great. Cleanliness, condition of hotel, location, great staff, amenities, comfortable bed, however, the room was extremely cold. (only a worry in the winter). I had turned the heater dial on when I arrived back from dinner, and continued to be cold. The setting choices where 1 thru 5 (not a thermostat). I put it at 3. An hour later, I was still freezing. I called guest services, and was told that they do not turn on the main unit until 10:00pm. I was still freezing at 10:30pm, and called them back, and they informed me that I can use the space heater in the closet to help get rid of the chill. Never even new it was there!!! I plugged it in, and used 3 blankets to fall asleep. Basically, this hotel would have been amazing in all categories, if it was so cold outside.
review.negativeRemarks: How cold the room was
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location to everything in the city

review.title: Weekend at Chancellor
review.reviewText: Great hotel for the price and location in Union Square. Walking distance to public transportation (cable cars and bart) and shopping. The room was very small but clean. Early check in is available at no additional cost. One thing I did not like was that parking was a block away. But overall it was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to shopping and public transportion

review.title: Love this place
review.reviewText: My wife and myself always stay here when we go to S.F. ,Great hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Desk staff,
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
Staff were really friendly and helpful, and the breakfast options varied - everything I tried tasted great. The location is also good - cable car stops outside, close to other transport links and close to a variety of restaurants and shops.

If I return to San Francisco, I'll definately stay here again.

review.title: Fantastic stay, would stay again
review.reviewText: Could not ask for a better location! Rooms are small but very clean and comfortable. Hotel was very quiet as well, didn't even hear neighbors or city noise. The only downfall was a shower with no water pressure.
review.negativeRemarks: No water pressure
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location, right on Powell street.

review.title: San Francisco's Best Deal
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is clean and comfortable and the staff is friendly and helpful. The beds are comfortable and the rooms include a small refrigerator. The rooms are small, but that is relatively standard for San Francisco hotels, and they are well arranged for maximum convenience. It is located half a block north of Union Square so is convenient to everything, including BART, bus and trolley lines, restaurants, shopping, and museums. For the price, it is easily the best deal in town.
review.negativeRemarks: Tiny bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Perfect--convenient to everything

review.title: unbeatable location!

review.title: It's all about location!!!
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay in the middle of Union Square. This hotel is all about location! Theaters, shopping, restaurants, drugstores, fast food, cable cars, within walking distance. Complimentary fruit, cookies, coffee, are a nice touch. On site restaurant, other restaurants nearby. Staff and concierge are helpful and courteous. Rooms seem to be rather small. I was traveling solo, so perhaps larger rooms are available. I would definitely recommend this hotel to business travelers and couples.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to many attractions, courteous,knowledgeable staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was somewhat small.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, theater, cable cars, etc. close by.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at the hotel. The location is terrific. Central to everything that can be done. The rooms were perfect and suited our needs. Which were to get good nights sleep and freshen up. The value for money is fantastic and the service is extremely friendly. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and we highly recommend the Chancellor Hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Room a little small
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location

review.title: Central to everything
review.reviewText: Nice and central to Union Square and cable car stop. Hotel is nice, clean and quaint, showing its age though. Some staff were helpful. Good value and good comfortable stay.
review.negativeRemarks: A little aged

review.title: Very comfortable and accomadating hotel
review.reviewText: Me and my boyfriend had a great stay at the Chancellor over New Years. The rooms are small, but extremely comfortable and have all the accomadations you could need. The staff was very helpful and friendly. There's a tour desk in the lobby where the concierge sold us a 3 day metro pass to get on any of the buses or trolleys in the city which was really helpful. Also he arranged a shuttle for us to get to the San Jose airport for our departure. The hotel is in a really good location near the a BART station, restaurants, and shopping. There's a Walgreens on the corner which was really handy to pick up snacks or meds or anything else we needed. Our room was very clean and the beds were really comfortable. I'd definitely stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near Union Square

review.title: We'd eagerly stay there again
review.reviewText: Location was great -- the Chanellor is convenient to everything. But a drawback to being in the heart of any city is city noise, such as sirens in the middle of the night. Still, we would stay there again. No microwave, no coffeemaker, but a friendly staff and an overall pleasing experience. Oh ... and free sugar cookies in the lobby. Also, being next door to Sears Fine Food is a big plus; you can grab a massive breakfast to start your day.
review.negativeRemarks: No coffeemaker
review.locationRemarks: Located in a vibrant, safe area of the city

review.title: Terrific and affordable Union Square hotel
review.reviewText: Fanstastic location, welcoming and attentive staff, free coffee, tea and homemade cookies and moderate prices make this small hotel a consistent winner. Bathrooms and closets could use updating but are kept scrupulously clean--beds and room furnishings are more up-to-date. This was our 5th week-long stay and we look forward to many more. Would have liked to rate them a 4.5 overall but the Expedia scale does not permit it!
review.negativeRemarks: Old (but very clean) bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Ideal--right at Union Square and cable car

review.title: Perfect location, needs a serious renovation
review.reviewText:
The hotel is perfectly located, within walking distance of almost everything. If you need to go to the Fisherman's Wharf, just get into one of the cable cars passing in front of you.
Also, the staff is very nice and helpful.
However, the hotel really needs a refurbishment. The furniture and everything else is very old.
review.negativeRemarks: Need a refurbishment
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Great hotel, great location!
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel and staff. I would recommend staying here as in a central area. The only thing I didn't like was the noise from the ACs outside the hotel, but probably just being picky!

review.title: Good value/service/location, but a bit small/dated
review.reviewText: Our room faced Powell St but was relatively quiet since it was on L13. The only complaint we had was that when we first arrived we noticed a musty smell as well as well as the smell of cleaning agents. Our friend who got a room in the back of the hotel found it too stuffy and hot but ours was fine. Our bathroom was a bit cramped with insufficient towel racks/hooks but the bathtub shower was a good size. The free cookies, fruits and water in the lobby were very welcome.
review.negativeRemarks: Musty/cleaning agent smell
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient - Historic tram stop just outside and a quick 5-10min walk to/from Powell St station.

review.title: Sleep at the heart of the San Francisco!
review.reviewText:
walking distance is so close to shopping, dining and bars-clubs.
Preffer upper level rooms to avoid noise from the street.
Free wi-fi is awasome, i used it a lot.
Building is old and the rooms are small but for this value its excellent choice.
review.positiveRemarks: Free cookies at lobby! Legendary yummy!
review.negativeRemarks: Small&old Bathroom

review.title: Perfect area.
review.reviewText: Rooms were small but very nice. Hotel was in a perfect area of town. Able to walk to the warf and downtown. Staff at the hotel were very nice and helpful.

review.title: A historic place with character in San Fransisco
review.reviewText: A splendid place to stay in San Fransisco. Lots of amenities (including complimenatry coffee/tea with cookies and sweets). Very friendly staff allowing us to check in around 8am long before the official time. The location is fabulous with walking access to sightseeing (cable cars, Union Square, Chinatown) restaurants and shopping (from Macy's to Barneys in Union square).

review.title: Location Location Location
review.reviewText: The best location in San Fransisco! This hotel is a hidden gem.

review.title: family stay....
review.reviewText: cute, great location, staff very friendly....our room faced powell and it was very noisey but it's an old hotel and on a busy street in San Francisco! You cant have it all....I plan on going back for sure!
review.positiveRemarks: it was old and charming, quaint, cute
review.negativeRemarks: the street noise but at the same time we were in a great location.
review.locationRemarks: doesnt get any better in the heart of Union Square....location location location!!!

review.title: A touch of historic San Francisco
review.reviewText: As return customers, my adult daughter and I found this comfortable, well-maintained "old lady" to be exactly what we wanted for our visit. We enjoyed our street view, even with its noises, for we wanted to feel the energy of the city. Also, being able to see Union Square from our window was special. A big plus was that we could open the window a crack for a little fresh air; it only opens a little bit, so is not a safety hazard. A hotel upgrade from our last visit was that internet access is provided free of charge. And the staff has a wonderful way of making guests feel welcome.
review.negativeRemarks: Step up to the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Chancellor
review.reviewText: Great location, great food at the restaurant, great service by the staff, little details that make the difference like cookies at night. The room was very small and somehow uncomfortable.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great hotel for its central location. It was very convenient for us and although the room was small, it was more than enough for us. The bed was comfortable. Noise carries between the rooms, so earplugs might be wise.
review.positiveRemarks: Good choice of tea in the lobby. Yummy cookies too!
review.negativeRemarks: The bath was old, but clean. The water was not hot enough for a good soak, and so it turned out to be a bit of a waste to bother with a bath.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal. On Union Square. We got a quiet room at the back of the hotel - no view, but ideal for sleeping.

review.title: The centerpiece of a Special Holiday
review.reviewText:
As we knew before going there, that this was a " boutique " hotel, we knew it would be
an older facility, which had been upgraded. This was WHY we selected the Chancellor, as well as for its ideal location. We were delighted with the experience we had there. In every aspect of service and facilities, it EXCEEDED our expectations. The room, while small, was very well-kept, with an " old-world " charm we loved. We had notified the reception that our stay with them was to celebrate our " 30th " wedding anniversary. In response, they had provided us with a bottle of champagne and deluxe chocates. A very thoughtful touch, we thought. We appreciated how all the staff treated us in the friendliest and most efficient manner. We so enjoyed the dining room--" Luques " that we ate all three of our brakfasts there. Discount coupons we provided in our room, on arrival, which we used both towards a meal, towards drinks in the lobby bar. The tour desk manager-" Mike" offered excellent advice on how best to travel around the city for the three days we had there.( without a car, which proved not to be a problem) All -in-all, it was fantastic experience and we will DEFINITELY use the Chancellor Hotel when we return to the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Old World Decor and a Charming Staff
review.negativeRemarks: We couldn't stay Longer
review.locationRemarks: Ideal - close to everything we wanted to see

review.title: Stay here!
review.reviewText:
Very convenient being right across the street from Union Square. Very clean and comfortable, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Easy access by foot, cable car, taxi, or bus to everything San Fran has to offer!

I would definitely stay there again.

GS - Sydney, Australia
review.negativeRemarks: nil
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Small hotel in grand location.
review.reviewText: Well located vintage hotel. Friendly staff. Rooms are small, which is a reflection of the age of the property, but still an excellent value. We landed from Shanghai at 8 am suffering from acute jet lag and were able to access our room in the morning, without having to ask. It was a great surprise and much appreciated.
review.locationRemarks: At the heart of the shopping district. Right next door to to DSW (Designer Shoe Wharehouse), Macy's and Saks Fifth Avenue.

review.title: the travellers gktt
review.reviewText:
location was just perfect. in union square.
The staff were very helpful, we had a a room with twin beds, the room was clean, beds were very comfortable, pillows (whoa) if only i knew where they bought them - just comfy.
we had a good time and would stay here again
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: central, perfect

review.title: Very basic hotel
review.reviewText: Disappointed with the hotel overall. The bed was too hard and uncomfortable, the room was stuffy (no air, only fan), the bath tub ceramic was cracked. I was expecting better quality from reviews I read.
review.negativeRemarks: The lack of comfort in the room
review.locationRemarks: In Union square, great for new visitors.

review.title: Ideal city centre hotel with character
review.reviewText: Perfect location for shopping, sightseeing and restaurants
review.negativeRemarks: slow lifts
review.locationRemarks: Ideal downtown location

review.title: Great central location at reasonable price
review.reviewText: Excellent access to transit and cable car, and to nearby inexpensive cafes and diners. And Union Square is very pretty at Christmas time. Commute to Financial District only $10 each way and fast. Used the refrigerator for dinner leftovers and the hotel staff kindly warmed them up for my morning breakfast. Good free coffee and apples too.
review.positiveRemarks: Price, location re transit, and basics, all excellent
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, walking to BART and Muni, but taxi to other SF districts is cheap.

review.title: Nice little hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, has a parking garage just a block away, close to Union Square. The rooms were a bit small for my taste, but overall not that bad. Used the hotel just to sleep anyways, spent all my time outside checking out attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, close to the business area.

review.title: Great to stay
review.reviewText:
It's right in the union square so that was very good, and the pharmacy was right behind it so that was good too, but a bit noisy in the nite, even when the windows are closed.
Bath tub was nice too.
If I have a chance to stay again I would.
The staffs are very helpful as well too.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator are bit sketchy.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: Clean room, comfy bed, healpful staff. Small hotel but suited us fine. Also in a great location for shopping!

review.title: Great hotel in the heart of downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Excellent location, about 20 footsteps from Union Sq. Great service, nothing was a problem. Can't wait to stay there again.

review.title: Great hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText:
This is a great hotel in the heart of Union Square. It's smaller than some of the large hotels, making it more quaint and the amenities and servie better. Other comments included complaints about a small bathroom - this is true, but it is true of most hotels in SF. However, the room is rather large for the city. I have stayed in more upscale hotels with smaller rooms. The Chancellor is an older hotel, so yes it only has two elevators, but we never had a problem using these.

Overall we enjoyed our experience at this hotel. If you enjoy a room with a view then be prepared for the street noise, as is expected with any big city. If you don't want the noise, ask for the other side and it is very quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: across the street from Union Square on Powell Street. Easy access to both cable car routes.

review.title: Location,location,location
review.reviewText: Central to everything anyone would want out of San Francisco. I've been back to this hotel almost 5x in the last 2 years due to its location, friendly staff and clean rooms, though the bathroom is on the "compact" size! Will definitely be back and would highly recommend!
review.positiveRemarks: Centrally located, Union Square vicinity, Bart and Tram accessibility
review.negativeRemarks: Compact size bathroom

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: Excellent Location--- Across the street from cable car stop. Helpful and friendly staff. Close to shopping, restaurants, bars etc.. would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: slow elevators
review.locationRemarks: excellent location. close to shopping, transportation, restaurants. Everything.

review.title: Cosy and comfortable!
review.reviewText: Great little hotel! Right in the heart of Union Square.. If you are looking for a cosy and homey feeling hotel, this is for you! Very clean, warm and friendly. Also fresh cookies at the hotel lobby everyday!

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is fantastic, close to everything you need, the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was small by American standards but had everything we needed, the WiFi worked well. The constant supply of cookies was irrisistable to my husband!!

review.title: Brilliant value, great location
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a hotel that offers large rooms and plush surroundings then maybe this hotel is not for you. However, if you are looking for a clean, comfortable hotel in a great location with great staff then do not hesitate to book this hotel. The hotels web site is a true representation of what the hotel offers. The bathrooms are small, but they are clean and our room had a deep bath that was great to soak in after a days sightseeing. The room was clean, well appointed and had great sheets and pillows. There is no AC but ceiling fan was adequate for the room. The coffee and fresh cookies provided are a great way to start the day. Good location for catching the sightseeing hop on hop off bus. Macys just across the square and the Cheesecake factory...could you ask for more?

review.title: Good location and quiet
review.reviewText: Stayed during Thanksgiving Weekend, 2012. Good location. Recommend choosing a room in the back so you are not on Powell street. It was very quiet in the back.

review.title: good value.
review.reviewText: we found the staff very good , the service excellent and the location very central.

review.title: A pleasant surprise.
review.reviewText: From the moment we walked up to the check in desk to the moment we checked out, we enjoyed our time at this hotel. The customer service was great and was probably the best we encountered on our entire holiday to the States. Every staff member that we interacted with were friendly and accommodating. The location was perfect. Walgreens was 2-3 shops next door. The Cable Car stop, Union Square and Macy's were a 2min walk down. Westfield shopping mall, the Cable Car turnaround and Powell St Bart Station were a 10min walk down. The room is small but its clean and comfortable. The hotel is old but the rooms give off a art deco feel. We had a great view from our room overlooking Union Square. We did hear the saxophone busker in the evenings which was nice to listen to at first but did get a little annoying over the next few nights. The street noise in general did not bother us but the ambulance sirens did as they sounded like wailing or a child crying. We didn't have any of the cookies at the bar or make use of the travel info desk downstairs or indulge ourselves with the pillow menu but all sounded like a lovely touch to the hotel experience. Overall if we do ever come back to San Francisco, Chancellor Hotel on Union Square will be our first choice and a big thank you to the staff who made our first time experience to the States pleasant and enjoyable!
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the customer service.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel looking a bit dated (but this is minor).
review.locationRemarks: Perfect. Close to restaurants, diners, shops, Macy's, Union Square, Cable Car stop, Bart Station Powell St and Westfield Shopping Mall.

review.title: Size does matter!
review.reviewText:
Wonderful little place with a ton of charm. It was within walking distance of many venues in SanFran including the Moscone Center. The staff at the front desk could not have been more accomodating. The only things I would change about the place would be; (1) to install sleep number mattresses in lieu of pillow tops.. my bed was dredfully soft. (2) the shower head height is perfect for shorter people, at 6'-2"., I had to practically get on my knees!.. therefore, I would install "hand held's" shower attachments to suit taller guests.
The room was quiet and comfortable. Great little place, nice breakfast, cozy little bar and always coffee and cookies at ther ready!
review.negativeRemarks: shower heads too low
review.locationRemarks: convient to most downtown areas

review.title: OK for a couple or single.
review.reviewText: The room was very small. The view was poor. The staff was excellent. The food served in the restaurant was good.
review.negativeRemarks: small room
review.locationRemarks: good

review.title: Great for visiting the SF city.
review.reviewText: This hotel is in an older building and has a lot of character. Its right on Powell Street, in the heart of Union Square in downtown SF, so you walk out of the hotel onto a bustling street. Did not find the street noise as bad and if you want no noise then you probably should not stay at a downtown hotel. Quick walk to the Moscone Center. Powell street Bart a block away from hotel and cable car stops right outside the hotel. So transportation is easy. The rooms were on the smaller side, but the ceilings were very high. The Walk in closet was roomy and adequate for storing multiple bags, suitcases. Hotel even provided a umbrella! The bath salts were a nice touch. Some other reviews have complained about the step up to the bathroom, it wasn't an issue in any way. It was clearly marked on the floor and the only possible danger could be stubbing a toe if you forgot the 1 inch height difference between the room floor and bathroom floor. If you are looking for the generic large hotel chain comforts, this hotel probably wont appeal to you. But if you want to try variety, this is a great place. Great location, hotel staff was very accommodating and helpful. The hotel is well kept, beds and linens were very comfortable and the restaurant downstairs serves a good breakfast and lunch. Plenty of dining options a few feet away and all around the hotel. If you want to visit the city, then this is a good place to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The old world charm and 24 hour coffee service in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: The back rooms look upon other biuldings.
review.locationRemarks: Awesome location. This is the only reason I will go back to this hotel.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, great location, very attentive staff. Would definitely stay again.

review.title: Great price for the location
review.reviewText: A very pleasant hotel in a great location. Rooms are small european style. Great price for the location.

photos.caption: Small bathroom with little counter space
Flat screen TV we rarely watched.
They have a 12 pillow menu (extra cost)

review.title: Recommended hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText:
The Chancellor Hotel is a small hotel 4 blocks uphill from the Bart station with a city bus stop 1/2 block away. The hotel has a restaurant and bar. The lobby has cookies, apples, coffee and tea. No coffee makers in the rooms. They was a minifridge in the room.

The rooms at the Chancellor are small but functional. The bathroom was especially small with limited counter space. There was a step down coming out of the bathroom that I fell from one morning. The bed was very comfortable. I loved the linens, and I rarely say that. There is no a/c but that wasn't an issue when we visited. We had to move the chairs to get to the windows but opening the windows was enough fresh air for us and kept us comfortable. I never heard noise from other rooms and the elevators worked quite quickly. Never really had to wait long for them.

Based on the other reviews, I already expected noise. We were on the10th floor on the back side, so away from the street. The view was NOTHING to look at. There was still enough city noise that I walked to the nearby Walgreens and bought some ear plugs which corrected the problem. I'd bring them along if you're a light sleeper or bothered by noise.

There was a large walk-in closet with a safe that we used free of charge.

The staff at this hotel were very friendly and helpful. Check in and check out was quick. They were extremely helpful in providing directions for the Bart and restaurants.
Room Tip: Higher up and back from the street would be quieter.
review.negativeRemarks: Small bathroom with little counter space
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of great stuff!

review.title: Chancellor Hotel
review.reviewText:
Excellent choice, street view, closeness to trolley, bus, stores, restaurants.
Accommodating and helpful staff.

review.title: Economical and well-located
review.reviewText: Not a fancy hotel with all the extras, but perfectly adequate and serviceable for a business traveller. Great location, just a half block from Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: Always free apples, free home-made cookies, free coffee in lobby, and sometimes free popcorn.
review.negativeRemarks: Very old building, not renovated but adequately maintained. Everything worked well.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent downtown location - A half block from Union Square

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great boutique hotel located right in Union Square. It is an old hotel so the room sizes are smaller and a little shop worn. The maid service was a bit below par as they left garbage in the wastebaskets and used cups on tables, etc. Other than that it is a very convenient place to stay in downtown SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Maid service could be better.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of great restaurants and diners close by.

review.title: No Chillin here!
review.reviewText:
I was totally shocked to find out that the rooms had no A/C, Yes, no air conditioning! We arrived on a day that was 88 degrees and stayed like that for 2 days, we got a 6 day package and knew that there was nothing that we could do about it so BUYER BEWARE. The room was small and not as nice as stated, the hotel is in need of updating even though they say it was updated! Our bathroom was peeling and tub needed repairs. It was noisy being on the street front which I do not recommend, We sweated it out for the time we were there!
On a bright note the staff was very accommodating and friendly, the location is great with the Cable car stop 200 ft away and a short several blocks to Pier 30, Fisherman's Wharf and Embarcadero. I would have 2nd thoughts about staying here again unless it was Winter.
review.negativeRemarks: NO AIR CONDITIONING
review.locationRemarks: Great Location, lots of Restaurants and Bars 3 blocks away on O'Farrell a Chinese Rest named Dojima Ann..Wow, Cheap and Great food, we went 3 times

review.title: Take a chance on the Chancellor :-)
review.reviewText: Location cannot be beat! Within steps of the hotel is shopping, dining, coffee shops, a drug store, and access to transportation. Union square is steps away and we had a great view of same from our 8th floor room. This is a very busy location so you need to be prepared for what that entails. This was our first visit to San Francisco and this is a great hotel to stay at given its location. Staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms and common areas are well kept (the bathroom not so much). We would definitely stay here again, especially given the reasonable price compared to other hotels in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom was not as nice as the rest of the room and we didn't have air conditioning
review.locationRemarks: Steps to everything!

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: A wonderful stay with plenty of assistance from the staff. We all had a wonderful stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The old charm that was kept throughout the renovation.
review.negativeRemarks: Walls were a little on the thin side (but understandable due to the age of the building)
review.locationRemarks: GREAT LOCATION

review.title: ok if you are a very small person
review.reviewText: very old hotel its ok but needs updating bathrooms are very very small and water presure was really bad. good value for someon on a budget.
review.negativeRemarks: small bathroom

review.title: Would come again in a heart beat!
review.reviewText: Lovely, cozy, character hotel. Great, friendly service.

review.title: Union Square Gem
review.reviewText: Love the character and the friendliness of staff. The small restaurant is lovely and the food is excellent. We've been before, and we'll come again!
review.locationRemarks: Great location adjacent the cable car line, union square and great shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Union Square option
review.reviewText:
I needed to stay in Union Square, but I was on a limited budget, so this fit the bill. The room was very clean, but small. I felt like I was in Europe due to the tight space.
As it's just outside Union Square park, it was very convenient walking around the area.
review.negativeRemarks: I didn't like having to step up into the bathroom, but they did make this obvious with markings on the floor.

review.title: Perfect for a stay in centre of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Brilliant location on Powell Street in the heart of downtown San Francisco and the cable cars stopped outside front door. Restaurant, bar and housekeeping staff were delightful.

review.title: A little Gem in the city
review.reviewText: Brilliant location very friendly helpful staff. Nice bar to relax in after a long day touring the city. The only downside was that you couldn't make a coffee or tea in your own room but it was available in the reception/bar area 24/7 with free cookies and apples which really made up for it. The rooms weren't huge but great value for money for a city hotel. We had an annoying fan in the bathroom that was motion sensitive and there was no way of turning it off and during the night it was quite loud! Saying that I would still definitely reccomend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy extract fan in toilet that we couldn't turn off
review.locationRemarks: Union Square close to cable car, trolley buses. Walking distance to bay area if you are fit! 5 minutes by trolley bus or 10-15 minutes by cable car

review.title: Stay here and no where else
review.reviewText: As usual a great stay- would not stay anywhere else. My nornmal complaint is that there is no coffee in the room( although there is in the lobby but not going to down there and get some in my pjs. Also no AC- but everything else is perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: No ooffee in the room
review.locationRemarks: Perfect- easy to get around and bus system in right there.

review.title: Very acceptable
review.reviewText: My wife and I found the hotel to be very acceptable and we would have no hesitation about going back, although we did take other reviewers' comment seriously and we would have to consider the time of year in relation to the usual temperatures, as with no air-conditioning it could definitely be very warm. A great spot and we had a most enjoyable stay.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Small room - good for 1 person
review.reviewText: OK, the staff friendly and helpful. The service in restaurant was poor at best.
review.negativeRemarks: step up into the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: close to Union Sqaure

review.title: Expensive
review.reviewText: Expensive for what it is - compact city hotel with small rooms. However beds very comfortable, and well located.
review.negativeRemarks: Waiting for elevator
review.locationRemarks: Very central

review.title: Bargain for the price!
review.reviewText: Extremely comfortable bed, great view. Overall, very worth the money!

review.title: Central location
review.reviewText: Location close to everywhere. Nice hotel but small rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms
review.locationRemarks: Central, however I wouldn't recommend staying near union square lots of homeless

review.title: Convenient position in city location
review.reviewText: The hotel is traditional and substantial. The plumbing was well insulated, there was a large walk-in closet for cases and clothes. Being hyper-critical, eg, the electrical cables were tacked to the top of the skirting board whereas in a more modern hotel, they would be more hidden. The hotel had character. The staff were very polite and helpful. It had a travel desk for advice. It is superbly sited for the hop on/hop off buses, and the cable car runs past the door. Macy's, etc are visible from the front bedrooms. Good restaurants are within easy walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: Uninspiring view from rear bedrooms
review.locationRemarks: City centre without being in noisy environment

review.title: Nice little secret in Union Square..
review.reviewText: This is the second time I stay at The Chancellor and I will definitely stay there again. The first time, I went there with my daughter on a mom/daughter trip. This time I was there with my husband. The Chancellor is not a fancy hotel, but it is centrally located, it has the best staff and very clean rooms. The rooms are small but practical. Anyways, who wants to stay in a hotel room when you are in San Francisco? My husband and I checked in (without any problems), settled in and set out to explore the city. Cable cars, all the shopping you want, China Town, Little Italy and the Theatre District are all within walking distance. There are plenty of restaurants, pubs, bars, fast-food places to meet your budget. I loved the freshly baked cookies ( available around the clock ), cool water and fresh popcorn during happy hour. All free of charge.
review.negativeRemarks: The view from my room. We faced the rooftop of the building next to us"
review.locationRemarks: Great location...

review.title: Best San Fran hotel!
review.reviewText: We stayed at this lovely downtown hotel for the last 2 nights of our honeymoon. We loved it. It's historic but kept very nice. The staff was amazingly helpful and even parking and unloading was easy. And you can not beat the location!

review.title: Chancellor hotel, Union Square, San Francisco.
review.reviewText:
Great location at a good price, friendly and efficient staff. In house breakfast good value and tasty.
Complimentary coffee and cookies a nice touch.
Highly recommended.
review.locationRemarks: Very central to Union Square

review.title: A jewel in the union square area
review.reviewText: The Chancellor hotel not only provided quality and comfort in an ideal location at a great price, but also adds some nice touches over the top to make the stay enjoyable - such as complimentary Lord and Mayfair Bath salts, deep soaking bathtubs (if baths are your thing), complimentary coffee and cookies at all hours of the day, and water with cucumbers available in the lobby also. The complimentary toiletries were of a nice quality as well, and they even go so far as to provide an umbrella for your use (staged on the wall inside your huge walkin closet). In the room, there were two luggage racks, and although the room was not large by any means, you could store all your luggage and access it easily inside the closet to conserve room space. There were two sitting chairs in addition to the chair under the desk, wireless internet was complimentary, and there was even a glass jar full of a variety of hard candies in the room. The room was clean and the linens smelled fresh. Unlike most other hotels I've stayed in, I didn't see a hair anywhere and felt like the room was actually clean. Nice job, Chancellor Hotel staff!
review.positiveRemarks: amenities (coffee, water, free internet, cookies, candies, umbrella, bathsalts)
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: great location 1/2 block north of union square next to Sears fine foods. Along cable car line with easy access to the Powell BART station

review.title: reasonable place to stay in SF
review.reviewText:
Small room, staff busy and not particularly friendly.
Location great, but room noisy as a result.

review.title: Great Location,nice staff,nice restaurant,bad beds
review.reviewText: I liked the location of the hotel. just few steps to union square and the station of the old cable car and starbucks.nice staff. let check in early. very helpful concierage. the down side is that the bathroom is small, you could barely sit on the toilette. the beds are not comfirtable. very small room you could just walk, not good if you have lot of luggage like we had. In recap, recommended for those on limited budget.
review.negativeRemarks: beds, small rooms
review.locationRemarks: few steps to union square, sturbucks and the old cable car station

review.title: great value in Union Square
review.reviewText: A great hotel in a wonderful part of San Francisco. Clean, simple, pleasant - you really can't ask for more.

review.title: Business traveler - 2nd stay here
review.reviewText:
Good deal for the buck. Not super fancy - but do you need it when you are not in the room most of the day.
But if you are there to decompress after a long day, it's perfect. Extremely plentiful and comfy bedding, candies, apples, cookies, coffee and iced water are plentiful.
Super nice staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Not modern but doesn't need to be.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to the scene.

review.title: Great hotel for Union Square visit
review.reviewText: While the room was a little cramped, the location was perfect for Union Square and the attractions were easily reached by Public Transport. There's free tea and coffee at all times in the lobby and free cookies too! Staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. It was clean and modern - we really enjoyed our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Bit compact in our twin room
review.locationRemarks: Great location, a short walk from the cable car and lots of restaurants, shops and bars nearby.

review.title: Good value in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in an excellent position. Staff were always friendly and helpful. The rooms, although older, were nicely refurbished.

review.title: No Spanish TV channels
review.reviewText: Customer service was not the greatest. The young man at the counter was not approachable. I had a change of plans and needed to cancel my last stay and he gave me the round a round. Breakfast was really good. Room was fine. They don't provide qtips ladies!
review.positiveRemarks: I enjoyed breakfast! The room's look was nice.
review.negativeRemarks: It was the final soccer game for the Olympics and I couldn't see it on regular TV because they didn't provide enough channels.
review.locationRemarks: Location is like any other, packed and congested. But we didn't care because we weren't there most of the time.

review.title: Nice, but noisy
review.reviewText: Nice place, great location, decent sized room for the price. Major drawback was being on the 2nd floor facing Powell St. meant loud noise starting at 6:30-7AM. If I could guarantee a room on a higher floor not facing the street I would give this place another try.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: A great hotel for exploring San Francisco. Complimentary cookies.

review.title: Great value for price
review.reviewText: Great hotel in fantastic location. Nothing fancy, but superb value for the price.

review.title: Don't believe the pictures
review.reviewText: Very small room facing backs of buildings, energy facilities of other buildings and faced West. Because of afternoon sun, the ceiling fan was not enough. Maids and maintenance people were very pleasant. There was no concierge and only a part time bellman. The help at the desk were not fully informed and cash was not available before 8 am. The bed was fantastic. Even with Expedia discount, it was not worth the price I paid.

review.title: Girl friend week-end.
review.reviewText: This was a charming, well located hotel. We wanted to stay near Union Square and this hotel was a perfect location. The hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful. The room was on the small side but clean and quiet at night. Would stay again at this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything was very good.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near Union Square. Took Bart and it was a short walk to the hotel from the Powell Street Bart station.

review.title: Try sleeping in a Bowling Alley
review.reviewText: The room was noisey. Road noise from the street. Was like there was a bowling alley next door.I think it was construction work going on , but why all night?
review.negativeRemarks: Not a peaceful place to sleep
review.locationRemarks: Location near Union square

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: The rooms are small, but they give you all you need and the beds are comfortable. We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant twice and the food was very good and reasonably priced. The free coffee in the lobby every morning is nice.
review.negativeRemarks: room is small, but it's all we needed
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Top Marks for the Chancellor!
review.reviewText:
Excellent room, clean and comfortable with plenty of light fittings, and open view from windows. Quiet, on 11th floor.
We asked for a fridge and this was brought up straight away.
Very helpful desk staff, and 'bell boy', Kent.
Also can recommend the people who ran the desk for booking excursions and the shuttle for the airport on our return journey.
It was particularly delightful that they marked my birthday, by giving me a bottle of wine and a Happy Birthday balloon and flowers in my room.
Top marks!
review.locationRemarks: Central location, just off Union Square, near public transport.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Perfect location for shopping and easy access to public transportation
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great - right on Union Square

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: All staff very friendly and willing to help. Will stay here again.

review.title: Perfectly located hotel
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is unbeatable, with it right on Powell st. at union square. You are able to walk out of the hotel and on to cable car! This is the best thing about this hotel. What you must understand though is with it being an old hotel in an urban city, the rooms are quite small. This is of course to be expected, but still surprising once you're in it. A queen bed barely fits.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff is friendly and very helpful
review.negativeRemarks: room size, bathroom small as well, not modern
review.locationRemarks: UNBEATABLE!!!!! O Powell st. at Union square! Cable car right outside hotel, take it down to Fisherman's Wharf!

review.title: Very Convenient
review.reviewText: Staff is helpful, and knowledgeable about nearby restaurants. Location is very convenient and faces Union Square, with cable car operating on Powell Street.This hotel has a European feel to it, and is older but well-maintained. Parking is offsite in a commercial garage about a half-block away, with helpful attendants and in-out privileges with the optional parking package that we selected when reserving our room.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff is helpful and location is within walking distance of many good restaurants and upscale retail stores.

review.title: Chancellor Hotel great older hotel.
review.reviewText:
This is our 2nd time staying at the hotel and we love the location and the little "extras". They offer cookies, coffee and assortment of tea's through out the day for their guests. Around "happy hour" time the popcorn machine comes out and you can help yourself to a bag..or 2!

The hotel is in a perfect location around the Union Square area. China Town is only a 5 block walk and the Theater district roughly 8 blocks. The bus stop to Japan town and California academy of sciences museum is 3 blocks away. The Cable car stop is right in front the hotel, trolleys roughly 3 blocks away and the buses all around.

It is a older hotel and its starting to show its age. Our bathtub was starting to flake some of the coating on the bottom and the corners around the room are banged up. However, I would stay again with no regrets.

review.title: Highly recommend - loved the location!
review.reviewText: If you want to take advantage of the great shopping San Francisco offers, the Chancellor Hotel provides the perfect location. The room was clean and comfortable, the staff friendly and helpful, and the location was the best (right across the road from Union Square with an abundance of public transport options nearby). From the hotel all of the main tourist attractions we're easily accessible. I would highly recommend.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Amazing staff
review.reviewText: We have never enjoyed hotel staff as much as we did here! They were courteous, helpful and overall made our trip more enjoyable:)

review.title: Contented with the Chancellor
review.reviewText: Small but comfortable rooms, nice bed, great pillows! Very clean. Cleaned thoroughly every day. Staff friendly and helpful. Free coffe, tea, cookies and apples in the foyer. A real treat.
review.locationRemarks: Very central, so the hotel is not completely quiet at night, though fabulous double-glazing keeps most of the noise out.

review.title: 4 nights in the Chancellor.
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is unbeatable. The staff are very friendly. The bedroom meets all reasonable needs and expectations. The bar is friendly and a great place to meet and chat to other guests. Complimentary coffe and cookies are available all day. The staff are very friendly and knowledageable. It was an ideal base for a father and son visit to San Fransisco. For the price it represents excellent value and it would be our first choice were we to visit the city again.
review.negativeRemarks: The bedroom was a little bit dated but not a problem to us.
review.locationRemarks: Superb, adjacent to Union Square and on the Powell / Mason cable car line.

review.title: Great location at a great price
review.reviewText: Hotel is in an excellent location - right in the Union Square area in the heart of downtown San Francisco. The rooms are nicely decorated and are decent size (if you're just a couple, it's ok). However I did find the bathroom to be on the small side with virtually no counter space and the tub was just awkward (very high so difficult to step into and the shower head was very low). The hotel offers free pastries, coffee and tea in the bar area every day.The staff at the front desk was most unhelpful and their "concierge" desk was in the habit of providing inaccurate information. However, given the price and location of the hotel, I would recommend it.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff and the bathrooms.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of downtown San Francisco - in the Union Square area.

review.title: Very Convenient
review.reviewText: Locatin is excellent and very convenient being right in Union square and on the Powell cable car line. The hotel is in an old building so the rooms and bathrooms are smaller than you might expect in a US hotel. You are in the middle of town so do expect some noise and the rooms are not air conditioned so you'll likely want the window open. The above are not criticisms but facts to help you choose your accomodation. I would stay there again.

review.title: Good place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: This is an old hotel in a great location for sightseeing in San Francisco, being very close to Union Square and Market St and adjacent to a cable car stop. There are lots of restaurants and cafes within easy walking distance. The rooms are small but comfortable. There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms, but tea and coffee is available 24/7 in the lobby. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Nice hotel but no air con, so uncomfortable
review.reviewText: Sadly we hit San Francisco in warm weather, and the hotel has no air con! This made the room very hot at night despite a ceiling fan, so I slept badly, hence the poor rating. Everything else was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Room too hot
review.locationRemarks: great area

review.title: Nice place to stay in downtown
review.reviewText: Me and my friend stayed there for 3 nights. We had a great time in San Francisico. This hotel got the best location. It is closed to everything u want. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was in an old style but comfortable bed and pillows. Even in an old building but they keep it nice and nite we sure will come back again!
review.negativeRemarks: Two single beds not queen beds
review.locationRemarks: Near union square, shopping centre

review.title: Perfect choice in SFO
review.reviewText: An excellent hotel in a wonderful central location. I would highly recommend it to everyone I know travelling to SFO. Across the road to Union square you are right in the middle of everything, shopping, dining, touring! Complimentary coffee and cookies all day long in the lobby and free wifi all included! Excellent!
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Central- union square

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel in a great location beside union square and all amenaties near by.The rooms have everything you need ( safe iron and ironing board tv hairdryer even a umberalla lol ).Staff are friendly and helpfull .We would highly recommend this hotel to everyone its great value for money ..............
review.positiveRemarks: It would be the staff ( Mike on trip desk ) and location ........
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe free beer instead of coffee lol
review.locationRemarks: Great cable cars out side union square and buses 1min away in the heart of san francisco shopping area ..................

review.title: Handy location.
review.reviewText:
Close to Union Square and plenty of places nearby to eat.Comfortable room ,well furnished.
Great to have tea,coffee and cookies available daily.Nice in house bar with traditional "Happy Hour". No noise issues for sleeping.A pleasant experience.
review.negativeRemarks: The staunch African American woman bar tender in the house bar, not customer focused.
review.locationRemarks: Handy to every thing.

review.title: Great location, bit pricey and very tiny
review.reviewText: The location is probably the best thing about this hotel. it's in the heart of downtown and only a few blocks from the train. Check-in was easy, we got the 11 floor in the corner. We didn't have anyone stay next to us, except for one night and we could hear him talk through the wall on the phone. It only lasted 15 mins. The room is SUPER TINY!!! Didn't bother me, I just thought it was expensive for what you got. There was no breakfast, most of everything was kind of old looking (but charming). You pay for the location. I don't think I would stay there for my next visit, but there really wasn't anything wrong with the hotel except for price.
