review.negativeRemarks: Price
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for shopping and only a few blocks from the train

review.title: Comfort at a reasonable price
review.reviewText:
Good sized rooms, quiet and clean. Easy walking distance to China town and Union Square with Levi and Apple stores on your doorstep.Staff friendly and very helpful.
Will probably stay here next time.

review.title: San Francisco break
review.reviewText: The hotel was comfortable and well-furnished. It was very well located, just off Union Square with cable cars running past the door. The room was small and cramped and so was the bathroom. No coffee/tea making facilities or refrigerator in the room which we had had in the previous 11 hotels we had stayed in during our trip. The staff were excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: Helpfulness of the staff and the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room

review.title: Chancellor - basically good.
review.reviewText: Overall, great location, good staff, comfortable. Only two adverse comments, the bar is inadequate and not conducive to hotel patrons to stop by for a snifter. The complimentary coffee and tea service in the lobby was disappointing. Always, the coffee and hot water dispensed from the flasks was of a temperature that was well below that which was correct for the job. When I mentioned it to the lobby man saying that the water was not hot, his response was that it was. Isn't it so that the customer is always right? You need to find a better way of keeping the beverages hot!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, free and convenient internet access
review.negativeRemarks: Complimentary beverages - see notes above.
review.locationRemarks: On a cable car route, close to Union Square, very handy for most places

review.title: Great location and friendly.
review.reviewText: The hotel offers coffee, tea and biscuits (cookies) for no cost at all and 24 hours a day. Very nice touch! The staff are also very helpful.

review.title: Super bosh
review.reviewText:
Really good hotel and great location. Good breakfast and nice touch with 10% off tokens for food and bar etc.
Funny barman in Luques and generally really good value. Comfy bed as well.

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: Great location.. close to many things to do! The hotel room was small, but just fine for two. We really enjoyed it here and would so go back in a heartbeat.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of room
review.locationRemarks: GREAT!

review.title: Nice staff, great location
review.reviewText:
Great location next to Union Square, nice staff, clean room. That said it's old and it shows in the bathroom, with no fan and aging decor. My room was perfectly clean and I'll be happy to stay there again, but I did notice this was indeed an old building.

Lots of places to eat nearby. Note that the cable car runs right outside and will produce some noise.

The free WiFi Internet was unreliable and the flat-screen TV didn't have HD and limited number of channels.
review.negativeRemarks: The clean but old bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: Within spitting distance of Union Square, tons of restaurants nearby

review.title: Ok, but not great.
review.reviewText: Good position and price, but the room was tiny. I felt cramped, and I was a solo traveler.Staff were polite, but not particularly friendly or welcoming. I think there are better places in the area.

review.title: Chancellor hotel 2012
review.reviewText: Only thing missing coffee / tea maker in room but available in foyer and fruit and cookies
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: central to most things Union square , cable cars all transport shopping .

review.title: Alaways a Great Stay
review.reviewText: Hotel experience has always been great for me. I don't think of staying anywhere else when i come to S.F.
review.negativeRemarks: Can not think of any least favorite things about this hotel, thats why I always stay here.
review.locationRemarks: This is just a great location, so much to do in the area. .

review.title: Nice central location.
review.reviewText: Stayed 3 nights at the Chancellor 5 April. The hotel is only a 5 min walk from the BART Powell St junction. So no Taxis needed. The walk to the hotel is not too steep, we only had small cases so no problem going up this somewhat gentle slope (For san fran) to the hotel. Check in was quick and cheerful. Room was nice, very clean and an adequate size, lets be honest were not intent on staying in. Free coffee whenever you want from lobby. Next to Union Square so ideal for Powell st trams or open top bus which you can get on the square, we took a 2 day hop on hop off tour bus. Highly recommend. Would stay here again.

review.title: pleasant
review.reviewText: better than expected. Nice extras like hard candy in the room,cookies and fruit in the lobby

review.title: Charming
review.reviewText: For an overnight stay, we found our room quiet, clean, and comfortable, exactly what we wanted. The staff were all friendly and helpful. If you need modern fixtures, you won't be happy but for the price and location, we loved it!

review.title: Our stay
review.reviewText: Great location, lovely staff. It is easily excessible from the BART system. Lots of fabulous places to eat near by, although the hotel does offer good food with competitive prices. The staff are very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor needs updating, especially in bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: Fab location right on union square and easily walked from BART

review.title: NICE HOTEL IN A GREAT LOCATION
review.reviewText:
We always stay at the Chancellor when in S.F. A few steps from the best shopping in Union Square, with Cable Cars right outside the door to take you anywhere.

OK, the lobby could use a little spiffing up. The small "gift shop" displays junk, and brings down the hotel's appeal. The management should get rid of it or fix it up. If I want junk I can find it on the street. Also a large (very old) plant next to the desk looks junky.

Rooms are small, but comfortable, with little extras, such as selecting the type of pillow you would like. Nice little bar and restaurant in the hotel, plus Sears Restaurant, next door, is a must stop for breakfast. Usually a line in the morning.
review.negativeRemarks: Things in the lobby make it look junky.
review.locationRemarks: The best

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff. Nice room. Excellent location. Great value!

review.title: Very Nice Hotel in a Great Location
review.reviewText: We were very happy with the Chancellor Hotel. Our room was clean and had a comfortable bed with three chairs for sitting. There was a flat screen TV and the washroom was quite functional. In the lobby there were delicious cookies, ice cold water and coffee. The hotel in within half a block of Union Square and now DSW is right next to the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Boutique Hotel in a Great Location
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators and washrooms are a little small
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is half a block from Union Square and two of the historic cable cars go right by the hotel.

review.title: Great place on a budget!
review.reviewText: First time in San Francisco and thoroughly enjoyed it! Was looking for a place to stay that was within our budget but also a nice hotel. Have NO complaints what so ever. Great place to stay!
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Perfect if you are spending a lot of time in the city. Easy to catch public transit if going out of city.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: I was in room 1507 in the back of the building. Incredibly quiet compared to the front of building on busy Powell St. The bedding was very comfortable also.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of Union Square.

review.title: Union Square location
review.reviewText: Small room but comfortable king sized bed. The hotel is in a great location and is financially reasonable.
review.positiveRemarks: Cookies and apples in reception area and a large comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room

review.title: Fantastic location
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable and a fantastic location. Don't expect anything over the top but if you like cleanliness, competent youstaff and a great location then stay here.
review.negativeRemarks: street frontage, no parking area
review.locationRemarks: Right next to union square, cable cars, buses, trains and teams

review.title: Best bang for your buck
review.reviewText:
Excellent location, right outside is Union Square and a couple blocks from all the shops.
All the staff were very helpful. We had a room with a queen and it was slightly small so would be suited for couples rather than families. The bed was very comfortable and clean. There was no kettle to make a tea/coffee in your room but is available downstairs.
review.positiveRemarks: Bellboy Matt was very friendly. Remember to tip him extra!
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Right next to Union Square, easy walking to shops, bus stop, parks...etc

review.title: Hotel at Union Square
review.reviewText: Overall, I liked the location of the hotel since it is right by Union Square. The rooms are small but the beds are comfortable. The paint, etc., in the rooms could use a bit of updating.

review.title: Chancellor
review.reviewText: Ww loved the hotel and the location is perfect and very central. We did experience a theft in the room the first day we were there of a very expensive camera , and despite repeated phone calls and e-mails to the hotel and management, we have not even received an acknowledgment of the theft . I realize the hotels may not assume any responsibility for theft from their own staff but they should at least acknowledge they have a problem and take steps to deal with it. I would recommend the hotel but give advice to lock up everything in the room and if is too large to lock in the safe then lock it at the front desk. Do not leave anything out in the room .
review.negativeRemarks: staff
review.locationRemarks: right across from union square

review.title: Good choice.
review.reviewText: Always a good experience to stay here. Good value and location.
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms but pleasant.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location relative to Union Square.

review.title: Chancellor
review.reviewText: This is an older hotel, and you can tell. I don't consider this a minus however. The Chancellor has great character. It's in a great location, right by union square park.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location and near lots of diners and cafes. Very convenient and not too noisy. I am not sure what it would be like in summer without air conditioning
review.negativeRemarks: Lack or air conditioning

review.title: Chancellor Hotel
review.reviewText: Comfortable room, not great view from the side but were only in it to sleep so not a big deal. Check in & out speedy. Really helpful staff would do anything for you to make your stay more enjoyable. Good breakfast in the hotel restaurant. Yummy home baked complimentary cookies with tea and coffee 24 hours a day! Only negative was early closing hours of hotel bar. Nice to see they are so environmentally friendly where possible.
review.negativeRemarks: View
review.locationRemarks: Union Square great retail area

review.title: Definitely coming back
review.reviewText: Nice old hotel...but well kept and charming. Doesn't have all the frills of newer hotels...which in some ways is very nice. Relaxing, GREAT staff, affordable restaurant and bar with good eats and service. Will definitely stay here on my next trip back to San Francisco.

review.title: Good & comfortable hotel.
review.reviewText:
The hotel was very well situated, close to Union Square, on Powell to see the cable cars & close to public transport. It is a bit worn but the furnishings, chairs, bed etc were very nice & comfortable. The staff were also very helpful & efficient.
It could be noisy as I was in an adjoining room and the first night there were very noisy neighbors but that can happen anywhere, the second night was no problem.

review.title: A man looking for valued accommodation
review.reviewText:
1. The staffs are very accommodating. There was a five hours gap between my check-out and be picked up by the shuttle. I need to make use of the time to do some paper work. The front desk staffs allowed me to use on of the tables in the hotel restaurent to do my paper work before it opern for business.
2. There is a step-up of 2-3 inches to the bathroom in my room. Although there is a label 'step up' on the upper step but is still easy to have your foot got caught on that step when it is dark at night. It would be nice to make it a slant instead of a srep.
3. It would be nice to have an under the counter small refrigerator in the room. Even Motel 6 has one.
review.negativeRemarks: None really
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: San Francisco very liberal city
review.reviewText: Hotel and staff excellent. Location excellent right on Union Square, next to cable car stop; best place to stay in SF lots to do and see. Loved SF and the people, everyone friendly and very well mannered. We were there for 7 nights and did something different everyday. Very sad to leave.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for bars and restaurants, transport and shops.

review.title: Classy and friendly
review.reviewText: I've stayed here a few times before. I really like hearing the guests mingle with the staff as if they are old friends. Having said that, staff need to make sure they pay the same attention to everyone so we are not jealous!
review.positiveRemarks: ice cold water with cucumber upon arrival
review.negativeRemarks: slow elevator, usually full of housekeeping staff
review.locationRemarks: of course it is great. I preferred having a room near the top floor.

review.title: A Great Location and Hotel
review.reviewText: A great older boutique hotel in the heart of Union Square in San Francisco. The rooms are small but very adequate. There is coffee, apples and cookies available 24/7. Staff is very accommodating and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, boutique feel of hotel and location.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are small.
review.locationRemarks: Being in the heart of San Francisco at a reasonable price.

review.title: Chancellor Hotel - Good Location and Great Value
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is in a good location just off Union Square. The room we stayed in (201) faced Powell Street and the noise from the street and the cable cars could be heard but didn't overly bother us. The room was compact room but comfortable. Overall I rate this hotel to be good value. Breakfast was great with good service. This is my second stay at the Chancellor and I will be back next year.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room size, noise from the street and cable cars

review.title: Good choice for the price
review.reviewText: The Chancellor was really nice to stay at for the price we paid, a little small but the staff were really friendly and very helpful and the complimentary coffee and biscuits were a nice treat. Our room was on the second floor facing the street, which meant it was a little noisy but not an issue. Great sized cupboard as well, the bathroom wasn't too bad, so overall we had a nice stay. The Chancellor had a nice feel to it and it was really close to Union square and not too far from everything else.
review.negativeRemarks: room somewhat small
review.locationRemarks: close to Union Square shops, cable car tracks (which made it slightly noisy)

review.title: Met my expectations
review.reviewText: Great location, clean good service coffee tea and cockies downstairs - I would prefer an electric kettle in the room. Free internet however no swimming pool.
review.negativeRemarks: no coffee machine in the room and no swimming pool
review.locationRemarks: Close to market , convention centre close to BARt for the airport

review.title: Not good experience
review.reviewText: Very old setting (furniture...etc). The only plus is its location.

review.title: Pleasant stay in a great location
review.reviewText: Older style, pleasant hotel in a great location. Staff were very helpful, efficiently organised taxivan, luggage storage on our last day and later, shipment of some personal items we inadvertently left behind. There was attention to small details such as providing a useful map (unprompted). Room size was OK, comfortable furnishings and a large closet, although bathroom space was quite small. The bed was a little too hard for my preference, but there was an extensive pillow menu.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed was hard
review.locationRemarks: Great location convenient to Union Square shopping and easy to get to other sites of interest via cable car, trolley buses or streetcars.

review.title: Nice hotel in downtown SF
review.reviewText: Great hotel to stay in downtown SF, nice and friendly staff and highly recommended.
review.locationRemarks: DOWNTOWN

review.title: Great small hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, very central, good cafe for breakfast & lunch. Suggest avoiding Room 9 on the upper floors - steam pipes cause an ongoing knocking in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Knocking noise caused by steam pipes in room n09
review.locationRemarks: Central to Union square, shops, theatres, cable car.

review.title: Would stay there again!
review.reviewText: I loved it! - really well located, everything was nearby and the cable car stops at the door of the hotel and everything for a really nice $$...
review.positiveRemarks: tea, coffee, cookies and apples on the lobby, so when I wanted to have a little bite I could always have a cookie
review.locationRemarks: Great! everything is nearby

review.title: Lovely, comfortable, great location!
review.reviewText:
Location is excellent, right next to Union Square. The staff are amazing -- friendly, helpful, accomodating. Try the happy hour in the tiny bar and if Rory the Irish barman in on duty -- talk to him! He's a gem and pours a good drink.

Rooms are small but comfortable and very clean. Nice touches range from the candy jars in the room; quality bath products; coffee and cookies at the front desk...Didn't give it five stars because the rooms are small -- but that's to be expected in such an old hotel.

Cable car stop is just outside the door -- but long waits because it's a tourist area. : ) Got the parking package. We parked our car in the garage around the corner (1 block away) and had in and out privelages throughout our stay.

review.title: Great time
review.reviewText: Great Hotel right on Union Square, close to everything. Older hotel but very well kept up. A little noisy if you keep the windows open but with them closed very quiet. Great Hotel and would go back to it again any time.

review.title: Chancellor Hotel Review
review.reviewText: Great location on Union Square. Friendly staff. Enjoyed the complimentary tea/coffee and cookies. Small room but clean and functional.

review.title: Christmas stay in Union Square
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a great location and the staff were polite and helpful. I would recommend to a friend!
review.negativeRemarks: Self parking was around the corner instead of at an onsite garage.
review.locationRemarks: Four blocks from cable car turntable and next to the tree at Union Square - perfect!

review.title: Safe, convenient, comfortable
review.reviewText:
Location: right on Union square. Wireless: fast enough. Room: had complimentary candy. Bed: big and comfortable.

Would highly recommend for the traveller who wants a safe, convenient and comfortable hotel, but doesn't need bells and whistles like a gym or pool.

review.title: Great spot, would recommend
review.reviewText:
We stayed for three nights in December and cant fault the place. Great location for shopping, central to everything and getting transport, however we did spend more time out of this area in fishermans wharf, bridge area etc.

A refrigerator would have been nice.

Complimentary coffee and cookies were a nice touch, and all staff very helpful.
review.locationRemarks: The wharf area is very touristy but you have to see it, same as alcatraz and the bridges. I liked the old pin ball machine (museum) near pier 41 (where the sub and liberty ship are, another couple of things worth seeing).

review.title: very impressed
review.reviewText: i have stayed at this hotel 6 times , it is the type of place you can call home away from home

review.title: Great Location BUT
review.reviewText:
The location of the hotel could not have been better being on the corner of Union Sq and on the cable car line. Cost of the hotel was reasonable for location. However the hotel itself is tired and you do not expect the sheets or the bed cover to have holes, not even darned ones which these weren't.
Bar facility was non existent: advertised as happy hour 5 till 7.30. Not open at other times and the one time we were in the hotel at 7.15 it was shut. Could do with coffee making facility in room as 90% or more hotels have in this day and age. However coffee was available in the lobby 24/7.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square. Easy access to tour buses, cable car, China Town, Little Italy and all sights.

review.title: Not so good
review.reviewText: Two cots, no heat, must room...

review.title: Awesome location for people who want to be in the city center
review.reviewText: Very nice, old fashioned, yet comfortable hotel. In the very heart of San Fran.

review.title: Simple, Classic San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great, simple, moderately priced, classic, place to stay

review.title: Good Choice
review.reviewText:
For the price, this Hotel is a good choice. It was an older Hotel, but it was clean,
the service was good, the location is excellent.

review.title: Julia from switzerland
review.reviewText: The hotel staf was very friendly and organized us a room at already 10 in the Morning. Our Room had a window but we could only see the next house wall.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: This is a really comfortable hotel in the perfect location for sightseeing and shopping. Cable car is right outside the door and the Powell BART/muni station is at the end of the street. This hotel has real san Francisco character and charm, the rooms are a good size with a great television and nice bathroom. The staff were really friendly and the complementary tea, coffee and cookies in the lobby was a really nice touch. I would definately recommend this hotel!

review.title: A great experience!
review.reviewText: It was a quaint hotel, very clean and nicely decorated, with the character that comes with older buildings. The room was small, but comfortable. I loved the bathtub; it was nice and deep. It was a great location and wonderfully convenient, as we were in town for a convention as the Moscone Center and for some light sight-seeing. The staff was very accommodating (i.e., helping with our luggage and lending us umbrellas). We were there for 5 nights.
review.locationRemarks: Financial district, Chinatown, Marina/Embarcadero

review.title: As advertised
review.reviewText: Very helpful staff, outstanding location--were aware of my requests, and had everything ready! Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Best buy - great location, good service, comfortable beds
review.reviewText:
I stayed in hotel for my MBA trip and three of my friends also stayed in the same hotel, and I can tell you we we were all happy to be in this hotel and we didn't had any major complaints.
The room was spacious enough and clean, with pleasant service, comfortable beds and an awesome location.
I liked (as many did) those free morning cookies, fruits and coffee - a great way to start a day :)
The only complaint I have is that hotel is little bit outdated and needs some refurbishing in the rooms, even though the rooms are really clean.

Thank you for pleasant stay!

review.title: Convenient location and comfortable accommodation
review.reviewText: I found this hotel to be very convenient and comfortable. The room was clean and tidy. Whilst there was no A/C there was a fan to keep the room cool. The room I had was quiet in terms of street noise. The only thing I found unuseful was that they did not provide tea/coffee facilities in the room - I missed my morning coffee to wake me up.

review.title: Perfect area - great for business travel
review.reviewText: All you need for business travel - convenient location - great area to take a morning run or an evening walk, 24 hr coffee at the hotel with specialty coffee shop and convenience store 1/2 block away.

review.title: Ideal Base To See San Francisco
review.reviewText:
We were looking for a clean, quiet and comfortable hotel in Union Square at a reasonable price and the Chancellor more than fit the bill.

I was pleasantly surprised by decor and upkeep of the hotel. The nicely furnished room was on the small side but this was not really a concern for us as we spent most of our time out in the city and only returned to the hotel to sleep.

This is an ideal hotel to spend a few days in San Francisco. Those looking for a lot of space or luxury might wish to consider alternatives

review.title: Very good option.
review.reviewText: Very good option for the price in SF. Excelent location, good condition and service.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, where the major business are and close to everything else.

review.title: Excellent location.
review.reviewText: Easy access to the airport using BART. Close to shops, cable car and public transport. Good staff service.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great price for an excellent location. There was no A/C but we went in October so the temperature was perfect for open windows. The staff was very friendly. Would stay there again.

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: Great clean hotel, Excellent location, friendly personnel

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Room a bit small but overall very nice hotel and good service

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is located on the Cable Car route and is in the shopping district. Hotel rooms are a little small but are clean for the hotels age. Would stay at the location again

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Right off Union Square. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Older hotel, but that is not unusual in SF. Clean, and the service was excellent. Would surely stay there again.

review.title: Excellent location and price
review.reviewText: This hotel has an excellent location, you can see Powell St from the room and you are just a few steps of many stores and the BART station. I really recommend it if you are looking for a good price and great location.
review.locationRemarks: You can't miss Powell St, the Golden Gate, and Alcatraz, if you don't like the prission, you will love the views.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: We stayed two nights and were elated with the comfort and service The Chancellor! A great location and excellent front desk service. We will definately return for another visit.

review.title: excellentn but no air conditionning and noise
review.reviewText: excellent service use the valet parking
review.locationRemarks: visit sonoma valley and the fisherman. s wharf

review.title: Would return
review.reviewText: Loved the staff. Was fine for an urban hotel with convenient location. Noisy work was being done in the area early in the am. Being from a country location, could not get used to sirens at all hours. Not convenient for anyone with a car, so would recommend using public transportation. Overall, we had an enjoyable stay.

review.title: Great location, I would stay there again.
review.reviewText: Great location, clean room and great staff. I would stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Union square. Great location shopping and restaurants.

review.title: No air condition in the room, not suggested for summer visit.
review.reviewText:
This hotel should have about 100 years old...you can see from the room.
It was very small and old, but the cleanliness was very good.
There was no air condition in the room but thanks that we don't need one as the weather was nice and cool.

The location is good as it is just next to the cable car (Powell-Hyde/Masion) but on the other hand it was quite noisy at night. And locate near the Union Square allow you have more time to shop nearby.

This is the only hotel we booked via Expedia that really read our special requirements as they provide a free champing to celebrate our honeymoon!

review.title: "Wrong Star Rating"
review.reviewText:
This Hotel has a 3-Star Rating ,when it should be 1 1/2 star,I dont know exactly how the Hotels are rated, but this is not rated how what it should. We waited 5 hours for our room to be ready, we had reserved our room 2months in advanced. Also very old, which old is fine that's what the city is about , but looks like they have re- painted a few times but the rust of the pipes just keeps on flourishing. The heater had fallen off the wall and the nails are sticking out and between the heater and the wall there is all the dust you can imagine. The old carpet is wonderful for the dust mites , I'm sure it serves as a great hotel for them. The hair dryer wasn't working , and the handyman they had just kept telling me it was fine , the thing would practically burn your hands when at use, I spimply told him "don't worry it's ok, I was almost finished" . I told my husband , "well their problem if the room catches fire"! I disconnected it from the wall.
Overall in my opinion it's no good, there are plenty of 3Star hotels that are true 3Star.

review.title: Great Hotel Excellent Location
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for 5 nights on our honeymoon and could not fault the hotel.

It is in a perfect location right near union square with excellent transport options nearby.

The service at the hotel was beyond their star rating with the fastest check-in I've experienced and friendly and knowledgable concierge/bellboy to assist with your stay!

The rooms are snug as expected from reviews on here but are plenty big enough for 2 guests. The room has a large comfortable bed (with a pillow menu), a small table and 2 chairs nearby the window and a desk and chair. Free wifi internet is a great plus!

The hotel was exactly what we expected with no nasty suprises!

We would stay here again for the proximity and great service.

review.title: Great location but AC would be nice.
review.reviewText:
Loved the proximity to Union Square and the staff of this hotel was wonderful.
The room was spotless and well appointed. The only complaint is that there is no air conditioning in these rooms. We were completely aware of this before we booked and do npt fault the hotel at all but want to make sure that others are aware if they plan on visiting in the warmer months. All in all - we will come back.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Comfortable hotel in busy Union Square. Crisp design. We had no view but the 06 rooms have a large closet that provides some extra room. Also quite location since it was away from the street.

review.title: Good but not great
review.reviewText:
Unknowingly, I had chosen to visit San Francisco at a time when about 23,000 female marathon runners had descended upon the city. This hotel was not my 1st choice but, at least, I was able to obtain a booking in the location I wished to be.
Not having air-conditioning, however, in these days & relying only upon a solitary fan rotating at some dilatory speed was not conducive to a good night's rest during a particularly hot spell in the city.
All staff were friendly and helpful, however, so this lessened the shock to the system emanating from the fan which had possibly originally seen better days cooling the fevered brow of Somerset Maugham on one of his tropical excursions.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel for a quick trip to see San Francisco. Bed was very comfortable and room was great despite being extremely small (normal for an older hotel - we didn't mind, we didn't spend much time in there anyway). No A/C but it had a fan and windows were able to be cracked. Location was great, but we had to find parking in front of hotel to get checked in and then get parked. Very difficult to do and frustrating. The coffee was cold at 6am. There was a tour desk where we could buy our Muni Passports. That was very helpful!

review.title: Reasonable and well positioned city hotel
review.reviewText: Can't fault for price and location. Bathroom needs updating though.

review.title: Don't accept directions to the airport from the front desk, you may miss your flight
review.reviewText:
Front desk offered directions to the airport
Only they were not up to date and we were left to fend for ourselves

review.title: Good location but very noisy
review.reviewText: This hotel is extremely well located, but there is no climate control (airconditioning). This requires that the windows of the rooms have to stay open during the night on hot nights (or if you want fresh air any time). This implies that the street noise comes in the room. I can tell you that San Francisco by nigth is extremely noisy !

review.title: San Francisco Vacation
review.reviewText: We have been staying at the Chancellor Hotel periodically for 30 years and have never been disappointed. The location is superb ( right on a cable car line and next to Union Square), the staff is always polite and very helpful, the rooms and public areas are immaculate, and the price is very reasonable for a downtown city hotel. It does not have air conditioning in the guest rooms..

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Great location, Great service.

review.title: Nice Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Good value for money
Nice location, next to Union Square.

review.title: Old hotel with exceptional staff
review.reviewText:
We stayed here Sept 21-23, 2011. The property is located on Union Square, which is a major shopping and transportation hub. San Francisco is fairly spread out, so no hotel will be convenient to walk to all of the attractions.
The hotel is nearly 100 years old, but has been reasonably well modernized. The room was small (typical for big city hotels) but had a gigantic closet. Note there is no air conditioning, but ceiling fans are provided. This is typical for older hotels in San Francisco. We could hear cable car bells and street musicians from our 7th floor room if the window was open. The window was double-paned, and closed tightly, so we didn't hear anything when it was closed. There was also no noise from adjacent rooms. Hotel staff was extremely accomodating - we felt like home there. Free coffee and cookies in the lobby all day. Free access to a nice fitness center around the corner.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Super older style hotel, ideally placed on Powell Street to pick up cables cars and the F line Street car. Good access to the main areas. Helpful staff, coffee and cookies all the time.

review.title: Great value in heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: The rooms are small but nicely appointed with a comfy firm mattress, choice of pillows, high quality bedding and all the basics you need. This is a boutique hotel, not a luxury chain. The tourist desk was outstanding and very helpful in guiding us on things to do. It is right on a cable line, near the stop for hop on and off buses, and in the heart of the deluxe shopping district. THere are lots of restaurants nearby and several night clubs within walking distance. There is free wifi, complimentary cookies and coffee or tea in lobby all day long and a restaurant in the building serving breakfast and lunch as well as a San Fran classic restaurant serving swedish pancakes next door. The price is incredible for all you get and compared to other hotels in the area. I would go back anytime we go to San Fran.

review.title: Nice, convenient location!!!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, helpful and friendly staff, convenient and close to everything!!!!

review.title: Chancellor Is The Best
review.reviewText: Great location, clean comfortable rooms - the Chancellor cannot be beat!

review.title: Comfort and Convenience
review.reviewText:
My husband and I have come to the Chancellor on many occasions and each time we have been impressed with the kind and thoughtful staff. Everyone seems to have a pride in the hotel and they genuinely enjoy communicating with their guests.
The location is perfect for all attractions. We particularly enjoy the breakfasts at the hotel restaurant for quality and value.
We will always consider the Chancellor first!
Many thanks,

review.title: Best bet in SFO if you want to live in the heart of the city and not spend much.
review.reviewText: excellent location! small room but its in the heart of the city so expected. staff very friendly. I lost my room key, they did not charge anything. rooms clean with all basic amenities. 24 Hr tea/coffee free at lobby level. value for money. recommended if you are not looking for ultra space OR luxury.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText:
We spent two nights (8th and 9th August) at this hotel. Our room was clean and functional, but, as an end corridor room, it suffered from the fact that its entrance door was set at such an awkward angle that the entrance area seemed cramped  so that, for instance, you could not enter the bathroom unless the entrance door was shut. When we stated that we had not been pleased with the room on leaving, we were merely asked whether we had asked for a replacement on arrival, which we had not.

We would much rather that a hotel simply gives us of its best unprompted rather than waiting for the stimulus of complaint before yielding up a fair deal. The rooms on the internet, which had lured us in, looked a lot better. We do not think that we got a fair deal.

The breakfast arrangements in the restaurant were rather workmanlike. Food was brought and the waiting staff seemed to be constantly checking to see when they could clear away. We had some excellent breakfasts in our hotels in the States, but this was not one of them. Everything is separately charged and the quality is barely adequate, so that the quality to price ratio is poor.

The Chancellor is not a bad hotel, but I would not rate it as a good hotel and would not rush to return.

review.title: Hard to Beat!
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel is right on Union Square. The cable car runs outside the front door! There is a place to park in front while you check in, very convenient. Room was very comfy and they had a pillow menu to choose from. Bathroom was vintage but very clean and refreshed. They even had an iron and ironing board in room. I was amazed at the value for the reasonable price. Try it!

review.title: Fabulous boutique-like hotel
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel was lovely from the decor, to the staff. They had cute little perks, such as a rubber ducky for the bath and a candy jar in the room. They had free coffee and tea available in the lobby - which was much better, in my opinion, than having it in the room. There were also scrumptious cookies and apples for guests in the hotel lobby. I would definitely go back to the Chancellor hotel!

review.title: Great if you want to be in heart of downtown action
review.reviewText:
Great location, but as you're downtown watch out for extreme homeless presence, some mentally disturbed, esp at night.
Other than that you have Union Sq and Market street a stone's throw away, not to mention the cable car right outside the door. Recommend the Mexican restaurant about 300 yds North on Powell...

Oh, the hotel itself? Just okay for the money, hence the '3' rating.

review.title: Enjoyed my stay
review.reviewText: Really nice hotel in a great location. The room was small but very comfy. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Convenient to downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel is on Powell Street in San Francisco....it is only a few block s from so many things; China Town, the cable car turn around, Union Square and fantastic shopping, and many restaurants. It's so easy to hop on the cable car and ride to Pier 39, and hop back on after a long day of sight seeing. The cable car stop right on front of the hotel. The hotel it's self was fine...a little old, and the hallways were narrow, but the service was good. Rooms are pretty small..two people max. There is a bar, and a restaurant for breakfast and lunch. Fortunately it's a short walk to almost any kind of food you can think of...4 or 5 Starbucks within a couple of blocks either way. There is no hotel shuttle, but you can get Super Shuttle to and from the airport for about twenty dollars. All in all, it was a good stay. I was by myself, and felt safe in the hotel, and out walking around.

review.title: Good location, average hotel
review.reviewText:
Great location, very average hotel. Hotel is old and basic. Staff looked uninterested. Was still asleep when housekeeping came around and they never returned, so room was not cleaned on one day.

Wifi was great.

Did the job but will look elsewhere for next trip.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great San Fran Location!
review.reviewText: We arrived at the hotel v v tired after travelling for over 24 hours! Much to our relief our car was taken and parked for us. Whilst checking in we were pointed in the direction of the complimentary refreshments and cookies - which were fab and sampled often during our stay. Our room was lovely, and the large size was quite a surprise for such a centrally located hotel. It was our honeymoon and staff had left champagne, chocolates and a gift for us on arrival, a really nice touch and the champagne was lovely, and of a very good quality. The hotel is in an excellent location within walking distance from all sights, amenities and good quality restaurants etc. We would definately stay there again when in the city. But..you must try Scala's Bistro over the road for breakfast - it is fantastic - and was the best breakfast we had in our two week trip of California's west coast!! The pancakes are unbelievable!!

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel. Right next to Sear's restaurant a famous place to eat breakfast and across the street from Sir Frances Drake. Located right on Powell Street with the street cars. The front desk staff were helpful with restaurant and bar advice, very polite and friendly. We arrived very early and they held our bags until check in and they held our bags at check out for our early evening flight. I was a bit worried that there was no air conditioning, but there is no need for it, the city is very cool. Can't wait to return and I would recommend this place hands down for the price and location.

review.title: would stay again
review.reviewText:
This hotel has a great location. You are right in the heart of the city.
The rooms are small but clean. It is an older hotel but well maintained
The trumpet player at Union Square got a bit annoying after a few days but if you close the window it kept the noise out. Can't recommend Sears for breakfast but the hotel breakfast was good

review.title: Convenient Union Sq Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location in the heart of San Fran. Old facility but room was clean and staff helpful. No air con, but that's not a problem on most days in SF.

review.title: Good time in San Fran
review.reviewText: Comfortable hotel in convienent location. Loved the cookies, apples and coffee in the lobby which were all complimentary! The only improvement would be a computer for guests to use in the lobby. Great stay, otherwise!

review.title: Pleased with our choice!
review.reviewText: Never having travelled to San Fran, we had no idea where to stay. I researched the area and hotels over the internet and finally settled on Chancellor's. The location was perfect and at what I thought was a reasonable price considering how much higher some of the other hotels were charging. Keep in mind, it is an older hotel so rooms are a bit smaller than the normal but nicely arranged and maintained. Loved the big walk in closet where not only could you put your clothes but there was room to store luggage and even get dressed in there! Love a deep tub? They have them along with a rubber duck to keep you company. A 'perk' I love in a hotel - magnified make up mirror in the bathroom! Our room faced Union Square which meant we may have 'heard' a lot more then had it faced another side but it didn't bother us. Free..live music by the trumpet player on the corner every night! Rooms are not air conditioned but do have a ceiling fan. My only suggestion to the hotel - rather than having the heavy comforters on the bed during the warmer months, perhaps a light throw would be a better alternative? You could not have slept with it on the bed so it had to be dragged off and put somewhere every night. Hotel location was perfect - right across the street from Union Square and with a trolley pick up on the corner. Coffee, cookies and apples..all free to patrons were an added bonus each day! On site Information Desk that was quite helpful as were the hotel desk clerks.

review.title: Lovely Hotel, Crowded Neighborhood
review.reviewText:
If you like staying in the middle of super touristy high-end shopping/dining district this is a great idea. It was a convenient area for transit lines to get to any part of San Francisco and we were able to walk to lots of sites. But the number of people on the street 24/7 and the high prices of dining/shopping nearby bothered me. Driving to the hotel was extremely difficult and I had to spend almost double what I usually spend on diapers. Wish I had just stayed a few blocks further from this area of Powell.

That being said, the hotel was great. The service was FANTASTIC. Everyone was really nice. Never thought anyone was bothered to help and was quite happy to do so. If you care, there is no AC. This was not a big deal for us.

review.title: good Hotel for tourist looking for great location
review.reviewText: good hotel for tourist, very convenient location

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location and big room for downtown San Francisco. Our room faced the back so not really any view but no traffic noise which is worth it. Also, no problem with no A/C. Between the ceiling fan and having the windows open it was cool enough even in July. Great value for the price we paid as well. Our 1 problem was with the cleanliness of the bathtub. It had stains on it which we were able to remove with a bit of scrubbing, so the maid staff should have been able to as well.

review.title: Great Union Square Hotel
review.reviewText: Recently finished my third visit to the Chancellor and it remains my hotel of choice in SF. Can't beat the quality and location for the price. Rooms are on the small side and tend to have too much furniture for my taste (extra chairs, etc.), but certainly aren't too cramped to be uncomfortable. I'd prefer losing the extra chairs and adding a mini-fridge, but that's a small point. With so much to do in SF, I don't spend much time in the room anyway. Very helpful staff, an easy walk to Chinatown, right next to a cable car stop, plenty of good restaurants in the area.

review.title: Chancellor Hotel
review.reviewText: Very happy with the hotel. Comfortable room, although a bit cramped. Excellent location. Friendly service.

review.title: Good price to quality ratio at the Chancellor
review.reviewText: At Expedia's saver rate, the Chancellor is probably the best value for your money in San Francisco. Next to Union Square, on one of the cable car lines, with a stop right out the door, this is a good place to stay for a couple of days, and picturesque even for a hardened European. Breakfast at the hotel was good as expected (and easier to digest with a coupon from the reception). Almost all that I hoped for, and much, much better than I feared, in an otherwise quite tourist-trappy San Francisco!

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: Loved the room. Very comfortable.

review.title: great value for everything
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel was just perfect! Great location steps from Union Square Park, very friendly atmosphere and a fun, convenient bar in the lobby for a quick drink with fellow travelers and locals. Rooms are compact but fine and renovated and there is great cross circulation of air from room and window in the bathroom. Would def go back!

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is so convienient. Close to Union Sqare with the cable car just outside the front door. A short walk to the bus and tram in Market Street which takes you to the bay area. Surrounded by shops and restaurants. The hotel dining room serves a quality breakfast and lunch. Coffee and biscuits are available for guests in the main foyer around the clock. The rooms are comfortable, not all that spacious, but that is not a big issue when you are out and about all day. Staff are friendly and very responsive to your requests. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great location, small but economical & friendly
review.reviewText: Can't beat the location, close to everything a tourist wants and needs. The room was a bit small and the bed a little firmer than I like, but I figured SF, like NYC, tends to have smaller rooms in the city and really how much room do two people need to sleep anyways :) Staff is very friendly and accomodating and for some reason my partner LOVED the coffee. Cute bar downstairs. Would definitely visit again.

review.title: Fantastic Location!!!
review.reviewText: The location was awesome! I had pretty high expectations after reading the reviews for this hotel and have to say, I was not disappointed! The location couldn't of been better and staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. Take advantage of the pillow menu and free cookies and tea. The room was really tiny but we were so busy sightseeing and were only in our rooms for shower and sleep. This hotel is a great value for the location and service!

review.title: Decent for the price
review.reviewText: This is the first time staying at this hotel. The location is great and the price was right.

review.title: We love this hotel
review.reviewText: We had a great experience at the Chancellor this week. It's a small, older hotel with great character, friendly staff, totally smoke-free, and in an excellent location just 1/2 block off of Union Square. Our room and the bathroom were small but the bed was big and very comfortable and we prefer ambiance over square footage. We especially loved being able to open the windows and get fresh air - often not possible with the newer chain hotels. The price was very reasonable through Expedia, especially for that location in San Francisco. We got the self-park package. The garage is 1/2 block from the hotel with unlimited in and out. We didn't even use our car though, we were able to walk everywhere. We will definitely come back.

review.title: great location and service
review.reviewText: This hotel is a great option for singles traveling and for couples, but has smaller rooms. Maybe not a great option for people with kids. Very clean, well renovated, close to BART and MUNI, Starbucks on the corner, lots of shopping, great restaurants.

review.title: Good location for all facilities
review.reviewText: Good location to all transport and centrally located for shopping. Hotel room was a little small but then you only sleep in it and there was only 2 of us. Otherwise everything was fine. No refrigerator but ice machine was on every floor and you had to go to lobby for complimentary coffee/tea and cookies but to us this wasn't an issue. Value for money was satisfactory. Perhaps the only problem was someone in the adjacent room or nearby set their alarm for the whole floor to wake up so we heard that one morning and another a couple decided to have quite a loud discussion on another morning. Don't know whether that was thin walls or loud neighbors! But we were on vacation so who cares - we could go back to sleep!

review.title: Great Hotel, great Location.
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is a great hotel. It is about 3 blocks up from the BART station at Market and Powell. It is a across from Union Square. It has a cable car stop right outside the door. It is in a great part of town with several restaurants of all types within a few blocks. Front desk is great and will call make reservations at any restaurant or recommend a restaurant. Room was clean and the bed was comfortable if a little soft for me. Bathrooms were clean. Rooms were small but typical San Francisco size unless you want to pay several hundred more a night. Has small restaurant that serves breakfast and lunch. Food isn't bad and the price isn't much more than other restaurants in the city. Also has a small bar downstairs that is open evenings.

review.title: First time to San Francisco, brilliant!!
review.reviewText: Great hotel in superb location. Very comfortable and staff so helpful particualrly Matthew who is their to answer all your questions as well as give you great ideas and advice. Will definitely reccommend

review.title: Good Hotel Great Location
review.reviewText:
A good hotel located in a great spot just off Union Square. Close to the cable cars and other public transport. Staff were very helpful and a young guy on the front saved me from getting a parking ticket (i was just slightly off the reserved parking area). I'd only just arrived so that wouldn't have been a good start to my stay in the city!!
The room was compact but very comfortable and clean. The only thing that let it down was the bathroom, it was slightly "tired"(dodgy plug, walled tiles need re-grouting).

review.title: Great Location, Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: I'm a college student and so on my trip to San Francisco I was on a budget but Expedia made it easy for me to pick a great affordable package with a great hotel. The Chancellor Hotel is right in Union Square. There is a cable car that comes down that block and there was a great trumpet player that if we left our window open could hear from our room. The hotel is located near transportation, restaurants and shopping, what more can you ask for. The hotel itself was also very pretty.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: A clean, majestic old hotel in a great location for shopping, eating and getting around town.

review.title: great spot!
review.reviewText: excellent hotel....only 2 elevators so u had to wait a bit but other than that great spot!

review.title: Amazing Location - Old World Charm
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a wonderful location, just steps from Union Square with the cable car stopping outside the front door. The rooms are clean, a little small but we didn't find it an issue as we were out in the town most of the day. The decor is antique but there is nothing wrong about this. Rooms facing the street would get a bit of noise so ask for a room at the back if this is an issues (although there is no view to speak of from these rooms). The front desk\bell boys weren't the most active i've met but otherwise the hotel was great and we would stay here again.

review.title: Great Location, High Quality for the Price
review.reviewText:
My wife and I stayed two nights at the Chancellor, and after a friend recommended it to us. We were very pleased with the hotel which is central to the heart of San Francisco, and close to major conveyances. While small, our room was clean, quiet, nicely appointed and comfortable. There was some noise from adjoining rooms, but it was not troublesome and we slept very well. The price of the room was quite reasonable given the quality and convenience we enjoyed.

We would definitely return to the Chancellor.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText:
Great location !!!! The service is great! They help a lot..
There is a free computer in the lobby with free printer !
Also there is an umbrela in each room that saved us on one rainy day.
The room is very clea, not too big bu it's location is cover for it.

review.title: Best breakfast in town
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay. The room wasn't massive but everything worked, it was comfortable, clean and modern and the staff were really friendly and helpful. We'd particularly recommend using the restaurant for breakfast as the staff were really nice and food was of a high standard.

review.title: Great location, well maintained.
review.reviewText: Great location. Very handy for public transportation! Clean and well maintained. Would stay again.

review.title: Great neighborhood, excellent service, def recommend!
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in a terrific area of town. Tons of shopping and great restaurants are all within walking distance. Our room was very clean, the beds were exceedingly comfortable and the free wireless was great. (not to mention an enormous walk-in closet!) The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and constantly willing to help out. They also offer an off-site fitness center which is really fantastic. We def recommend this place and would stay here again!

review.title: A great hotel in SanFran's Union Square
review.reviewText:
My fiancee and I just got back from a trip to San Francisco for 5 days. Although we weren't overly impressed with the city itself (there's just more to do in my home-city NYC and his home-city Boston), we both were extremely satisfied with our stay at The Chancellor. It was super convenient to the cable car line and buses which was great since we didn't rent a car. And although it was on busy Powell St, our room on the 11th floor was so quiet and peaceful.

If you like to shop there are TONS of major stores (Nordstom's, Coach, Saks, Macy's, etc) and small, pricey boutique stores within a 5 minute walk of Chancellor.

The ability to pick "gourmet" pillows to suit every sleeper's need is a cute and unique touch.

Just keep in mind that this is an old hotel, so don't expect huge modern rooms. But fortunately for us, I was looking for more of a historic, nostalgic hotel and that's exactly what we got!

One last thing, it certainly shouldn't be a deal breaker but the showerhead was obviously installed with shorter people in mind - my 6'3" fiancee had to practically bend in half to rinse his hair!!!

review.title: Great Location - Cozy - We would go back
review.reviewText: I made the reservation after reviewing many Hotels on the Internet and picked the Chancellor based on previous reviews. Reviews were accurate and we were very pleased and would definitely go back. It was the perfect location and the kind of Botique Hotel we were looking for. After seeing many of the other Hotels I had reviewed online I knew we made the right choice. Great place!

review.title: Pleasantly Surprised
review.reviewText: We were extremely pleased since we usually stay at a 4 star and it had a 3-star rating. The reviews were good so we thought we'd take a chance. The location was excellent and close to everything. Walking distance to Chinatown and all forms of transportation. Union Square is right in the middle of the best of the shopping district and the Square itself is very nice to visit. The rooms and service were outstanding and we especially liked a choice of 10 pillows as "extras." We loved Sears restaurant right next door for breakfast. Famous for their pancakes. The desk arranged our City Bus Tour which was a nice way to start off our stay. We saw some parts of S.F. we'd missed on previous trips. Our guide recommended R & G Lounge for the best food in Chinatown and it was fantastic. We loved eating at McCormick's in Ghiardelli Square with its huge view of the bay. Burger Bar in Macy's was also delicious. Great trip!

review.title: Best time in Frisco
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the Hotel, It is an old hotel, the room was not that big, but is was clean, the furniture was nice, sturdy and properly scaled for the room. The service was good, the employees in the lobby were great and very helpful. The location was perfect, it is where you want to be if your visiting Frisco, in the heart of everything, yet you feel very safe. The elevator was maybe the smallest I had ever been in. The breakfast was unimpressive, but there is a great breakfast place right next store. Overall I'd give it a 4 out of 5 and I would stay there again

review.title: Great San Francisco Value
review.reviewText: This is great value with quality service, the staff could not be more helpful. Rooms are fairly basic but more than adequate, ask for softer pillow or room fridge and it is delivered promptly. Great location in central city for shops and transport. If we return to SF which we loved, it will be first on our list to stay at. Free computer access in Lobby or wireless. Room service even provides great lollies.

review.title: Great, but needs AC.
review.reviewText: Great location, super clean, comfortable and quiet hotel. Staff were great and we loved the free tea and coffee anytime of day. We weren't concerned about the lack of AC because we'd heard the nights were cool in San Francisco, but we found the room too warm to sleep in comfort. Opening the window cooled us off, but even on the 11th floor there was lots of street noise. If you don't mind being warm, this hotel is fabulous.

review.title: Convenient and Clean
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel was very conveniently located. The staff was wonderful and the rooms were exceptionally clean. A little small but very workable. A nice place and a great value on Expedia!

review.title: love to go back anytime
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel , nice neibohood, nice stafs. Love to be there anytime.

review.title: Excellent location for the price
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and taken care of, the location was great and the price we got was perfect. The only issue I can say I had with the hotel is that the remodelations and maintenance of some parts of the hotel are not of very good quality, but they are taken care of.

review.title: great bargain, great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in such a great location. Walking distance to shops, Bart train, cable car and great restaurants. The staff is very friendly and helpful. My only complaint is the wireless internet connection was poor. I often had to take my laptop to the lobby to get reception.

review.title: Exceeded Expectations
review.reviewText: LOVED this hotel. Cannot say enough good things, especially not knowing what to expect from hotels in San Fran. As others have said, the rooms are on the small side, but this would be expected. Stylish decor -- great both modern and classic touches. Also - the hotel staff is amazing!! Excellent customer service but not short on personality - a hilarious "cast of characters". Nice room ammenities, nothing overlooked from an extra umbrella to candy. Loved access to the nearby gym. Great location, great hotel, great staff - and a great value for the area - will definitely, definitely stay here again.

review.title: Friendly and Helpful Service A+
review.reviewText: This hotel is a little older than some but was very spacious and was smack bang in the middle of it all. The staff at the front desk were the best I had on my USA trip by far, very helpful very friendly. Def recommend staying here clean, big and easy to get to things

review.title: Perfect for our quick trip
review.reviewText:
The Chancellor Hotel is in a perfect location-close to the Powell St BART (from which you can explore the whole city and get to and from the airport), shopping and bus lines. The rooms are smaller than your average hotel but were just as pictured-perfectly clean, comfortable and bright. The bed was comfortable and the many different pillow options are a nice touch.

The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful when I asked for directions and advice and we appreciated that they held our luggage for us after we checked out until we had to leave for the airport.

Overall we had a great stay here!

We would love to stay here again!

review.title: Most of the comforts of home
review.reviewText: I liked that the Hotel was well rounded. I enjoyed the breakfast restaurant, and the bar. I did not use the tour desk or concierge. The room was comfortable, but the walls were thin. Only a trickle comes out of the shower so good luck washing your hair. I was initially worried when I saw that my low priced room overlooked the building mechanicals. Slept like a baby, very quiet, until neighboring rooms woke up early.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Really great hotel for the price! Walked to great dining, bars, shopping. Be ready to pay $30 for overnight parking, but that's the norm for the area. Definitely recommend!

review.title: Excellent hotel and priced well!
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in a area. No worries when leaving the hotel or returning to it. The lobby is very well kept and clean. The room was clean and had all the nessecitites. It is an older hotel but that is the charm of it. Being that it is older was nice. We had a room that faced Powell street. We had no problem sleeping. We thought there may be an issue with sound but there was not. There was a flat screen TV in the room which was nice as well. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: will definitely go back
review.reviewText: I enjoyed staying at this hotel. Excellent location for sightseeing. Small but cozy room. Parking was convinient as well.

review.title: Very good service and free parking in a great location!
review.reviewText: From the time we checked in, we were treated as special guests. The room was small, but clean and the decor was updated. The location was perfect, right along the cable car line. Free parking was tremendous, though it was a block away, it is very unusual in this local. Rates were amazing for all that you receive. I would DEFINITELY stay here again.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Great hotel experience--amazing locating right in Union Square. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and had a great European touch. I will definitely stay there again!

review.title: Great SF hotel in the heart of everything.
review.reviewText:
Perfect for the traveler who wants to be in the middle of San Fransisco with quick access to public transit including the trolley. Get the 7 day Muni pass and ride the trains, buses and trolley cars all week. Use the Bart to get here from the airport for only $8. You can't beat it. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. Not luxurious, but all anyone should need. Cookies and apples in the lobby!
The staff is great too. We didn't try room service and don't mind a little street noise, so if you looking for super quiet and the height of luxury, this might not be your stop, but then again, why are you hanging around the room?

review.title: Tons of charm, tons of value
review.reviewText: Can't get a better deal on this location with old world SF charm (yes, that also means spaces are on the small side) in the Union Square vicinity. My room was stylish, super clean, bright and had all the amenities we needed, including free WiFi. Bed was dreamy. On the Powell cable car line, but even better it is two blocks to BART, Muni, and the F line to Castro. Tons of shopping and restaurants at your fingertips. Really, I can't say enough good stuff about this place. I have stayed in some dumps in the city in the name of saving a buck, and I have stayed at the big fancy places, too. If you really want to ditch the car and enjoy the city the way it was meant to be enjoyed, this place is the best deal out there!

review.title: Chancellor SF
review.reviewText:
For the price, the hotel is ok. Cleanliness not the best, but overall ok (bathroom mirrors not clean, etc). Tha staff did not remove empty bottles and some garbage.
The best is location (besides Union Square) and the price was reasonable.

review.title: Close to everything you want or need in San Fran
review.reviewText:
Hotel is old, and is in keeping with the city, that is why you are there to experiance the downtown life, and be within short travelling distance to all the amenadies, the staff was wonderful, they guided us around (gave directions) could speak English very clearly, and enjoyed their jobs.
they keep the homeless moving in front of the hotel so you are not questioned every time you go out the door, and there are three well placed eating establishments with-in 100' of the front door.
you have to enjoy the age of the building the beauty of the inner core, and imagine being there 60 years ago, or longer really well worh the experiance i would go back again.

review.title: Excellent Hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: See above.

review.title: It's just okay
review.reviewText: The hotel is older and this is no surprise as it's supposedly a historic location. The rooms are small, again, this would be expected in the Union Square area, so, not a big deal. The room we stayed in seemed to have been renovated fairly recently, but, could have been cleaner (the bathtub in particular). This hotel is located in the middle of everything, and close to shopping, restaurants, Starbucks and a Walgreens, so the location is perfect. The front desk staff seemed a bit aloof, with the exception of the bell-boy/door man...he was eager. Walking in, the lobby seemed stuffy and had a slight musty oder (could be from the bar or folks smoking right outside the front door)...You're really paying for the location which can't really be beat.

review.title: It was a wonderful stay and I would recommend it to my friends.
review.reviewText: Everything was good at Chancellor. It is well located, in the centre of San Francisco, where things happen. Everything was clean and confortable in my room. I saw prepared professionals there.
review.userLocation: New York, Chicago, London, Berlin, Sao Paulo,

review.title: Centrally located to all important downtown venues
review.reviewText: I was so very pleased with the accomodations, service and locale of the Chancellor that it will be my first hotel choice whenever I am in San Francisco. Top name restaurants, shopping, and the cable car are right outside the hotel's front door. Great choice!

review.title: Chancellor Hotel - Strongly Recommend
review.reviewText: I travel to San Francisco three or four times a year for business. I'm always looking for the best price on a boutique hotel and won't stay at a hotel with less than 3 stars. I've stayed at the Chancellor Hotel several times now. It's reasonably priced, terrific service, clean and its located in the heart of Union Square. The rooms are small but certainly sufficient for one or two people. I always ask for a room off the street because the street cars and crowds on Powell Street can get noisy.

review.title: Excellent choice
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a perfect location. Plus the rooms are a decent size (neither small nor large), the bed is comfortable, and the parking option rate saves you $25-$35/night in extra costs. The personnel are uniformly helpful and cheerful.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is right in the middle of union square with tons of shopping and convenient to cable cars and buses. Old but well maintained. Small rooms but sufficient. Restaurant next door named Sears has great breakfast. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: San Franciscos Best Choice
review.reviewText: Great Hotel. Excellent location, nice people giving support. The room is always very clean. The best cost/benefit in San Francisco.

review.title: great value
review.reviewText: My husband and I were extremely pleased with this hotel. Great location, clean, attractive room - cookies and coffee/tea in the lobby a nice plus which we enjoyed on several occasions

review.title: Great little hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Chancellor for a weekend with a friend and it was exactly what we were looking for. Good service, great location, great price. The rooms and beds were small but we were there to see the city so we didn't really care. The hotel staff was friendly and made great recommendations for places to go for dinner. I will stay there again next time I'm in SF.

review.title: Look forward to another stay at this hotel soon!
review.reviewText: Excellent location right up the street from Union Square and lots of shopping! Hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. The hotel was very convenient and the hotel parking was closeby and easily accessible. Would highly recommend this hotel to everyone. Can't wait to go back.

review.title: good value in SF
review.reviewText: clean, comfortable, great location. Although some finish seems old(some paint were chipped on the wall in our room), they pay attention to what I feel important: cleaniness, comfortable bed and linens, the sound proof windows, nice size room.

review.title: Definantly can't wait to go back,maybe with the whole family...Or just the two of us again!
review.reviewText: My husband and I enjoyed our stay here,we were celebrating our 21`st wedding anniversary.The room was perfect just for the two of us,not too small and was cozy with a big t.v. also.I would like to stay again,the best part was the location.At the busy shopping area near Tiffany's,Starbucks across the street,and Victoria's Secret! If yo love to go shopping it's perfect.No need for the car either just grab the trolly and enjoy the day!Loved it the only negative thing was the toilet in our room leaked a lil from the base.But that was not too big of a deal for us.I left my heart in San Francisco!So we shall return there again.:)

review.title: Nothing Left to Chance @ The Chancellor
review.reviewText: Everything was fine from check in to check out. A great value for a hotel 1/2 a block away from Union Square. Rooms were small but well maintained and comfortable. Amenities were good for what we paid for. Only stayed 1 night. night. Bathrooms were tight but elegant. This is an older/historical building. *Bonus: Their bathtubs are freakin huge!* A great place to do some serious downtown shopping for a couple of days in SF. Get in, get out, hit the streets and feeel safe about having a good "home base" to work from!

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText:
My mattrese had an indentation in it. The bed was very narrow. The step up to the bathroom was unsafe.

Everyone was wonderful to us. We loved the free coffee, tea, cookies and apples in the lobyy.

The location was great and close to all transportation

review.title: Good Hotel on Union Square
review.reviewText:
Good hotel on great location. You can walk pretty much anywhere from the place.
The only one bad thing is absence of air conditioner. Even on new year's eve, during rain, you can feel humidity in the air.

review.title: Wonderful hotel for the money!
review.reviewText:
The Chancellor Hotel is an lovely small hotel located in Union Square area,
convenient to everything. Our room was spotless & comfortable. The staff
was very efficient and accomodated us when we asked for a room in the rear of the hotel so we would not hear traffic on Powell Street. We got a fabulous rate through Expedia--well worth every penny & then some! We stayed at this hotel a few years ago but w/ extensive remodeling, the Chancellor is even better now. The bed had luxurious sheets and was very comfortable so we slept very well. Highest recommendation!

review.title: A gem!
review.reviewText: Location of this hotel is prime. Very decent price for a great location and spotless hotel. Powell street cable car is literally steps outside the main entrance. We had a great room with a view on the 15th floor. We were originally on the 3rd floor upon check in but just asked if there were any rooms available on any higher floors. Very easy! Were were moved to the top floor with no problems. Love, Love, Love this hotel. Will stay here every time we visit S.F.! The staff and management gets an A++ too!

review.title: best place at the best time
review.reviewText: Very nice staff. I couldnt make connection with the lady at the gift store, but the rest of the staff were very caring and friendly.

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: I love the hotel because it was near a cable car station in front of union square, it was clean and it wasn't expensive.

review.title: Nice place, great location
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is a nice place in a great location. The room was small, clean and comfortable. While we didn't spend muchc time there, other than to sleep, we did apprecaite the staff and, again, the location.

review.title: Loved it! Couldn't ask for more.
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel. The location was perfect in Union Square. The beds were very comfortable. Everything was clean. The workers there were very helpful. The bartender was very nice and he did good drinks. The cable car stop was infront of our hotel. There were so many restaurants and shops all around including a 5-level Macys. I can't believe how little I paid for how great this hotel is.

review.title: Great location ; reasonable rates
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the Chancellor many times - and it never disappoints. For the price and location- it cannot be beat! Staff were very helpful and professional. Parking with in and out privilges was only a block away, but I did not need my car much because of the convenient location, right on the cable car line on Powell and 1/2 block up Powell Street from Union Square. I drove to the city from Southern California, and with all the lights and Christmas decorations - it was a great time to be in the City. Rooms are small and compact but clean - and I had no problem with noise ( or anything else) I will be back, mostly because of the location and the most reasonable price and convenience when I have my car with me.

review.title: Solid and well deserved positive review.
review.reviewText: Looked up several reviews of this hotel online. Everyone writes the same thing which I will echo: great location, friendly staff, affordable rates, and quality accommodations.

review.title: Great location, but rooms quite small
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is fantastic, just half a block from Union Square and major shopping possibilities (Macys, Tiffany's, Louis Vuitton, Walgreens, Starbucks). Tour buses to see the city go from Union Sq and in winter there is an outdoor ice skate rink to go with the huge Xmas tree and glittering lights. The room itself was compact but quite clean and pleasant, although for the same price the Villa Florence (same price and on Union Sq too) is a better choice as the rooms are much bigger and the whole feel of the hotel more glamorous. The staff at the Chancellor were helpful, and there are free computers to use by reception, plus free cookies, apples and tea/coffee etc all day.

review.title: Recommend hightly
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location, the rooms are comfortable and quaint, the service is satisfying, the elevators are fast, and the price is right. I have stayed here several times and have had the same excellent experience each time.

review.title: Best location and good transport to airport
review.reviewText:
