The room is a little small but clean. Good value for money, staff are helpful and friendly, the location is excellent, overlooking the lovely Christmas light at Union Square. Good restaurants near by. Coffee and tea is available all day long.
Will definitely come back.

review.title: Pleasant place to stay
review.reviewText: My room was clean and bedbug free. The bed was comfortable. The room was quiet. I enjoyed the free cookies and apples in the lobby daily. The staff was pleasant and helpful.

review.title: Almost great
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location. The rooms are a bit small but they're very clean and comfortable. But if Internet access is important to you I'd stay away. The hotel's wifi was slow and unreliable with frequent disconnections.

review.title: Great hotel - excellent location at Union Square
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay at the Chancellor Hotel. This is a moderately sized boutique hotel located at Union Square with cable cars running right past the front of the hotel. Great ambiance, terrific service, very friendly and helpful hotel staff members. We stayed just one night for a holiday shopping getaway and had a wonderful time visiting San Francisco and enjoying the holiday season and beautiful setting of Union Square. The hotel was excellent! Our room was comfortable, clean and quiet. We had a corner/end room on the 4th floor that was just perfect. Coffee and newspapers are available in the morning in the lobby--quite convenient.

review.title: Gem in downtown San Fran
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel is an old world hotel with charm in the heart of the shopping district of San Francisco and within walking distance to most main tourist attractions. The cable car stops right outside the hotel and the street cars go from the east to west sides of downtown only a few blocks away. The area was clean and the staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Annual Holiday City Visit
review.reviewText: Very friendly hotel with character and a great location. It was the perfect fit for our annual holiday visit to the city. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our room overlooked Powell St. with a view of Union Square and Macy's which added to the holiday feel. Then in the morning Sears is right next door for breakfast so it's hard to imagine a more perfect overnight in the city.

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: Great value, excellent location at a fair price. Clean, perfect blend of luxury and value.

review.title: A great place to stay
review.reviewText: Very helpful staff. The bed was very comfortable and the hotel offers a menu of pillow choices. Convenient location. Cute rooms with nice TVs.

review.title: Great location and staff
review.reviewText:
Great location
Lots of good restaurants nearby,
Great area for shopping too.
The street noise was not an issue.
And the staff knows coustomer service.
We'll be going back.

review.title: Chancellor Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Quality service. Excellent location. Be aware that hotels in San Francisco don't seem to have air conditioning due to the climate. Room was quite comfortable temperature wise. Cable cars right outside of room were noisy, but I thought it added to the charm of the visit. Keeping windows closed at night reduces the noise to acceptable levels.

review.title: Perfect location and small hotel
review.reviewText: I was at the Chancellor Hotel with 7 other team members and everyone had a great experience. Good value, nice small rooms were perfect for single travellers.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Location of the hotel was great and service was extremely speedy. Bell-man was great with helping load/unload baggage from the vehicle and was also very helpful in getting us a cab. Hotel and the restaurant was very good. Front desk service was pleasant. There was one day where towels were not stocked but they quickly dropped off towels after notifying them. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Loud, indifferent, but convenient
review.reviewText:
Cons: this hotel is right next to the cable line and in the heart of Union Square, so you will hear the cable cars all day and night long. We tried to ask for a room on the other side of the building but they were not available. The noise level is unavoidable due to the location, and would have been more excusable if not for the receptionist's welcome, which was indifferent to say the least and took away the charm of the building.

Pros: very convenient location to shopping and good eats. Found a great coffee shop a few blocks away that had Danish pancakes (yelp) and of course convenient to transportation and shopping. Bed was very large and comfortable. However, we stayed at the Hotel California Best Western last time and things were just better: ambiance, service, noise level...and just a few more blocks away.

Would not stay here again :(

review.title: familiar and unpretentious
review.reviewText: it is the people we enjoy at the chancellor, and of course, the location. mike, matt, alicia, mao, yesmi....they all give a human face to the hospitality industry

review.title: Chancellor was centrally located, in a fun SF location
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel was located in a wonderful neighborhood. It was easy to get to from BART. It was a comfy, cozy hotel--had a European feel to it. I could walk to everything, and there was great shopping and restaurants within a few blocks. Walked around in the evening and felt perfectly safe. Rooms were very nice and the hotel staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: A good choice for budget-conscious travelers who don't want to sacrifice comfort or location
review.reviewText: Can't beat the price for what it was. Location was great - if we weren't walking we could catch public transportation to everywhere we wanted to go from right outside the front door. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Coffee and cookies in the lobby were a nice touch. Rooms were comfortable - my only comment is that sometimes the noise from the street below was audible from the room (which didn't really bother me, but it might bother someone who is more sensitive). Next time I'm in SF, I would absolutely stay there again!

review.title: Would Go Back, Great Location
review.reviewText: Clean, convenient location, in the middle of the shopping district, cable car outside, street cars down the road, within walking distance of the Ferry Terminal, restaurants, just a nice place to be.

review.title: I'll go back any time. great value
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located. I found it to be very quiet and the food in the restaurant very good and reasonably priced. This hotel is a great deal.

review.title: Great central location
review.reviewText: Not the cheapest option, but a clean comfortable room in a great central location.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel!!
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was VERY friendly and helpful, that includes everyone from the front desk to the maid and maintenance guy. the room was clean and very well done, we were on the back of the hotel so there wasn;t any street noise even though we slept with the windows open, location was great and close to everything , highly recommend this hotel and would stay again if I ever go back.

review.title: Could not be better
review.reviewText: The was great. Everyone did their best to make our stay enjoyable.

review.title: A very pleasant surprise, I will return when I need a local R&R in SF
review.reviewText:
For as long as I have lived in the Bay Area (over 25 yrs.), I was not at all familiar w/the Hotel Chancellor. It was such a wonderful recommendation! I prefer small cozy environments, and the Chancellor is just that. The World Series games were going on, the lounge was busy and festive; the rooms are small, old, charming and well maintained; service was helpful too.

I did miss having a coffee maker in the room, or alternatively, being able to order coffee from room service. However, I went to the dining room and requested to take the french press pot of coffee to my room and enjoy it while gettting ready in the morning.

review.title: Would recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Excellent!

Would highly recommend this hotel. We picked it for the value it offered for this excellent location.

The location couldn't have been better. But more than that this was a lovely hotel. It had loads of the original fixtures and fittings, and a really welcoming atmosphere.

I think all hotels should be like this - the best location and a really nice hotel without having to pay for the things you don't have time to use when you are visiting a new place, i.e. a swimming pool and a gym.

Loved it, loved it!

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: For my first time in San Francisco it was pleasent to arrive to a nice comfy hotel, great location and courteous staff! It is what you pay for, bedrooms might be small in comparison with other hotels but it was comfortable and clean. The location was perfect, just half a block from Union Square...would definitely go back!

review.title: Great staff, great location, slightly small
review.reviewText:
We were very satisfied with the service we received, since we arrived they were very helpful, friendly and willing to help us with anything we needed. I was very satisfied when we came to the hotel with a bottle of champagne and I went to the bar and asked for a couple of glasses of champagne and without doubting the barwoman gave the last two she had.
We didn't use all the hotel's services but I had the feeling that I could ask them for everything and they would fix it for me.

review.title: Would definitely stay at the Chancellor again
review.reviewText: It is evident that the Chancellor Hotel is an older hotel that has undergone renovations recently, therefore, the architecture retains that old world charm but the room furnishings are new and fresh. The room and bathroom are on the smaller side, but there is a walk-in closet. The price and location just can't be beat. The hotel is right next to Union Square, across from Saks. It is within walking distance of the BART station, the convention center, the shopping, Chinatown, and even Fisherman's Wharf. There are good restaurants within steps of the hotel. I would definitely stay here again the next time I'm in San Francisco.

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: Large closet, plenty of clothes hangers and an iron & board all very welcome. A good safe, as well. Fortunately I didn't need the umbrella which was thoughtfully provided.

review.title: Better than what I expected
review.reviewText:
The hotel was actually better than expected for the price. The hotel was very responsive to my needs of a refrigerator and late check out. We were running the Nike Half Marathon and we were able to go back to the hotel and shower and clean up. Location is perfect. The start of the line up is in front of the hotel.
The Hospitality was Superb!

review.title: Charming
review.reviewText:
The building was quite an old structure, but very well maintained. So it had a beautiful carved facade and high ceilings, but small elevator. They modernized very efficiently and are very environmentally conscious.

My room was relatively small, but comfortable, well designed, very clean. The bed was of a high quality, but too soft for me. I didn't like that housekeeping kept opening the window to the fire escape when I was out of the room. (It wasn't secure).

Mike at the front desk was very gracious and accommodating when my plans changed and I needed to stay an extra night. I didn't get a deal as good as when I booked the hotel as part of a package with my flight; but they didn't gouge me either.

review.title: this is the place to stay for comfort , friendliness and location, we cannot rate this hotel highly
review.reviewText:
San Francisco can look a bit off putting at first, most of the buildings and shops have been around a while and it gives you a feeling of times gone by. This is however, the charm of the city and it soon does not take you long to like it. We arrived at the Chancellor Hotel about 11.00am after being dropped off by our shuttle. First impressions were mixed but that sooned changed with the friendly welcome we were given. We were given a room immediately on the 13th floor which suprised us as we thought check in would not be till at least 2.00pm. Our room was quaint, a king size bed with furniture and decor that matched the charm of this fantastic city.
If anyone is looking for a hotel in San Fransico which is right in Union Square and surrounded by some of the best shopping in the world from Macys, Bloomingdales down to the best outlets where one can get bargains you would not believe.
Put quite simply, if anyone is looking to stay in this city for a few days to see the sights, do some shopping, eat at some great restaurants, including the one at the Chancellor, don't look any further than The Chancellor, you will not be disapponted.
Our visit will be always remembered here as one of the best times we have had on our trips overseas and just like the famous song, you can and will leave a piece of your heart in San Fransico.

review.title: Perfect for San Francisco
review.reviewText: Rates were good, room was comfortable, we enjoyed the whole trip

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: The location is great, very central and a good starting point to explore the city. Also accessible from public transit (Powell St). Lovely hotel with great service all around.

review.title: Location, location, location!
review.reviewText: Location was awesome, right downtown very close everything and right on the trolly line. We asked for a room on the backside to so it was less noisy. It was a bit warm since there is no A/C but we did have a fridge which was nice. Didn't find the desk staff overly helpful, but courteous.

review.title: Super location - clean and quiet
review.reviewText: Very good location and clean, well cared for hotel. I was surprised at how quiet the hotel was - our room faced Union Square but with the window closed, there was very little street noise. Excellent value for the money! Apples, cookies and coffee in the lobby were a nice plus.

review.title: A frequent all expense traveller to SF
review.reviewText: I go to Union Square as a pilot on overnights 30-40 times a year and this place is as nice as any I have stayed at. Comfortable, clean, great staff and cookies and coffee in the lobby for free. A better location? I can think of none.

review.title: Loved the Chancellor
review.reviewText: Everyone at the Chancellor was friendly and helpful. Although the rooms are small, they are arranged so efficiently that I can't remember ever having a more comfortable and convenient room. I wish they had double beds rather than twin beds, but the great matresses, linens, and pillows compensated quite a bit. The area was great.

review.title: Great Service!
review.reviewText: The hotel employees provided great customer service and were able to get us checked-in early. Rooms were updated, modern and clean. The lobby is beautiful and historic. The hotel is in a great location for exploring the city on foot. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others looking for good value in San Francisco. (Only negative is that we were there during a record-breaking heatwave and, like many hotels and businesses in the area, the hotel had no A/C, so it got quite hot at night.)

review.title: would definitely stay again
review.reviewText: just right. good price, excellent location, old timey downtown charm but nice clean room & bathroom, comfortable bed, good closet space. Very happy we picked the Chancellor.

review.title: Great Hotel ---- But
review.reviewText:
Overall this was a very nice hotel. Its well maintained, the rooms are clean and comfortable, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Its in a great location, right off of Union Square and is surrounded by fantastic shopping and plenty of excellent restaurants. The cable cars run right outside of the hotel, and you can pick up buses at both corners of the block taking you almost anywhere.

But, and I didn't realize this when I booked, the hotel does not have air conditioning. So you're left with a problem, you can leave your windows open and be comfortable (SF is quite cool) but have to listen to a lot of city noise, or you can close your window, and have it get rather stuffy as the night goes on. Based on this, I'd recommend this hotel only for an Oct-Apr stay, and avoid in the summer.

review.title: Would definitely go back!
review.reviewText: We were there for a week in September and found the hotel to be: good value for money, convenient location and quiet!

review.title: Great location and excellent value.
review.reviewText: This is a superb location in Union Square and although it is an old hotel,it has been skilfully converted to maximise the space available. That being said the rooms are rather small.

review.title: Can't say enough about this hotel!
review.reviewText:
What a delightful experience the Chancellor Hotel was!
If you're looking for a bland, generic hotel experience, stay away. If you're looking for a hotel with elegance and character then this is the place for you. The staff were uniformly delightful, the room was exactly as advertised, and the location is un-beatable.
The trolley car stops less than half a block from the front door, at Union Square, so despite having in/out parking privileges in the lot (which is one block away) we never needed our car for the entire stay. We had a room at the back of the hotel, so, other than the faint sound of arias floating up from the Opera House behind the hotel we heard little or nothing of the big city bustle around us. The room itself was compact but beautifully decorated and immaculately clean, with very comfortable beds and an original bathtub big enough to drown in!
Will not even consider another location to stay in when we return to San Francisco.

review.title: Great Trip
review.reviewText: Everything was great at the Chancellor Hotel. The rooms are small (we expected that) but very comfortable and clean. The staff was helpful and very friendly. The location was great and we utilized public transportation to get around. I would stay there again.

review.title: Quite adequate, great location, good value
review.reviewText: The room was small but clean and quite adequate. Great downtown location, cable car stop 1/2 block away. Great price, too, for downtown SF.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: Excellent location, friendly staff. Room was somewhat smaller but very nice. No Coffee maker in the rooms, they are located on the main level.

review.title: Our hotel for any visit to SF
review.reviewText:
The Chancellor Hotel presents itself as one of a kind and it truly is that, a refreshing departure from the typical chain type hotels.
The location is just about perfect and the staff more than accommodating.
We especially enjoyed hanging out at the bar for a drink a few times as the bar tender was as helpful as anybody could be about the city as well as just good conversation.
Our stay was perfect and we would come back on our next visit to SF.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The washroom is a bit old. Overall, the room is clean and service is good. The location is really good, close to street cars and buses. Even though there is no air conditioning, the ceiling works great. Food in the area is a bit pricey. Probably better to get out of union square before trying to have breakfast.

review.title: Traveler from West Kelowna
review.reviewText: Very nice "classic hotel" very friendly staff and close to everything you would want to do in San Fran. We would stay at the hotel again.

review.title: Definitely Impressed
review.reviewText: Great location with helpful desk clerks. They made reservations for us and helped us with directions. I would definitely stay there again. Amazing time.

review.title: Can't wait to come back! Awesome location!
review.reviewText: I came for a visit in September. It was very accommodating to have a hotel so close to everything in San Francisco as I didn't have a car. I relied mainly on the public transportation and walking to get around the city. I love the kind and super friendly front desk. When I called to request a later check out, the front desk lady was very accommodating. I also requested a fridge to keep drinks cool and it was provided upon request. Very clean and comfortable room. Nice job!

review.title: Nice Hotel with Awesome Location for Reasonable Price - a Deal!
review.reviewText:
My daughter and I arrived early and no rooms were available for early check-in so the hotel staff gladly stowed our belongings for us while we went out. In the lobby was complimentary coffee and cookies which were greatly appreciated after a long trip.
The concierge told us about the best tour deal and also about the best muni-pass to buy. She was right, and we were glad we listened to her.
The front desk clerk checked us into a quiet room that we asked for, and it was really quiet. The hotel is old but comfortable and clean. The rooms don't have air conditioning (if they did, ours was broken) but have nice ceiling fans and the windows open, so even though the weather was a bit hot, the room was okay. The room featured a 42" flat-screen TV with some good free movie channnels like HBO. The safe in the closest was large enough for my daughters 15" laptop. The beds were the most comfortable I can ever remember in a hotel - most beds are too hard. Not these, though. Also, the hotel provides a wide variety of pillow if the ones in the room don't suit you. We really enjoyed the location as well. It is well positioned just a block off of Union Square in a safe part of town where you can walk to eat without much fear of being hassled by the multitudes of people begging that S.F. is, evidently, known for. Also the cable car runs right past the front door and the Powel Street Muni and Bart trains are only a few blocks away. The big, high-end stores are right there, as well.

review.title: Cute and convenient!
review.reviewText: We loved our room and can't wait to return to the Chancellor! Right on the cable car line and within a few blocks of the BART station, we were able to get around the neighborhood and the city with ease. The room was well maintained and we appreciated the hotels efforts to recycle and reduce the consumption of water and electricity. The room had all the usual amenities - soap, shampoo, blow dryer, etc. It was a nice surprise to have an ironing board and iron as well. We called ahead of our visit to request a mini-fridge. Great for leftovers and a few snack items, but be forewarned - make sure to check temperature control knob. Ours was set too cold and we froze our apples and leftover pizza! We enjoyed the friendly staff, and the cozy lounge in the evening when we wanted a nice glass of wine but didn't have the energy to walk anywhere else that day.

review.title: perfect location, close to BART and Cable Car, shops
review.reviewText: We used this hotel to visit colleges, took BART to Berkeley and airport, easy.great location, walking distance to Chinatown, all shops, no need for expensive hotel breakfast, Starbucks etc. all around. Room was all renovated. Good price for this location.

review.title: Quaint hotel, but very nice.
review.reviewText: Our room at this hotel was quite nice & my granddaughter loved the huge fluffy bed quilts. Room was very small, but a fine place to stay for the night. We liked the closeness to the cable car, had only to cross the street.

review.title: Pleasantly Surprised
review.reviewText: The location is perfect in Union Square. The trolley goes right past the front of the hotel and Union Square is across the street where you can catch the sightseeing buses (which i recommend for a quick overview of the city before you start exploring independently). The rooms are small, but comfortable. The best part was the pillow selection! They have a list of 12 different pillows you can choose from (memory foam, buckwheat, magnetic, knee pillow, and body pillows, etc) which was a treat in itself. The bathrooms come with a bath salts and rubber ducky in case you're in the mood for a bath. Had a problem with the TV turning off by itself during my paid movie, but other than that we had a great stay. We visited this hotel in August and I was concerned about the hotel not having air conditioning since I'm from Texas. There was absolutely no need for it and we had an incredibly comfortable night.

review.title: Ideally situated hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent choice=- good situation off Union Square, near to BART and cablecar. Well equipped and comfortable room, if slightly small. Would recommend this hotel.

review.title: This hotel was what I expected for what I paid.
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is excellent. The room is clean and maintained.

review.title: Great entry point into Yosemite
review.reviewText: This is a small hotel located in the center of Groveland. It was a great place to spend the night prior to going into Yosemite the next day. The food (breakfast) was awesome. The staff friendly - you felt welcome the moment you walked into the door. A number of restaurants are in town that offer options for Dinner if you like. It felt like you were spending a night with a relative as part of your vacation.

review.title: Nice boutique hotel
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel on recommendation from my sister, who had stayed there during a business trip. Everything was great. The price was very reasonable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean, neat and quiet. We knew going in, that there would be no air conditioning. That turned out to be a moot point, as the temperature during the day never climbed above the low 60s. And heat was provided by a portable space heater that was stored in the closet. At night the temperature only went down to the low 50s, so my wife wheeled out the heater and it was adequate in keeping the room warm. We were there in late July. We also knew we were only getting twin-size beds--now we understand why. The rooms are just not big enough to support anything larger. They turned out to be okay for our stay. We never ordered room service, but did eat lunch in the restaurant once and breakfast several times. The food was good and reasonably priced (by hotel standards). For convenience, they had wifi in the rooms (requiring a username and password). I have a wifi-enabled smartphone. And after it didn't work the first day, I tried again the second day and was able to get on the Internet on my phone. They also had a PC down in the lobby, available for use. All-in-all, it was a very pleasant stay there, although we were gone most of each day, touring San Francisco. We would highly recommend this hotel to others.

review.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
review.reviewText: Cost friendly, clean, quiet with a very polite and helpful staff. Very convenient location.

review.title: Great bang for your buck
review.reviewText: Great place to stay because of it's proximity to Union square and all the main attractions in the SF area. Close to transportation both cable cars and transport that will take you to the airport without having to take cabs. You can virtually walk to all the main attractions in SF from this location including shopping and nightlife. It's a quality 3 star hotel that conforms to 3 star expectations. I'll be back!

review.title: A gem of a hotel one block from Union Square
review.reviewText: My wife and I loved the well-kept classic architecture of The Chancellor. The staff was very courteous, efficient and presented themselves in an extremely professional manner. One got the impression that "the guest is always right" from them. True to the style, the room and bathroom were on the small side, but not at all run-down. If you like sleek, modern hotels, then this is NOT the place for you. The bed was very comfortable. The option of selecting your pillow type was a neat idea. Like every other hotel in SF that I have ever stayed at, there is no AC. In that to get cool air, one has to keep their window open, subjecting the guest to street noise (why must the SF sanitation dept work in the middle of the night?!). There was only one night at The Chancellor that this was a problem. My one gripe was the service at the restaurant where we went one morning for breakfast. The guy who waited on us was the same who seated us. How could he forget we were there? There was only one other party eating there when we were seated. After 20 minutes, and seeing other people seated and waited on who came AFTER us, I finally sought him out. No apologies. It ended up taking over an hour for breakfast.

review.title: Natasha
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a prime location, everything from shopping to great food is within blocks! The staff is very professional and accommodations are great.

review.title: Best value for your money! location is excellent
review.reviewText: I'll not hesitate to recommend Chancellor as its location is excellent, the concierge are pleasant and accommodating, the room is clean and most of all the price is reasonable

review.title: san fransisco central
review.reviewText: hotel was clean , freindly and helpfull, parking was included in the price which made it a very good deal as parking is difficult to find and very expensive in san francicso, we also took advantage of the valet parking, good value at $ 8 dollars and its not easy driving round the city, very happy experience for us, alcatraz is a must do, book tickets online as early as you can, best vegetarian restaurant, millenium is a few blocks away at the calalfornian hotel , superb food, great service, recomend the taster menu with the wine to match ,we realy enjoyed this, expensive but well worth it.

review.title: Great Spot
review.reviewText: The hotel was exactly as we expected it. The location was perfect for touring the city and finding transportation to other areas

review.title: Nice hotel for reasonable price
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel in a good location, well-staffed and maintained. Our room location wasn't the greatest--center of hotel with view of the fire escape (probably due to the Expedia rate), But the amenities were nice, and employees helpful.

review.title: Highly recommend
review.reviewText: The location was great - situated on Powell Street -cable cars right outside the door and Union Square. Rooms were quiet and comfortable. I would definitely stay there again. The staff were very helpful and friendly.

review.title: Chancellor-San Francisco
review.reviewText: One of San Francisco's best kept secrets. Outstanding Service. High Quality Room. Excellent Location. Fantastic Experience. Definitely will return and recommend to others.

review.title: Small room but incredible deal and perfect location!
review.reviewText:
First visit to San Franciscowanted to do all the "touristy" sorts of things so this hotel was perfectly located. The staff was welcoming and prompt in the way they handled us. Had some issues with the wireless internet, but they explained it to be due to heavy traffic on the network because of a conference they were hosting.

The room was, indeed, small, but we opted for the cheapest room and didn't expect much more. I was nervous about the lack of air conditioning (I can't sleep if it's hot at all) and I was just fine.

It was great!

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel was right next to Union square. The room was very clean and well organized and the hotel staff was fantastic. The hotel doesn't have many amenities (no pool or exercise room) but those aren't important when you're here to see the city. It does have free wireless in-room. I would definitely go back to this hotel in the future.

review.title: Charming Historic Hotel Near Union Square
review.reviewText:
Very charming hotel, well situated next to Union Square. The hotel was built in 1914, but had been renovated a few years ago, so was in very good condition.
The room was quite small, but everything was well maintained and clean. Since we didn't really spend that much time in the room anyway, the size wasn't much of an issue. Flatscreen TV, very comfortable beds with nice cotton linen sheets and comforters. If you didn't like your pillows, they had a pillow bar in the lobby with a broad variety of different types of pillows.
Huge, wonderful old bathtub, perfect for soaking after a long day of walking all over town.
No AC, but the windows opened, and the weather was perfect during our stay, so no big deal.
No in-room coffee/tea service, but there was always fresh coffee and tea down in the lobby, along with a tasty selection of cookies (on the check-in counter.) Had breakfast twice in their restaurant and the quality of the food and service was quite good. Prices were moderate for SF.
There was a tourist booth in the lobby where you can purchase a MUNI pass for accessing SF's great mass transit system. Besides saving us money, the pass made it much more convenient for hopping on and off the city's various buses, trains, trolleys, and cable cars. Highly recommended, if you didn't bring along a car, or maybe even if you did.
All in all, a very nice hotel, at a very reasonable price. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: perfectly located
review.reviewText: this hotel was great. perfectly located, lovely, no noise in the room, room clean and comfortable but bathroom a little old. the hotel offer free cookies, apples, coffee and tea 24/24, but there is no continental breakfast!!

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: We did lots of reserach on hotels and areas to stay in SF. We were completly satified and happy we chose this hotel. As you will realize, lots of other hotel options are literally right next door or one block away for double the price. Stay here...you will be glad you did. PS- The closet space was amazing!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: My husband and I enjoyed our time at the Chancellor. It was a great location--central to just about everything we wanted to do/ see. The staff were very nice and my husband especially loved the 'pillow menu'. The restaurant also had a good breakfast. We would definitely come back if we're ever in San Francisco again!

review.title: Quite good but...
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, central location, woulld have liked coffee/tea maker in room. Thermos in lobby often too cold.

review.title: Best value in Union Square, San Francisco
review.reviewText:
I loved this hotel! The room was small but very quaint! Loved the hip decor even the cool green paint on the wall. The bed was super comfy and you get to choose your perfect pillow from the hotel's pillow menu! If you enjoy soaking in the tub after exploring all day, you'll love the hotel's super deep bath tub! Bath salt & rubber ducky included! Breakfast was sooooo delicious! Honey yogurt with fruit, crab benedict and pecan pancakes! YUM!!!

Great location, hip hotl, super friendly staff and you can't beat the price!

review.title: A Great Hotel with a Reasonable Rate
review.reviewText:
We were very pleased with our experience at the Chancellor Hotel. The location is on Union Square across from Saks Fifth Avenue. The hotel has a touch of elegance. The staff is friendly. The free apples and cookies are wonderful during the day. the room was ample and clean. The mattress and pillows were so comfortable that we slept better there than at home. The pillows, quilt, and comforter were made of down. One of the best perks of the hotel was free Wi-Fi in EVERY room!

Also, there is the sweetest lady, Miss Susan, who works there helping people with transportation and tours. We looked forward to seeing her everyday.

This was our third stay at the Chancellor because we love it. We have never been disappointed there. I am sure that we will be staying at the Chancellor the next time we go to San Francisco, too.

review.title: Elevator woes
review.reviewText: We were told we were getting the best room they could offer. It was on the top floor with a great view, but the room was located right next to the elevator and all night all you could hear was the noise of the elevator going up and down. This was worse than the noise from the street car below us. We knew the street car would stop at a decent hour, but the elevator noise was unbearable. Some unlucky person had to get those rooms, but we were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and were not appreciative of the desk captain telling us that was the best room. The next day we complained enough that they agreed to move us to a lower floor away from the elevator. I didn't appreciate the evening desk person trying to sell us on the room we already had, rather than listening and trying to accomodate us. The rooms were rather small, but that goes with the historic hotels in San Francisco; it was cozy and nicely decorated. The restaurant in the hotel, Luques, offered a great breakfast for a decent price.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is a great place to stay for location and value.Rooms are comfortable. Free coffee and cookies in the lobby was a nice touch.My second stay there, and didn't disappoint.

review.title: Union Square
review.reviewText: Perfect Stay

review.title: Very Satisfied
review.reviewText: I know that other reviewers mentioned the noise of the rooms but that is part of San Francisco and it was something that added to the experience of San Francisco. The sounds of the city were one of the memorable experiences and I would go back to this hotel again. The evening sounds happened but all was quiet about the time we retired for the night. Visiting San Francisco for the first time was amazing. The Cookies were amazing as well. Thank you Chancellor.

review.title: Would definately go back
review.reviewText: This is an old 1920's hotel that has been renovated. The rooms, bathrooms and hallways are small as are lobby and elevator but it added character and it was clean and well kept. The complimentary coffee, oookies and apples at any time of day or night were a nice touch. If you want to be where the action is and great shops outside your door this is the place to stay. We could catch the cable car right outside the door, the BART was within walking distance with suitcases and we did walk to Chinatown, Fishermans Wharf too. It can be noisy late at night and early morning - the cable cars start up at 6am and runs to 1am.. Overall I would rate this 4.5 out of 5 and would certainly go back to stayand also recommend to friends.

review.title: Great location, clean rooms
review.reviewText: Great hotel... very helpful. Rooms were small but clean and well maintained. They had a pillow menu for us to select from which was a fun thing to try. We were located right on the trolley line and were right by union square. The gym was located in a different building... which was a little inconvenient but OK. One of the only hotels we found in San Francisco that offered parking. Ours was built into our rate and perfect for us to park our rental car.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel was pretty good overall - great location (right by Union Square), not too expensive, and they had free coffee/tea. The rooms were kind of small (expected since it was an old hotel), and the breakfast was a tad pricey, but very tasty. I'd say a good choice.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Had a great time.

review.title: Love the Chancellor
review.reviewText: Great hotel, the room was ready when we got arrived. I had contacted the staff before our arrival and informed them that it was our anniversary, and they had a complimentary bottle of champaign chilled and ready for us. I had also requested a 14th floor room, with a refrigarator, and both request were granted. The lady at the tour desk was very helpful in giving us information on excursions, and booking tours for us. Wes Tyler the manager responded to all emails that I sent with questions about the hotel, We live in Dallas, TX so I was concerned about the hotel not having air conditioning, but this was no problem whatsoever. The hotel is also in a great location. We will stay at the Chancellor the next time we are in San Francisco. Great job!!!

review.title: what we had hoped for
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great area to see the city from. We bought a three day MUNI pass that allowed us unlimited trips on the cable cars, trolleys, and buses. The cable cars were easy to hop on right outside of the hotel and get us where we needed to go. We asked to be moved to a higher room which made a difference in street noise. With no AC I was a little worried but cracking the window and turning the fan on made the room very comfortable and it was even unseasonably warm while we were there. We knew the rooms would be a little smaller but they were fine for sleeping and regrouping...especially for the price compared to other area hotels. The pillow menu was pretty nice too. If you need a hotel in a good spot to see the city from and are just using the room to sleep and regroup then this is a great hotel for the price. Clean, comfortable, and affordable.

review.title: Just Perfect!
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel! We would definately stay there again. We had a room on the back side of the hotel and the noise was not an issue. There was a lot of mention that the rooms were small, but I thougth they were perfect and they look exactly like they do on the website. The hotel was clean, nice and the staff were very helpful. We enjoyed Happy Hour at the bar and the staff was very helpful with out transportation to the airport and with recommendations for different places to go and eat. Location was outstanding. Right on the cable car line, right near diners and theatres. Just perfect! I can't wait to go back to San Francisco and I will definately stay at the Chancellor Hotel.

review.title: San Francisco close by
review.reviewText: This hotel was right on the Powell- Hyde cable care line and opposite Saks! Just blocks away from Chinatown, and 2 blocks down from Union Square. The room was a little on the small side and you could hear people in their rooms. The tub faucet was constantly dripping. Breakfast was good. You can buy passes for the cable car and public transportation right inside the hotel.

review.title: Great location, good value. Only drawback is street noise.
review.reviewText: Nice, clean hotel. Decent amenities. Good WiFi. Only problem is noise from the street if you are a light sleeper. Not too bad from 5th floor.

review.title: Average hotel but comfortable bed!
review.reviewText: I requested a quiet room that didn't face the street and was easily accommodated with that. The room was nice and the bed was comfortable even though it was really small! There was a weird smell to the hotel, but it wasn't that bad. The room was nicely decorated and the hotel was old but cute.

review.title: Great staff and location
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Chancellor in June 2010. We checked in at 2:00am and found a very friendly staff person expecting us and our room waiting. Rooms are on the small side, which we expected in a city, but ours was clean, quiet, and comfortable. The location is excellent, close to Union Square and the Powell Street BART station. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Not a city girl so wish it had been a little more off the beaten track but overall was great!
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff and rooms although pretty small were clean and well done. Lots of amenities! Especially loved the fact that you could buy Muni passes in the lobby from a lady that really knows the city, bus routes, everything. She was great.

review.title: Reasonable option for Union Square
review.reviewText: We had a room on a high floor. It was an older hotel but it was clean and nicely maintained. The room was comfortable and quiet. Internet worked well. We only stayed one night, arrived late and left early. Lobby and restaurant were basic. Located close to Union Square on Powell St. Reasonable choice at price.

review.title: Our new choice in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The rave reviews about this hotel are absolutely true. The location in Union Square can't be beat, and the hotel itself was perfect. We stayed in Helen's Suite on the top floor, which offered a nice living area, two bathrooms, and the bedroom. The bed was super comfortable and offered a great night's sleep. The bathroom products were top of the line and were replinished daily.

The general manager Wes and his entire staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome. From the two for one drink coupon at the hotel bar, to the complimentary maps of the city, everything was well thought out. This will be our hotel of choice from now on in San Francisco.

review.title: Great location, great value for money
review.reviewText: Our stay in May 2010 was our 3rd time at the Chancellor in 20 years and each time we have been very satisfied with the hotel. The location is just great and the cost far less than other hotels in the same area. We found the staff very helpful and loved the friendliness of the staff in the bar area and dining room, made our stay there like being at a friends place. The hotel had been renovated since our last visit and we liked what they had done with it, the only thing that we would miss if the weather had been warmer was air conditioning but would definitely stay there again!

review.title: "Hit the Spot"
review.reviewText: Went to this hotel on the recommendation of a business traveler who spoke primarily of its convenience. However, we found it to be more than that. Although certainly not a fancy place, it was more than comfortable (although the bathrooms could use an upgrade) and the staff were as helpful as any high-priced hotel you can find. We would definitely stay there again. And, oh yes--the price was right!

review.title: 4 star service in a 3 star hotel
review.reviewText:
The Chancellor is situated in a great location virtually opposite Union Square, and has the benefit of the cable car stopping right outside to help you get up those San Francisco hills!

The rooms are a lot smaller than the promotional photos portray. There wasn't really room for two suitcases and the wardrobe area was very limited - no shelves and just one hanging rail and the safe was in there too, so stacking the cases was not possible.

As with all American hotels it seems, there are not any tea / coffee facilities in the room, and there wasn't a fridge either. The rooms were comfortable and the bed was very nice and you can choose from a whole array of pillows!

The reception staff are very good, particulartly the lady behind the shop / excursions counter.

There is free internet access in the lobby - don't use the one in the bedroom, it's slow, very slow, a pain to use and costs you money as well.

For location though, you can't really beat it for the price.

review.title: Can't beat the location
review.reviewText: It's amazing to get a boutique hotel at such reasonable rates in the middle of all the action. Cable car stops are just outside, Union Square is down the road, so are all the shops. Also very handy able to buy MUNI pass in the hotel lobby. The room is tidy and clean, the staff is helpful and we had a great time. Although it's a bit scary walking around late at night with the "beggars" down the main road. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody because of its great location.

review.title: Best Value In The City!
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly greeted by the staff upon arrival. My room was not ready so I asked if they could expedite things since my flight was early. I was able to check in hours ahead of time due to the prompt housekeeping staff. The room was a little small but very comfortable (I had an inside room facing East).Everything was "super clean" and in good working order. The closet was almost a room in itself. The location could not be better if you want to get a feel for the city. You are literally right in the middle of everything. I would highly recommend this hotel for its great location (right on the Powell cable line) and excellent value. There's no air conditioning so you may want to think twice in the September/October time frame.

review.title: Will definitely go back!
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel. Location was central to just about everywhere. The hotel staff was very helpful in recommending places to eat. The room was a little small, but not too small. It was very comfortable.

review.title: Nice for the price
review.reviewText: The Chancellor was a nice hotel and the staff was very helpful. It was updated recently but wasn't exactly what I was expecting from the pictures on the Expedia website. Rooms are small and so are the bathrooms. We are tall people and the shower was hard for us to manage in since the shower head is hung so low. Over all it was a nice hotel for the price.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is a great hotel if you're looking for something that is not your average, run-of-the-mill hotel. The renovated rooms are super-cute and have a boutique feel. The location couldn't be better for tourists, and there even is a desk downstairs where you can get tickets for the trains, cable cars, etc. The hotel room and bathroom was small, but fine for a short stay. The closet was huge! In my opinion they should have cut back on the closet space and expanded the bathroom so it can fit more than 1 person at a time. Another downside is that the room we were in had an adjoining door, and although the walls were pretty thick the doors weren't - we could clearly hear our neighbors' conversation in their room. The hotel offers a "pillow bar" where you can select what type of pillow suits you best for your sleeping needs, and they will exchange the pillows in your room for the one you select. I stuck with the ones that came in the room, and they suited me just fine. The bed was firm and the sheets were soft and warm. There's definitely some city noise if you're on the street side, but I'm sure that would be the same at any other hotel. I stayed for just one night and would recommend it to anyone!

review.title: Good hotel right in centre of Union Square
review.reviewText: Really good convenient hotel

review.title: a great spot in the centre of San Fran
review.reviewText: One couldn't ask for a more convenient location in San Francisco, less than a block from Union Square with great transit as well as lots of shopping and dining options. Although the room was dated, a little tired looking, and quite small, it was clean and well kept. Walls were also a little thin. The staff is very friendly and helpful and were able to offer a lot of great tips for getting around.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: Was great overall experience, room as expected, everything was to our complete satisfaction. We will satay here again on our next trip to SF. Extreme value!

review.title: Would definitely stay there again.
review.reviewText: The Chancellor was a quaint hotel with a lot of character. Although the rooms were small, we had everything we needed. Don't let the single bed idea fool you, there were extremely comfortable. The location and charm of the hotel really made this a great choice.

review.title: Clean and convenient....
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location. 4 blocks from BART and 1 block from union square. Clean, neat, staff was friendly and reasonably priced. Would stay again.

review.title: Recommended - with reservations.
review.reviewText:
Big positive for the lady at the Tour Desk. Helpful, friendly and went out of her way to please. Staff in the Restaurant also quite nice. Front desk staff helpful as well. Her suggestion about the 3 day public transport pass was invaluable and saved us heaps.

Supposedly there was a Bellman, but I only spotted him three times. Each time standing and talking to a limo driver who parked outside and came in for a chat once a day by the look. He didn't appear to be there to assist with luggage.

The location was great - handy to anything you needed, and a great location for public transport of all types.

Coffee, tea, apples and huge biscuits available - in the lobby - most times for a light brekkie.

The room was the smallest we have ever stayed in anywhere, but clean and well serviced. Pillows, as in nearly every hotel we stayed were far too soft, even the selection didn't help. Maybe it is an American thing.

review.title: Great hotel for the price
review.reviewText: The rooms in the Chancellor are in the middle-small range, but they are larger than "tight" or "cozy". The lack of air conditioning means that the windows need to be open at night, and since the hotel is in the middle of a very popular area, means there is unavoidable noise. Higher floors and different sides of the building can minimize the noise, but not eliminate it. The bed is comfortable and comes with both heavier and lighter comforters, so you have some control over that situation. The bathrooms are updated, but many have old tubs (some clawfooted for the antique crowd). I found them perfectly adequate and clean. I didn't use many of the hotel services, but the WiFi was good in the room and the desk was helpful with taxis and storage of luggage. I got a very good price on the room, making up for the slight inconvenience of noise at night.

review.title: Highly recommend it
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was extremely polite and helpful. The hotel room is very charming and kind of vintage. Clean and safe place to stay. Great value for our one week stay. I would stay their again.

review.title: Great City, Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
this hotel is indeed a boutique hotel. a little different, which is what we were looking for. not the carbon-copy Chain type. Staff was very friendly and helpful.
a great value. It reminded me of little hotels in Europe.
The location was quite central and we could walk nearly everywhere. I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat, it was a great value.

review.title: Decent Hotel, Decent Price through Expedia
review.reviewText: Through Expedia we got a great rate for this hotel which is comparably and probably more affordably priced than other hotels in the area. The Moscone Center is a nice walk down hill in the Southeast direction and Chinatown is a quick walk in the North and slightly East direction. The twin beds are comfortable although they are small, not recommended for the 200+ lbs person.

review.title: Good location, friendly, clean, poor wifi
review.reviewText: Everything ok, good price, excellent location, but hotel wifi was not usable.

review.title: Shopping central
review.reviewText: Great location. Next to all major shops. Cable cars stop right at the front door. Hop on off buses stop only 1 block away. Heaps of great eateries nearby. The homeless beggers after dark are in abundance which is quite annoying but because of americas silly coin obsession you end up with fist fulls of change which they appreciate. The hotel is very comfortable and breakfast is quite good. Good little bar in the foyer for a drink at night. The lifts are small and slow. The staff are very helpful and seem like they enjoy working there. Overall quite a good hotel in a great location in the centre of the city.

review.title: Great Place and Great Price!!
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I stayed here and had a wonderful time. Everything was within walking distance and close to public transportation, we didn't even rent a car. We took the BART straight from the airport and it worked out great, just walked a few blocks from the Powell St. BART station to the Chancellor. Everyone was very friendly and accomodating. The only downside was that the room did not have air conditioning and it got stuffy in our room pretty easily, so staying there in warmer months may be a bit more uncomfortable. For the price and the location it was perfect. We'll be back! :)

review.title: Quaint, charming and inexpensive.
review.reviewText: This hotel was great. Apart from one mistake by the in-house restaurant, my experience was perfect. The rooms are small but the walk-in closet and bathroom make up for it. This hotel is located in an incredibly convenient area and is an ideal place to stay when traveling for work.

review.title: GREAT value for money, would certainly go back!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was located in a very convenient location, near many shops and close to all transportation. The room was pretty small but clean, beautifully decorated and quiet for the location. Sheets and towels were changed every day and there was even a wifi internet connection in the room. The staff was friendly and helpful and we checked in immediately. I certainly recommend this hotel as it's really worth its money. The only disadvantage that could be a problem in the summer is that the room doesn't have an aircondition but it's ok for winter or spring(i visited on March10). Would definately stay again if visited San Francisco.

review.title: Left our heart in San Francisco!!
review.reviewText: see above (travel experience!)

review.title: Excellent budget choice
review.reviewText: For the price, this hotel could not have been better. Room was spotless and comfortable even if a bit small. Staff were very friendly and attentive. This was a family trip for my 50th birthday and we had 3 rooms, and all of them were good. Right on Union Square across the street from a cable car stop, so an unbeatable location. Parking was available around the corner at a private lot, but the price was reasonable, and again, the valet service was quick and friendly. Room had free wireless internet which was a bit slow and dropped a lot, but it was good enough for checking email. It was much better in the lobby bar.

review.title: BEST SERVICE EVER EXPERIENCED
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is as good as it gets in San Francisco. Cable car line goes by the front door, shopping and dining all around. convenient access to taxis or rental vehicles. Tour desk was very knowledgedable about San Francisco and made many great suggestions for free. The rooms was a little on the small size but very clean and comfortable, best thing is the cost was so low we were able to get two rooms for what most comprable hotels charged for one room. Better than anything else was the staff and service were excellent. They attended to all of our needs as though we were VIP's. This hotel made our week in San Francisco a success.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Everything we expected for the price, will be coming back for future trips.

review.title: Great location...but walls too thin
review.reviewText: Location was great, and the room was a decent size, in good shape - but for three nights I was kept awake by neighbouring occupants who in turns were loud, fought, and other things....we also requested an early morning (3:30 am) wake up call to catch our flight that never happened...good thing it was our backup, but if we had been relying on it we would have missed our flight for sure.

review.title: I would definitely recommend this hotel!
review.reviewText: Very satisfied with the hotel - nice, clean, friendly, good location. If I visit SF again, i will come back to his hotel. I have nothing to say against their service.

review.title: Fabulous hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great. It is in a perfect location and the front desk was so helpful! When booking the hotel I typed in that we preferred an upper level room with a view and they even managed to accomodate this without me even having to ask. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

review.title: A hotel with character in a great location
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel with huge discounts online and I was generally impressed with my experience here. The hotel is located in a very convenient part of town, steps away from cable cars, the BART, buses, shopping and restaurants. The service was very good as well. The hotel has a distinct character and style that sets it apart from the hotel chains. My one criticism with the hotel is that the beds were way too soft, as were the pillows. Other than that though, highly recommended!

review.title: NICE HOTEL IN PERFECT LOCATION
review.reviewText: We truly enjoyed our stay. It was the perfect location, because we could walk anywhere we wanted to. The staff was friendly and very helpful, especially when we needed to arrange transportation. The room was small but perfect since it was just my wife and I. We both loved our stay and would stay there again!

review.title: Will definitely return
review.reviewText: Excellent confort, convenience, and service

review.title: Pretty good
review.reviewText: The building is old, in a charming way, and this somewhat evident in the look of the bathroom walls and walk-in closet, and also from the spiral staircase. The bed was very nice. The desk and chair were nice, though the chair was perhaps not all that suitable for working. The bathroom was quite ok, but not exceptional. The room wasn't exceptionally quiet, but ok. The hotel seems to be environmentally conscious. Wireless was not very reliable, but maybe the load was particularly high during my visit. The hotel does not provide free breakfast. A simple free relatively healthy breakfast -- bagels and coffee -- would have been nice. Overall, the hotel was fine for the price I paid, except unreliable wireless is an annoyance for business travelers. Hopefully they will address this. I know it's difficult to provide wireless to a large number of people while keeping costs reasonable.

review.title: An excellent place to crash
review.reviewText:
For those travellers on a budget and long, busy days of work and exploring San Francisco, this is a good choice, if all you require out of your hotel is a clean, quiet place to sleep at night. It is not without its charms; the room was perfectly adequate and well maintained, though a little warm at times.
Even though the Chancellor is right on Union Square, it was perfectly peaceful. There is a small nook of a bar downstairs, and a pleasing breakfast in their comfortable dining room is available and reasonably priced. One can walk out the front door to catch a trolley to Fisherman's Wharf or walk downhill a couple of blocks to catch a streetcar to the Castro.

review.title: Great staff and a good hotel
review.reviewText: Very helpful and knowledgable staff. A great location and would definately recomend to anyone wanting good value for money.

review.title: Impressive!
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable, excellent location, and professional, courteous staff.

review.title: Love the location, walking to restaurants and shopping!
review.reviewText: The room was clean and modern. No complains. The best thing of the hotel was the location. We loved walking to good food and lots of shopping.

review.title: My choice for Union Square
review.reviewText: Everything as expected. Room is quite small for 2 people on 3 night stay or longer. Maid service could be better.

review.title: Excellent accommodaions
review.reviewText: The service was outstanding and the location is convenient to eating places, the wharf, the cable car and shopping. It is a perfect place for a relaxed, pleasant business or pleasure stay.

review.title: Good price, great location, nice room
review.reviewText: The hotel was super close to the big shopping mall, Macy's, and other shops. The location of it was super convenient especially when our flight arrived late. We just took the last underground train (BART) and got off at the Powell station, walked 10 minutes (or less) and we were there! The cable cart runs right in front of the hotel, so getting to fisherman's wharf was super convenient, and also, the walk wasn't that bad (which we did and took us about 20 to 25 minutes if you are not afraid of hills). China town and financial district was also within blocks(approx. 4to 6 blocks). Despite we didn't have the best view, but we were only there at night to sleep anyways, so it worked out fine. The building is pretty old but inside was clean and great traditional decor (not elaborate but nice!). Free wifi!

review.title: Think small
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is within walking distance to many shops and restaurants. It is also on the cable car line as well as a few blocks from the metro and bart station. The rooms were clean and well maintained but the room we were given was on the second floor right in front of the exhaust vents for the restaurant downstairs - this could be a nuisance if you want to sleep in as the vents does generate noise. The bathroom leaves much to be desired. It was really cramped and in order to sit on the toilet, you need to seat yourself at a slight angle. Other than that, the stay was a good enough since it was in a good location.

review.title: Wonderful location
review.reviewText:
A very well located hotel. Very clean but rather small rooms. The staff were extremely helpful and polite. They have their own tourist information desk which provides discout tickets for many attractions and schuttles.
The only food they provide are breakfast and light lunches but the hotel is surrounded by restaurants and eating establishments of varying quality.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: It was perfect. We'd like to go back to this hotel next time we visit San Francisco again.

review.title: I would go back
review.reviewText: Nice Clean Hotel. Good price. The only drawback is parking as you have to walk a block and a half to the garage and you have to pay for parking. Great location. Very friendly staff.

review.title: SF weekend at Union Square
review.reviewText: Very nice Hotel that I would recommend to anyone. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We received a Hotel restaurant coupon when we checked in so we decided to try it out for breakfast and it was wonderful. The food, the service all top notch. No complaints at all. All in all we had a great experience at Chancellor Hotel.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: I enjoy very much staying in the hotel and I love the location. Thanks.

review.title: Chancellor Hotel is the BEST!
review.reviewText: Quaint, nice and oh so cute!

review.title: Great Value and location
review.reviewText: Decent hotel at a great price; good downtown location. At rack rate, not a bargain but if you catch a discounted rate it is a great hotel for this location. Rooms on the back are a bit quieter.

review.title: I will stay here again
review.reviewText: A friend and I stayed at this hotel for six nights while attending a conference in town. We were extremely satisfied with this hotel. The room had more space than I expected -- a walk-in closet provided more than enough space for our luggage, and besides two twin beds there was a desk and two comfortable chairs where we could sit and chat. The free wi-fi was fast and reliable, and the hotel was fairly quiet (given the fact that it's on a busy street in a major city). We received great service as well as great recommendations from the staff on restaurants and night life... and the coffee was good and fresh in the mornings. If i was forced to chose one thing that wasn't excellent, I would say the towels were too thin (a couple of them had some near-thread-bare spots)... but given the price and the comfort of the room, this didn't really matter too much. Even the bath salts they provided were nice, and the choice of pillow type was a great touch. Also, we purchased a 7-day MUNI pass in the hotel lobby and used it for cable car and bus travel, which worked GREAT for us. Wonderful way to see the city!

review.title: lock the window
review.reviewText:
This hotel was nice and pretty comfortable. My window wasn't locked when I arrived, but after I locked the window shut, this eliminated much of the street noise that is ever-present. For some reason there was the smell of a freshly used restroom when I arrived to my room and that was perhaps the only downside to the place.

There were also some unexpected perks like q-tips and bath salts in the bathroom.

review.title: Sweet As!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Chancellor for three nights in December and will definitely go back if we get the opportunity. The Good: Friendly and approachable staff. Great restaurant and bar (patronised by locals, too). Staff ensured room preferences were met. Ultra-convenient location. Free newspapers and high quality toiletries. Spacious and practical room layout (separate luggage storage room including wardrobe was very useful). Quiet room and comfortable bed and pillows. Unobtrusive and thorough housekeeping. Efficient and quick check-in/out. Always felt safe in and around the hotel. The Not So Good: WiFi signal quite weak on the 11th floor.

review.title: Union Square
review.reviewText: I was very pleased wth the accomodations. I hadn't stayed in the heart of SF in a long time so I was not sure how convenient the hotel would be. It is near major shopping stoores and walking distance to malls, movie theatres and restaurants. We were able to take the BART and had to walk only 4 blocks. I felt very safe in the area even though there were several homeless lurking in the area. The room was on the small side with one queen sized bed. There was a large closet to store your luggage. The housekeeping staff was very accomodating. I would stay there again. I recently found out my niece and mother stayed there many years ago in the late 80s The cable cars ride right by the front of the hotel.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Over all great Hotel and in a great location. My only dislike was the parking. The hotel did not have its own parking lot. They contracted with a parking lot 1 block away. This alone was not a problem. The lot was great and so were the employees. The problem was the additional cost for parking. I was not aware when I made the reservavtions thru Expedia that I would have to pay an additional $25.00 per day for parking. This was an unexpected expense.

review.title: San Francisco made easy and pleasant
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a very good location near to transportation, shopping and other amenities. It was very well appointed and clean. We did not require much service, as we were in San Francisco to visit family, but any time we ask for information or assistance everyone was very helpful. I would certainly stay there again.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel is a clean and comfortable boutique hotel in a great location near Union Square. Good value.

review.title: Would like to go back.
review.reviewText: We stayed at this Hotel 3 days before Christmas,and really loved its position in Union Square. Our room was very comfortable for a small room, and provided all that we needed. The reception staff could have been more friendly to visitors who had travelled such a long distance, but on the whole we felt The Chancellor, was a great place to stay.

review.title: Perfect location, great hotel, Loved it.
review.reviewText:
We stayed at this hotel Dec 27 -31 2009

The location was fantastic, we could not have picked a better location. The hotel was built in 1914 and was at one time the tallest building in San Fran. The rooms are a little small but very comfortable. For the time we spent at the hotel we found the hotel offers just enough. There are no Bells and whistles but we did not pay for the RITZ, I loved it and would recomend it to all my friends.

review.title: I love it and hope prices don't go up!
review.reviewText:
Pros: The location is great, just a few steps from Union Square. The front desk is helpful and fast. The room is nicely decorated, as seen in picutres, The bathroom has "old world" charm. The price is good, particularly considering all the above.

Cons: Decoration of the lobby needs work. The souvenir / supplies store does not have attractive items. The elevator is smallish.

The pros far outweigh the cons. I'll stay in the same hotel in my next visit.

I did not try the breakfast or bar of the hotel, so look at other reviews for that.

review.title: Will definately stay there again... Can't wait
review.reviewText: We arrived very late at night/early hours of the morning and booked in with out any problems...The hotel was very clean as was our room. One nice thing was we could open our window (7th Flr) just about 4" just to let in some fresh air (The window would not open any more for safety reasons) All the staff were very nice, very helpful and nothing seemsed to be any trouble. I would definately stay there again and would highly recomend the Chancellor Hotel.

review.title: great rates for a very good hotel on Union Square
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel can't be beat for convenience to the central area of SF, Union Square. The Hotel itself is small but very nice. Especially the lobby and rooms are nice, though a bit dated. The carpet in the hallways are a bit worn and could use replacement, but overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends or family.

review.title: Great location, fantastic staff
review.reviewText: We only had an overnight stay, but nonetheless it was a very pleasant experience. The staff is wonderfully friendly and helpful in all respects. The rooms have been upgraded and are small, but nicely done for an older hotel. The rooms on the street are noisey, so ask for an interior room if you don't want to hear every garbage can in the area being emptied at 4 a.m. Overall, it was a great value.

review.title: Great place to stay, especially when attending Nike Women's Marathon
review.reviewText: This is such a great place to stay. My boyfriend and I really enjoyed it. It is centrally located to many things. Cable car right outside the door, BART just down the street. Requested a special room with a view but still quiet. That is exactly what they gave me. Cookies and coffee/tea always available in lobby, though they ran out of the yummy chocolate chip while I was there, but the oatmeal was not too shabby. I was there for the Nike Women's Marathon in Oct. 2009, and the location was great. Expo was right outside the door as well as the starting line. Drop off for the shuttles back from marathon was just a block away. I would definately stay here again.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!!!
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel especially if you want to stay within Union Square. There is a parking fee of $35 (valet) but almost all hotels in SF have a parking fee and this is actually one of the cheaper parking fee I've found. The room was not very big but it was good enough for two person. I thought the bed was comfortable, I had a great night sleep. The location is excellent! Everything is right outside and within walking distance. If you get the chance, go across the street at the Sir Francis Drake Hotel for a cocktails at the Harry Denton's Starlight Room. They usually take reservation but you can go up to the 18th floor and ask if they can sit you for cocktails. They charge $5 cover charge but it's worth it. You get an amazing views of San Francisco throughout the club.

review.title: Best San Francisco Experience
review.reviewText: The best location and the hotel (although small rooms) is exactly what you look tor to get the classic San Francisco feeling, The staff is great, and the location cannot be beat. If you are driving, the package with the parking is great. We stayed over Christmas and felt very much at home. Can't wait to go back.

review.title: In but Out of the Hussle and Bussle
review.reviewText:
In a place like SF, you'd really need to be in the heart of things, but considering that you are on a holiday, you would want to get some quiet rest at the end of the day.

Chancellor hotel could provide just that. Located just minutes away from the main square and the Chinatown district, it's perfect to go exploring on foot and get away from everything at night. It is served by cable car (I forgot which line), so it's convenient to get to and from fisherman's' wharf.

We had some trouble getting to the Golden Gate Bridge area but the kind lady at the tour desk managed to find out a way.

Overall, expect a nice cosy hotel with a wonderful service staff.

review.title: The Prime Chancellor
review.reviewText: Very cozy. The location was prime. We go to The City every year for Christmas. Have stayed at several Hotels around Union Square. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Best Location, European Feel
review.reviewText:
Love this hotel!! We walked to shopping and restaurants - Union Square at Christmas was the best!!
The hotel is small enough for great personal service. The rooms are small but adequate.
Definitely our favorite hotel in the city - great price and great location.

review.title: Perfect little gem in SF
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel on Union Square is such a find. Reminded us of the hotel we stayed in in Paris. The rooms are smaller, but still have plenty of space to be comfortable. The location is ideal with great restaurants within walking distance and the value can't be beat!! We don't even consider another hotel when looking to book a San Francisco vacation!

review.title: Lovely old hotel
review.reviewText:
I travel often to SFO and enjoyed my stay except for one thing....no coffee maker in the room. I truly hate to have to dress and leave the room to go downstairs for coffee. Yes, there was coffee in the foyer, but it was so black and thick as mud, that I couldn't drink it.
I returned to SFO 5 weeks later but stayed at another hotel, just because of the lack of a coffee maker in the room.
Otherwise, I loved the hotel.

review.title: Better Than Expected!
review.reviewText:
Due to the age of the hotel, it was in surprisingly good condition and was very clean. The room was quite small, but comfortable with all of the amenities needed other than a coffee pot. It had a huge closet (which made up for the room size) and a nice, large flat screen TV. It appears that the entire hotel has been completely remodeled and is well maintained. The only drawback is the lack of air conditioning, thus I would not likely plan a stay in the summer.

The location is excellent, in heart of Union Square with easy access to shopping, restaurants, cable cars, trolley's, etc.

The staff was very friendly and accommodating and the bartender was excellent and very helpful (unfortunately, I cannot remember her name).

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: nice place, great location, good staff.

review.title: Love the Chancellor
review.reviewText: This was our third stay at the Chancellor, and we love it! The rooms are clean and comfortable, the staff is friendly and helpful, the location is ideal, and the price is very reasonable. We wouldn't stay anywhere else in SF.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: Fastastic location. Front desk was very knowledgeable and helpful in giving out printout s of directions. Daily paper and good strong coffee in the lobby was a treat. It was convenient being able to purchase bus/cable car tickets in the lobby. Great restaurant right across the street.

review.title: Excelent option at Union Square
