review.reviewText:
PROS: Excelent location at Union Square in San Francisco. It is clean and all workers are very kind and dilligent.

CONS: It is an historical building in downtown San Francisco so rooms are small and restrooms are very very small.

SUGGESTION: A bottle of water in each room would be very appreciated by customers, because you have only tap water to drink in the rooms.

review.title: Nice Place
review.reviewText: Old hotel that has been remodeled. Bathroom was a bit small, walls are thin, but very comfortable. Lack of A/C might be an issue in hot weather, but all rooms do have ceiling fans. Comfortable stay.

review.title: Great staff. VERY CLEAN!!
review.reviewText: Everything was great from the friendly, helpful staff to the cleanliness of the room. Nice BIG bathtub. We stayed on the 9th floor and street noise was still a bit of a problem for us. However, we live in a very quiet neighborhood. It might not be a problem for others. Very convenient location. Would stay there again.

review.title: Will go back again
review.reviewText: The staff at the hotel very friendly and courteous. Location is very convenient...walking distance to most of the shops and restaruants. Room was clean, bed comfortable and the availability of coffee and cookies was great.

review.title: Beautiful old hotel in a great location!
review.reviewText: The Chancellor hotel is a well maintained hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We stayed in November, so I'm not sure if the rooms would be too warm, but when we were there it was excellent. The location is great. But probably the most imoportant thing for us was that the rooms, and the whole hotel for that matter, was very clean and well maintained.

review.title: best location....will stay there again!!!
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is centrally located in Union Square. There are plenty of restaurants around and Chinatown is only a few blocks away. The area is shoppping haven for us. One can catch the cable cars in front of the hotel. The hotel has shown it's age and t.he rooms on the small side but we knew that from the start and it was okay with us. Our room was always clean with enough towels and toiletries and the beds were very comfortable.They have fresh coffe, tea, cookies and apples available in the lobby 24/7 which is a nice touch. The staff were very accomodating and hospitable. Susan from the tour desk was very friendly and helpful to us. This place is a gem and is highly recommended.

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in a good location. We had the parking package, which was at a good rate compared to other places and the self park garage was only half a block away. The Muni pass was a good buy and the tip from the front desk to utilize a web site to learn exactly which buses to take, and where to catch them to travel to a particular destination was very helpful. We did wish that the hotel included a continential breakfast.

review.title: Great visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The hotel was older and it must have been how traveling was years ago. But that's fine with me because I'm an old fashioned kind of guy.

The entire stay was great including the breakfast that I ate on my last day. I accidently submitted that I wanted the internet connection, which would have been fine except for the fee. The fee was promptly taken off when I explained that I didn't want it.

review.title: Great Convenience - OK Neighborhood
review.reviewText: Close to all public transportation. Great for shopping. Comfortabale accomodations. Helpful concierge/tour desk. The only thing I didn't like were the panhandlers on the streets. Other than that, great experience, would go back.

review.title: SF visit
review.reviewText: This a nice hotel, close to everything. location is great. Free internet. The only draw back is you have to park out side the building in a commercial building with a pass. But, it is a small inconvenience to a great location.

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: The hotel has many pluses from location, price, free internet, on tap coffee/tea and cookies to friendly staff. The only minor negatives were the rooms were small (common in San Fran) but clean and comfortable and the tea/coffee always being luke warm. Other than that you can't go wrong.

review.title: Comfortable, stylish and convenient
review.reviewText: This is our 3rd trip to San Francisco and each time we've stayed at the Chancellor. The hotel is in a convenient, centralized location right off the Powell St cable car line. Amenities are more than satisfactory and the staff is courteous and helpful. The only drawback is the unavailability of king-sized beds (queen and twin beds only) but the rooms are still quite comfortable. Just a lovely place to stay!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We were next door to Obama (in the next hotel). Really helpful, Susan at the front desk is extremely keen to assist with all matters touristy. Fantastic!

review.title: Pleasant hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel on a prime location,service was good,friendly people,the only thing I missed there was not a boiler for making tea or coffee in the room plus no fridge either.But in the lobby was 24/7 coffee or tea available for free.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Great location... easy to get around... great restaurant next to hotel (Sears)

would stay again.

review.title: This was a great place to say
review.reviewText: We really liked this hotel; it was clean, well-maintained and had European charm. We didn't try the restaurant, but it looked nice. There was a small bar in the lobby where coffee, fruit and cookies were always available. Coupons were provided for a nearby department story, 2 for 1 at the hotel bar, discounts at the restaurant. The location was great, right in the heart of Union Square. The staff was really friendly, too. The rooms are a bit small, but we spent most of our time in San Francisco out and about the city, so it didn't matter much. The beds were comfy and bath salts were provided (along with a nice big tub!)which came in handy after all the walking we did! I would definitely recommend staying at the Chancellor.

review.title: Great place to stay and see San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel has been here a long time, but it has been substantially updated. The location can't be beat, the parking option was great. While the room was small, it was very nice. My one complaint was I couldn't figure out how to adjust the temperature, and it was very warm and stuffy. Kept the fan on all night. They also offerred a few nice perks.

review.title: Just what I expected
review.reviewText: I spent a few days at this hotel in October with my niece. The location was great; just close enough to Union Square to be convenient but not so close as to be constantly mobbed. The room was appropriately sized for a big city & decorated great. The closet was huge & allowed us to get all our luggage opened in it so we weren't stepping/tripping over things on the floor. We had a great stay & would definitely return.

review.title: Sweet  Bijou [ in a good way ] Hotel
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel ! great location next to Union Square,good access to everywhere we wanted to go, much of it we could walk to. The staff was lovely....helpful and caring... watching out for whatever we needed. I felt relaxed here. Though the room was tiny, things such as classy fern prints on the walls,comfy bed, high def tv with HBO, sweet little treats such as a jar of candy and rubber duckie in the bathroom , made it a most comfortable refuge. Borders Books right next door was a plus. Will definitely return and refer to friends.

review.title: A little Tired but Location is Great
review.reviewText: Hotel looks a little tired but they have done a lot with the room. Great location near Union Square and right on the Powell-Hyde Cable Car line. There is a Border's next store and a Walgreen's right up the block. Cookies were an added bonus and the food at the hotel restaurant is not great but adequate. Service was excellent and room was clean. They offer a valet service as well if you have a car.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: We were very impressed by Susan who helped us with the transportation around the city and back to the airport. She was very helpful and freindly.

review.title: Wowed by the locale convenience, friendliness of staff and comfort
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely courteous, and although the room was not what you would call luxurious, it was cozy, comfortable and clean. The location was very convenient. I would definitely recommend it.

review.title: highly recommended
review.reviewText: The staff was awesome and helped us get to where we wanted to go. Rooms were clean Location was awesome. would stay there again. We loved everything about the chancellor

review.title: Love the Chancellor!
review.reviewText: What a great hotel in a perfect location! When we booked our room I had mentioned that it was our anniversary, they took it upon themselves to put us on the 14th floor with a view of Union Square! In addition to that, they had a bottle of champagne waiting for us with two souvenir champagne classes and a frame to take home with us. We LOVED that! We had gone out to eat one of the evenings that we were there and brought back left overs, although we didn't expect that they would have one, we called and asked if they had a fridge downstairs we could put our food in, instead they brought a mini fridge to our room for free! Anything we asked for (including a pair of scissors) was ours within minutes! The room was clean, flat screen TV, good size bed, pretty good sized bathroom for SF, and cute green accents throughout the room. For the price, the hotel well exceeded our expectations, we will be staying here again!

review.title: Excellent stay at the Chancellor Hotel
review.reviewText: Not a single aspect to complaint about. From the friendliness and professionalism of the staff, to the comfort of the rooms and the great location, everything was perfect. It was a memorable stay.

review.title: a very good choice
review.reviewText: chancellor was comfortable,clean, and very centrally located.What more do you need?

review.title: Excellent value. Convenient location.
review.reviewText: I found the Chancellor to be good, basic accommodations at a reasonable price in a perfect location. There was nothing fancy about it, but it was clean, comfortable and was missing none of the essentials.

review.title: Loved it.
review.reviewText: Wonderfully historic. Great location. Friendly staff. No complaints.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel near a great location in San Francisco.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is walking distance to China Town. The trolley stops right outside, and the hotel is only a few blocks up from the turn table. The staff were very friendly and allowed us to register early so that we could get the best room available. My only complaint was that it was too hot in the room, but I suppose that's expected when it was 90 degrees outside and the room didn't have no a/c. The rooms are on the small size, but furnished nicely. Overall, I would recommend this to some one that wants to be central to most tourist-y activities in San Fransisco.

review.title: Very good Hotel for San Francisco
review.reviewText: the hotel staff are very good and the management are wonderful, they can't do enough for you, so two words "Stay there"

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Though old, the Chancellor Hotel is an excellent choice - the location is fantastic, the price is reasonable in the extreme, and the dinning room, serving breakfast and lunch at reasonable prices is perfect - the Chancellor is an old fashoned hotel - nice rooms, very pleasant staff and not expensive, a perfect place to stay while exploring a city.

review.title: Solid Classic Hotel with Great Location
review.reviewText: Chancellor is an older hotel and locally owned, so not a major chain style. That said it was nice, clean and the location is superb for Union Square. The staff was very nice, and the restaurant was an excellent choice for breakfast. Food was good, staff was very polite and the price was much lower than typical hotel menus. The rooms are nice, although not overly large. Amenities are typical and I'd happily use them again for any trip.

review.title: Good & Basic Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location. By all the great stores and transportation. Walking distance to Chinatown as well. It is a very basic hotel. You get what you pay for. I was not disappointed w/ the quality of the rooms nor service.

review.title: Fantastic location with character & charm
review.reviewText: Had a great stay at the Chancellor. Location is perfect for a city centre stay with easy access to everything. Staff were very helpful and knowledgable and went out of their way to assist. Room was comfortable and clean - it is an older hotel (where I left my heart in San Francisco had its public debut) - but this means it has character and we loved it. Trolley stop right outside the hotel means getting about is easy. Great hotel and at bargain San Francisco prices!

review.title: Fantastic Hotel, Great Price
review.reviewText: I traveled here with my partner and both of us were very happy with the service. Each employee was very helpful and everyone took the time to help us navigate through the city. The restaurant is also very reasonably priced and serves delicious food. It's a bummer they don't have a continental breakfast, but there is free coffee, tea and cookies all day. I would definitely recommend this hotel in the future...

review.title: Perfect Spot
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is the perfect spot for people that enjoy shopping. It is in the middle of Union Square and just a few minutes from everything. Staff was very helpful especially the informational/tourist booth downstairs. Great deals on city tours and very accommodating to your needs. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: HORRIBLE, great location
review.reviewText: EXTREMELY SMALL ROOMS, no bigger than 12'x10' with a stellar view of the side of an a/c unit. But, If you are looking for a hotel in the middle of everything with more things to do than you can possibly fit in to your day, this is the place.

review.title: The Best Place in the Best Location
review.reviewText: We loved our brief stay at the Chancelor..the location was perfect, the staff so very helpful and friendly. The room was clean and bright. We loved the character of the hotel and being right in the centre of great restaurants, shops, Union Square and transportation. We have already recommended this hotel to friends and family and will definitely stay there again on our next trip to San Fransisco.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: I loved the Chancellor Hotel. The staff was very helpful, the location is great, right on the cable car line, close to sights and shopping. The beds were very comfortable and the hotel provides fresh baked cookies every day in the lobby, free to help yourself.

review.title: Nice stay and location very convenient
review.reviewText: Very enjoyable stay at the Chancellor Hotel. Bar and restaurant provide excellent service. Highlight was Susan Song (Suzie). She staffs the mini grocery store/information desk. Her restaurant advice was exceptional and lining up a limo to take us to pick up our rental car was just a great ride, complete with a stop along the way to take some great pictures of the City.

review.title: Great Location and great Staff
review.reviewText: Never been in a hotel which had better staff, Alicia and Rex in the bar were very friendly and helpful. Food in the small resturant was excellant and wait staff especially Mao and Alex were wonderful. Victorian hotel but recently redun interior. Perfect location 1/2 block from Union Square. Very quaint with egyptian cotton sheets and lots of pillow options for us bed snobs. Mattress was a little too firm for me and room was on the smallish side but I would definitely go back to the Chancellor again. Lots of places to eat with in 3 or 4 blocks. I was very satisfied.

review.title: Can't go wrong
review.reviewText: Excellent location. Service was great. With all those great reviews we knew you just can't go wrong with this one. San Francisco was amazing! Union Square is a great location.

review.title: Chancellor delivers
review.reviewText: Great little hotel slap bang in the centre of San Fran. Small but well appointed rooms, comfortable and clean. Free coffee and pastries in the lobby very much appreciated when you have jet lag and its five in the morning!. Would not hesitate to stay again.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: This is probably one the best hotels I have stayed in, in the US for the price. The staff were amazingly helpful, esp Michael (who went to extreme lengths to help us fix the wireless internet connection) and Rory (who gave us excellent directions to all the local attractions). If you're visiting SF, definitely stay at this Hotel, you won't be disappointed.

review.title: Comfortable and quaint hotel
review.reviewText: This is close to Unin Sq and the staff was very helpful. They also gave you a disocunt for parking if you parked your car at a nearby garage...only $22 for over night. That's a great deal for SF.

review.title: Great Union Square Location and The Price is Right.
review.reviewText: We've stayed here many times because of the convenient location to the shops and restaurants of the Union Square area. They have recently refurbished the rooms so they are fresher. Though the bathrooms are very poor (original). This is not a "fancy" place but a very servicable, pleasant hotel with "affordable" prices in an expensive city.

review.title: A cozy place
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel was very nice. We had a great service, the room was clean, there is always coffee or tea in the lobby. Also, it is very well located. You have a cable car on the same street, you are close from Chinatown, shops, restaurant etc. I strongly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Fun hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: I went to San Francisco for an appointment at the French Consulate, and brought a friend along for company. Although the rooms are a bit small, they are cute and clean. The location was perfect for my needs, right on top of a great shopping district and a short walk from the Consulate. Our room faced the street, so it got a bit noisy at night with the windows open and the cable car right outside, but it didn't really bother me. All in all a fun little place with polite staff.

review.title: SFO's best secret hotel
review.reviewText: Ideally located , right on Union square, the hotel does not attract much attention but inside it is all the contrary: very welcoming and well maintained, nice staff and comfy room. The parking facility is also extremely convenient. Would definitely go back next time in SFO.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised!
review.reviewText: This family owned and operated hotel is charming and located right in Union Square ... close to transportation, shopping, dining. Staff was friendly and helpful; rates were most reasonable.

review.title: THE CHANCELLOR...? Sshhhhh, don't tell anyone!
review.reviewText: This hotel is absolutely fabulous (and was the last time we stayed, years ago). Staff, location, rooms, bathroom -- all fantastic and even more so given the great rates on Expedia. One caveat: if you don't like city noise, get a room higher up on the back. But if you don't mind the sounds of the City waking up, it's all very exciting. But again, don't tell anybody. It's our little secret. Ssshhh.

review.title: I recomend it, and stayed at it again.
review.reviewText: a renovated, small hotel, at walking distance of turist attractions,

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: We stayed here on the 15th floor from July 29 thru August 2. We were in town to see tennis tournament in stanford, california. The room was nice, clean, and decent size. The location is amazing, we had a great view of Union Square. The cable car stops right outside the door. Service was amazing, they offered all kinds of transportation and advice. They even held our bags free or charge.

review.title: No other hotel I'll stay in at SFO...Max per room 2!!!
review.reviewText: Location, location, location.. Cable cars, buses, bart, China Town, North Beach, bus stop for Culturebus, downtown are all within steps away from the front door.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel in the middle of everything
review.reviewText: Chancellor is just as advertised - a small hotel that shows attention to its guests - we arrived after midnight and they had everything ready - we were in our room in minutes. They have fresh cookies and tea available 24/7 and the room was great. Add to this the location in Union Square and I was very happy.

review.title: Always a favorite place to stay in the city.
review.reviewText: We enjoy the quaintness, location and convenience of this hotel. Have used it many times for both leisure and pleasure.

review.title: Excellent pick - Highly Recommended - Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: Best deal for the money. Friendly staff with lots of smiles, fantastic location across from Union Square, comfortable room, charming interior, close to all transportation. Only complaint, no coffee in the room. Other than that, sheer perfection.

review.title: very nice hotel
review.reviewText: room is small, but worhty every penny for the price

review.title: Great Stay!
review.reviewText: Very accomodating-had a couple of special requests-the hotel was happy to assist.

review.title: Excellent location, excellent value, excellent service, comfortable, safe
review.reviewText: The title of my review says it all. Overall, my trip to San Francisco was oustanding, and this hotel was just perfect for me.

review.title: Pretty good for the price
review.reviewText: We got a pretty good deal on this hotel, and were pleasantly surprised for what we got. The hotel room was nice and comfortable. Everything was kept up pretty well. Clean and up to date. Staff was helpful for the most part. The only bad part of the stay was the noise, which is expected from an old hotel. The walls and doors are pretty thin so you can hear people in the hallway and the next room, but after all I will still recommend it. Last piece of advice, its a very good hotel if you are not planning to spend too much time in the room, if you want to just lay around and stay in most of the day, I think you would feel cramped quickly due to the size of the room.

review.title: Cute hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here when vacationing in San Francisco and were very pleased over all. The rooms were small, but very cute. The location was great and all the staff were very friendly and helpful. We would definitely consider staying here again.

review.title: Very charming boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Overall, the Chancellor offers great value if you're looking for a decent base of operations from which to explore San Franscisco. I'd say the 3-star rating is accurate. You can't beat the location, right on Powell St. at Union Square. I didn't find street noise to be a problem as things tended to quiet down after 11:30 or so. Rooms were very comfortable but small, as this is an old hotel given a recent facelift. All plumbing worked perfectly. The choice of pillows is a nice touch. Not much of a bar, but who cares? There are hundreds of other choices within walking distance. My only caveat: the walls are very thin (though I've heard this about a lot of the older San Fran. hotels), so if there's a party going on next door, you'll hear it. We were lucky as the revelers quieted down around midnight. There's also complimentary use of a top-notch health club right around the corner which I really enjoyed. I booked this hotel based on the deal and other positive reviews, and wasn't disappointed. Would stay there again.

review.title: Comfortable and quiet
review.reviewText: Very comfortable and still relatively quiet, given the location at Union Square right by the Powell St cable car line. Perfect for sightseeing and in easy walking distance to BART.

review.title: Lots of Charm
review.reviewText: The room/bathroom was a little small but it was okay for 2 people. I liked this hotel for the great location. We were within walking distance to great restaurants and shopping. I would recommend adding the parking pass to the room. It will save you money and you have unlimited in/out privileges. We would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Perfect Hotel for a leisurely get away
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay, especially the little bar in the loby, Can't wait to go back.

review.title: Go somewhere else in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The room was small, my husband felt claustrophobic, we looked out on masonry. I had asked for 2 twins, they gave us a queen that felt like a double. The concierge offered minimal services. We actually went across the street to another hotel to avail ourselves of helpful information. The hotel breakfast was overpriced. Do not stay there.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: trolly car stops directly in front of hotel. Very cute and clean. We will come back again

review.title: Overrated but good
review.reviewText: Rooms not very large but thats OK - I knew it was a Euro-style hotel. They said every room is the same in the whole place. Something about the sinks and the way the counters are always make my shirt wet when I drink from them - kind of annoying. Staff at hotel was top notch though. Pretty much all the shopping and dining you could ask for in a great central location.

review.title: Great location, free parking, nice and clean! The parking is located at 450 Sutter St.
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel is a good value. It has a great location on Powell St. just off of Union Square. It is conveniently located close to restaurants, shopping, and the cable cars. The staff was helpful and courteous. They offered free parking, which is a big value in San Francisco. It is more of a boutique hotel and not like some of the larger hotels. Good value, clean, polite and efficient service. That was my experience.

review.title: San Francisco's biggest hidden secret
review.reviewText: The service was excellent from the time we arrived till our departure. The presentation of the room was stunning, along with the beautiful view of the city. It was close to Union Square, the cable cars run right past the hotel and is within minutes to the pier area which is why we went. We highly recommend this hotel...a big "10"

review.title: Always a pleasure staying here.
review.reviewText: This is my fifth time visiting San Fran and I've stayed at this hotel the past four times. The location is perfect; half a block from Union Square, cable car stops right in front of the hotel, and a few blocks away from taking the BART or MUNI. I didn't even realize that they renovated the rooms with new furniture since the last time I came here. The staff were nice and helpful. When I come back to visit again, this hotel will always be my first choice.

review.title: Very classy and satisfying
review.reviewText: Terrific location, very classy, yet reasonably priced. This is a super clean, very comfortable, and appealing hotel that was a joy to stay in. Inside, you have simplicity, a fine home-base feel, and understated elegance; outside, you step directly into the pleasurable bustle of the city. The hotel is surprisingly quiet, given its location in the heart of the action and directly on the cable car lines. The handsome overhead fan is entirely sufficient for this naturally ocean-cooled city. Adjacent to the lobby, with its free coffee, cookies, and tea anytime, is an excellent breakfast room with excellent, friendly service. You can walk to many of the prime locations and easily take the nearby public transportation everywhere else. Free access to a nearby health club (with weight machines and lap pool) completes a virtually perfect picture. Prices may vary by night of stay (we actually paid less on the weekend).

review.title: Pleasant stay.
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great spot. Parking is 1 block away, nice easy walk. This location is great. Love listening to the cable car bell ringing, this is what S.F. is all about in my opinion. The staff was wonderful & friendly.This is where I stay from now on! I recommend upper floor facing Powell st. You hear the cable cars a little & get a great view of Union Square. Kenny. Chino Hills Ca.

review.title: Lovely place - brilliant location too
review.reviewText: Hotel was great. Don't understand some of the negative reviews about it. We initially booked only 2 nights as we didn't want to lock ourselves into something that may not be so great. Huge mistake. First thing we did after spending a night was to extend the stay for the trip duration. Would gladly stay there again. Room was very nice and the staff were extremely courteous and helpful. Probably the best place I've stayed for the money.

review.title: convinent and reasonable price!! good choice!!
review.reviewText: Good!!

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: Very clean pleasant hotel located right by Union Square. The rooms are very pleasant and the overhead room fan was a plus. I would recommend this little jewel to anyone visiting San Francisco.

review.title: Nice Hotel for Us Seniors
review.reviewText: We can't wait to go back to San Francisco and stay at the Chancellor. What made it a very pleasant experience was that our server at the hotel's coffee shop was very friendly and attentive. The hotel was a half-block from Union Square, so we explored the Union Square area including Macy's, Nordstrom and some of the great restaurants in the neighborhood. We were also within walking distance of Chinatown, the Financial District and the Civic Center/Asian Art Museum. A short ride on the bus (at a very affordable senior's discount price) took us to Japantown, with its ethnic restaurants and shops. We were on the bus to Golden Gate Park past Haight-Ashbury with some burned-out hippies from the '60s or '70s who seemed kind of wasted. We also saw many same-sex couples holding hands, hugging and kissing. Quite an interesting trip.
review.userLocation: San Gabriel Valley, Los Angeles County

review.title: Great stay! Will go back!
review.reviewText: Hotel is clean, comfortable and in a great area that is very conveniently located. The room was great. It has wireless internet and a jar of candy which was refilled every day. The staff is friendly and helpful. The cookies and tea in the lobby are a nice touch.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Great location and competent staff.

review.title: I would love to go back.
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for four nights in July and it was excellent. The location is perfect it is adjacent to Union Square, which is close to restaraunts and shopping. The staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms clean. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to San Fransisco.

review.title: Charming Small Hotel
review.reviewText: Having spent 4 nights in this hotel, I would highly recommend this hotel. The location is just perfect, easy access, many shops, cafes and restos nearby. The room is rather small, however it's still ok. The staffs are very friendly, especially the bell captains and front desks. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: The location was ultra convenient, room was perfect, bar was a nice comfortable place to unwind after a day of site-seeing, staff was friendly. Will definitely stay here again the next time I'm in San Francisco!

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in Union Square in San Francisco. Basically the rooms are extremely small especially for two people with luggage. No air conditioning was not a problem other than the bug flying around our room. The hotel is old, cramped and slightly rundown. The desk personnel were great. I think there are better hotels in the area at a slightly higher price.

review.title: Excellent Hotel...very professional and convenient
review.reviewText: This is an excellent hotel to stay at. It is within the union square area close to the shops and the trolley. Walking distance to the bart and the staff at the hotel are very courteous and professional they made my stay there like I was at home. I loved it.

review.title: Location, location, location!
review.reviewText: Rooms are small but nicely furnished. An excellent value for a good hotel that's only a half-block from Union Square.

review.title: excellent
review.reviewText: The hotel met expectations in every way.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Rooms are nice and staff is great. Best location, right at Union Square. Dont drive, fly in and use the very easy and everywhere transportation. Use there tour desk for all your travel and tour needs. Had a great time and we will return.

review.title: Pluses and minuses
review.reviewText: Great location, friendly, helpful staff. One of the best breakfast bars in San Francisco next door, Starbucks across the street and a Walgreens on the corner. The cable car stops outside (but is usually full by the time it reaches this stop). However the lifts broke down regularly (important when you're on the 14th floor) and I was shockked at the room service charges (not cheap to start with, then add 18% tip and a $2 delivery charge).

review.title: Nice hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: We stayed for the Apple developer conference (WWDC). There's a restaurant in the hotel which is pretty good and really convenient. Sears Fine Food is right next door and a great place for breakfast. The walk from the hotel to Moscone is an easy one through Union Square. We will likely stay there again next year. Recommended.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: No major complaints - in general a great place to stay.

review.title: Just what we needed!
review.reviewText: The Chancellor was a wonderful pick for my husband and I. We recently spent 4 days in SF and chose the Chancellor based on reviews, location and cost. It was absolutely perfect! The hotel is central to everything, accessible from the airport via BART and within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and Chinatown. The staff was very welcoming. The room was very clean, although a bit small, but we didn't go to SF to be holed up in a room anyway (besides, it's a historic building and that's how things were made back then before we Americans decided to super-size everything!!) We only had breakfast at Lucque's on one occasion but I must say it was great, the best bacon I have EVER had! I would definitely stay at the Chancellor again.

review.title: Very good experience and value
review.reviewText: Very good value for the Hotel in a great location. Staff were excellent. We will be returning.

review.title: Small but nice
review.reviewText: Hotel was small and the bathroom a little dated but the room was nicely decorated. The major draw to the hotel is the location...it's right in the middle of the Union Square area. The parking package was also a plus...parking was about a block away and had no problems getting it parked or picking it up. If you're looking for a hotel close to shopping and Union Square & can catch a deal then don't hesitate staying here. I would stay here again.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: First time at this hotel. Checked out the reviews on Expedia and took a chance. And we were surprised and delighted with our 5 night stay. Great location next to Union Square on Powell; the friendliest group of employees on all shifts; small but clean,comfortable & tastefully decorated rooms; free warm home-baked cookies & coffee/tea available 24/7 in the lobby. Great price! Excellent service.

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: This hotel was wonderful! Perfect location!

review.title: Lovely hotel on Union square
review.reviewText: We stayed for a 2 night break which we thoroughly enjoyed. The hotel has lots of character, rooms are very clean with nice furnishings. Central location near to restaurants and shops.

review.title: Not bad!
review.reviewText: I was there on a mini vacation with my boyfriend and the hotel was a little better than I thought. The room was a bit small but there was only the 2 of us and I didn't expect a huge room for that price. The employees were good and they serve free coffee and tea throughout the day. The only thing that bothered me "VERY LITTLE" was that one of my towels had a stain on it, but I asked for some new ones and they brought it right up. The location was great also, right where the shopping district was. I would visit this hotel again.

review.title: Best value for vacation/ wish we were there now!
review.reviewText: Location, cleanliness, and friendliness of staff make this our hotel of choice in San Francisco. Easy access to public transport, central location for most destinations, and superior comfort level. Staff is "old school" helpful and polite, and city information for 1st time visitors is abundant. Free coffee and some sort of snack is always available in the lobby, and there is a drugstore on the corner if you need to buy any other little sundries.

review.title: Great Value and Location
review.reviewText: My husband and I decided to take a weekend trip to San Francisco and found a GREAT deal on Expedia. The hotel location is perfect...you can take the BART from the airport right into Union Square and it is only 4 blocks away. We did check in late Friday night so by the time we got there the only available rooms were on the 2nd floor...although the noise was not that bad. All day there was fresh coffee/tea and snacks in the lobby....thought it was a nice touch. Would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Great location, comfortable room
review.reviewText: This hotel was a great deal and was in the best location. The trolley car literally picks you up right across the street - can't beat that! Plus you are very close to lots of shopping, and it is walkable (although a bit challenging) to chinatown, nob hill, etc. I've read other reviews that say the neighborhood is not that great - I have no idea what they are referring to. If you've been in a major city before, then you won't think this neighborhood is bad. In fact, there's a Saks Fifth Avenue across the street - last time I checked, they don't put those in bad neighborhoods. The room was very comfy - and they provided all the normal amenities - umbrella, iron, shampoos, etc. It was clean and the look was very boutique-y. The room was a little bit small, but there was an enormous closet to stuff all your luggage away into. All in all, it was a great place to stay to explore the city from.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Nice, clean hotel with a great downtown location. Can hop on the cable cars and be anyway in a short amount of time.

review.title: Will consider this hotel again
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a convenient location and the price was right. Albeit a little on the old side, the hotel was all together a nice place - the people were friendly and I loved the choice of pillows. I never had the opportunity to select from an array of pillows - great for my neck! - and all free!

review.title: Overall, I enjoyed my stay there
review.reviewText: Pros: very clean and quiet room, staff was very helpful in finding me a quiet room as per my request, good location; Cons: small room, check-in time was 3PM, there was no coffee in the room; Overall I was satisfied with my stay and I would stay there again.

review.title: The Chancellor=Great Location and Comfort
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel is in the perfect location. The staff members were friendly. The room was clean and very comfortable. The best part was that wireless internet service was free.

review.title: Cute little place to stay in idea location
review.reviewText: Not having an extravagant budget this place suited our needs. Conveniently located near Union Square and if I recall correctly we got the free parking package...the parking lot was within reasonable walking distance from the hotel, a block I think so everything worked out nicely.

review.title: wonderful gem
review.reviewText: What a lovely little hotel in the heart of Union Square!! There is world class shopping just steps from the front door. The room was just right-we had a room with twin beds that were so comfortable. The pillows were great. The room faced Powell Street and you would never know it. The roon was quiet. The staff was superb. Don't hesitate to stay at the Chancellor.

review.title: Great location, comfy hotel!
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel and would definitely stay there again. it's in a great location on Powell Street, only a few blocks from the cable car turnaround, Close to Union Square for shopping and tram, trolleybus, train links. The room was quite small and no view but the bed was wonderfully comfy and the free fresh baked cookies and coffee everyday was fantastic!

review.title: Hot and poor ventilation
review.reviewText: Room faced west.HOT AFTERNOON SUN. window would not open. Ceiling fan going full blast to no avail. ROOM 902. we should have asked for another room. room should never been rented this time of year MAY. Great location. Clean but CRAMPED BATHROOM. SF has lots of small hotels in general area, have stayed in several with no problem. Would not return.

review.title: Great location, good hotel
review.reviewText: First things first, this hotel has a great location!! Near to cable car line and the BART station. Overall I had a very pleasant stay. Room was clean, comfortable, and bright. As other reviewers have mentioned the rooms are small by US standards, but wasn't an issue for me. Remember to bring your own conditioner, since the hotel only provides shampoos :).

review.title: Great value on Union Square
review.reviewText: I spent 4 nights at the Chancellor while in town for a convention. I had initially planned to stay closer to the Moscone Center, but the convenience of Union Square to restaurants and shopping drew me to the Chancellor, as did the very affordable rates. Based on other reviews I requested a high floor room at the rear of the building. I was given a room at the back the 13th floor, which made for some interesting banter with the bellman in the elevator. The room was smallish, with a double bed, but perfectly adequate for one and there was plenty of closet space. The bath was compact, clearly old, but decently updated; had my wife been along I'm sure we'd have wished it was bigger, but it was fine for one. Lack of AC was not a problem, but I can imagine that it could be. I'd request a north or east facing room in the summer. Breakfast was very tasty, a decent value, and service was prompt and attentive, so I was able to get in and out quickly, which I really appreciated. Overall, I was very impressed with the level of service received and the Chancellor's staff was very friendly. The only thing I didn't really like was the lobby bar - it certainly wasn't anywhere I'd want to have a drink, just not a very attractive or welcoming space. Perhaps without TV it would have had more appeal. I'd recommend the Chancellor to travelers looking for a hotel with a convenient location and great service who can do without marble bathrooms and empty square footage.

review.title: Centrally located with cable car access out the front door.
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel based on reviews from others who have stayed at the Chancellor, and we were not disappointed. The rooms are small but we like the ambience of an older hotel, and the fact that we were a short distance from everything we wanted to see. The rooms are nicely furnished, the entire staff very helpful, and there was always a fresh cup of coffee available in the lobby. Considering that we were only in our room to shower and sleep, it was perfect.

review.title: The room was great, the lady at the information desk downstairs...not so great.
review.reviewText: The rooms were pretty nice

review.title: very well
review.reviewText: This is my 2nd time to stay in Chancellor,although its room is small,I fell it is very comfort to me,service is good.

review.title: excellent
review.reviewText: excellent

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Booked this hotel for a Birthday getaway for my wife and I because of all the great reviews. Upon arrival we went up to our room on the top floor where a bottle of champagne was waiting for us. The room and bed were very comfortable, bathroom is a bit small but you don't spend most of your time in there so it's a mute point. You cant beat the location, it is right in the thick of everything you could possibly want, cable car is out front, shops, restaurants... I am a very picky person and I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location, and good services and rooms. Recommended.

review.title: The chancellor hotel is very nice
review.reviewText: The hotel is small and there rooms are smaller than a marriot other chain hotel but if your looking for a some thing fun and in the center ofall thats going on in san fran this hotel is a good choice we will stay there again if we go back to san fran.

review.title: Excellent value, superb location.
review.reviewText: The holiday to San Francisco was to celebrate our wedding annivesary and 50th birthday. The hotel staff were very helpful and the room was comfortable and very clean. We didn't use hotel amenities, but only because we wanted to go out and about and explore the city and outlying districts. Free tea, coffee and home baked cookies were always available in the sumptuous lobby area, these were lovely and always welcome after a day in and around the bay.

review.title: Great Location/Nice Amenities
review.reviewText: The hotel was in good condition, friendly staff, and conveniently located to Union Square, historic landmarks, Chinatown, the trolley, etc. Would definitely stay there on a return trip.

review.title: Great Deal
review.reviewText: Parking/Hotel Rate Lots of Ammenities Very helpful staff

review.title: It was great!!
review.reviewText: We are definitely going back. It was right smack in the middle of Union Square. We had a great stay!! Room was clean and very comfortable. Don't expect it to be quiet, though, because it's right at Union Square but we had a room away from the street so it wasn't that bad... But, all in all, a great place to stay.

review.title: Will use it every time in SF!
review.reviewText: Was great. Helpful staff. Good cookies and apples in the lobby. Convenient parking. Great location. Had a little noise from an adjacent roof when work was being done on it EARLY in the morning, but not the hotel's fault.

review.title: Well worth a visit - will hope to return again soon
review.reviewText: We took the BART from the airport to Powel Street and it was a light walk up hill to the hotel (5mins). Although we had a room on the forth floor with a view over the fire escape (!!) and the room was smaller than the one we had at at a 3* stip hotel in Vegas I would stay here any day over the other hotel. The room was stylish, clean and comfortable (best sleep in USA!) and we were made to feel most welcome by all the staff even though we had only 3 nights here. Excellently placed for connections with car hire, local transport just round the corner. You can dine cheaply or up market, your choise within minutes of stepping out the door. Lots to see from area so will be working on hubby to go back to same place again.

review.title: Small hotel great value
review.reviewText: This small hotel is extremely convenient for business or tourist travel. We stayed there with 2 children and were very happy with the complimentary coffee, apples, cookies, and newspapers that were available any time of day. The staff was very helpful at giving directions and making restaurant reservations, etc. My Children particularly liked the "pillow menu" from which you could choose many kinds of specialty pillows to make your slepp more comfortable. We accidentally left some items in the room after checking out and the staff could not have been any more kind and generous in sending the items to our home.

review.title: A lovely hotel
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the Chancellor. The hotel is in a fantastic location - right on the Powell cable car line which travels up to Fishermans Wharf, and excellent for shopping and only 5 minutes from chinatown. The room was very clean and comfortable and the restaurant was fab - we ate breakfast there every day. The staff were welcoming and helpful. If we go back to san Francisco - which I hope we will - we would definately stay in the Chancellor again.

review.title: Spring fling in San Fran
review.reviewText: Great location. Cable car stop right in front of hotel. 1/2 block to Union Square. Room was small but that's par for a hotel built in the 1910s. Clean. Hotel does not have air conditioning. Was not an issue for us in March but given the relatively noisy street scene, a summer stay could be a bit uncomfortable. Staff was very helpful with reasonable, non touristy restaurants. No Gym facilities on site but Hotel has an agreement with a local public Gym one block away with decent equipment. Overall we had an excellent stay and would recommend.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was perfect for our needs. We spent most of our time out doing things. It was clean and comforable. Good value with the included parking and internet. Nice to get the cable car right in front. The room was quiet because we were on the back side. I have stayed here in the front and it was noisy. Staff was helpful

review.title: Waited past check in time to get in.
review.reviewText: Great views of Union Square.

review.title: Perfect Surroundings
review.reviewText: A wonderful old-world hotel in the heart of San Francisco. Right on the Powell Street cable car line which you can hop to so many sights. Easy walking to superb dim sum and spectacular views of the bay. Drivers beware -- Powell Street is extremely busy. There are spaces in front of the hotel where you can park to unload and where you can leave your car until the valet parks it -- 20 minutes for valet to retrieve your car. I considered this a minor inconvenience for such a great hotel. We absolutely needed a car to drive to the Valley -- if you don't need one, leave it at home.

review.title: great location, great price!
review.reviewText: i really enjoyed this boutique hotel. great location, very central. nicely appointed room and comfortable bed. staff was very friendly and helpful as well. a nice hotel experience all around.

review.title: Fantastic
review.reviewText: Exactly as stated in the Expedia guide, comfy, friendly and very close to ALL the action. I had an amazing holiday and would highly recommend this hotel, may even use it again if im ever back in 'The City' again!

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: Overall, good hotel, great location. Very clean, staff was helpful and polite. Room was small...but it is San Francisco...

review.title: Small Room, Great Location.
review.reviewText: The room was very clean, recently painted and all new furniture(including an LCD TV), but it was very small. The location was great, as soon as you come out the door you were in Union Square. The hotel bar was dated and very small. For me that was the worst part of the hotel. If you desire a cocktail I would suggest going to one of the other Hotel bars. I would recommend this hotel for a short stay (2 - 3 nights) as it one of the cheaper hotels next to Union Square.

review.title: Nice Place
review.reviewText: The room was small, but clean and functional. For a short trip to the City, it's great - all the amenities you need, especially if you spend your time out and about.

review.title: Great location for a great price
review.reviewText: My husband and I recently stayed at the Chancellor Hotel while attending a party in the city. I'm very familiar with the Union Square area and hadn't ever noticed this hotel even though it's right in the heart of the best location of the area. The park and stay option was a great deal. The room was tastefully decorated, clean and comfortable. A little on the small side, but that's what I would expect from an older hotel. It had charm. I have already recommended this hotel to others and would definitely stay again.

review.title: I only use this hotel,
review.reviewText: This is a perfect place to stay. Everyone is so friendly and helpful. It is very close to walk to Union Square. The bart at the airport drops you off 3 blocks from the hotel. The trolley picks you up in front of the hotel and takes you straight to Fishermans warf.

review.title: Chancellor Hotel - San Francisco
review.reviewText: Good location, in the heart of Union Square. The rooms and bathroom were a bit too small, but the Chancellor is a smaller boutique hotel that was built back in the early 1900's, so I can understand that. Staff was quite courteous and helpful. I also picked this hotel because of their "parking package" offer to save some $$$. Parking in San Francisco is extremely pricey!

review.title: Great location, good value
review.reviewText: We had a pleasant one night stay at this hotel, my husband and I chose it for the Union Square location and the price. The room was clean, decently furnished and decorated and had a nice flat screen TV and iPOD hook up. The staff were helpful and pleasant. The room and ensuite were a bit on the small side but were perfectly adequate for our over-night stay. There was a pillow menu - we didn't notice it in time to order any, nice touch though!

review.title: Close to Everything
review.reviewText: This is an affordable option in Union Square. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful. It's walking distance to great shopping, restaurants, and attractions. If you don't want the exercise,the hotel is right on the cable car line or a block away from the buslines.

review.title: Would go there again!
review.reviewText: The location was excellent. Right on the trolley car route. Parking was free! That was a bonus. Morning coffee,tea cookies and apples were a good start to our day. Staff very friendly and helpful. Lady at the guide area was helpful for getting our day pass on the street cars and trolley.

review.title: Charming Little Hotel
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, clean room, close to everything. I'll stay there whenever I go to San Francisco.

review.title: It was great until...
review.reviewText: The shuttle from the hotel to the airport was extremely poor. We booked it at the tour desk inside the hotel the day prior, and there was no mention the shuttle would be making multiple stops after picking us up. On top of that, the van was in sad shape- it had been raining that day and there was rain dripping from the dome light. The driver seemed indifferent to our and other customer's needs. Other than that, I recommend the hotel, but do hope they don't associate themselves with this particular shuttle service no longer. If you stay there, book your own shuttle with airport licensed companies, or take a cab.

review.title: Fine hotel in a central location
review.reviewText: I would stay at this hotel again. It's very centrally located and it is moderately priced. Not too expensive not too cheap either, just right, I would say.

review.title: Have already recommended to other people
review.reviewText: Good location near Union Square and cable car lines. A short walk to Chinatown and the French section. Very enjoyable.

review.title: Perfect for us
review.reviewText: The location was perfect for two tourists getting to know San Francisco. The staff were friendly and helpful Highly recommended

review.title: Can't wait to go back~ The perfect location in Union Square
review.reviewText: My brother and I stayed in Chancellor Hotel from Jan. 28-Feb. 6, 2009. This hotel is located in the perfect location, 3-4 blocks from the cable car last stop but NOT steep walking distance. We took BART from SFO airport to Union Square and walked to our hotel. This hotel is also located in between Borders bookstore and Walgreens (24 hr store), with major shopping mall and store around it. The hotel's tour desk staff Susan is a very nice lady who can help you book different day trips. In general, the hotel staff is wonderful. FREE Internet access with printing, complimentary coffee, tea and coffee in the hotel lobby.

review.title: Price is right
review.reviewText: This is an OK hotel, but we got great rates with parking included.

review.title: Great Location, Helpful Staff
review.reviewText: Needed a place to stay one night on my own with a good location. Very friendly staff and just up the street from the Bart station. Many other great places to eat and drink nearby. Rooms smallish, but clean and up to date.

review.title: Charming hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: For our first visit to the city we booked the hotel here not knowing what to expect. We drove down, and if you're driving opt for the package that includes parking just around the corner from the hotel. Although the hotel looks and is old, it's absolutely beautiful with lots of charm and style. The rooms are nicely decorated, with an amazing view (we had the Powell St view from top floor). The rooms are very clean, and staff are helpful. We are picky with cleanliness adn had no issues with that at all. Also the hotel is literally located in the centre of everything. Kitty corner from Union Square, 5 minute walk to Market St shops, and the cable cars are right at your door steps. Great restaurants are literally steps away. Would stay there again. Although my wife and I are young (26 and 31 years old) we love the old style decor, charm, and service. Would recommend to first time visitors, and anyone without a car as transportation and shops are steps away.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel is charming, older style hotel with fresh carpet, paint, updated bathrooms, decor, etc. Room was on the small side, but since I was travelling alone it was fine. Appreciated the free wifi in room. Not sure I'd stay there in the summer as there is no air conditioning, only ceiling fan. But I was there in Jan. Staff was extremely nice and helpful. Needed directions and info on business I was looking for and they did a great job of helping me out. Lobby bar is a nice cozy place to hang out. Would definetly recommend!

review.title: Great Location - Would go back!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location (and had a great price) - right downtown in the centre of the shopping district! Don't think for location/price it could be beat. It is also a couple minutes (walking) from the subway system (that takes you to/from airport), all transit systems, and many local attractions. The room was very comfortable and the staff was very pleasant and helpful. Would definitely go back again! If you are planning to go keep in mind this hotel was constructed in the 1920's, and was recently renovated.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: First time in San Francisco. Very nice people, spontaneously helpfull at the desk, especially the concierge. Very well located if tou wish to see downtown and city center and Chinatown nearby. From there, we were able to take an ample city walking tour, taking us up to Coit tower, down to Fisherman's Wharf, visit Alcatraz after lunch and back to the hotel before dinner, even though it might be considered a strenuous walk by some... Nearby parking, included in the price if you chose that option. The standard room we had was clean but quite small, unless you have little luggage.

review.title: Satisfied
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location, adequate accommodations. No free breakfast, but the breakfast is very, very good.

review.title: A Great Price and a Great Location
review.reviewText: This was a great find. Located in the city in the heart of everything. There was plenty of shopping, dining, and leisure places to go steps away. I would go back again!

review.title: Can't Wait To Go Back
review.reviewText: It was a great experience, the hotel was great, the staff were friendly and very helpful. It was a nice relaxing trip for us. The room was a bit small but it was still very nice and clean.

review.title: Amazing Stay
review.reviewText: A great hotel. Located in the center of downtown San Francisco, the Chancellor provides the best features at very competitive prices. Noteworthy were the helpful personnel at the lobby, fast internet, free parking and of course the very good condition of the room.

review.title: Ideal base for San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel Chandler made our stay in San Francisco a memorable one, they had took the trouble to make us feel special as it was the first leg of our honeymoon. Our room was spacious, comfortable and clean, and they'd left out some champagne and chocolates on arrival which was a nice touch. The front desk staff were more than helpful with suggestions, directions and getting us sorted out with travel arrangements (Suzie in the shop in particular)

review.title: Cozy place to stay
review.reviewText: We stayed at the hotel for a mid-week shopping trip. The hotel is conveniently located to shopping, restaurants, the theater district and many transportation lines. The rooms are small but nicely appointed, bright and very clean. The staff was very friendly and the tiny bar downstairs was perfect for a post-shopping wind-down drink!

review.title: Perfect for shopping in Union Square
review.reviewText: This place was right by Union Square, maybe a two to three minute walk. The hotel is older but that makes it have its personality. Everything is very nice and well kept up. There is a lot of brass and marble and it was decorated nice for Christmas. The room was small and clean and had everything you need. The room had been updated recently. The closet was a walk in, perfect for storing purchases. The staff was great and the little restaurant they have for breakfast and lunch was very good. We had breakfast there and were pleasantly surprised. They have a little bar also. There are also several good restaurants steps away from here.

review.title: Not the Ritz, but clean and adequate
review.reviewText: The hotel honored all of my room requests (high floor, far away from elevator, quiet.) The lobby staff were extremely helpful about answering all of my questions about public bus routes and they seemed to enjoy highlighting routes out for me on maps. My room had a bright green painted wall that didn't match the decor, but it was clean with a comfortable bed. The extremely narrow bathroom shelf above the toilet allowed my dental floss and hotel hand lotion to separately fall into the toilet bowl.

review.title: Quaint and convenient
review.reviewText: This is the second time we stayed here and couldn't be happier. Park and stay package is great with the garage a block away. Union Square half a block away. No view and the rooms are tiny, but the convenience outweighs those negatives. What more can you ask of San Francisco when you can hear the cable cars clanging from your room?

review.title: Great location; comfortable accomodations
review.reviewText: A clean, well-appointed room steps from Union Square.

review.title: very nice
review.reviewText: nice location, very comfortable and clean. would definitely go back.

review.title: Tip-top location
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel is an unassuming, but clean and comfortable hotel near good restaurants and shopping options--from Euro-design boutiques to major American department stores. We stayed on the 15th floor, but the elevator was fast enough to go up and down with coffee and cookies at a whim.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: There is a good place to walk.

review.title: good location and very comfortable
review.reviewText: nice

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: located in the union square, makes this hotel of of the most convenient hotels. the rooms are really small. but are clean.

review.title: well placed, well kept, and unpretentious old hotel that is a good value
review.reviewText: Rooms and baths small but comfortable and clean, in superb location near Union Square that is great for walking and catching the cable car from

review.title: It was perfect!
review.reviewText: My stay at the Chancellor was fabulous. Great location. Easy to find from the Bart station and right on Union square. In the heart of it all! The people were freindly, service was great and my room was just what I wanted and needed. Great linens and pillows and a superb bath tub! It is right on the cable car line so site seeing was a breeze. I will definitely go back to San Francisco and will always stay at the Chancellor. You can't beat the location or the price! Loved it!

review.title: Great location- old San Francisco with charm
review.reviewText: This is a good deal and a nice place. If you are into chains with road warriors at the donut table in the morning, forget about it. If you can pause a bit and see the charm, its a good stay. Location could not be better either for tourism or business.

review.title: Excellent value!
review.reviewText: There were so many positives to this hotel. The hotel is situated within view of Union Square and in the center of everything. The room is small but is beautifully decorated with a very large closet. We were on vacation and only slept in the room anyway. The hotel has a restaurant too with decent prices because some of the food in the area is pricey. The parking is in a garage 1/2 a block away but the attendants park it for you and let you use the car when you want. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco for business or pleasure except families with children or large groups.

review.title: Chancellor Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location. Great price. Great experience.

review.title: Great spot
review.reviewText: Good hotel in a great spot. Extremely helpful hotel staff. Rooms are a bit on the small side but are enough to meet your needs for a short stay. Only suggestion for improvement would be to include breakfast as part of the room rate.

review.title: A truly pleasant experience
review.reviewText: I had booked my vacation 2 days before I broke my leg and couldn't cancel it! But I couldn't have stayed at a better place! They were so acoomodating. We were celebrating our anniversary and they had a great package available and all set up when I arrived. A great plus are the fresh homebaked cookies and coffee/tea/hot cocoa available 24/7! The location is amazing and everything of interest in accessible. This place is wonderful and a great value for the price!

review.title: Excellent position, prompt service, nice people
review.reviewText: Great pro: free internet and print outs... which I do not get in many luxury hotels. My husband loved the complimentary cookies and coffee served in the lobby (which are a great idea for people leaving early for tours outside town) and the rubber duck..

review.title: Great Staff
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful and gracious. The bar was cute and personal and breakfast was delicious at their hotel restaurant. The hotel couldn't be in a better spot. Shopping, restaurants, and transit all over the area.

review.title: I would go back on my next trip
review.reviewText: This is a quaint hotel. It's not flamboyant by any means, but it's in a great location in respect with Union Square and other locations one would want to see. I was there on business it was a perfect room for that. I like how there was free Wifi in the hotel, but it was sometimes hard to connect to it.

review.title: Great location; otherwise very cozy
review.reviewText: I stay at the Chancellor for two nights over Halloween. What this hotel mainly has going for it is location/price. It's right on Powell St, so there's very easy access to the Powell St cable car ... and it's just a few block walk to the Westfield Mall and tons of other shopping and dining. The downside is ... everything about it is small. The rooms are cozy, the stairwells and elevator are tiny etc. Two of the more major downsides for us were the lack of air conditioning and the room service. It was late October and the ceiling fan wasn't cutting it so we opened the window, which helped but there were sirens blazing all night. Secondly, we left our order on the door for room service and they simply forgot to grab it. Parking is fairly simple ... just about a block away in the 450 Sutter garage, so if you don't pay for valet be prepared for that. Drive up, check in and drop off your luggage before heading to the garage. Likewise

review.title: Not great for business
review.reviewText: Rooms are fine but restaurant didn't open until 7:00 a.m. and there was no room service Monday or Tuesday. Location was nice and rooms were comfortable but amenities for business travelers were lacking.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised
review.reviewText: What a great little gem in the heart of San Francisco! Great location on cable car line, easy access to major sites and easy walking to shopping, dining and visitor sites. My room was clean, comfortable and quiet. Would definitely come back again.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice. Rooms were just redone. They were just a little small, but done very well. Parking is around the corner (because of one way streets it's about 5 blocks to drive to it... and find it) but about 1/2 block to walk it.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The only problem with this hotel is that there was no air conditioning available in the rooms. In September, the room got quite warm when we came back in the evening.

review.title: The Chancellor
review.reviewText: I was quite pleased with the awesome location and very affordable rates. The hotel itself was first class, full of ambience and otherwise terrific. The room was a delight, cleaned well and I loved the environmentally conscious theme. However, upon arrival at 9:30 in the morning I was told that the room would not be ready until 3 pm. THIS is probably the only real complaint I have as my wife and I were on our honeymoon and pretty exhausted after the early flight. our only option was to pretty much wander around the city until the room was ready several hours later which we did. Sure, we had a good time doing it but, come on, if I pay fro something I expect it to be ready when I get there. Overall, though, it was a wonderful experience and we will be staying there on return trips. We will just take a later flight.

review.title: Awesome location for the price
review.reviewText: Very quaint hotel within walking distance to all the shops and sights. Many have mentioned the room to be small, which it may be for more than two people. I highly recommend it!

review.title: A UNION SQAURE DELIGHT
review.reviewText: Being a commuter to the city, I have been to many 'boutique' hotels...This is the first time I have stayed at the Chancellor... To my surprise, it was delightful...A wonderful staff, a well decorated room, clean... Loved my all day long complimentary tea in the lobby.. I will be back..!!!

review.title: OK, but not great
review.reviewText: Chancellor is an 'older' hotel. I didn't realize it didn't have air conditioning, luckily, it was a cool evening and the ceiling fan did the trick. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Continental breakfast is pushing it a bit, more like free coffee in the lobby.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: We found everything about the hotel to be very nice. It was an excellent location, convenient to multiple public transportation options. There is also plenty of shopping and dining choices within walking distance. Our room was clean and comfortable. I found the bed to be better than other hotels I have stayed in and the pillow menu was a nice touch. Overall I feel we got more than or moneys' worth at the Chancellor.

review.title: great hotel!
review.reviewText: great hotel at great location! and great price too! I recommend!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel...helpful friendly staff, great location, very good value for money.

review.title: Loved the Chancellor
review.reviewText: The room was very pretty and the hotel charming. Though the room was small it was not an issue since we spent most of our time out exploring the city. It had a comfortable homey feel with a nice white comforter and lots of cozy pillows in addition to the specialty pillows offered. Apples, cookies, coffee and tea in the lobby at all times were a nice touch. Big bathtub with bath salts supplied was appreciated after a long day with lots of walking. We spent 2 nights at the Chancellor. The location was great. Our second night we rode the cable car and hopped off right at the door. Traffic in front could be a bit noisy at night, but we just closed the window when we went to bed (the weather was not hot and there was a ceiling fan)

review.title: Good location. Very clean and comfortable.
review.reviewText: I especially liked the tea and coffee available all day.

review.title: Very well located
review.reviewText: Rooms are small but very well acondicionated. well, you can listen very good closer rooms... Location is the best in San Francisco

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Room very well appointed with super comfortable beds with wide choice of pillows--made for a wonderful nights sleep after walking all over the city. Wonderful old fashioned bath tub--deep and long and just what I needed to calm the sore muscles. Old hotel but nicely updated and if you are lucky enough to get a front room facing Union Square with a full moon coming in the window you have hit the jackpot. Just where I wanted to be--right on the cable car line and in the middle of everything!!

review.title: Great central SF location
review.reviewText: Would def recommend this hotel

review.title: Good hotel at reasonable price
review.reviewText: I was very happy with the condition and service of this smaller, old hotel. It can be a bit noisy if you get a room at the front. Take earplugs. Excellent location for tourists and only a 10 minute walk to conference center.

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: Good hotel for the price. Old but clean and staff very attentive.

review.title: Will definitely be back.
review.reviewText: The location is ideal, hotel is charming and staff is helpful and accommodating. The rooms provide about all the space you need, fits two perfectly. We will definitely be going back.

review.title: Great hotel and location
review.reviewText: Location was terrific. Close to Union Square and all transportation. Room was comfortable, clean, bed was extremely comfortable. Room is small but very well done. Hotel was close to shopping resataurants and entertainment. Hotel was rich looking, staff helpful and frendly. I would go back and would recommend it to anyone

review.title: Small town feel
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very pleasant with exception to the lady who works at the kiosk in the lobby. I think she is there to help guest with tour arrangements, there are snacks available...etc. I found her to be very rude, as though she did not really like her job. Other than that the hotel is very charming, offers a small town atmosphere in a big city.

review.title: Liked it enough to go back
review.reviewText: Location is great - steps from Union Square with its concerts, and near countless restaurants, public transportation, and shopping. Noteworthy points within the hotel include the staff's attentiveness and friendly assistance, and the quality of food and speedy service at Luques, the restaurant and bar.

review.title: Great Location - definitely go back!!!
review.reviewText: It was our first time to San Francisco and didn't know what to expect...once we got to the hotel we were pleasantly surprised! Caddie-Corner from Union Square, a cable car stop right in front of our hotel, a starbucks across the street, great restaurants in walking distance and shopping! The hotel was crisp and clean with decently friendly employees. They had internet access thru the building and an actual computer with access that you can use in the lobby. It is an old hotel, but it has been kept up well! Negatives #1 - Thin walls (could definitely hear the neighbors) and noisy streets (although we actually enjoyed that!) #2 - we thought the restaurant downstairs served dinner but it was only lunch and breakfast (quite good breakfast too!)

review.title: In the heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: You wont find a more reasonably priced hotel in Union Square that is clean and comfortable. Not many frills but more than adequate for your place to crash while visiting San Francisco. I saw other hotels in the area priced considerably higher that were further from the trolleys and the downtown.

review.title: Great Location for San Fran
review.reviewText: Although my first impressions were that this was a bit old fashioned when I arrived, the room and hotel were very clean, homely and comfortable. Moreover, the location of this hotel is superb, just up from Union Square and with easy access to many districts in this fantastic city. Couple of other tips - book your own hire car (don't rely on the hotel to get you one as they didn't for us), and pre-book your trip to Alcatraz (if that is what you want to do). Also, the hotel bar closes early, which isn't a problem as there are plenty of places close by, but don't rely on it for a night cap! Good hotel, in a prime location that was both comfortable and convenient.

review.title: nice value, great location in midst of it all
review.reviewText: DH and I took a get away trip for my 40th bday. This hotel was exactly as we had hoped. Yes, the rooms were small, but neat, tidy and updated in nice colors. The bed was comfortable and I have to say as a woman who is 20 weeks pregnant the pillow menu was a BIG bonus. I was able to order up a body pillow and it made all the difference. Who wants to pack one of those, after all. The only thing I can say negative was the temp of the room. It was toasty. Still if you kept open the window for the early evening it stayed okay temp wise during the night. Far too noisy in Union Square to leave it open all night. Other bonuses: bought a pass for trolley in lobby, free apples, tea and coffee

review.title: Exceeded Expectations
review.reviewText: Half a block from Union Square with the garage around the corner. Convenient loading zone right in front of hotel. Rooms and bathrooms are very small, but don't need much for sleeping. Appreciated the twin beds. Spotlessly clean, which was the most important thing. No way to adjust coolness of room so had to use ceiling fan and keep a window open. There was some industrial noise but we were too tired to care.
