Sears Restaurant right next door is good, but service is mediocre. Lots of other places to eat in every direction. Parking package made it very easy.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: small, nice, great staff and location.

review.title: Wonderful stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was reasonably priced, convenient to transportation and very comfortable and clean. Everyone I met was welcoming and friendly, very responsive. Thoroughly positive experience.

review.title: Great location and price
review.reviewText: I will definitely stay at this hotel again, great location and price. The staff was really helpful and friendly.

review.title: Perfect hotel in a fabulous location.
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel was a great place to stay and the staff was super. We had a good room, comfortable bed and loved our location. We will be back to the Chancellor Hotel.

review.title: Very Clean
review.reviewText: Hotel has been refurbished. Great service. Convenient to many activities.

review.title: Clean & New
review.reviewText: I travel every week for work and this hotel was very nice. The rooms were extremely small though. All amenities, hotel staff and accessibility were top notch.

review.title: Can not wait to return!
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel is a lovely older boutique hotel. They have done a wonderful job in updating the rooms. The hotel is in a perfect location to Union Square and the cable car stop is right in front of the hotel.The hotel staff were friendly and helpful.We are making plans to go back next month!

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: If you want excellent location and reasonable location in San Francisco, this is your place.

review.title: Great location, Great price and and great place to stay for 3 nights
review.reviewText: We stayed in the Chancellor for 3 nights at the end of a 2 week tour round California. The location is amazing and we got a great rate. The rooms aren't massive, as the hotel isn't huge, but they're more than comfortable and having stayed in SF before I haven't found anywhere else that is as central for as good a price for the standard the chancellor provides

review.title: Great position
review.reviewText: Well positioned hotel at Union Square close to shops, restaurants and transport. Cable car right outside. Older style hotel with lots of character. Staff were all friendly and helpful. We stayed on two occasions and our first room was much bigger than the second. We had breakfast there each morning which was very reasonably priced. Try the fruit cup for $5.

review.title: Great Choice Near Union Square
review.reviewText: This hotel was near-perfect for the money. Good location, excellent staff, free coffee, refreshments, fruit. Good inexpensive breakfast in the restaurant. Quiet. This is an older hotel, with a few modest disadvantages like narrow stairs (if you use stairs) and no air conditioning--but San Fran does not get that hot. All in all, highly recommended.

review.title: Reasonable price, good location, ok ovreall
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a very good location near Union Square is rather reasonably priced. However it is definitely dated and could use some freshening up in the areas such ascarpeting, furniture, paint. Staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: Very comfortable hotel and extremely convenient to Union Square and Shopping.

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: This hotel had the most pleasant and informative staff I have ever witnessed.

review.title: Had a wonderful time
review.reviewText: The Chancellor was great. We stayed for two nights and had wonderful service checking in and out. The front desk was also helpful with all types of information. It was a surprising hot weekend for San Francisco, but the ceiling fan kept the room nice and cool. Just keep both windows open. I recommend the parking pass since the hotel is downtown. It was easy to check in and drop off the bags with the curb side parking. The parking garage is right around the corner and easy to get to if you need it. But who wants to drive in San Francisco.

review.title: Geat Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: Although the room was a bit small, it was very nicely decorated and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel staff was exceptionally helpful. Would also recommend the resturant in the hotel as a more accessable and economical alternative breakfast destination to the famous one next door. The food and service were very good.

review.title: Would stay again. Excellent location.
review.reviewText: Cookies and coffee in reception area were a great treat all day around. Drink vouchers for the bar and shopping voucher for Macys also great. Hotel not as 'new' as expected from the published write up on its recent renovation but everything was clean and in working order and the rooms were well big enough and functional. Great value for what we paid and would stay again and recommend to others. Can't beat the location - you can walk or commute via public transport to any area from the hotel. Just get out there and enjoy!

review.title: Treated like Gold, as if they really wanted us there. Will definitely return.
review.reviewText: We travelled 7 major cities in USA and this hotel was at the top of our list. We were treated like Gold, and the staff actually cared about their customers and ensured we were looked after.

review.title: I always stay here
review.reviewText: I've been to SF four times now and I've always stayed at this hotel, not only for the locality (right on the cable car line and on Union Square) but the friendliness of the staff. Upon arrival, they were able to get us a room for early check in and we arrived at 10am! You can't go wrong when staying at this hotel. For the location, the price is excellent. The only drawback is they only have two small elevators for 15 floors. So, if you come in on a sold out weekend and got a room somewhere in the middle, you may have to take the stairs. Luckily, we stayed on the 15th so we always got an empty elevator. Other than that, you only need a room to sleep and this hotel has the best price for it's location.

review.title: My SFO Vacation
review.reviewText: Hotel is clean, staff very helpful & killer location (Union Square) It has Free Wi-Fi on the entire hotel, rooms have a modern look since it was renovated 7months ago. Only thing you need to be prepared is the valet parking, they use a 3rd party parking lot so the rate is a bit to high. Other than that this hotel is perfect on both budget & location.

review.title: a good value
review.reviewText: room was small but clean....had windows that opened which to me is always better than air conditioning. great location .... was able to walk all over the city and pick up mass transit with no difficulties at all. staff was exceedingly polite, made me feel very welcome. little touches count, like the rubber ducky and the jar of hard candy. would absolutely stay here again.

review.title: Good for the money
review.reviewText: This is my second time at the Chancellor, and I'll be back again. Don't expect luxury, and since you're right on Union Square you'll experience the benefits (and drawbacks) of being in the middle of a major city. The Chancellor is a comfortable place to stay, and an excellent value for the location.

review.title: Great value - perfect location
review.reviewText: We chose the Chancellor based on reviews and were not disappointed. It's a small hotel steps from all the shops on Union Square, great restuarants and a cable car stop at the door. The rooms are smaller than some but well furnished and super comfortable beds and pillows. They have coffee/tea, cookies and apples in the lobby all day which is a nice treat. Parking is right around the corner at a secure lot - but I don't recommend driving in San Fran :) We'd recommend the Chancellor and look forward to our next stay here.

review.title: Lovely Place to Stay...
review.reviewText: Stayed here for my husbands birthday in May. Staff were very welcoming and helpful. Room was small, but thats to be expected, so wasn't a big deal to us. Room was clean and comfortable and we were thrilled with the awesome location of it. Located by tons of shopping, restaurants, pubs and attractions... we'd totally stay with this hotel again, most definitely.

review.title: Fine at a good price
review.reviewText: With the special rate we got it was no supprise to find a small cramped room awaited us. (Room 1300) However it was quite OK, after all we came to experience SanFrancisco not the Hotel room. Great location, just a small walk away from local transport systems. (Which are really easy to work with) Plenty to see do and eat in the area.

review.title: Perfect hotel for a short stay in a marvellous city
review.reviewText: A very good "standard" hotel in an excellent location. Perfect for sightseeing, shopping and dining out. The room was clean, well kept and comfortable. The foyer and bar areas are quite small, but you shouldn't expect to spend any time there apart from checking in and out. You couldn't be in a better location for setting out to explore this wonderful city.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: This hotel is certainly very well located in Union Square, with all the attractions within walking distance. We found the room clean and the beds comfortable.The only thing was that we expected the bathroom to be newer due to the apparent recent renovations that the hotel had undergone. Will definitely be back though as staff were courteous and helpful.

review.title: Terrific hotel in perfect location
review.reviewText: Elegant, upscale hotel right on Union square. Very reasonable prices, esp for location. Highly recommended.

review.title: Can Highly Recommend This Superb Hotel
review.reviewText: This wonderful Hotel is centrally located on Powell Street at the Union Square. The rooms are not very large but this is compensated by the overall cleanliness of the rooms, the bathrooms, and the hotel in general. The beds had sparkling white linens with a host of pillow choices for your personal comfort. The bathroom boasted various lotions and soaps and even a yellow rubber duck for the bathtub. The staff was friendly and efficient and the lobby offered cookies, apples,coffee,and other complimentary items throughout the day. Parking was conveniently located within a block of the hotel in a covered parking facility. When I return to San Francisco I will certainly stay at the "Chancellor" again.

review.title: FABULOUS LOCATION!!!
review.reviewText: This was an old, but very nice and well maintained hotel. The rooms were small (as advertised) but very comfortable. The staff is fabulous and very helpful. The location is fantastic! Cable cars stop right outside the door to take you to Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square is right around the corner, Chinatown is a very short walk. This hotel is in the middle of everything.

review.title: Highly Recommended
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel is an older hotel that offers a taste of old San Francisco charm with stylish guest rooms. My wife and I were very pleased with the service from the point of check in. The room was clean, stocked with above average amenities, including some neat features like the DIY Spa package for the tub and a pillow menu. Even the ice bucket was classy. The bed was comfortable, the noise was low, except on the weekends and in the mornings. Waking up to the clanging of the cable car was more of fun, unique experience vs. an annoyance. There is no air conditioning. If it is over 80F outside, it might get a bit stuffy. The room was also a decent size for two adults, not too big or too small and it offered a great walk in closet. Every time we walked around the lobby looking confused, someone was there to help, whether it was to hail a cab, learn how to ride the cable cars and buy a cable car pass, check in/out, park, or grab a late evening glass of wine at the bar. Throughout the day, you can take advantage of their coffee and cookie service in the lobby. A key feature of this hotel is the location. You are on top of Union Square. It is a 10 minute walk to Chinatown (you can avoid the hill by walking down Post to Stockton). All in all, my wife and I were very pleased with the value the Chancellor offers. The management seems to pay close attention to details that tend to be overlooked in hotels that are more expensive.

review.title: You can't get more central
review.reviewText: I was surprised at what we got for the price, pleasantly surprised. Check-in was smooth; fast and efficient. The rooms are not large, but I was expecting this after picking up on other reviews. The room was particularly tidy and comfortable; no complaints from this punter. Room servicing was excellent. The breakfast menu is a bit shy on selection for those of us who desire the more simpler meals.The prices are comparable to surrounding eateries. The hotel is location, location, location - stay here and surprise yourself. The tourist kiosk in the hotel lobby is very handy and the staff extremely helpful. Definitely on our return schedule.

review.title: Excellent place to stay in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is by far one of the best places to stay in downtown San Francisco. It is literally 1/2 block from Union Square. The building is old, but extremely clean and well kept. The staff is excellent and very friendly as well. The rooms are on the small side but they are spotless and very well appointed. They have a tour desk that is very helpful including selling Muni passes. World Famous Sears Fine Food is next door and has great pancakes + food. The cable cars stop across the street to boot. I would stay in The Chancellor again and again. For the money, it cannot be beat by any hotel in the area. After you get over the smallish room, the location, staff, etc are all exceptional.

review.title: great location in SF
review.reviewText: We stayed in SF for a long weekend. the hotel turned out to be perfect! the location is great at union square at the cable car line - or you could just walk to all other spots in SF. The hotel was very clean with great service: free coffee, cookies and fruits around the clock, free choices of different pillows, free newspapers, free wireless internet. Couldn't have been any better!

review.title: Great Hotel in the Heart of SF
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the Chancellor. The staff was superb. The rooms are not very large (as one would expect for a classic hotel of this age), but they are clean and modernized - more than enough room for people who want to enjoy SF by day and only need a comfortable place to relax and sleep. The only real complaint is that the bathrooms are small and hard to accommodate two people getting ready at once. But the ambiance, and more importantly the friendly, attentive, courteous staff make up for any of it's few shortcomings. The following warning does not reflect in any way The Chancellor Hotel: San Francisco is a wonderful place full of adventure and history but there is a professional criminal element alive and well. My wife was pick pocketed during our stay on one of the cable car stops. It was a professional set up involving multiple people and was executed with perfection. The San Francisco police will not respond to a non-violent crime, so they are free to operate unabated. We had to fill out a police report ONLINE! So please be careful, as this completely ruined our stay and really turned our opinion about this seemingly wonderful city.

review.title: Very nice art deco decor. Will definately go back!
review.reviewText: Great access to all downtown shopping & touristy things. Right on the trolley car line. Great resteraunt

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: I visited San Francisco with my mom - when we arrived at the hotel, the helpful staff made check in a breeze. We shared a room that had two twin beds which was perfect for us. The room was tiny, but well maintained with comfortable beds - perfect for two travelers not spending a lot of time lounging around the hotel. Any question we had about San Francisco the staff answered - even printing out directions for us to get to our next hotel when our stay was over. My mom had recently purchased a new laptop with Vista, and the staff even helped with some problems she was having learning the new operating system. Overall - this was a great experience, with a cute as a button hotel and very friendly staff.

review.title: Perfect place for us!
review.reviewText: First time in SF and this hotel was wonderful --- beautiful and comfortable room, very friendly and helpful staff, fabulous location, clean and cozy elegance, friendly guests, great coffee and cookies, fun rubber duckie, and just the right size to make my whole family feel comfortable and involved with the heart of the city. We loved sitting in the lobby and watching the cable cars, stepping out for good eats and great shopping, and relaxing in the luxurious room with delightful, up-to-date accessories. This hotel was just the right size, atmosphere and location for us!

review.title: Seeing San Franscisco
review.reviewText: The hotel is in the ideal place for seeing SF- for example the cable car stop is just outside the door and Union Square is a stone's throw away. Great place to stay. The car parking arrangements were a great benefit.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a great location. Fantastic value for money. I had considered staying in Fishermans Wharf but was glad I chose this location once I realised how central it was. The rooms are not huge but very comforable and quiet. They had the feeling of a recent refurbishment and were always serviced well each day. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and accommodating. The cable cars stop right outside. Parking for the hotel at subsidised or included rates is just around the corner. If I return to San Francisco I wouldn't look anywhere else

review.title: Great for the money in downtown SF
review.reviewText: Not alot of perks but great spot to see anything and right on the cable car line.

review.title: i will stay there again
review.reviewText: Everything was awesome and will definitely be back

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: an older well maintained hotel on powell street right at union square. the area is beautiful and you can catch a cable car just steps from your door. rooms are small but clean and comfortable. the staff was friendly and professional. we took a 1/2 day trip to muir woods national monument (a virgin stand of giant coastal redwoods)if you've never seen them and you have the time it is very worth it. this hotel is a great deal, would definitely stay there again

review.title: Great location and value.
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in the middle of everything. Clean and extra like cookies, apple, and coffee in the lobby are plus. The bed is very comfortable. However, next time I check in I have to make sure to ask for a room in the back not facing the main street. It gets quite a bite of street noise incl. the bell ringing of the cable car in the lower level.

review.title: Small, but cozy and staff was great, cookies too!
review.reviewText: The staff was the best part of the experience. I was greeted warmly, the front desk happily assisted in driving direction and they gave me great assistance to get my computer geared to work while there. Bravo. The rooms are small, but clean and I loved the location. Loved the cookies--reason enough for a second trip!

review.title: Great place to stay downtown
review.reviewText: Really close to Union Square and only steps away from the BEST breakfast spot in SF: Sears Fine Food. The rooms were tiny but spotless and very nicely decorated. I loved the botanical prints on the walls. The bathtub was a treat, too...really deep and awesome for soaking.

review.title: Great value for money! Would stay again
review.reviewText: It is an ideally placed hotel to Union Square and for the cable cars. We asked for 2 quiet rooms, which ended up at the back of the hotel, but that was fine as it was away from the dinging of the cable cars! The rooms were small (a double room consists of 2 single beds) but the bedding was fresh and clean and they even had a pillow menu. Hotel services were fast. They only do food on limited nights, but that was ok as you have lots of places to eat in Powell street (I recommend Lori's dinner, down towards Market Street).

review.title: Great location and great bargain
review.reviewText: cable car, bus line, bart station, all within blocks, a great central location for a trip to san fran. we'll be staying here again

review.title: Nice room, comfortable, but a little old
review.reviewText: Spent a couple days here and was overall pleased with our experience. The room was clean, modern and comfortable. The bathroom was in decent condition, but the room seemed a bit nicer and upgraded. But overall the bathroom was still clean - the room was in a little better condition. Location is great. 1/2 block from Union Square, 10-15 minute walk to MOMA, 10 minute walk to China Town. Restaurants/shops very close by.

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: Good situation on Union Square and quite good value for money Good bed but small bathroom

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Neat old hotel. Classy upgrades. We will be going back.

review.title: Best location--1/2 block off Union Square
review.reviewText: Parking prices are ridiculous; they should be valet. Thin walls.

review.title: good
review.reviewText: good

review.title: nice hotel and great location
review.reviewText: the room was nice, romantic, the hotel's location was close to everything, and the cable cars took you everywhere else...I'd stay there again...in fact I have already booked a future stay.

review.title: Charming Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff were considerate the room was comfortable No kettle in the room but free tea and coffee and biscuits in the lobby all day

review.title: Average hotel
review.reviewText: Pros: Location, reasonable price Cons: Small room, parking place is about 50m away (2 street cross) from the hotel. No banding machine inside.

review.title: Location, location, location!
review.reviewText: On the square if you are visiting for shopping. Quiet and clean.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Rooms were small, but clean and with the price and location, you really can't beat this place. Plus, they have free yummy cookies and coffee in the lobby every morning.

review.title: Charming hotel on Union Square
review.reviewText: Great rooms - nice stylish, comfortable furniture. Most comfortable hotel bed ever. My room had a lovely view of Union Square and all of the holiday decorations. The extras were what set this hotel apart: the rubber ducky (and a Santa one, at that), the alarm clock with the iPod dock, the pillow menu. They also have a menu of spa products, but they were out of the one that I wanted, a minor inconvenience. But overall, an ideal location, a great room, and an excellent price. And the pancakes at Sears were amazing.

review.title: Great Location--Fine Little Hotel
review.reviewText: Okay the rooms are not huge. But this hotel is clean, well-maintained, less than a block from Union Square, and the price was more than reasonable. The price varies according to season of course. But it would be hard to find a better location for the money. The parking is a bit pricey however -- $29.00 a night if I recall correctly at a nearby garage.

review.title: Highly Recommend
review.reviewText: This hotel is a great place to stay. The rooms are classy, very clean, and updated. We loved the down comforter and pillows and colors. The tub is the size of a claw foot so you can actually soak in it. The staff were very helpful. You can't beat the location - two blocks from Chinatown. We walked to Coit Tower, the Fisherman's Wharf and the Union St. shopping area in one day. You do hear the noise of the Cable Cars, but we liked that since it is SF. The parking garage is right up the hotel. My husband and I couldn't believe the price for what we got. Definitely one of the best and safest hotels you could stay in. We'd stay there again, even if the price was higher.

review.title: A True San Francisco Experience
review.reviewText: Having lived in San Francisco in our younger days and with young children, this autumn we gathered our now adult children and their spouses and flew to The City for the glory of it all. We knew that we wanted a hotel that felt like San Francisco, not the local chain at the freeway interchange, and after much Internet searching chose the Chancellor. We could not have been more pleased. The hotel is located near Union Square and The City is all around you. We could see the Square from our rooms, hear the cable cars, eat breakfast and lunch in a lovely small restaurant in the hotel with other eating opportunities with multiple alternatives within two blocks, walk as much of The City as we wished, catch public transportation within a few blocks to take us to all sites of interest, easily catch a cab, be served by a cooperative friendly staff, know that we were entirely safe, and all at a very reasonable cost. Sure, the hotel is old and could use some up dating, especially the bathrooms, but even here a word of caution is necessary. To up date too much would reduce the charm, and the charm is more important than the fanciest shower. Should we ever return to San Francisco the first and most enjoyable task will be to reserve our rooms at the Chancellor.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location. Clean and comfortable rooms. Would stay again.

review.title: Very good service, quiet comfortable room, great value
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The room was very clean and my wife loved the bed linens, pillows, down comforter, and large bathtub. We will definately stay there again.

review.title: Good Bargain
review.reviewText: Great location and price. Friendly service but no concierge.

review.title: Great Gem
review.reviewText: Pleasantly suprised by the Chancellor. Very clean room and hotel! Bed linens were fabulous, but the beds were a bit short. The staff was very friendly. Rooms were small but well decorated and the bathroom was well-stocked. The bathub was fabulous. It was so long you could lay down and float! Loved that it was across from Union square and transportation. THe hotel food was lacking, but there is a great restaurant next door for breakfast. Will definitely stay here again!

review.title: Great room, great location, great price
review.reviewText: We had an amazing experience at this hotel during the weekend of Dec 1/2nd. The hotel room was very clean, the bed was extremely comfortable, and the noise level was not bad considering it's very central location. The hotel even gave us a wonderful view room, when I told them we were celebrating a birthday. We overlooked the Christmas tree on Union Square. The only glitch was when we ordered room service breakfast to be delivered, it was delivered to the wrong room (where the people staying in the wrong room actually took our pancakes and coffee, how wierd is that?), Chancellor staff delivered a new breakfast, but ended up being an hour late and charged us full price anyway. Kind of odd. Overall, it was an excellent hotel though, stellar rooms, and wonderful friendly staff.

review.title: Very happy with my stay
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Chancellor for two nights in early October 2007. Having read earlier reviews, I asked to stay on a top level floor in a room that was renovated - and was obliged. The room was small, but clean and very comfortable. The renovation of the room is well done. The hotel is in a great location close to all the shops and restaurants around Union Square. I think it was very good value and would have no problem staying there again or recommending it.

review.title: Chancellor Hotel never fails
review.reviewText: I have traveled to San Francisco several times before and stayed at the Chancellor. It has always been my first choice because of it's location, service, and reasonable prices. The Chancellor has never failed me. This past trip I went with my college roomie, and she liked staying at the Chancellor because of the location, cleanliness, and soft and warm beds. I would definitely return to the Chancellor again.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: Location of hotel is excellent to cable car, coffee shop and all the shopping around Union Square. Room was small but very comfortable and cozy. Took airport shuttle from hotel for $14.00 and two add'l stops. Will stay at Chancellor again will refer family/friends.

review.title: The place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Well, if you are off to San Francisco, you can do no bad staying at the Chancellor Hotel. It is literally just off Union Square and is slap bang in the middle of all the shops. The cable car runs outside and in 10 minutes, you can be in Fishermans Wharf. The hotel itself is modern, has a great bar which does great happy hour martini's. The rooms are comfortable, have recently been re-furbished and has everything you need. They even give you free tea, coffee and cookies everyday. The staff are all friendly and will go the extra mile to help you. All I can say is if I head back, this will be the only place I will stay!

review.title: Our new Thanksgiving tradition
review.reviewText: We love the Chancellor Hotel! This is an older hotel with small, charming rooms but that's okay because we don't spend much time in our room. The bathroom boasts a large tub for soaking which is also a big plus. The hotel staff are very knowledgeable, friendly and do their very best to accommodate. The hotel has a small dining room which serves great food for breakfast and lunch. This was our second stay at the Chancellor and we will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Would certainly stay again!!!!!!
review.reviewText: Great hotel, couldn't fault it!!!!!

review.title: Lovely European-style hotel on Union Square
review.reviewText: Listen to the trolley car's going along Powell St and you know you're in San Francisco. Hotel is entirely non-smoking, beds are really comfortable with down-like covers and lots of pillows. Free wireless internet access and a very nice gym (also free) around the corner. Centrally located. Rooms aren't huge, but fine for 1 or 2 people.

review.title: Lovely hotel in super location
review.reviewText: The staff were friendly and welcoming. Room was one of the recently refurbished ones and they kindly granted our request for a room with a good view of Union Square. Room was not too small - more than enough for our needs. Bathroom was clean and always hot water available (been to hotels where it all ran out!) Self serve coffee, tea and coffee in lobby a nice touch. Best thing is the location - cable car stop right outside and loads of shopping and eating places to choose from. Also good access to transport to all the sites. Thoroughly recommended.

review.title: Union Square value bring ear plugs
review.reviewText: A little noise from the chiller of the next-door building kept our room humming as if a liberal senator with a history in city politics was stumpping two rooms down the hall- but two ear-plugs and the chatter was dulled to typical liberal city buzz. The Chancellor tops our last minute list -- I bookked one night in advavnce and was pleased with the etched glass windows of the 2nd floor conference room, the availability and the location just off Union Square.

review.title: A Hotel well worth considering
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Chancellor for 4 nights at the end of October. Whilst maybe modest in appearance, it proved to be an excellent choice for our stay in San Fran. The staff were more than helpful, and little extras such as tea, coffee and cookies in the lobby,an umbrella in the bedroom,and free internet access, all made our stay most comfortable. The bedroom was a bit on the small side, but nevertheless there was space for everything. Our shower proved to be the easiest to use in 3 weeks of travelling all over the USA! We would certainly recommend the Chancellor for it's friendliness, excellent location,and good breakfasts.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Extremely convenient to Union Square .. Good price .. Would return there again

review.title: Top location and staff
review.reviewText: Stayed here for just one night in October. The location was ideal for us - it was the end of our visit to San Fran and we wanted to shop. The hotel is right by Union Square so Macy's and all the big stores are with a couple of blocks, and the cable cars stop outside the hotel too. The hotel staff are extremely friendly and welcoming, really helpful, and recommended good local restaurants for brunch and dinner. Free coffee, tea, cookies and apples in the lobby. Free wireless throughout. Room was very well equipped and clean. Comfy bed, quiet, good amenities in the bathroom. Only downside was that the room was a bit small (the furniture seemed crammed in), but there was a big walk-in closet so we put all our bags and shopping in there. And given the amount of time spent in the room it didn't really matter.

review.title: Chancello Hotel, a great place to stay
review.reviewText: We were very satified with this hotel. Great location, clean comfortable rooms, and friendly helpful front desk staff. The rooms are small, but refurbished with a reasonable price tag. I would definitely stay there again and I'm pretty picky.

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: Nice small hotel with character in a great location.

review.title: Excellent San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: The service was excellent from check-in to check-out. The hotel was pristine with especially comfortable beds and linens. The location was amazing, a half block away from Union Square, close to SF's shopping district, and across the street from a stop on the historic Powell Street cable cars.

review.title: Chancellor Hotel Oct 2007
review.reviewText: Great location, older hotel, very clean with helpful and friendly staff. Rooms are very small, but adequate for unwinding at the end of the day and sleeping. You can catch the cable car to Fisherman's wharf right across the street, and there are plenty of dining, shopping, and nightlife options in the immediate area.

review.title: Want to stay there every time I visit SF
review.reviewText: Location was superb and the staff very friendly, engaging and accomodating.... I really enjoyed my stay there. I even had to stay an extra night because I'd missed my flight and they quickly found me a new room, offered a wake-up call and got me set up for the airport shuttle since they knew the bart wasnt running early enough for my new flight.

review.title: Will go back again
review.reviewText: Grat location. The staff were very helpful and courteous. The reataurant was clean and the food was very good. Plenty of choicees for breakfast. Had a good lunch.

review.title: Great value, great location
review.reviewText: Well kept hotel in the heart of San Francisco. Great value for the money, easy access to all public transport in the Bay area, including cable cars. Well kept area, friendly staff, restaurant on premises for breakfast, and neat, clean rooms. Rooms also have ceiling fans for those warmer summer nights. There is a tour desk downstairs with info and booking for in and around sightseeing. Location is quiet for the downtown area, minimum number of street people on this block.

review.title: Great location. Great staff. Great value.
review.reviewText: Why stay anywhere else on Union Square?

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great base to tour around SF from. Cable outside and right in middle of shops, walking distance to China town and Market St. Could not be faulted. Very comfortable beds with great pillow menu, room a little small but no problem as only used to sleep. On 10th floor with a view of Union Square, no problem with noise even when building marquee for Nike Womens Marathon on 21/10/07. Would highly recommend for location and value. Try pancakes at Sears next door (people queueing for breakfast!) or Loni's up the hill.

review.title: A nice stay
review.reviewText: Room was small, but clean and comfortable. Great location, a good value for the price.

review.title: The Best
review.reviewText: This Hotel is located the best place for shopping, transportations. Peaple are so nice and kind.

review.title: Great Location and Value
review.reviewText: Perfect location in Union Square. From there you can walk to Chinatown or the Theatre District and stroll around the posh places to shop in the city. The "Powell line" for the city's cable car (the one that takes you to the Fisherman's Wharf)makes a stop just a few steps from the Hotel (right in front of the Disney store). You can also catch a cab at any point aroud Union Square. The rooms aren't big but neither small. They are just what you need if you are planning to spend a lot of time roaming the city and not hiding at your room (remember this is San Francisco, after all, and there is plenty to do besisdes watching TV in your hotel room...) Each room includes a comfortable queen bed (with choice of pillow from a 12-style menu) with recently renewed interiors and mobiliary. The bathroom is small, but adequate, with a bathtub and a yellow rubber ducky for your bubble baths. Concierge was very helpful in the arrangement of city tours (including a nice one-day visit to Sonoma and Napa valley). Also the staff is resourceful and nice to guests at all times (even at 4:30 AM when we departed). The small restaurant at the hotel is good for breakfast (it is not cheap, but its prices are comparable to those of the diners in the area and I would say the quality of the food is much better).

review.title: San Francisco gem
review.reviewText: For a hotel in this location on Union Square our stay represented good value.

review.title: Excellent value and location
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel as we were at the Moscone Centre for a conference, just 10 minutes away, yet wanted to be in the heart of downtown. The north shore area is also easily accessible with a trolley ride or 10 dollar taxi from right outside. Hotel itself is friendly, with pleasant and clean accomodation. The view was non-existent (into the centre of the hotel, but we were never in there long enough to worry, San Francisco has enough gorgeous views elsewhere! Excellent value - try it.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Great location on union square for shopping and cablecar route for touristy things. Comfortable rooms. Good gym and pool round the corner which is free when you stay in the hotel.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: This was a perfect hotel in a great location right on Union Square. Very comfortable, lovely staff, great complimentary cookies and coffee in the morning. Would definitely recommend.

review.title: Location, location, location.
review.reviewText: A wonderful "botique" hotel one half block from Union Square. Although the rooms are small, they are very comfortable and clean. Free morning coffee and newspaper in the lobby is a nice touch. The resturant serves a great breakfast, brunch and lunch. Great place at a great price.

review.title: Ideal location
review.reviewText: Ideal location in Union Square. All the main shopping is within a few minutes walk in any direction, the train to/from the airport is three blocks away and it's right on the cable car route. Also easy walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and the Alcatraz tour. Hotel itself very comfortable, clean and staff all helpful and polite. Stayed there at beginning and end of trip to California and only minor criticism is that my room the first time had a big a/c unit on the roof outside the window so was a little bit noisy. Just a small thing though and other than that, great value.

review.title: Stay there just for the tub...........
review.reviewText: They have a huge bathtub to soak in every night after a long day of climbing hills. It was wonderful, they even give you a rubber duck. We had a very pleasant stay here for 5 nights though our room was not as cool as I would have liked, they do have a ceiling fan but the windows just didn't seem to bring in that much breeze. I guess that all just depends on your room location though. The only complaint I really had was that they didn't seem to do that great of a job on the daily room cleaning, but I would definitely stay there again and I would recommend it to anyone. It's also right next door to Sear's Fine Foods restaurant which is famous for it's breakfast. We ate there every morning. YUM!

review.title: Perfect Little Gem in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: This Hotel is a great for those who are on a budget. With the location of the hotel I think that they could easily charge more. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were small but practical, and tastefully decorated. The rooms were quiet and comfortable. The area of the hotel is a shoppers paradise and it is easy to get to almost anywhere in the city from this point. The cable cars run from right outside the hotel and it is better to catch them at this point than at the cabel car turn around anyhow. (No Line)

review.title: 1 st Class location ,great hotel
review.reviewText: Little gem of a find .... This is a very good budget hotel in a fantastic location. The rooms are a " little snug", and the bathrooms a bit small , but this adds to the charm. The rooms do not have A/C but we didn't find that a problem we opened the window!!!!!!! . If you don't like the sound of the cable cars ask for a room on the upper floors, but beware the rooms at the back don't have any views , well you could count the bricks in the walls ...... because thats all you can see. Book the parking package if you can as it is not cheap to park . We left our car in the car park for the entire time we stayed , far better to use cable car , bart etc ( buy 1/ 3/ 5 day tickets). Hotel on Union sq giving easy access to ALL sites and attractions. My only "gripe" the hotel has a great little bar with good "tenders" but why oh why does it have to close at 10 pm... just as you get back from a days sightseeing when you could murder a good beer they are shutting... salvation can be found round the corner. We will return to this hotel to stay next time ....and can't wait.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was small, basic but great. The location is superb, the cable cars stop practically outside and the bus, BART etc are at the end of the road. You are also right next to Macy's and SAKS and the shops of Market Street. It really is the best location! The room was small but the bed was very comfortable (there is a pillow menu...very impressed by that)! San Francisco is such a lovely place but somewhat tainted by the number tramps...but most seem harmless!

review.title: A good base whilst in San. Fran.
review.reviewText: It's quite an old hotel so the rooms tend to be on the smaller side and views shouldn't be on the list of priorites when staying at the Chancellor. However, we did find the room very clean and comfortable and is ideally situated in its location next to Union Square.

review.title: FANTASTIC LOCATION IN A FANTASTIC CITY
review.reviewText: We stayed in the Chancellor for 5 nights when we visited San Fran in September and had a great hotel experience. The hotel is very central for all tourist attractions in the city including the cable car stop just outside the hotel, the city bus tour departing outside Macy's and of course the wonderful shopping on Union Square! Hotel staff were very friendly and added a personal touch to our stay. Rooms were clean and well maintained with fresh towels and bedding daily. The little rubber duck left in the bathroom for each guest is a lovely gesture as were the complimentary cookies and coffee in the lobby 24 hours a day. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone.

review.title: The best kept secret in San Fran
review.reviewText: Very comforting and welcoming hotel. Safe and clean. Nice touch with the complementary coffee, tea and cookies all day long. Excellent location.

review.title: Excellent Location and Value
review.reviewText: We stayed 5 nights at the Chancellor on Union Square. Upon arrival the desk staff was very helpful, checking our bags and providing a safety deposit box for our valuables. We saw two rooms at the chancellor, the first room on the third floor was beautiful, newly decorated (although there was a distinct smell of paint, the second room was on the 14th floor and was much less nice, it included a flashing neon light coming in the window. I would recommend a room at the back on the hotel and not facing the street. Overall the room was small but perfect for two people. The hotel service was excellent. The location was great for shopping and getting on public transportation. We would definately recommend the hotel to friends and would go back ourselves.

review.title: May be a good value, but this is no 4 star hotel
review.reviewText: This is an older hotel that has been somewhat spiffed up. Room was small,no room for a couch/sofa, two small chairs only. No AC, so had to sleep with window open, which brings in a lot of street noice. Breakfast at the hotel restaurant was quick and very good.

review.title: Hotel Chancellor
review.reviewText: Super friendly staff went beyond the call of duty to help us find our way around the city. The room was modern, stylish, clean and comfortable-much better than the photos suggest. This is THE gem of union square, and as my boyfriend puts it, " where quality and value intersect." (Our friends stayed at a trendy place down the street and paid 3 times what we paid per night only to find a nappy carpet and paper thin walls!) Will definitely stay here again!

review.title: Nice and quiet.
review.reviewText: The location is great; the cable car is right outside the door. There's lots of restaurants and entertainment all within walking distance. When in the hotel room, the sounds of the street are shut out. The bed was very comfortable.

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: This is a great place to stay with a great location to all the shopping you could ever want. Located next to Sears Fine Dining and the Cheesecake Factory in the top of Macey's

review.title: Would definately stay at this hotel in future visits to San Fran
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for two nights 27 & 28 Aug 07 and had a brilliant time. The staff were very helpful and the hotel very clean and friendly. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. I would have NO hesitation in recommending this hotel to any of my friends or family. Took the alcatraz trip early in the morning and would recommend this. Book the visit before you arrive in San Fran if, like us, you are only there a few days.

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. Staff was helpful with tips for eating and what to do in the city. Located in the heart of downtown, walking or public transportation can get you anywhere you need to go. Being from Houston we were worried about not having AC but it was not a problem at all. We opened the window and even in early September it was a cool 59 at night. We would stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The Chancellor was quite satisfactory to us. The room was clean although the air-conditioning was not working, so our room was fairly noisy at night because of the street noise (we needed to keep the window open for air circulation). The breakfast was good, the concierge was helpful. The towels were lovely and thick. We couldn't get NPR on the radio without a lot of static. The nearness to Union Square was a big asset. The hotel provided a discount coupon for their restaurant and for nearby Macy's. Value was excellent overall.

review.title: Decent, good location and great price
review.reviewText: Stayed two nites. Perfect location. Older hotel with small but servicable rooms. Room overlooked an adjacent wall and fire escape which was a little creepy but the hotel seemed secure otherwise so it didn't bother me. Got a great rate on expedia.

review.title: Too Noisy
review.reviewText: We were put on the second floor, facing the street. The noise from the street kept us awake the first night but we were able to tune it out for the rest of our stay. The bed was not comfortable.

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and the facilities are ok, the only thing that should improve is the service in the tourism counter. Regards

review.title: Good service
review.reviewText: Good service and very friendly staff. They really wanted the guests to be comfortable and have a good time.

review.title: Great Room, Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel couldn't have been in a better location, especially if you're into great shopping. I thought the proximity to Union Square would make for excess noise, but on the 10th floor, I could barely hear any street noise. The staff of the hotel, from the valet, to the front desk agent, to the maids, we all very friendly and helpful. The room, though slightly small, was decorated very nicely and the bed was comfortable. The pillow menu was a nice touch, too! And we couldn't get enough of the cookies in the lobby. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, whether visiting from out of town or a local, like myself.

review.title: Great Price for Union Square
review.reviewText: This was a very nice hotel right on Union Square in an excellent central location. It was a great deal. The rooms are small but quaint. There is no A/C, but we were very comfortable with the windows open (in late August) and enjoyed the fresh air.

review.title: Good Deal
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is a pretty good hotel for someone on a moderate budget. The room we stayed in wasn't very roomy but the location was central, the service was friendly and the restaurant was great (only had breakfast). Would recommend to others visiting the area.

review.title: Great Place to Stay in San Fran!
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is a wonderful choice if you are visiting San Francisco on vacation or business. It's extremely convenient to everything, and within walking distance to many restaurants and neighborhoods. The staff is extremely friendly and the rooms are clean and comfortable. The beds are really great too, and they even have a pillow menu if you want a special pillow! I stayed here with my very picky mother, and she loved it. Definitely consider the Chancellor for your stay in SF.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The area was ideal for touring around. The hotel was clean and safe. The lobby and elevators were smaller but fine. Apples were good! I will chose this hotel for my next stay and recommend it to others.

review.title: Great hotel with some unusual frills
review.reviewText: Wasn't sure what to expect, but this is the kind of hotel that people keep returning to. Extremely clean, very friendly staff and guests. Self-serve coffee in the lobby all day (no coffee-makers in the room), but I almost preferred it. White noise machines available (which you might need depending on the side of the hotel your room is on), many different pillow types to request, and various tub attachments for a little whirlpool in your own room. Bar is open for evenings, and the bartender is great. Free wireless internet too! Talked to a couple people that said this is where they always stay.

review.title: The Chancellor Delivers!
review.reviewText: I have used Expedia with great results. There has never been a mix-up at the hotel when I arrive, all arrangements are confirmed. The comments of other guests are not made-up to sell the hotel. I found that all of the comments made, good and bad were true to some extent. The Chancellor is a charming, small hotel which is terrifically situated at Union Square. The stylish rooms are smallish, just as they are in New York, London and Madrid. The entire hotel shows pride of ownership. The bathrooms are spotless and well maintained as well as equipped with all the essentials. The staff are helpful and exceedingly efficient. The coffee, tea, cookies and apples are also a nice little touch. We definitely will stay there when we go back to San Francisco.

review.title: Good Hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Good Price Good Quality Good Service

review.title: Good value and location
review.reviewText: Everything was great except I'd prefer to have AC in the room even though the temperatures in SF are usually never too warm. However, there are ceiling fans in the rooms.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel is a comfortable hotel with a caring staff. Parking is convenient and reasonable. We ordered room service every morning and the breakfast was great. The location is an easy walk to Chinatown and next door to the shops on Union Square. We would definitely stay here again.

review.title: rubber ducks
review.reviewText: The room was nice, though a bit small, fine as long as you don't want to work at the desk. The rubber ducks in the bathroom were a great touch, as were the cookies at the front desk. Good location, close to transit. One thing, it would be helpful if the pay phone had a sign to say it was out of order instead of it just eating coinage and then the staff saying that it has been broken for a few weeks.

review.title: A little Gem of a hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Chancellor based on previous reviews. Basically, it would be difficult to fault this hotel. The location is ideal for downtown and from the service was friendly and helpful from all the staff. The room wasn't huge but it was immaculate and well equipped. The nice thing was the personal touch such as an umbrella in the wardrobe that could be borrowed and a rubber duck in the bathroom. Just little touches but they enhanced the visit. There was also a huge ceiling fan instead of air conditioning which was a pleasant change. The public areas of the hotel were stylish and immaculate and quiet. The only issue we had was with a noisy young family in our adjoining room. This issue was resolved by the staff immediately as they were very understanding and moved us straight away to another room. Based on our experience it might be a good idea to ask specifically for a room that is not adjoining!? Overall this is a lovely hotel and we would not hesitate to stay there again the next time we are in San Francisco. The price was excellent as well. Just don't tell too many people about it or you might not get a room!!!!

review.title: would stay @ this hotel again
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a fabulous location for walking to financial district and China Town and close to many public transportation spots. Room very clean, but carpet needs replaced or cleaned very well.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Loved the Chancellor Hotel! The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms are very clean. The location was great and convenient to BART, the Muni and the cable car/trolley. Really easy to get around to all the sites. My only complaint is that the beds are too hard.

review.title: Fabulous
review.reviewText: Hotel location 1/2 block off Union Square, on the Powell trolley line - can't get any better location, especially at the price. Hotel architecture is old SF charm. Lefty O'Douls baseball memorabilia restaurant is just around the corner for another old SF experience. On 8/5/07 I had an inside room which was very clean and had large closet, with iron and ironing board. A "library" of books to borrow/leave is on the second floor. I travel frequently and prefer hotels with character, rather than the cookie cutter chain hotels, and this one is terrific.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: older hotel, small rooms but great location handy to shopping, transportation, good price,

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: Cramped quarters, but excellent location with character. Staff very accommodating. Hope to stay there again!

review.title: Fantastic Location
review.reviewText: Although the hotel was old the overall condition was well maintained. Very clean room, quite small but adequate for a short stay. The room we occupied looked out onto the fire escape but the benefit of this was it was quiet. Bar area very small not somewhere you would choose to spend an evening. This hotel is in a fantastic location. Staff were all very helpful and polite.

review.title: Recommended
review.reviewText: Clean quite little hotel in the heart of Union Sq.

review.title: Good location, but not much amenities
review.reviewText: Older hotel that could use some renovations. Uncomfortable beds, no air conditioning,kept window open for air but then had all of the street noise.

review.title: it was fine
review.reviewText: I'm not one to spend much vacation time in a hotel room so as long as it is clean and convenient it's OK with me. The hotel is older but it was clean so that is what I cared about. Everyone on the staff was very nice. The dining room looked depressing so we didn't try it.

review.title: Good bang for the buck
review.reviewText: This hotel was very close to union square, compared to other hotels in the same area, this was a real deal. The interior seemed a bit dated but the rooms were very clean and well appointed. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff was also extremely accomodating.

review.title: Hope to go back sometime
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel - it was wonderful and very reasonably priced. The staff were super and Susan at the "Tour Information Desk" was lovely and gracious. The location was perfect. I have nothing negative to say and this was my first time to book a flight/holiday from Expedia. I will definitely do it again.

review.title: great value
review.reviewText: We have stayed there amny times and it is an excellent value and location.

review.title: grreat location and comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: Great location and nice hotel for the price. Very close to all attactions and restaurants.

review.title: No sleep in the Chancellor
review.reviewText: If you want a hotel room you can sleep in, don't stay here! The rooms are very noisy and hot - and generally include a view of a brick wall.

review.title: Delightful
review.reviewText: Small, a bit scruffy, cosy, but utterly lovely and brilliant value. Fabulous location, delightful staff, rooms small, tidy, nicely decorated, clean, and comfy. First choice to stay in SF.

review.title: Excellent Choice
review.reviewText: Great location. Rooms small but very clean and surprisingly quiet. Excellent staff - very helpful. The valet parking was quick and easy.

review.title: Location Location Location
review.reviewText: Right on the door step of union square, with the trolley route outside the door. Excellent value for money. Slight smell of moth balls on our floor!But ok once you get use ot it! A small quaint hotel you will have difficulty to beat.

review.title: Old Hotel in the heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: Chancellor is an older hotel. Established in 1914, so don't expect the latest and greatest. It's still nice tho, older, more cozy feeling. Rooms were small but adequate. Aside from, you can't be the location. Just kiddie corner to Union Square, off one of the cable car lines. Basically, just a place to sleep and keep you stuff for a short stay.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel provided a really great location, convenient to the famous trolley cars and historical streetcars. The service was great -anything that we asked for was done. The room that we stayed in was small, but comfortable and had a great view of Union Square. The bathroom could have been bigger, but had a great tub in it. The fresh cookies, coffee and tea were a nice perk as well. I would stay here again.

review.title: Great Location! Great Service!
review.reviewText: If location is what you're looking for, the Chancellor is a GREAT place to stay. The staff was friendly and very very helpful. The room was a bit small but comfortable and since I only stayed one night and needed to be in the room less than 6 hours total, it was great. It's in a GREAT location on Powell St about 4 blocks from the trolley stop and subway and about a block away from Union Square. Great value.

review.title: Very good deal for budget travelers
review.reviewText: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for 6 nights and our room was very clean and the staff was very accomodating. Only downfall, there was no refridgerator. But all in all we were never really in the room. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. It was right near all the high end stores and tons of places to eat.

review.title: Excellent value for money, great location
review.reviewText: Perfect for what we needed - a base from which to explore the city. Room and bathroom were quite small and we didn't have a view from our window, but this wasn't a problem as we were there to be out and about in San Fransciso all day, not hanging around in our room! Would definitely recommend for people who want to explore the city, felt very safe walking back there in the evening due to its excellent location right in the heart of Union Square (we could even see Macy's from the door!). Staff were friendly and helpful and hotel was very clean.

review.title: Handy for all attractions
review.reviewText: Clean room,mainly friendly & helpful staff. Fan in room helped when hot, but air-conditioning would be better, there was record high temp when here, but few hotels in San Fran have A/C as is not normally hot enough. Hall ways, stairs, etc are a bit old looking and pokey. Nice & quiet at night after about 11:00pm. Handy for all standards of eating. Main shopping area literally only yards away. Public transport right outside (tram) or within easy walking distance. Tours and transport tickets can be booked in lobby and airport transport.

review.title: Best location, value, and great service!
review.reviewText: We stayed here in early April 2007. This hotel is in a perfect location - on Powell St just north of Union Square. The value is amazing for San Francisco. Rooms were very clean, there were plenty of complimentary extras that made you feel very welcome. There were free cookies, popcorn, coffee, and apples in the lobby at all hours. The rooms had little rubber ducks to take home as souveniers, little jars of candies, and you could order special pillows for no charge. Also free wireless access which is a great plus (most places charge). The hotel is about 90 years old so the rooms are a bit smaller than in the big chain hotels, but we did not miss anything and got a much better experience here.

review.title: Fabulous hotel in a fabulous location
review.reviewText: Do not stay anywhere else - this hotel offers excellent value for money and you are right in the heart of the city, close to all the shops and attractions. The staff are friendly and helpful and I would definitely stay here again if I returned to San Francisco.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: A really nice hotel in a great central location.Rooms are clean and very comfortable.Staff are friendly and helpful. Try Sears next door for breakfast. Great food and good value for money. Get their early though as queues soon form.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Chancellor 13th to 16th April, at the start of our California trip. We couldnt have hoped for a better location, right on Union Square. There is a tram stop directly outside the hotel and a Concierge who has worked at the Chancellor for 30 years and can grab you a taxi in minutes - he also knows the city inside out. Three minute walk from China Town (we had a fabulous chinese buffet) and surrounded by restaurants, theatres, great shops and lots of coffee shops/bars. The hotel is old and decor is a little dated but our room was immaculately clean, well equipped (even has an umbrella which came in handy on day two of our stay) and the bed was very comfortable. When checking in the Receptionist advised us that we had a quiet room - she was right - for being in the heart of a city, we couldnt hear a sound, not even traffic noise. Would definitely return to the Chancellor again, great value for money.

review.title: Good middle range hotel
review.reviewText: Very good within it's price range. Would have preferred to be able to make coffee in the room rather than have to go down to the restuarant; a mini bar would also have been appreciated.

review.title: Comfortable, convenient SF location
review.reviewText: Staff was excellent. Hotel is just north of Union Square, convenient walking access to shopping, BART, and businesses. Older property, small room but clean and quiet.

review.title: loved this hotel
review.reviewText: As a single women I am interested in a secure hotel with easy access to the city. The Chancellor's location can not be beat - right in the heart of shopping and easy access to both cable cars, buses, trolleys, and the bart. The rooms are small compared to newer hotels but I was not in SF to stay in my room. The hotel could not have been more helpful when I had questions and the rooms was very clean and the bathtub was a treat. I loved my short time in SF and if I get to go back someday I will stay at the Chancellor.

review.title: A good deal
review.reviewText: Staff were friendly and helpful, and the cookies at the desk are a nice touch. Bed and pillows were very uncomfortable. No A/C so make sure you leave the fan on 24/7. Clean, but old. Good deal though, so I would stay again.

review.title: Great location & value
review.reviewText: Arrived early and was able to be accommodated with early check-in. The staff was very helpful in recommending transportation options since we elected not to rent a car. The restaurant had very good selections for breakfast and there was unlimited coffee, tea, cookies and apples available in the lobby. A little bit of noise from being right on Powell St. (cable cars begin at 6:30 a.m.) but the location was worth it.

review.title: Great value for a centrally located hotel
review.reviewText: We had read good reviews of this hotel that indicated it was our sort of place and prompted us to book it - and we were not disappointed. It is not for those who expect the height of luxury or huge "American"-sized rooms. However anyone planning to stay in this area of San Francisco would hopefully be aware that this class of hotel usually means historic buildings with smaller rooms. Our twin room was good sized we didnt intend to spend time there except for sleeping, and we could not complain about the bathroom - though not large enough to walk around in, the shower and bath were very good size and standard. We requested a room away from street noise and got a quiet room at the back (not a great view, but what would you expect!). We really appreciated the free internet computer in the lobby. We didn't have much need to speak to staff, but when we did so they were helpful and friendly and accommodated our late check out request. The lady at the Tour desk is apparently not part of the hotel staff. I think her job is to sell tours etc - as we didnt need help with tours we didnt really deal with her.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: The best is its location

review.title: quaint and friendly
review.reviewText: If you want modern,boutique type hotel don't stay here. The hotel has character and charm and you cannot beat the position at this price. We found the staff extremely friendly and helpful. Perfect stay for us in early April - take note there is no aircon.(maybe its not needed in SanF.) Right on the trolley route so you will hear clang clang -ding ding if you are at front and windows open - we loved it!!

review.title: Very Pleased
review.reviewText: An unbeatable location for us. Easy walk to Chinatown, Nob Hill, and SoMa. Longer, but pleasant, hike to North Beach and down to the wharves. Hotel was friendly, clean, and efficient. No real complaints. On a sunny day, walk from Union Square down to Fisherman's Wharf, taking a rest break on the way at Washington Square and stopping inside the beautiful Catholic church on the Square. After touring the waterfront, get lunch in neaby North Beach (rather than at an over-priced place at Pier 39) and then ride a cable car back to the hotel. Our room was a bit small and the bedclothes were rather past their prime, but these are very minor quibbles. Excellent value and location more than made up for this very slight reducation in comfort.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the central location, the valet parking, and the great value through Expedia.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: The staff here was so incredibly nice and helpful. The location can't be beat -- right in the heart of Union Square, and reasonably priced. It's nothing fancy, but if you're staying in this part of town, you're not looking for anything lush to begin with. We will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Good value for money, excellent location
review.reviewText: A nice clean hotel in an excellent location in Union Square. Cable car right in front of the hotel and all the best shops just a stone's throw away.

review.title: We felt like we were in a hotel in Europe
review.reviewText: This hotel is the cleanest I have ever stayed in. The staff was very courteous and friendly. The location, right in Union Square, was perfect as we were exploring all areas of the city. I would go back again.

review.title: excellant hotel, great location, magnificant staff, ready to go back
review.reviewText: This hotel, while a bit older, is a true classic, the staff was very helpful and very quick. The cookies in the lobby are great, and would love to get the recipe of the cranberry one. The location couldn't be better. Everything seemed either right at hand, or very easy to get to. I would reccomend this to anyone. It may not have some of the ammenties of newer hotels, but the location and staff MORE than make up for that. My wife and I are all already making plans to go back. The pillow menu is great, and the bar service is great too.

review.title: Great location and service
review.reviewText: The hotel is right on union square which is a great location to tour the city. We were able to see everything by foot: Chinatown, fisherman's wharf, Japan-town and more. The service was top notch. We received a parking ticket because the valet parking was late for the puck-up. The hotel made sure that the ticket was paid by the valet parking, and they faxed us the receipt to the next hotel we stayed in so we can present it to the rental company. We really felt in good hands. They also mind the smaller details such as a compelemntary coffee, tea and cookies stand in the lobby, available 24h for the guests. Since we celebrated a romantic event, a compelmentary sparkling wine waited for us in the room upon arival. Don't miss this one!

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: The best feature of Chancellor Hotel on Union Square is definitely its location. It was so easy to find it and go around San Francisco from it. There's a backside though, if you are looking for a very quiet place to stay, I'd recommend you'd find a hotel further from the lively SF centre. The noise from the streets is quite audible through the night but the hotel itself is very peaceful.

review.title: Great Location but Room was a little Tired
review.reviewText: The location of the Chancellor is great. Close to many sightseeing spots and very easy to use all forms of public transit from here. Our room was very small which was ok for two people but it was definitely in need of a renovation. Carpet and bedding looked old and worn. However, the staff were all very nice and helpful and nice and our room was very clean. The price was very reasonable so I definitely felt overall that we got our money's worth! Would not reccommend using the Lorrie's Airport Shuttle service. They seemed unorganized, driver's were rude and driver did not pick up people in the order of their flight time (i.e. we had to wait longer even though we had an earlier flight). Take a cab instead.

review.title: you get what you pay for
review.reviewText: This hotels greatest asset is its location.Its service is excellent and the staff could not be more helpful.The rooms look a little "tired" but was informed that the hotel is having a makeover .I just hope it does not bump up prices. I hired a car and the parking arrangements couldnt be easier - once I got the traffic arrangements worked out !

review.title: Value-Priced Hotel
review.reviewText: Room was way smaller than expected, but got a great deal. Overlooking union square and close to financial district and great shopping. Overall room cleanliness could have been better, but good place to stay on a budget.

review.title: Perfect location, service, everything
review.reviewText: I stayed here just one night for a business conference in the Union Square area. The location was perfect, right next to everything you could need. The room was clean, and (surprise since my window opened to Union Square!) very, very quiet. I had a peaceful evening, and there were extra's available without asking - pillow, blanket, toiletries, etc. Staff was kind, helpful, very courteous. Price was comparable to other places I've stayed that were not nearly as nice. For leisure - I only book where I can bring my dog. But for business I would come back in a heartbeat.

review.title: A weekend stay
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel. I chose it for the proximity to the conference I was attending, but the location for other Frisco attractions is excellent. I found the room to be quite clean, didn't have any problem with the size (I stayed by myself) and the hotel, while not new, was by no means run-down or old feeling. Whenever I go back to San Fran, I will stay in the Chancellor.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The location was perfect in Union Square and we had plans to go dancing at the Starlight Room directly across the street, so it was very convenient. The room was very comfortable and clean albeit a very small bathroom, but serviceable. Definitely would stay again! The complimentary cookies at the front desk were delicious.

review.title: Excellent Location and Price
review.reviewText: As described, this is a 1920's hotel that has been well-kept. The room was small but not cramped, clean but not luxurious. My window from the 10th floor overlooked Union Square. The lobby is attractive and the staff was very helpful. They had a pleasant breakfast room with excellent service and food. It's a great place to stay on a tight budget, if you plan to be out and about in the city for most of your trip.

review.title: The Best part of our trip
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel due to the fact that it had all positive reviews. I work in a hotel so I was very impressed that it got a perfect rating. The Chancellor Hotel was friendly on the phone and in person as well. The staff were helpful & yes, the rooms are small but clean & very conveniently located to shopping, dining & public transportation. We had 2 double beds & a rollaway & it was very cozy. The coffee & tea service 24 hours a day was a pleasant bonus as well as the daily newspaper. I would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Convenient SF Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is conveniently located near Union Square. Rooms are dated and building could use maintenance. But room was clean and comfortable and the price was reasonable for location.

review.title: Chancellor Hotel's Great Staff
review.reviewText: We found the hotel to be in an excellent location and the staff was extremely helpful and pleasant, Breakfast was also very good. Smallish room, but pleasant. Great pillows!

review.title: Best San Francisco location
review.reviewText: This is a small wonderfully located hotel. The staff are welcoming and helpful. The restaurant in the hotel is excellent, a good value and superb food, fresh and well presented and prepared. Rooms are of a decent size, quiet, and the hotel reflects the best of "old stately San Francisco". I'd stay there again in a heartbeat. Only 4 blocks from BART station, tourist center, and 1/2 block from Union Square and good shopping.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: This hotel has prime location right on Union Square. It's unbeatable and great value for money. The staff were pleasant and the barstaff gave us excellent tips for sightseeing around town....thankyou!!! We found the room size fine escpecially if you plan to be out in the city most of the time. Nice, clean, friendly hotel.

review.title: Excellent place to stay!
review.reviewText: We would stay at the Chancellor Hotel again. It is in a great location near Union Square, shopping, public transportation, and museums. We loved the cookies they had available every night and their pillow menu to select the type of pillow you like best. The rates were very reasonable. An easy walk (slightly uphill) from the BART which makes flying in and not getting a car (overnight parking is expensive) to see the city very easy.

review.title: Amazing location!!! Ridiculously great price for location.
review.reviewText: The highlight of this place is location. It is in the heart of Union Square where everything is happening and it's central to the whole city. Other hotels in this area are much more expensive and the rooms are cleans allbeit very small. But if you plan to be in the city and not just in your room. It is an amazing bargain considering the free WiFi and valet parking. (Though note a 20 minute wait to get your call so call ahead)

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText: I got the room on the 14th floor facing the Victoria's Secret store and overlooking a part of the Union Square. The room was clean and comfortable. What they said about poor noice insulation is correct, you can almost hear the whispers of the the guests next door. Fortunately everyone were really quiet and didn't make themselves heard! The Luques restaurant's got a good breakfast menu; I'd recommend the Luque's breakfast omlette skillet and this must be shared by two as the portion is simply too big.

review.title: Central location, great cookies
review.reviewText: Centrally located by Union Square, this hotel has smallish, but adequate rooms. The cleaning service was great so were the free cookies and tea/coffee in the hotel lobby. Good deal.

review.title: A Special Value
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is a great secret on Union Square. The hotel's quality versus price is excellent.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for one night to spend a couple days in San Francisco and do some Christmas shopping. The hotel itself was ok, but the price was very good. The best thing about the hotel is the location - right in the middle of the shopping district just up the street from Union Square.
