I recommend this hotel for people who are on a budget and don't need a new or fancy hotel. We originally planned to stop in front of the hotel and use their valet parking service, but the curbside was full with nowhere to stop. So we dropped the car off at the Sutter Street parking garage just around the corner. I recommend just doing that right away. And make sure you pay for parking through the hotel because you will save money.

review.title: in the Hub of SanFrancisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is on Union Square near Everything. Chinatown, the Steinhart Aquarium, the Modern Art Museum are all a few blocks away. Shopping is out the front door as well as the cable car. This is an old hotel with Small rooms. They only have twin beds and single queen beds. The great benefit is you can skip renting a car, save the expense and headache of parking, and enjoy having the city at your doorstep.

review.title: Will return...
review.reviewText: Our second stay at this great little hotel lived up to our expectations. The customer service is the best. Entire staff is friendly and accomodating. Their breakfast beats the highly touted Sears next door without the long wait. While the hotel is certainly old, it is clean and the location on Powell St is perfect walking distance to shopping, cable car and theater. We have visited San Francisco many times over the past 20 years and this is our favorite place to stay by far!

review.title: A good value at the Chancellor.
review.reviewText: I recently stayed at the Chancellor for a long weekend in San Francisco. The location can't be beat, and the place is in fine repair. Nothing too fancy, but free coffee, free umbrella to use for your stay. Prices were good, the place was very clean. I would stay there again.

review.title: nice hotel-
review.reviewText: cozy

review.title: Excellent Hotel!
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel Thanksgiving week. The best of all is the location. It is excellent!! The staff was very corteous. The rooms are small, but confortable, clean and cozy. I read comments from other people about noise, our room was very quiet. The restaurant and bar are very nice too. The 24 hour coffee, tea and cookies at the lobby was a great treat for all of us. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to enjoy walking around the city, you do not need to take your car out and hassle about parking. We chose the valet parking feature at the hotel and was very convenient the few times we needed to use our car.

review.title: As said, clean, budget, perfect for leisure
review.reviewText: I have read a lot of reviews of this little hotel right at the heart of Union Square. It's a bit on the old side, but very well maintained and clean. Staff is nice too. The wireless internet is not reliable at all though. So do not depend on that. Other than that comfy beds with clean sheets, nice clean bathroom. I would definitely go back. The location is unbeatable.

review.title: Great Location at Reasonable Rates
review.reviewText: Room was small but clean; adequate for my three-night stay. There was a little confusion when I checked in - the concierge mistook me for someone else & gave me the wrong room. Spotted the mistake when I checked the paperwork before signing. Besides apples in the lobby, there was also a candy jar in the room. I raided half the jar during my stay - simply loved them! No aircon in the room though. That's not a problem at this time of year but I wonder how they manage in the summer... Was on the 12th floor so noise wasn't a problem for me. In addition to being near all the major stores, convenient transport system and the theater district (I went to a live concert and a live comedy/revue), Chancellor Hotel is also within walking distance of the San Francisco Visitor Center - you can get lots of visitor info there for things to do if you haven't gotten them off the web already. Take note of Sat & Sun opening hours: 9am - 3pm. Dress warm as it gets really chilly in the mornings and evenings.

review.title: Enjoyed the Chancellor
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was great, helpful, cheerful. Room was small and a bit old, but totally adequate for one person. Location on the Powell St. cable car line off Union Square was very convenient. Wireless Internet, cookies and apples in the lobby made the visit pleasant. A good value.

review.title: Quality service and location
review.reviewText: Excellent and friendly staff service with an unfortunate exception on this with the concierge. Room clean, quiet, cosy. Fantastic location just up from Union Square and close to all shops, trolleys, subways, etc. Definitely recommend to anyone that will intend to spend time in the downtown area or also use as base for getting around to other city attractions.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: good hotel but not great. the building is not new, so don't expect a modern hotel. the room is very small, but everything worked, so no complaints.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Nothing fancy - servicable - good value for the money - friendly staff. I'd stay there again.

review.title: Good for Price Sensitive Travellers
review.reviewText: Close to business district! Good pricing. Rooms are clean and well maintained. Except it was little bit too warm during the night. AC or Heating temperature wasn't work too well.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location. You are right in the Union Square shopping area. All of the main department stores are within a 2 to 3 block walking range. There is a Cable Car stop right close byfor trips you might want to take. The hotel was clean and smoke free! Everyone was extremely helpful and couterous. A great place to stay.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel is great. The location is in the middle of Union Square. I liked the little perks such as tea and coffee, cookies and fruit. The staff was very friendly. We had a problem with the bathtub drain and it was fixed immediately. The hotel is old, but that adds to the charm of the place.

review.title: Would love to go back.
review.reviewText: Great location.

review.title: Good Location, felt a bit 'tired'!
review.reviewText: You really cannot complain about the location of this hotel, it's right on Union Square. Complaints: We had a room on the second floor basically overlooking a brick wall. The room looked a little tired - could have done with some nice fresh bedding, curtains, etc The concierge was rude beyond belief - she was supposed to be there to give advice to customers. However when we approached her to ask her how best to get to Golden Gate Bridge she basically told us it would take us 1.5 hours by various buses and we would be best to take an organised tour or get a cab. Whilst she was telling us this she actually picked up a duster and walked off dusting the top of a nearby television!!! We had to ask her to stop and speak to us! We managed to get to Golden Gate Bridge quite easily by cable car to Fishermans and then a bus and a walk. If you want a good location and like us you are only in the hotel for a short time then is a perfect.

review.title: Definitely will go back!
review.reviewText: We booked at the Chancellor based on its excellent reviews on Expedia - and were delighted with the friendly service including the "activity desk" in the lobby, great cookies and coffee in the lobby, wonderful location at a "quieter" corner of Union Square, very convenient and efficient valet parking service, and even a rubber duckie for the deep tub. Room and bath are small but, overall, a treasure!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The Chancellor hotel is nice and clean as well as centrally located at a reasonable price. The rooms are small, but it was enough for the two of us. The service was good, everyone was very pleasant and helpful. The only problem we had was that the cable car runs along Powell Street and it got a bit noisy. Other than that,it was a very enjoyable stay.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: Compared to other pricey hotels, The Chancellor is great value for money. The service is wonderful and very personal. Everything you could possibly want is at your doorstep. The rooms are a little small but VERY comfortable and extremely clean. I don't think there is a better location if you want to be in the heart of things. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: Everyone was very helpful and friendly. Gave good recommendations for food and sightseeing. Tours we booked through hotel were great. Close to everything we wanted to see. The service was great. No complaints

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The rooms are small, but my husband and I didn't mind. The only downside is that we suppose some of the rooms may be noisy if they are by the downtown area or the lower floors. The location gives easy access to transportation, though. Most of the employees were friendly.

review.title: Small room, but well appointed
review.reviewText: Probably the smallest hotel room I've stayed in, but enough room for what I needed, and very nicely appointed, including a walk-in closet. The hotel is right next to Union Square. For the money I paid, I consider it a bargain. I would gladly stay there again.

review.title: Loved this hotel
review.reviewText: What a bargain! Location was superb, practically on Union Square. The hotel itself is great for the price, we had a standard Queen, medium sized room and bathroom is small, but both were very clean and we were very comfortable there, exactly what we were hoping for. If you'd rather spend your $$$ on a huge luxurious room rather than for great meals and sights, then choose another hotel, if you want to stay in the heart of San Fran, have easy access to everything and have a clean and comfortable atmosphere to return to at night, this is the hotel for you. The staff were very laid back and helpful, very relaxing and friendly atmosphere. I overheard someone checking out, he told them exactly same thing, so I was not the only one to think so. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

review.title: Can't beat the location
review.reviewText: This hotel is directly on the cable car line and sits in a perfect location off Union Square. We requested a "quieter" room and were given a room near the top and not directly facing Powell (to cut down on the cable car noise). We heard basically no noise at all!!! The rooms are smaller than 'standard' but there was ample space and the character of the hotel makes up for any defeciences. Will definitely stay again!

review.title: Homey and Friendly
review.reviewText: This is a smaller hotel in a perfect location on Union Square...Everyone goes out of their way to make your stay more comfortable..Great bathtub..The smaller room is okay for two people.. This is our second time their and will stay there again when we go back to S F..

review.title: One of our better Expedia picks!
review.reviewText: We were impressed with the location - 1-1/2 blocks up from Union Square! We expected the room to be small but it was bigger. Met our needs, as we spent little time there. The street is constantly bustling with noisemakers at all hours, but the evening breeze is nice. The bed was firm, and the closet spacious. The staff were friendly and helpful. We would definitely return to this hotel.

review.title: Good for some, Not for all
review.reviewText: If you want to be right on Union Square, the Chancellor Hotel is the place to be, especially if you are being dropped off by cab. If you are driving and on a family vacation, checking in can be a problem, since the "white space" parking is limited and often taken by other delivery vehicles. Parking your own car is a block away and dragging your suitcase(s) can be challenging. While the hotel is old, it seems to be well kept and relatively clean. Our first room was right at the air vents and very noisy; however, the front desk expedited a move to another more suitable room. Prices at the hotel's restaurant were on the high side; you can find other places to eat nearby. Shopping around Union Square is great!

review.title: In the Heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: Unbelieveable location.

review.title: nice hotel in excellent location
review.reviewText: pros: - excellent location (safe, easy access from public transportation, easy to arrive from airport, plenty of shops around) - very good service - free wireless access to the internet - little extras like ironing bench in the room (handy if you need to refresh your shirt while on business trip), free coffee and cookies in the entrance hall in the morning, sweets in the room - price was not high compared to other hotels cons: - no air conditioning (in summer it may be a problem, I had to leave the window continuously open) - noise from street if the window is open... - the room was a bit small to my taste (in particular the bath room), but I haven't been in other SF hotels and can't compare. - no fridge in the room, no way to keep things cold overall: good place to stay, would return

review.title: very nice. great location
review.reviewText: nice hotel, rooms are small but comfortable, very clean, wireless internet -a big plus. located within walking distance from many attractions.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel - Great Staff
review.reviewText: This is the second time we have stayed at the Chancellor and a second time we have found the service to be wonderful, the staff helpful and professional and the rooms worth the very reasonable price. Ask for a higher floor as the street noise (as with any city hotel) can be a bit much.

review.title: Very good service. Warm and friendly people.
review.reviewText: Everyone in the hotel were very helpful and pleasant. They helped us pick our sight seens and shows. We loved the service and how they care that we had a good stay. The cable car stops right in front of the hotel, and the Union Square is right next to the hotel. It is a perfect location. I would come back any time.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed for 2 nights. The hotel is around the Union Square location, convinent to cable car stop and shopping. By the way, the restaurant next door is excellent. Will stay again.

review.title: A good deal
review.reviewText: Nice small hotel, very clean, staff was very cheerful and eager to help. Price is pretty cheap for the location and quality. Highly recommended.

review.title: Needs a little TLC
review.reviewText: The best thing about this hotel is the location - right on Union Square so very convenient to all the shopping and cable car stops right out front. The hotel itself I'd say is "ok" - but not special as I had hoped. Service was fine -- staff was friendly and professional. The lobby looked pretty but had that strange odor upon entrance that reminded me of a retirement home -- perhaps because it's older can't be helped? However, our room was a big disappointment. The queen size bed was rock hard and I've never been picky about a hotel bed before, but this one felt like a brick slab! The bedspread seemed to be VERY old as did the carpeting. Would we go back? Probably not because there are so many other choices in the same area that would be a better value for my money. But if this hotel fits your budget and you go in knowing these things you'll probably be fine.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is located a few blocks uphill from the BART station. It is very easy to take the BART from San Francisco airport to the hotel (even with luggage). The room is small but clean. Free Wi-Fi access is a plus. It's on the cable car route so it can be noisy if the room faces the street. On the other hand, it's easy to go to places on the cable car. Buy a MUNI pass so you can ride the excellent transit system anywhere in the city without worrying about transfers.

review.title: Still my favorite hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Overall this Hotel has it all. Reasonable room rates, couteous staff and the perfect location. The only flaw is that each time I have been there I have to call twice to get additional towels or a new pillow from their pillow menu.

review.title: Really enjoyable
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely helpful and the hotel, in addition to being well-maintained, was located close to everything.

review.title: Good Hotel for Bucks
review.reviewText: Chancellor is a good hotel for the money. The service is pretty good. They changed our room after the first night to a higher floor. The staff also came to our room to help connect to the free wi-fi internet connection. The hotel rooms are clean but small. The location is great, right in the middle of everything. The walls are extremely thin, you can hear people talking or the tv in rooms next to us.

review.title: Very Nice Hotel....good location....a bargin
review.reviewText: A very pleasant hotel with a welcoming and professional staff. We enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: One of the best location in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: This Hotel is located just in front of Cable Car Stop at Sutter Street. Also very convenient place for shopping, dining and moving to everywhere.

review.title: Fabulous Location
review.reviewText: Wonderful service and great location make this a great value. I don't think at the regular price it is worth it but we got a great rate thru expedia. The only complaint is the hard beds and noisy springs in them. It is a quiet place near great restaurants too. Very old San Francisco which we loved.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Great location. It is within walking distance to all the Union Square shops, Market Street and the Museum of Modern Art. We really enjoyed it. There was no air conditioning, though, which was obnoxious on the day we arrived since it was 85 degrees out (unseasonable for SF). It's a fine hotel.

review.title: Wonderful!
review.reviewText: We will definitely return! We were pleasantly surprised with the ambiance our room and the decor of the lobby. We were luckily enough to get a suite, but the other rooms were a bit small. Bottom line - Great price, great location, great hotel.

review.title: Affordable hotel within walking distance of great restaurants
review.reviewText: We were in SF only one night to make flight connections. The Chancellor is located within walking distance of Chinatown and North Beach. We enjoyed a great dinner at Tiramisu on Belden Place; the outdoor seating under umbrellas is wonderful. The tourist desk at the hotel was very helpful in making reservations for the shuttle to the airport the next morning.

review.title: Very Convienient, Very Comfortable
review.reviewText: Highly recommend this hotel if you are interested in seeing the City from Union Square area.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Cute boutique type hotel. Ideal location right in the heart of the city, close to tons of shopping, right along the trolley line, and plenty of places to eat nearby. Perfect for tourists and sightseers who don't plan on spending much time inside. It's an older building, plenty of character, rooms are not huge, but they never are in old hotels. The only downside was no A/C. The temperature was fine as long as the window was open and the ceiling fan was on, but it can be loud on the street, so I probably wouldn't stay there in the dead of summer.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: I was looking for a hotel that is close to any attractions/nightlife. I looked up many hotels in expedia.com and also the customer review pages. This hotel has one of the highest ranking among the ones that I have seen. The price is reasonable and so I booked it for my SF trip. This hotel is very close to the union square and all the shops. I parked my car at the parking lot and I did not have to drive for the rest of the day (although you have 24 hours unlimited in and out access). Everything is so close and handy. For the hotel, the room is a bit small, but it is very clean and tidy. The staff is very nice. Oh, did I mention that they have FREE wireless internet access? I have my laptop with me; and so I can get online in my room for free. If you do not have a laptop, there are two computers in the lobby for you to use. It becomes extremely handy; especially if you want to make dinner/lunch reservation online around the area. I would definitely go back and visit them again.

review.title: Very good
review.reviewText: Good hotel for medium price-range. Excellent location.

review.title: Quaint hotel for good value
review.reviewText: Small hotel. Staff very helpful. The twin beds were short, mattresses and pillows would have made the stay better. I would recommend this hotel for a one night stay, but not longer; based on beds.

review.title: Small room, Good location
review.reviewText: Good service, location, and cleanliness. We had to check in early and they stored our bags and parked our car without question. Would stay there again.

review.title: Next trip to SF, I'm staying here again!
review.reviewText: This was our first time staying at the Chancellor and as global travelers, we were both very impressed. Every single staff member is polite, the hotel is very clean and we loved the fact that the hotel is independent and not part of a big chain. The room was nice and the pillow menu is great. (love those down pillows!) Highly recommend to anyone looking for clean, boutique, affordable accommodations in San Francisco.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Rooms are small, but for a historic hotel, not bad. The bed was comfy. The staff was great. This hotel is 2 blocks from Union Square. Would stay there again, no problem!!

review.title: Good quality, safe area
review.reviewText: Located in a good area and very convenient to shopping and dining in Union Square. If you are a women traveling alone on business and looking for an affordable place to stay, this is it. Rooms are somewhat small but well appointed and comfortable.

review.title: Good deal in Union Square
review.reviewText: I'd read several reviews before booking at the Chancellor, and they were overall positive. I was pleasantly surprised when I saw it in person, though (in the past, I'd stayed at other hotels per travel sites' recommendations with less than favorable results). The staff was helpful, the room was clean, and the location is ideal. I'd definitely stay at the Chancellor again.

review.title: Comfortable, friendly hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Spent 15 nights in the Chancellor. Food excellent, although only the bar is available in the evenings. All staff very helpful and friendly. Room faced Union Square but effective double glazing silenced the noise. Free coffee and cookies - and sometimes popcorn - all available 24hrs a day in lobby. Wi-fi internet access a real bonus, although occasional difficulty connecting using my Palm PDA. Would be very happy to stay there again.

review.title: Will be back!
review.reviewText: Perfect location for food, shopping, Bart and Muni, and walking.....room was quiet and comfortable....will definitely stay again!

review.title: Chancellor--a great price performer on Union Square
review.reviewText: Our family has gone to the Chancellor since the 1960's...still a great value...still a very basic hotel, well maintained, in a great location. Don't rely on the room configurations online with Expedia--they aren't guaranteed--but the price is much better than direct booking.

review.title: Great Location, Low Price, but you get what you pay
review.reviewText: Great for people looking to be near Union Square. Couldn't get a good night sleep due to street sounds that resonated through the thin walls and windows. Room is old, but was relatively clean.

review.title: Great price, service and even better location
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is located perfectly for tourists. It's 1/2 block from Union Square, 3-4 blocks from BART station, and the cable car stops right outside on Powell St. The service of the staff was great. When my wife asked about the paint colors of the lobby the maintenance supervisor provided us with the exact color and manufacturer.

review.title: Great Location and Value
review.reviewText: The rooms are small and basic, but the hotel is in a great location, right in the heart of Union Square and very close to public transportation and the best shopping. Greate value for the price.

review.title: Cozy stay
review.reviewText: The Chancellor was a nice hotel for my wife and I. It's a smaller, cozier place that was in a great location and a relief from chain hotels. It was comfortable and the staff professional, I'd definitely go again.

review.title: Great location and excellent value.
review.reviewText: Comfortable, well located hotel, excellent value.

review.title: Good hotel for Down Town San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a very central in the down town part of San Francisco. The room was a good medium size and in good condition. It's location is right next to Union Square, with the tram just outside the door. The complimentary use of the Gym around the corner was very good. All the staff were very helpful and I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco. You get alot for your money

review.title: Wonderful Except for the Hard Bed
review.reviewText: Loved it all, but the bed was way too hard for me. I didn't get much rest.

review.title: Delightful boutique hotel - San Francisco ambiance
review.reviewText: Loved it! Everything about this hotel was delightful. Location, size (small and comfortable), helpful staff. Non-smoking throughout. Room was clean and fresh. Great atmosphere; you could feel the history of turn of the century San Francisco. Felt safe and secure. No detail was missed, including large black umbrella in the closet for guest to use as necessary. Will definitely go back to the Chancellor. P.S. Thanks to these hotel reviews I was able to choose the Chancellor....so keep up the good work!

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: The Chancellor is located in Union square, which is pretty much in the middle of everything. You're within walking distance of the Powell St. train municipal and BART train station, and the cable car stops right in front of the hotel, but it cost $5 a person per ride so I don't recommend it. The room itself is on the small side but extremely clean and comfortable. I would definitely go back just for the location alone.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We really liked this hotel and the location. I especially liked the 'pillow menu'. The menu has a list of different pillows to choose from so you don't have to use the average pillows they put on your bed.

review.title: Can't wait to return to San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was the way I imagined it. Small but very comfortable. Great service and close to everything that San Francisco has to offer. I will definitely stay at the Chancellor Hotel the next time I visit San Francisco.

review.title: I'll be back
review.reviewText: A very nice hotel in the middle of town. Neat, very clean and friendly.

review.title: Excellent price for location
review.reviewText: Truly a hotel with character in central SF. WAs pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness. While the rooms were a little small, this hotel provides good service, comfortable, clean, affordable accommodation. Would definitely recommend it for business travellers for the convention center (10min walk) too.

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: We booked because of reviews of previous guests and we were not disappointed with our selection. We were going on a cruise and stayed both before and after the cruise. The location is fabulous with access to anywhere in San Fransisco plus the staff was extremely helpful with any inquiries we had. Will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location in the heart of Union Square.

review.title: Nice, clean, little hotel in great location
review.reviewText: If you are looking for an affordable, cute hotel in San Francisco, I recommend the Chancellor hotel. It is in a good location and access to the rest of the city is easy. The extra touches such as free fresh coffee and tea all day and a choice of numerous pillow types were appreciated.

review.title: Will definately come back again
review.reviewText: Have been here 3 times in the last 4 months and will come back again. Friendly staff and prompt valet services. Free coffee and a pillow menu are a great plus. The first 2 visits were perfect. On my most recent visit I encountered 2 difficulties. First, towels were provided for 2 people when the reservation was for 3. It took 3 messages with guest services before additional towels were provided. Second, there was a problem with one of the elevators. The stairwell is too steep for elderly travellers to use safely, and the wait for the other working elevator took 15 minutes. I have been to several other hotels in San Francisco however, and this one is still my favorite.

review.title: Enjoyed our stay, would stay here again
review.reviewText: The room was a bit small, but this is a historic hotel. These types of hotels, no matter what city we stay in, seem to have smaller rooms!! We enjoyed our stay and the staff was great. They responded to our requests very promptly and the choice of pillow types was great!!

review.title: False Impressions
review.reviewText: The hotel is more concerned with their own rules and regulations than welcoming their guests to their hotels. Our room was small with very uncomfortable beds. Bathroom felt dingy and the bathtub was stained. With the exception of one front desk staff, everyone else just did not want to be there. I was so very disappointed. The only thing this hotel has going for it is its great location. Also the gym they have a realtionship with is quite good.

review.title: Value for money
review.reviewText: Good value for money on Union Square.

review.title: Very nice place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Well, you have to realize that it is very special kind of property, it is 1913 building with charm of that time. It is fairly convenient by all means, the location is the best you may wish. I emphasize the importance of location because in SF two blocks difference MAKES the difference. I can't complain to noise because it is part of fun, we live in downtown Chicago and sounds of the early morning streets are usual to us. The location is also important because right next door is "Sears" restaurant and it is great place to enjoy wonderful food. The in hotel restaurant prepares very nice breakfast! I can't claim for dinner because we always been out for dinner. The stuff is very polite, knowledgeable and extremely helpful. We booked tours from hotel and they picked us from hotel and returned safely back. The room was clean with everything in working order. We did asked for this and for that because we traveled with our baby son and always been assisted with most useful sense.

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: Wonderful location and excellent price. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are cozy and very comfortable. I will definitely return and recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco.

review.title: Great Location, adequate place to sleep
review.reviewText: The Hotel was great for location. Couldn't get any closer to Union Square. The staff was friendly and professional. The room was very small with small beds. Not much for view. Relatively inexspensive is a big plus.

review.title: Excellent place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: The hotels location ( half a block from Union Square) and its service is ideal for someone on a business trip to SF. the staff go out of their way to help.

review.title: Good quality for price
review.reviewText: Overall, my experience staying at the Chancellor Hotel was very good. The only reason I rated "comfort" a 3 is because the room was rather small, especially for three people -- parents and myself. We requested two twin beds. Good thing my parents have been married for 45 years ;-) The staff/front desk was very helpful with information and answering questions. Didn't have a chance to check out their breakfast. Akthough there are several good restaurants/diners nearby that serve great breakfast. The hotel's location is perfect, right in the middle of Union Square, within walking distance of restaurants, shops, etc.

review.title: Quaint hotel in the middle of shopping mecca.
review.reviewText: Very clean room with huge bathtub, great to relax in after days of shopping! Macys, Saks and great stores all within a 2 block radius.Friendly and knowledgeable staff.

review.title: very good value ,good location
review.reviewText: Feb 6 /11.After reading reviews of other people was a bit concerned,the hotel was very clean and safe although we had a room at the front of the hotel and we heard the noises from the street it didn't stop us sleeping.it is in a great location in the heart of union square. all i can say is we thought it lovely, very central to everything and the atmosphere day or night is great. We felt very safe on the streets, the bars and restaurants very good value for money, i would definately stay at the chancellor again and would recommend it to anybody that is going to San Francisco.

review.title: Comfortable Hotel in the Middle of the Shopping District
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and comfortable at a great price. The decor is a little out-dated. It's not a fancy hotel but makes up in the extra cleanliness. You'll be right down the street from all the shops in Union Square. We were there during the Christmas holiday season and had a great time. I recommend it if you're looking for comfort, cleanliness, location at a decent price.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel rooms while a little on the small side (it is a boutique hotel), are impeccably clean. The location of the hotel, and right on Union square with the cable cars running in front of the hotel make it a wonderful place to stay. My only complaint is the smoking right outside the hotel entrance- but of course, this is to be expected in downtown San Francisco, where smoking is a problem on the crowded streets, and of course as your luck would have it, you're down wind from someone smoking. Overall, good hotel, great location.

review.title: Excellent for the price.
review.reviewText: This is a very nice ,clean hotel with a very reasonable price in Union Square, NOT surrounded by panhandler, front desk service is excellent. Actually I was there for 6 nights, for sure next visit to SF still will stay there.

review.title: Stained linen, towels, and bed cover
review.reviewText: Our room was damp due to inefficient ventilation in the bathroom. The controls for the heat did not work and was not repaired while we were there. The bed quilt had brown stains, the wash cloths were stained, and the sheets were torn. Overall cleanliness and comfort level was very poor. On the up side, the room was quiet and the coffee was good.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and the rooms, although small were very clean. The hotel is right in the heart of Union Square. We did not need to take one taxi cab to get to great shopping, bars and restaurants. It is also 5 blocks from the BART. We will definitely stay there again.

review.title: I will go back soon as possible.
review.reviewText: People working in the Chancellor Hotel is very nice.

review.title: Excellent hotel in prime location
review.reviewText: This is an affordable, clean and comfortable hotel right off Union Square. This is the location you want to be as it is the hub for public transport (MUNI, BART, cable cars). There are also a lot of shopping and dining options. My husband and I stayed 5 nights and loved it. We requested a room at the back of the hotel before checking in as Powell Street is very busy and may be noisy. The area is safe as there are so many people around. Highly recommended!

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: If you love Union Square and love to shop you are only steps away. And only a step from the cable cars. Even on a busy New Years weekend we found it quiet enough to sleep if you request a quiet room. The room and bathroom are small but that is typical for hotels in this location. If you want a hotel in a great location at a reasonable price this is a good choice. You even get a pillow menu!

review.title: Excellent location, good rooms/charm
review.reviewText: I liked this hotel and thought there was plenty of room (even in the bathrooms) despite the remarks of other reviewers. Good staff that took care of our bags when we arrived early. I appreciated the central location as we made many forays into Chinatown and Union Square. A+

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful 3 night stay here in mid-November. Our room was at the back with no view, but I was happy with that as it was so quiet... I slept like a baby. Loved the extra touches to the room like the lolly jar, umbrella, rubber ducky and CD player! The bath was heaven after a day of walking around the city. San Francisco is now one of my favourite cities in the world, and this hotel enhanced my visit. It has a sort of charm about it that you can only get in an old-style hotel. It is in the perfect location for the cable car, shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Okay but will not return
review.reviewText: I did not enjoy the hotel room that much. There was no air conditioning in the room, just a ceiling fan that didn't seem too secure. I left the window open for some air but there was a lot of noise coming in from the street at night. Also, I didn't feel as if the hotel was very secure, I could see the light from the hallway through the crack in the doorway at night and there were no security cameras. The customer service was adequate but not above average. They took an imprint of my credit card for their records which I didn't really appreciate since identity theft is such a major problem these days. The main thing I enjoyed about the hotel was its central location.

review.title: Good Hotel in an Excellent location
review.reviewText: We stayed for 3 nights in November. The Hotel is slap bang in the middle of the Shopping and Dining area, adjacent to Union Square. Right on the tram to Fishermans warf and near lots of bus routes. We were please that we decided to stay in the centre rather than at Fishermans Warf. Try to get a room with a view of Union Square. Coffee and cookies available in the hotel lobby during the day. We used the hotel valet parking service (included in our rate) and our vehicle was brought around promptly (5mins) when we checked out).

review.title: Hotel personnel very helpful and courteous
review.reviewText: the hotel is very old and the rooms are small, but the service is excellent and the rooms are very clean. Great bathtub.

review.title: Great Hotel for the money
review.reviewText: Definitely will stay at this hotel again, clean, friendly staff, and rooms and bathrooms spacious.

review.title: Great Location but Uncomfortable
review.reviewText: Pros: Location - right at Union Square, walking distance to the great shopping & restaurants, trolley and BART. Room amenities - clean, pillow menu a plus Cons: Comfort - No A/C, only a ceiling fan. Days were in the mid-70s and the room gets stuffy at night. Would like fresh air but it's really noisy on the streets below. Noise - It's tough to sleep at night because of all the street noise - people & sirens, even with the windows shut. If it wasn't for the noise, I would recommend the hotel.

review.title: Staff was not knowledgeable
review.reviewText: Convenient location for Union Square area. Decent for the price but you must manage your expectations. The reason i would not recommend this hotel is b/c the staff was not at all knowledgeable about the area, activities, restaurants or transportation. If you asked for where a good Italian restaurant was, they literally told you they couldn't help, that they weren't familiar with the area. It was not just one or two staff members but each one we spoke to. They couldn't tell you what Trolley to take or where to catch the Bart or anything. Staff was useless from that regard and assistance of that nature is expected in a tourist area.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: hotel was very clean and comfortable. Excellent service. the room is not very large but was really nice and clean. the location of the hotel- right outside the door is the cable car line which will take you to the wharf and 2 blocks away is Chinatown. Hotel is right in the middle of shopping district. The subway is only about 5 blocks away. Would definitely recommend the hotel-worth the money and the stay.

review.title: I was surprised
review.reviewText: The people at the hotel were very warm and friendly. The room was extremely small, which surprised me. My dressing room was the closet. When we booked three people we were expecting more room. Two twin beds and a small roll away bed filled the room. The location was great and I would probably stay there again but not with three people.

review.title: Great Location, good staff
review.reviewText: We have stayed at the Chancellor many times. They are great. The location is superb. The rooms are small but clean. The restaurant has good breakfast, and the room service isn't bad. We keep going back for price and local.

review.title: Excellent location and price.
review.reviewText: Small rooms and no view, but for the price an excellent bargain. Since I was on vacation I did not spend much time in the room anyway. They have wireless hi speed internet on all floors now. No way to lock your laptop down though. In-room safe was very handy and user friendly. Hotel staff was very nice and the location was unbeatable. Had a hard time choosing were I was going to eat each night. So many choices. Cable car stops right outside the hotel, so of course I had to ride that to Fishermans Wharf and back.

review.title: Return to Chancellor Hotel was as nice as I remembered!
review.reviewText: Our first experience with the Chancellor Hotel was 14 years ago. My husband and I and another couple enjoyed our visit to San Francisco and the Chancellor Hotel and vowed to return for our 40th anniversary. Well, we've just returned home and we enjoyed our trip just as much as the first time. The staff is great, always friendly and ready to help in any way. We knew the rooms were smaller, but that was not a problem, as we were on the go everyday. The restaurant serves a great breakfast and the servers are a compliment to the hotel. The hotel has lots of charm and if we get to visit San Franciso again, we'll stay at the Chancellor Hotel!

review.title: Great Location - Great Value
review.reviewText: Experienced the energy of the city right outside the door...Union Square, cable cars ringing their bells, people walking up & down the streets - and always felt safe - but, could then retreat to our clean & quiet room on the 4th floor after a day of sightseeing! We loved the pillow menu!

review.title: Excellent value for money
review.reviewText: Great location just off Union Square. Unlimited free coffee/tea and cookies in the Lobby made up for absence of these in the room. Staff were helpful and friendly and we would certainly stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Perfect hotel for me
review.reviewText: I love this hotel! It is a beautiful, historic hotel and is in a great location. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful and we have nothing bad to say about our experience there. Our room was on the small side which we knew from reading the ads before we booked. This was not a problem for us, the room was very clean and nicely decorated and served it's purpose well since we mainly needed a room just to sleep in. The people in the room next to ours did keep us awake one night watching musicals on tv rather loudly past one in the morning, but since there is a Walgreens right on the corner of the block we ran down and bought ear plugs and the problem was solved. I'm not sure if the walls are thin or if the tv volume was just loud enough that it couldn't be prevented but like I said it was easy enough to solve the problem. There are plenty of restaurants and shops around the hotel and the Union Square area and since we don't mind walking we actually walked to places like Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Chinatown, and Ghiradelli Square everyday. If you don't want to walk or your feet are starting to hurt, there are plenty of other options. Cable cars, buses, and the subway are only blocks away. I highly recommend this hotel and the next time I visit San Francisco I will definitely be staying at the Chancellor!

review.title: Great location with a good value - definitely would stay here again
review.reviewText: Comfortable room with easy access to Union Square. Catch the cable cars within one block. Friendly staff with great concierge.

review.title: Great Hotel - Great Location
review.reviewText: Awesome hotel located right on Union Square. Free coffee, newspapers, and cookies. Restaurant in hotel for breakfast and lunch. Within walking distance to Chinatown and right by a cable car stop. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was spacious and clean with a candy jar. Would stay here again when returning to San Fran.

review.title: a very nice place to stay while in SF
review.reviewText: I liked this hotel very much. Locaton was very convenient. Overall the room was great - sleeping area was comfortable, very, very clean and well maintained. The bathroom area may be a little cramped but this should be clearly understood from doing any research on this hotel (it's an older hotel but very, very well maintained - much better maintained than most new hotels I have stayed in!). Requests were handled professionally by the staff. Considering all the upsides of this hotel I would recommended it without reservation.

review.title: (a) highlight of our trip
review.reviewText: san francisco is a cool, tourist-y, older city, and we did a lot of fun things while in town for a week; see the tips below, if interested. all in all, though, it's not the most user-friendly--we're biased, from chicago--and s.f. is probably more suited for residents or return travelers, of which we were neither (e.g. the confusing patches of hit-or-miss neighborhoods, the science of knowing how to get around without growing exhausted or penniless, and the strangely limited variety and quality of restaurants in high-traffic areas). the time in our hotel, then, was important--for resting, as well as being necessary to plot our courses--and the staff, set-up and location could not have been better or more amenable to this dynamic. we would definitely go back, and would also recommend staying here--for easy-going non-business travelers, such as ourselves. oh, and as a final note--the hotel's airport shuttle option worked out wonderfully, and was definitely preferable to (and significantly cheaper than) our cab ride in from sfo.

review.title: highly recommended
review.reviewText: We had really a wonderful time at Chancellor and we are very very pleased with this hotel. The location is superb! You have the cable car in front of the hotel and the BART at 4 blocks. The hotel is very well located in the middle of everything, restaurantes, theather, bars, shopping, etc... I have read comments about that rooms are small, but they are very comfortable, you don't need more. Chancellor's staff were very kind.

review.title: We loved the Chancellor!
review.reviewText: What a gem in usually pricey Union Square! We stayed on a night that they did a meet and greet with the hotel managers where they served free drinks and appetizers! It was fantastic! The service was impeccable and our every need was catered to. I have never heard of a hotel offering specialized pillows that can be yours for the night with a simple phone call. The room was small, but you're in San Francisco - what do you need a big room for when the city awaits! The next time we are in San Fran - we will stay at the Chancellor.

review.title: A pleasant hotel
review.reviewText: Centrally located, for the price, this hotel is hard to beat. The rooms were a bit small but if you're not spending much time in them, they're okay. They also have a very nice oversize bathtub. The hotel restaurant served a good breakfast. I would stay at the Chancellor again.

review.title: great location and quality
review.reviewText: The location is great, just off Union Square, and along the cable car line. Very comfortable rooms as well, and got a good rate through Expedia!

review.title: Location, location, location + price
review.reviewText: Great location, right on Union Square, price cant be beat for location

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: We went to San Francisco for the first time to celebrate our 5 year anniversary. We decided that we didn't want to stay in a chain hotel - we wanted to stay in a place with some San Francisco charm. After reading reviews on this hotel, we booked it for 3 nights. This hotel is in a fantastic location - right in the middle of everything - great shopping, right on a cable car route, near Nob Hill & Chinatown, etc. We checked in with ease, and were pleasantly surprised to find a bottle of champagne waiting for us in our room as an anniversary gift. While the hotel is older, it has been very well maintained...and our room was extremely clean. We had a great experience and would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Not happy with Hotel
review.reviewText: Rooms were small and cramped. No AC as it was an old building and the room was very hot.I had to make due with a ceiling fan and the windows open all night.

review.title: Great little place to stay in the perfect location. Heart of Union Square!
review.reviewText: We booked the hotel not really knowing what to expect and we sure were pleasantly surprised! The location is wonderful! Right in the middle of everything you could want to see in SF. Rooms were indeed small, but it wasn't a big deal. The pillow menu was awesome! Parking is an issue in SF but the hotel was extremly accomadating upon arrival. Staff was ultimatley accomadating and the food in the hotel restraunt was good. Tolley runs right down the street and everything is close. We can't wait to return to SF and the Chancellor Hotel. We had a wonderful time.

review.title: Terrific tourist hotel in unsurpassed location
review.reviewText: Very good use of an older facility. Many nice small touches -- always on lobby coffee -- afternoon popcorn, etc.

review.title: Average Hotel
review.reviewText: really really small hotel. Worst part is that even have no parking. Need extra charge for parking and brackfast... :( No air conditionr... slow elvauator.. Good location to everywhere in downtown

review.title: Wouldn't recommend this one
review.reviewText: The rooms were quite small, with truly tiny bathrooms. The bathrooms were so little that you had to contort a bit to sit on the toilet. While we were there, there was only one working elevator, and the hotel has 15 floors. It often took over 5 minutes for the elevator to arrive. The hotel rooms were clean and the service was good. The beds were very hard.

review.title: reasonably priced
review.reviewText: practically on Union Square, great location and clean&cozy rooms.

review.title: Nice hotel in downtown SF
review.reviewText: Loved the location and the room. Very cute and urban. Surprisingly quiet at night. The parking was a bit of a headache, but we are just used to parking everywhere in Georgia.

review.title: Great place for a quick stay
review.reviewText: This place was totally accesible to all the fun you can get into in downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Brilliantly situated and excellent value for money
review.reviewText: Apart from a problem with one of the elevators in the hotel not being operational, we were very impressed with the overall service at the Chancellor and their attention to detail on what other hotels may not even begin to think of. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

review.title: Don't mind the elevator
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Too bad there's no restaurant (anymore), just breakfst and lunch. During the rush hour the elevator reconstruction is a drag..

review.title: stay here
review.reviewText: Wow, our room was ready for us at 6am! The Chancellor was in an excellent location (near Saks and Neiman Marcus) and could not be more convenient to public transportation. This hotel has a great european coziness to it. Be sure to utilize the free pillow menu, the buckwheat and body were our favorites!

review.title: Vacationing in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The overall hotel experience was pleasant. There were long waits for the car coming from the garage used by the hotel - so be prepared to wait if you want to use your own transportation to get around the city. The rooms were decent and clean, but the pillows were not comfortable.

review.title: Worderfull!!! The Location couldn't be better!!
review.reviewText: Very confort room, a cable car line in front of the hotel, Shuttle service airport, Coffee and Cookies, frendly people, its a very nice place to stay. Ops just one elevator untill jul/05 but not a problem. The Back rooms are better, no view but more quit. Thank you Chancelor!! One day I will return!!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Chancellor for 4 nights and loved it - I would definitely stay here again. Great big tub for soaking after days walking the hills of SF - love the rubber duckie too. Close to everything, BART is handy. The one elevator really wasn't that big of an inconvenience. Very charming hotel.

review.title: Right on Union Square
review.reviewText: Had a great stay, the staff was extremely courteous and helpful. The location couldn't be any better. I wouldn't recommend anything else.

review.title: The ideal spot to stay
review.reviewText: In my opinion The Chancelor Hotel is a good place to stay, especially if you want to have easy access to see all the fun places there is to see in San Fancisco. There is night life, shopping, attractions and not to mention choices of public transportation to help you get around in and out of the city in a jiffy. Overall I would say that I got my monies worth and maybe more.

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText: The hotel employees were excellent. The hotel itself has character, but has small rooms and only one working elevator. Overall I would say it was okay.

review.title: Hotel with Character
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in the heart of Union Square. The staff is friendly & attentive. The hotel has the feel of a European Hotel. The rooms are a little small but have character. The hotel restaurant was very good (breakfast) although the place next door (Sears Fine Foods) is very good place to eat. The cable cars stop right at the hotel!

review.title: Feel like home
review.reviewText: Very friendly and comfortable hotel

review.title: good value for the location
review.reviewText: don't accept the desk's recommendation of the pearl of the orient should you ask for a good chinese restaurant

review.title: Would recommend this to everyone
review.reviewText: this hotel was perfect, close to shopping, restaurants and transportation. The restaurant which was open for lunch and breakfast was excellant with reasonable prices.  The staff is very friendly and accomadating.

review.title: My new favorite when I visit San Fran
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, nice clean rooms, comfortable beds, and right on Union Square. With Borders Bookstore next door, the trolley stop across the street, and a million places within 500 yards to eat, shop, etc. Really, can anybody ask for more?? Well, mabey an extra elevator. But apparently thats coming in June.

review.title: I'll stay there again
review.reviewText:
The hotel resturant is great and the rooms are very comfortable. Close to everything in San Francisco. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpfull.
They helped make the trip memorable.

review.title: Small and outdated
review.reviewText: Our room was small and I knew it would be, yet, it also was very dingy.  In addition, the people next door awoke early and you could hear everything they had to say.  The elevator was being repaired which also caused great difficulty in traveling to our room on Floor 12.  Otherwise, though, the bellman, front desk, and the person who retrieved our car were great.  I did like the bathroom, too.  The shower was hot and delightful and there were nice amenities in the bath.  Maybe this room is schedule for a makeover -- when it is updated, I think this hotel would be fine for a short stay.

review.title: My hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: It is well located and comfortable. Staff members are nice and helpful. It has free wireless internet at the main entrance. Organizes parties where special food is offered: when I was there it was a chinese party with free food and drink.

review.title: Great location and value
review.reviewText: We selected the Chancellor for its location and value and were pleased with both.  Although modernized, it retains some of the quirkiness of a older hotel (such as no air conditioning).  Great location - just off Union Square.  Cabs, cable cars and public transporations readily available.  Resaurants,coffee shops, and shopping nearby. The Sears restaurant next door served a great breakfast.

review.title: Good hotel at a good price
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a nice location, across from Union Square. Nothing fancy, but clean and nothing missing. Umbrellas in the rooms, clean, wireless in the lobby, gym passes for the Westin across the street. I stay there everytime because its priced right. Nothing fancy though.

review.title: Excellent value for price & location!
review.reviewText: Based on reviews written by other guests, I booked two rooms for a 1-night stay for 4 adults.  The trip was a surprise for our friends visiting us from Florida & they had never been to SanFran.  Not only were all 4 of us completely satisfied with our rooms, location, price, etc., but the hotel put a complimentary private-label bottle of very good wine in our friends' room for his birthday.  No matter what we asked/requested/inquired, the staff was on top of it in a professional, efficient, and friendly manner.  Yes, the rooms are smaller than an American "chain" hotel.  But if you like Europe, you will LOVE this hotel.  All the little touches really added up -- the thick monogrammed towels, the adorable rubber ducks for the bathtubs, bowl of fresh apples in the lobby, platter of cookies next to the complimentary coffee all day, jar of candy in the room.  It is all about atmosphere, not whether you can do a cartwheel in your room!  And we had just a standard room -- they have suites and specialty rooms available.  The only reason I would not give this a full "5" is because the lobby bartender looked like he was on sedatives and was slow and not very personable; also, they are upgrading 1 of 2 elevators so it is a bit of a wait.  Other than that, a solid 4.5 on a scale of 5!  We will definitely go back and recommend it to others.
review.userLocation: Tampa, FL previously, now from Sonoma County, CA

review.title: Chancellor Hotel on Union Square in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The location was excellent, the service was helpful, friendly and one bellboy kind of quirky but funny.  The elevator was not as bad as I had read in many reviews, we never waited more than 5 minutes even at the busiest time. The cookies and apples in lobby, were a great in between meals treat, oh and the popcorn.  The room was exceptionally clean, and my daughter loved the close proximity to the shopping areas, I would definately recommend this for #1, Location, #2 Bang for your Buck #3, service, especially Cleanliness, #4 Cutiness and Quaintness.  I loved it and will go back.

review.title: Fantastic experience
review.reviewText: After reading tons of great reviews about the Chancellor, I decided to stay there myself.  The reviews were correct!  All the little amenities really set the Chancellor apart from other hotels and you just can't beat the price and location.  My only complaint was that the carpet was a little worn, but the room in general was very clean and comfortable.  Excellent service, great stay and safe location.  I definitely recommend staying here.

review.title: Very convient location
review.reviewText: the staff was very helpful.

review.title: coments
review.reviewText: the hotel its very good, but only work one elevator, and that was uncorfotable, but for june may be the other elevator work. The service its very friendly, and the location its excelence

review.title: I've told all of my friends...
review.reviewText: ...if they plan a trip to San Francisco to stay at the Chancellor! I had a terrific experience! I loved the boutique feel and the lovely architecture made me feel as if I had stepped back in time. A very European experience in the US. Who could forget the prime location, location, location! Thanks, Chancellor, for another great trip to San Francisco!!

review.title: Great location and excellent staff!
review.reviewText: The Chancellor Hotel is a real find. It is an older hotel with real character. It has a great location just of Union Square (and right in the middle of good  shopping) and reasonable rates. The rooms are on the small side but very efficient. My room included everything I needed including an umbrella! (A nice touch). The hotel staff was excellent and very helpful. I plan to stay there next time I am in San Francisco.

review.title: Great Value!
review.reviewText: Though I went alone on this trip, even my wife would approve of the hotel and cleanliness!

review.title: Will stay again
review.reviewText: The staff at the hotel was first class.

review.title: excellent boutique hotel in the heart of san francisco
review.reviewText: i had a fantastic experience staying at the chancellor hotel in san francisco.  ideal location in union square, and excellent value for the money.  also enjoyed the free wireless internet in the lobby as well as the complimentary hot beverages and cookies which were available all night long.  would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for low-priced, high quality accommodations in the best city in america.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: This is an elegant small hotel with a warm quirky staff. The rooms are well maitained but slightly small. Free coffee and cookies are always available in the lobby. I wish every hotel was non-smoking like this one. The hotel food was mediocre but the area is full of great places to eat. The stores nearby are open late and their are many wonderful art galleries just around the corner.

review.title: Great location and service
review.reviewText: The hotel offers fine value for a great location (right on Union Square) and truly excellent service.  The fact that one of two elevators was out of service (for the long term) would have been an inconvenience had we not been on the second floor.  This hotel is a great leisure choice, though.

review.title: Union Sqare Area Hotel
review.reviewText: On the older side, but a nice place to stay.  Right near the Union Sqaure shopping areas.

review.title: Wonderful boutique hotel
review.reviewText:
This is a lovely hotel right next to Union Square - a great bargain in one of the loveliest cities in America!  The staff was friendly, the renovated hotel is charming and the central location is excellent.  I would highly recommend this hotel and will plan on staying at the Chancellor every trip!  The quaint rooms, the fresh coffee and cookies in the lobby, and the friendly bartender were pluses!

Thanks,
Michele

review.title: Broken Elevator Didn't Ruin a Great Stay
review.reviewText:
Everything was great!  A historic hotel, amazing location, fantastic staff... the trip had been a rough one, but the Chancellor Hotel exceeded my expectations!  The only problem was an elevator that was being repaired and therefore didn't work; it made coming and going a long, arduous task (especially since we stayed on the 14th floor).  The location was great!  A not-too-long walk to Chinatown and not-too-long-after-Chinatown walk to North Beach.  Less than half a block from Untion Square, a kinda-long-but-not-too-bad walk to the Embarcadero... it was great!!!  We got a lot of exercise!

Bottom line, I would WHOLE-HEARTEDLY recommend this hotel to anyone who asked.  Plus we couldn't beat the prices we found on Expedia!

review.title: Will definitely stay at the Chancellor again!
review.reviewText: With the help of Expedia, I got a great rate at a really nice hotel. The location is excellent - near BART, the cable car, shopping, and the bus lines. The room was clean and comfortable, the service was courteous. I'm glad I discovered this affordable gem.

review.title: Best Hotel Deal in SF
review.reviewText:
- Central location in Union Square.
- Comfortable rooms and good service.
- Free cookies and hot beverages.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText:
I stayed in Chancellor Hotel on Union Square in late December for six nights.  I loved this hotel! The great feature of this hotel is its location.  It's close to everything - 1 minute walk to the cable car stop, 4 blocks to Chinatown, about 10 minutes walk to the BART station, and very close to all the big stores around Union Square.  Its next door neighbor is the Border's bookstore.  I loved browsing books there before going back to my room.

The room was clean.  The bathroom was good size with a full size bathtub.  They also had free HBO.  When you check in, make sure to ask for a room on the back.  My room was on the street side.  Although I had very good view of The Drake Hotel, Union Square, and Macy's, I could hear the street noise (including the cablecar's bells) from the ninth floor.  It you are a light sleeper, it may not be comfortable for you.

The elevators were very tiny and slow.  They can only hold six people at a time.  During my stay, one was under repair.  So I had to walk up and down the stairs, which, by the way, are also narrow.  But all in all, I loved the hotel and will definitely return.

review.title: Very Nice location
review.reviewText: It was a very high standing hotel in a great location. would go back to this one if i had to go back to San Francisco.

review.title: It's a good value
review.reviewText: this place is not for the individual that wants a modern hotel.  it's older is a little wornen around the edges.

review.title: Location & parking
review.reviewText: This hotel is close to Union Square and transportation to anywhere in San Francisco.  Availability of parking is very helpful!

review.title: The best location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is in union square, surrounded by shops, mall and attractions.  Its location is the best.  Hotel staff is very friendly.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: clean & friendly and in a great location

review.title: Great Location!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location! It is right next to the cable car stop.  We really enjoyed our stay.  It is a very European style hotel. The staff was always very friendly and helpful.  Because of the walk in closet,the size of the hotel room is ok.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: I agreed to stay here because other women who were attending the same conference had picked it. With the great deals available on Expedia at this time, there are much nicer places to stay for the same price. The rooms were tiny, the carpet (and bedspread) needed to be replaced, view was into an alley and the lobby was cluttered and the decor cheesy. Although the staff at the front desk were friendly and the location good, I will not stay there again.

review.title: Great find on Union Square
review.reviewText: Location, location, location.  Other than the great location, Chancellor Hotel had friendly staff, nice perks (free coffee/tea and cookies in the lobby)and I found a great deal on Expedia.  I couldn't stop raving about the hotel to my friends who live in the Bay Area and now they're recommending it to their friends.  It was also great that they could actually park the car on the street near the hotel to drop me off or pick me up.

review.title: A Nice Place to stay for the Money
review.reviewText: I would recommend this place over the pricey hotel chans; it's in the middle of the tourists area, near the main Cable Car stop, plenty of dinning and stores withing walking distance. Hotel staff was friendly, hotel was pleasant; Baked cookies and gourmet coffee in the lobby 24/7 was a PLUS!

review.title: Good location.  Comfortable, well maintained rooms.
review.reviewText:
First of all, I feel hesitant about giving a good review of this hotel for fear that the hotel will become too popular.  
     The location is hard to beat.  Right on Powell, looking down at Union Square, next to Border's, next to Walgreen's, within walking distance to the Ferry building, N. Beach within Cable car over the hill, the Bart station nearby, etc.  Whatever you need is nearby. What more can you ask as far as location??
     As far as the room, just basic and comfortable.  Not the too frilly and stuffy  Victorian decor you see a lot in other S.F. hotels.

review.title: Quaint, quiet, quick
review.reviewText: Nothing overdone here, just some great lodging, great service, and not a lot of noise, close to everything.

review.title: Small, Small, Small
review.reviewText: The rooms are tiny, and old.  It looked like the carpet and bed covers haven't been changed for a long time.  I felt clastrophobic there, and had to check out the same night.  The only good thing about this hotel is proximity.

review.title: Old Hotel
review.reviewText: Everything in this hotel is very old.  There is NO AC.

review.title: One of the best deals for the money
review.reviewText: Umbrella in the room for your use--although you might prefer bringing your own compact one.  802.11g available in the lobby, but not in the rooms--also a couple of ethernet hook-ups, if you have your own cable and the seat is open.

review.title: Charming Hotel! Perfect Location...right on Union Square!
review.reviewText: The service at the Chancellor is impeccable. The wireless internet connection in the lobby and bar was awesome!

review.title: Chancellor Hotel, San Fran
review.reviewText: Great Hotel in superb location at a good price.  Tram line runs right by which adds to the atmosphere.  Room was clean and comfortable.  Union Square is half a block away. Only complaint is our room did not have air con which would be a problem in the summer.  Otherwise very happy.
